Name: Galway-Mayo Institute of Technology
Overview: The Galway-Mayo Institute of Technology is a university located in Galway, Ireland. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programs for distance education students.The cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. The estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student, are around 10,92,725 INR.Galway-Mayo Institute of Technology offers students scholarships, work-study, and various funding. These scholarships are based on merit and performance.Emolument reports that Logistics, Operations, and Purchasing specialists are the highest-paid Galway-Mayo Institute of Technology alumni and graduates, earning $84,000 annually. The university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship.
Eligibility Overview: Ordinary Bachelor Degree (Level 7) and Higher Certificate (Level 6):All Higher Certificates (Level 6) and ab initio Bachelor degrees (Level 7) have a minimum Leaving Certificate entry requirement of Grade O6/H7 or better in five Leaving Certificate subjects, including Mathematics and English or Irish, with a minimum of 160 points. Bachelor's Degrees with Honours (Level 8):A Grade O6/H7 or above in six Leaving Certificate courses, including English or Irish and Mathematics, is the standard minimum entry requirement, two of which must be passed in higher-level papers at Grade H5 or higher.Click on this link-https://www.gmit.ie/study/apply-to-gmit/irisheu-students/cao-student/entry-requirements
Accommodation: Off-campus accommodation The average rent is 550 to 650 Euros/monthThe residence type includes studio apartments, 3 bedroom apartments, 4 bedroom apartments, and shared apartmentsEach student apartment has a washer and dryer machine which ensures they don't have to pay extra for tokens for central laundry facilitiesMany of the student accommodation is located beside Corrib shopping center in the heart of Galway city

Name: Maynooth University
Overview: Maynooth University (MU) is a constituent of the National University of Ireland in Maynooth, County Kildare, located 25 km from Dublin, Ireland. The university has two connected northern and southern campuses. Maynooth University houses over 13,000 students and 900 staff from more than 20 different countries. The university offers 235 UG and PG level courses in its 26 departments and three faculties. The most popular courses are in streams such as Social Science, Humanities, and Natural Sciences. Several research universities fall under MU, including the Irish Climate Analysis and Research Units (ICARUS), Institute of Immunology, National Institute for Regional and Spatial Analysis, The Callan Institute, and the National Centre for Geocomputation. MU provides on-campus accommodations for full-time registered students in their five residences: The Courtyard Plaza, The Courtyard Apartment, The River Apartment, The Village Apartment, and The Rye Hall. Students can choose from over 100 student clubs and societies, such as rugby, badminton, tennis, surfing, canoeing, archery, and kayaking. Maynooth University has strong ties to the industry, including giants like Google, Microsoft, Facebook, IBM, Intel, HP, Coca-Cola, Cadbury, Goldman Sachs, L'oreal, and Unilever.The average annual tuition fee for undergraduate programs is about USD 13,700, and that for postgraduate programs is approximately USD 14,800. MU offers more than 60 scholarships for students seeking financial assistance, including the MU Entrance Scholarships, MU Sports Scholarships, and the Google Women Techmakers Undergraduate Scholar Award worth USD 1000.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic requirements: Indian Undergraduate Applicants' Eligibility Requirements Higher Secondary Grade 12 School Certificate  provided by the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) or Indian Cert of Secondary Education with a minimum overall score of 75% and an English score of 70%. (ICSE)All India Secondary School Certificate (Grade 12) or equivalent scoresAll other boards demand a 75% English scoreThe minimum age for students is 18 English Language Proficiency International students should submit one of the following English language proficiency test scores:   Indian Graduate Applicants' Eligibility Requirements Academic requirements: International graduates who want to enrol in postgraduate courses must have a bachelor's degree that is comparable to an Irish bachelor's degree. Indian graduates must score at least 55% in business degree programmes, and at least 60% in other graduate programmes English Language Proficiency International students should submit one of the following English language proficiency test scores:

Placement: Students must submit a Placement Application Form to the placement office and attend weekly placement classes to be placed. Students are recruited by top companies such as Google, Accenture, Bank of Ireland, Cadbury, Citigroup, Coca-Cola, Facebook, Goldman Sachs, HSBC, IBM, Intel, JP Morgan Chase & Co, Loreal, Microsoft, Oracle, SAP, Unilever, Zurich Financial Services, and many others after they complete their graduation.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation  Maynooth University offers on-campus housing for its students, with five distinct residences. Maynooth University has five residence options Courtyard Plaza, courtyard apartment, river apartment, village apartment, and The rye hallThe Residences are only for persons who can live alone without the support of other residents or outside helpApartment residents mirror the campus' diversity, so you may expect to live in an apartment among people of any gender (excluding minors), nationality or origin, age, and course or yearFamilies and children under the age of 17 are not permitted to live in halls of residenceFacilities:Microwave, oven, fridge, and kettle are all included in the fully equipped kitchenThe rooms include a dining room as well as a loungeAll flats have free WIFI On-campus housing link Off-Campus Accommodation Off-campus facilities include fully furnished apartments, with the average monthly rent between 500 and 600 EUR. Studio apartments, three-bedroom, four-bedroom, and communal apartments are among the residential typesParking, central heating, cable television, a washing machine, dishwasher, and a microwave are all included in the student housingMany shared residences have room-by-room rentals Off-campus housing link

Name: Trinity College Dublin, the University of Dublin
Overview: Founded in 1592, Trinity College Dublin is one of the oldest institutes in Ireland. Trinity College has over 18,000 students from more than 122 countries and offers over 600 undergraduate, postgraduate, short courses, and online programs. The college is highly acclaimed for its Law, Literature and Humanities, health sciences, and STEM programs.Trinity College Dublin has a competitive acceptance rate of 34% and accepts applications through the online application portal, with an application fee of 55 EUR. Academic transcripts, IELTS/TOEFL scores, Letters of Recommendation, and course-specific CV/resume must also be submitted. The college is spread across 51 acres and is known for its Georgian architecture, museums, art galleries, and theatres.With more than 6 million printed volumes, Trinity Library is the most extensive library in Ireland. Trinity College also houses the institute's Business School, Science Gallery, the Long Room Hub Institute for Arts and Humanities, The Lir Academy for Dramatic Art, the nanoscience research center (CRANN), and the Biomedical Sciences Institute. The annual tuition fee ranges from USD 28,000 to 56,000.There are many options for availing of financial aid, some of which are the Global Business Scholarship and Postgraduate Research Scholarship. The government of Ireland Scholarship offers a 100% tuition fee waiver. Students can seek accommodation at The Trinity Hall with a capacity of over 1,000 students in shared, single, or twin apartments or at Kavanagh Court and Binary Hub.The average price of rooms is USD 205 per week. The average annual cost of living can be up to USD 13,800. Trinity College students can choose from over 170 societies and sports clubs, including hockey, rowing, investing, advocacy, animation, and zoology. Trinity College has a more than 92% employment rate. With its location in Ireland's Silicon Valley, Trinity College students find employment opportunities from companies such as Google, Facebook, Microsoft, PayPal, LinkedIn, Airbnb, and eBay.
Eligibility Overview: All applicants must demonstrate proficiency in English. The following qualifications are accepted/permitted: 1 Irish Leaving Certificate: an ordinary level English mark of 6 or better. 2 GCSE: English Language with a C or above. 3 US High School: English grade of C in senior year.6.5 on the IELTS (academic version) (no individual band below 6)IELTS (academic version) 7 (no individual band below 7) for dental coursesIELTS (academic version) 7 for Clinical Speech and Language Studies (no individual band below 7) A minimum score of 63on the Pearson Test of English (Academic) - PTE Academic (with no Communication Skills section score below 59) is requiredEnglish A1, A2, or B: 5 at Higher Level in the International Baccalaureate (4 at Standard Level if presenting IB through English)
Accommodation: On-campus housing is located in the heart of the city, in either historic buildings in the centre of the university or more modern structures further east. Trinity's historic campus offers students a one-of-a-kind and unforgettable housing experience in the magnificent surroundings of the 400-year-old universityfor more detail click on this llink-https://www.tcd.ie/accommodation/on-campus/

Name: EDUCO- Technological University Dublin
Overview: Technological University Dublin is Ireland's first technological university, formed by amalgamating three existing institutes of technology in the Dublin area, namely Dublin Institute of Technology, the Institute of Technology, Blanchardstown, and the Institute of Technology, Tallaght. The university has five main campuses in Grangegorman, Aungier Street, Bolton Street, Blanchardstown, and Tallaght in the greater Dublin area. The five campuses house over 70 student-run societies and 40 student clubs, including Gaelic Athletic Association, football, Handball, powerlifting, archery, rowing, skiing, basketball, kite surfing, and cricket. With over 28,500 students and 3,000 staff, the university has five colleges, associated schools, and several research institutes and centers emphasizing computer science and STEM subjects. Popular courses include Product Design, Mechanical Engineering, Architecture, Engineering, Science, Marketing, Hospitality, Music, Optometry, Pharmaceuticals, Construction, Digital Media, and Journalism.The TU Dublin Career Development Centre helps students secure employment from top companies, including Accenture, Ernst and Young, Deloitte, Microsoft, Google, and Amazon.Student accommodation options in the university include; living with a host family, staying in a student accommodation hub, or renting private accommodation, with the help of TU Dublin StudentPad. The annual cost of living can be up to EUR 12,000. The annual tuition fee can range from EUR 10,000 to EUR 12,500. Students can avail of various scholarships for financial aid, including the Government of Ireland Scholarships and the Centenary Scholarships for International Students.

QualificationMinimum Grade

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

HSC XII

 

Standard XI will not meet TU Dublin's minimum requirements. Applicants with these qualifications must complete a recognized Foundation program. 

Successful completion of HSC XII

  • HSC XII: CBSE, ICSE, Kolkata or Tamil Nadu boards with an overall average of 70% or above.
  • HSC XII: West Bengal board with an overall average of 58% or above.
  • HSC XII: Maharashtra or Gujarat boards with an overall average of 75% or above.
  • HSC XII: All other state boards with an overall average of 80%+ or above

or

Successful completion of Standard XI with 55% OR successful completion of Standard XII 50% plus successful completion of TU Dublin Foundation or another recognised pre-university foundation with relevant subjects and 60% - 65%

or

Successful completion of 1 year of an Indian degree with an average of 55% with relevant subjects at a recognised third-level or higher education institution in addition to completion of senior high school. This assessment will be on a case-by-case basis.

Additional Requirements

  • Where Maths is required for a specific degree programme, a minimum grade of 75% is required in Maths, 80% is required for Engineering/Computing/Science programme.
  • Where a Lab Science subject is required for a specific degree programme, a minimum grade of 80% is required in a Lab Science subject
Placement: Work placement is an essential component of TU Dublin's higher education programs. It provides students with the opportunity to apply what they have learned, continue to develop new practice-based skills, and gain an awareness of what is expected of them in the profession, in our opinion.Employers benefit from chances to create research partnerships, recruit graduates, and collaborate with a Higher Education Institute on knowledge transfer and the creation of employable graduates.Work placement is a three-way collaboration between the company, the higher education institution, and the student. It allows companies to find a valuable source of competent labor for their company or organization and a pipeline for future recruitment needs.

Name: University College Cork
Overview: Founded in 1845, the University College Cork is a leading research institute situated in Cork, Ireland. It comprises seven faculties (Commerce, Engineering, Arts and Celtic Studies, Medicine, Science, Law, Food Science and Technology) in 4 colleges- College of Business and Law; College of Arts, Celtic Studies and Social Sciences; College of Medicine and Health; College of Science, Engineering and Food Science. With more than 21,000 students, the university is spread across 42 acres having state-of-the-art buildings like Alfred O'Rahilly, Cavanagh Pharmacy, Brookfield Health Science Center, Bio Green Café, Lewis Glucksman Gallery, Boole Library, and many more. There are over 50 active sports clubs and 100+ societies in gaming, political, social, religious, martial arts, water-sports, and other athletic games. The eligibility criteria for admission to University College Cork are based on scores in IELTS (6.5 and above), TOEFL (90 and above), PTE (63 and above), along with an admission fee of 50 EUR. Students can enroll in around 70 undergraduate and several postgraduate programs at an average tuition charge of 16,000 EUR- 22,000 EUR and 14,000 EUR- 20,000 EUR, respectively. The university provides financial aid up to 100% tuition fee to international students as loans, bursaries, scholarships like CACSSS Excellence Scholarship, SEFS Postgraduate and Undergraduate Scholarship, Quercus Masters Scholarship for all disciplines, etc. more. Campus Accommodation UCC DAC provides six on-campus residential complexes- Victoria Lodge, University Hall, Mardyke Hall, Victoria Mills, Castlewhite Apartments, and Aras Ui Thuama for students with a booking deposit of 300 EUR. With average staying expenses of 6,100 EUR, you will have Single, En Suite, Twin, and Single Ensuite room options. These charges include a fitted kitchen, TV, internet connection, laundry, wardrobe, enclosed parking area, and other facilities. With a 90% employment rate, graduates from University College Cork get placed with an average package of 71,000 USD- 90,000 USD.

Name: Griffith College - Dublin
Overview: Established in 1974, Griffith College is a third-level private educational institute in Dublin, Ireland. All three campuses- Dublin (main campus), Cork, and Limerick have high-tech infrastructures.The significant faculties at Griffith College are the Faculty of Journalism and Media Communications, Faculty of Teaching and Learning, Faculty of Design, Faculty of Business, Faculty of Engineering, Faculty of Professional Accountancy, Faculty of Law, Faculty of Lifelong Learning, Faculty of Music and Multimedia, Faculty of Pharmaceutical Science, Faculty of Professional Law, Faculty of Counselling & Psychotherapy, Faculty of Computing.More than 7,400 students are enrolled in 190+ undergraduate, postgraduate, international, professional, and short-term courses with part-time, full-time, blended, and online learning options. Students with IELTS and TOEFL certifications can fill out the online application form with an Academic Administration fee of 250 EUR.The tuition fee for postgraduate and undergraduate courses is 14,000 EUR and 12,000 EUR, respectively. Along with an application fee of 300 EUR, the average per night charges are 23- 46 EUR. Off-campus accommodation is available at an average monthly rent of 500- 700 EUR. The college also offers two types of financial support: Griffith College Dublin Bursary and Academic Merit Scholarship to international students. Griffith College provides placement assistance to students who can back an annual salary of 45,000- 65,000 USD.
Eligibility Overview: English Language RequirementsInternational applicants must meet English language standards.If you have completed previous studies in a language other than English, you may be required to take an English language test to indicate that you have met the English language requirements for your degree.You may be exempt if you have already studied in English. As part of your application, your eligibility will be evaluated.Check here for more details: https://www.griffith.edu.au/apply/international/understanding-entry-requirements#:~:text=English%20language%20requirements%20apply%20to,English%20you%20may%20be%20exempt.
Placement: Nil
Accommodation: Housing at GriffithOn a lovely 7-acre site in the heart of Dublin city, Griffith College Halls of Residence (GHR) provides students with a safe, secure, and private living place. Built in 2004, this purpose-built environment provides a comfortable and convenient lodging choice, especially for people who live outside of the capital.Our 24/7 security crew patrols the campus on a regular basis and is available to assist any GHR resident who requires assistance at any time.In the Dublin rental market, GHR is also relatively affordable. All costs are included in our fee, including water, electricity, heating, and Wi-Fi, subject to a fair usage policy.Check: https://www.griffith.ie/offices/accommodation
Course Description: Griffith College - Dublin is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. Griffith College - Dublin was founded in 1974. Located in Dublin,Ireland the university is home to about 1921 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.Griffith College - Dublin is ranked 8650th in Top Universities by Webometrics - World. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 7 undergraduate and 1 postgraduate programs. Griffith College - Dublin has 5 intakes in Feb, Jul, Nov,Sep, Jan. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 0 years and master’s degree courses is 1 years.The average yearly tuition fee of Griffith College - Dublin is around 12000.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by Griffith College - Dublin include Centenary Scholarship Msc Marketing,Ontario Graduate Scholarships Ogs Western University ,Doris Dixon Scholarship,University Of Calgary International Entrance Award.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to Griffith College - Dublin is the post-study work opportunities in Ireland. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.Griffith College - Dublin has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: Dublin City University
Overview: Established in 1989, Dublin City University is a renowned international university located in Dublin, Ireland. All five campuses in Glasnevin (DCU Glasnevin Campus, DCU Alpha Innovation Campus, DCU Sports Campus) and Drumcondra (DCU St. Patrick's Campus, DCU All Hallows Campus) are within a 3 kilometers radius of each other connected with public transport facilities. The university is divided into five faculties, Faculty of Science and Health, Faculty of Humanities & Social Science, Faculty of Engineering and Computing, DCU Institute of Business, and DCU Institute of Education. Additional facilities at the university include the Sports Pavilion, Inter Faith Center with medical and counselling service center, Church of Ireland Center, DCU Library with over 100 online databases, sound studios, computer labs, The Helix with Mahony Hall, six restaurants, a beauty salon, and general stores. Dublin City University houses more than 7,400 students pursuing over 200 postgraduate and undergraduate degree courses in Business, Health, Sciences, Engineering, and Humanities. Students can apply in Fall and Spring intakes after scoring minimum English proficiency grades in IELTS (6.5), TOEFL (92), PRE (63), along with an application fee of 50 EUR. The tuition fees per module for undergraduate programs is 900 EUR (for EU Students) and 1,280 EUR (for International students) while postgraduate courses cost 1,880 EUR (for EU Students) and 2,880 EUR (for international students). The university provides financial aid to students under Academic Scholarship Programme (up to 500 EUR), Merit Scholarship Program (up to 2,000 EUR), Sports Scholarship, etc. The on-campus accommodation facilities are given in residential buildings like Hampstead Apartments, and College Park Apartments with 4-5 shared bedroom options. The total expenditure of 6,150 EUR includes services like a kitchen, living room, free Wi-Fi, parking, ATM, laundry, and many more. Dublin City University enhances employment for graduates through pre-placement sessions to help them get annual salaries between 70,000 USD and 105,000 USD in companies like Dell, Google, eBay, Intel, etc.
Eligibility Overview: Entry Requirements to Undergraduate ProgramsApplicants are judged on how well they performed in their high school graduation exams. Applicants must meet the following entrance requirements in order to be considered:Entry Requirements in GeneralCourse Specific RequirementsResults from multiple sittings may be sufficient to meet general entry requirements and specialized programme requirements.Applicants who meet the minimal entry requirements are ranked in order of merit for admission based on their school leaving examination scores.
Placement: Dublin City University is ranked #301-500 in QS's graduate placement rankings for 2020. The following DCU programmes produced some of the highest-paid graduates:Executive MBA- 85,000 EUR/yrMBA- 78,000 EUR/yrMasters in Finance- 74,000 EUR/yrExecutive Masters- 68,000 EUR/yrBachelors- 62,000 EUR/yrFinance, management, consulting & accounting, and engineering students received one of the greatest packages available.
Accommodation: Housing at DCUThe University's central location puts you close to the heart of Dublin, where you can learn about and enjoy the city's history, shopping, and culture. Within walking distance of the university, you may enjoy the city's picturesque centre or the hustle of its nightlife. DCU understands that each student's demands are unique, which is why they provide single and double rooms, as well as shared student housing, for a memorable student experience.Check here for more details: https://www.dcuaccommodation.ie/
Course Ranking: Dublin City University's Master in Management programme appears to be reasonably well-liked based on course rankings. According to the Financial Times' ranking of master's programmes, DCU is among the top 100 programmes. Except for 2019, DCU has consistently occupied the 85th and 86th spots in the standings. In addition, DCU's rating in the QS (Top UniversitiesAccounting) and Finance rankings for the academic years 2019 and 2020 ranged from 251-300. The ranking of DCU by THE (Times Higher Education) in the PG Business and Economics rating rose from 301-400 in 2019 to 251-300 in 2021. In this case, we can assert that DCU has enhanced the learning environment, generated income, and earned a solid reputation for its business and economics program—all of which fall within the essential elements of THE. Regarding DCU's engineering and technology ranking, we can claim that major ranking publications QS and THE have consistently lowered DCU's place over time. DCU was ranked by QS from 262nd in 2017 to 401-450 in 2020. Similarly, THE gave DCU ratings ranging from 251-300 in 2018 to 401-500 in 2021. Additionally, from 2019 to 2021, THE regularly ranked DCU between positions 251-300 in its PG Computers ranking.
University Ranking: Dublin City University (DCU), which was founded in 1974 as the National Institute for Higher Education, began taking students in 1980 and received university status in 1989. Now take a deeper look at Dublin City University's position in the academic world. DCU was placed at 439th in the world according to QS (Top Universities2021 )'s university rating. QS has maintained DCU's ranking, moving it from 422nd in 2017 to 439th in 2021. DCU was similarly removed off US News & World Report's list of top universities worldwide, which ranged from 752 in 2018 to 838 in 2021. DCU's ranking in 2021 by THE (Times Higher Education) is between 501 and 600, a remarkable improvement of 200 points over the previous year. The two main criteria used to determine THE's global university ranking, teaching and research, must have been better at Dublin City than they were.

Name: National College of Ireland
Overview: The National College of Ireland is situated in Dublin, Ireland. More than 5,000 students at the National College of Ireland study various undergraduate and postgraduate courses in Business, Computing, Marketing, Data Analytics, Human Resources, Cybersecurity, and others. The tuition fee for undergraduate, master's and higher diploma is 10,000 EUR, 15,000 EUR, and 12,000 EUR, respectively. The college offers financial aid to international students under programs like Higher Diploma Scholarship (4,000 EUR), Entrepreneur Scholarship (50% of tuition fees), NCI President's Award (3,000 EUR), Undergraduate Scholarships (2,000 EUR), Women in Business Scholarships (50% of tuition fees), etc. With a 96% employment rate, graduates from the National College of Ireland get placed or pursue higher studies within six months of the degree. Due to its location in the International Financial Services Centre, students gain an average annual package between 55,000 USD and 75,000 USD in companies like JP Morgan, Facebook, Google, LinkedIn, etc.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic and English language proficiency score requirements: Undergraduate Programs CBSE, ICSE, Kolkata, and Tamil Nadu boards scored 70% or higherFor students from the West Bengal board, a score of 58% is requiredStudents in Maharashtra or Gujarat must have a grade point average of 75% or above in secondary schoolStudents from all other state boards must get a score of at least 80%International Foundation courses have varied entry requirements, ranging from 60% to 65% Postgraduate Programs A GPA of 2.2 or above and a bachelor's degree from a reputed universityCertificates from high school with satisfactory grades English Proficiency Requirements:

Name: Athlone Institute of Technology
Overview: In Athlone, County Westmeath, Ireland, lies the Athlone Institute of Technology (AIT), a higher education institution of technology. It was established in 1970 and currently enrolls more than 6,000 students, both full-time and part-time. AIT is among the leading professional institutions that liaise with the industry to understand skills and gaps and provide relevant solutions. Athlone Institute of Technology offers science, design, engineering, informatics, business, social sciences, and hospitality courses. Apart from its highly competent technical courses, AIT also offers its students great added value. Over 11% of the student population is of varied nationalities, ensuring a great cultural experience for international students. Over 90% of the students are enrolled in further training or a job within six months of completing their course. Through its modern facilities and experienced faculty, Athlone Institute of Technology helps offer students a truly enriching experience. Affiliated with over 200 other institutes worldwide, AIT's connections with big names in the industry have also proven beneficial in providing students with better employment opportunities.Athlone is among the liveliest towns in Ireland. Buzzing with annual drama festivals, theatre shows, clubs, art galleries, clubs, and shopping centers. Athlone offers plenty of avenues for relaxation and inspiration. With several options for comfortable and affordable accommodation, Athlone makes the stay for all students great. The AITs Students' Union pitches in to help abundantly.Tuition fees for international students range up to EUR 10,000 per course. AIT has the highest academic experience rating in Ireland. The institute is also ranked in fourth place in innovation partnership projects.
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility requirement which the applicants needs to meet is as follows :  Equivalent of Honours Bachelor Degree from a recognised University in a discipline relevant to the postgraduate degree sought with minimum average of 60% in final year examinations. Please check Bachelor degree classification for entry to certain postgraduate programmes. Letter of recommendation from academic lecturer from home university.
Placement: The Career Office offers placement assistance by organising career fairs, boot camps and recruitment programmes. They also assist with drafting resumes and preparing for employer interviews and presentations.  Also Read: Highest Paying Jobs In The UK 2022: How To Get Them
Accommodation: Several accommodation options are available around Athlone Institute of Technology. Average rentals are between 650 and 750 Euros a month. The institute does not offer campus accommodation.  Read more here on the UK's cost of living for Indian students.

Name: CCT college Dublin
Overview: College of Computing Technology (CCT) College Dublin is one of Ireland's leading professional and higher education institutions. This college was established in 2005 and is a state-of-the-art campus in the middle of Dublin. Founded as the College of Computing Technology (CCT), it offers an outstanding education in computing and business. Although it is a specialist institution in providing education related to computing, CCT also has a dedicated faculty for its business courses. Additionally, CCT College is a member of the Higher Education Colleges Association (HECA). The faculty of ICT and Computing at this institute is dedicated to advancing innovation in ICT. It offers both full-time and part-time programs, including weekend and evening programs. A few of the most sorted courses at CCT Dublin include MA in International Business, Master of Science in Applied Software Development, Master of Science in Data Analytics, Bachelor of Science in Computing and IT and others. Apart from these, a few short courses include a Diploma in Digital Marketing, Modular Diploma in Python Programming, Modular Diploma in Data Analytics Diploma in DevOps, Diploma in Cyber Security Fundamentals and others. They are also a part of a new conference that aims to enhance pedagogical techniques for ICT and Computing. All the courses at CCT College are industry-aligned and are designed to meet the industry requirements. Apart from it, these institutes also provide graduate professional assistance and career guidance. For admissions and academic documents, students must submit an English language proficiency test score of a minimum of 6 in IELTS and 60-78 in TOEFL iBT except for Master of Science in Applied Software development. As the courses of CCT College are aligned with industry requirements thus, students have a big chance of employment. Also, alumni of this college are working in leading organisations; therefore, they can avail themselves of this opportunity to get a job. "

Name: IBAT College Dublin
Overview: The Institute of Business And Technology College (IBAT) was founded in May 2004 in the Republic of Ireland in Dublin. The college, formerly known as the IBAT College Swords, established its first campus at Foster Bay in the Swords Area in the Northern part of Dublin. The Dublin City Campus was later established at Wellington Quay in 2011. The college is renowned for its well-equipped campuses, IT labs, libraries, and several canteens and breakouts for students to study and enjoy their leisure time. The college ranks 33rd in Ireland, according to Webometrics. The institute is home to more than 1500 students from around 45 countries, serving as a cultural hub for international students to network. The acceptance rate at IBAT is 12.5%, and the average tuition fee is around EUR 9000 annually. Female students can avail of the Women in Tech Scholarship offered by the IBAT College and other scholarships. It is one of the leading research-intensive universities in Europe and has links with more than 400 enterprises for graduate placements.IBAT College, Dublin is a vibrant community filled with excited students who want to make their mark in the world. By joining this campus, you can enjoy the company of highly-skilled individuals from different ethnicities, races, sexualities, and gender. The college conducts cultural visits to institutes around Dublin to enable students to build networks. The IBAT College Dublin offers specialized courses to equip students with various aspects of business such as digital marketing, supervisor management, business analytics, strategic business management, etc.  The college equips students with required skills through specialist courses such as Desktop Publishing, Programming, and Data Analytics. It also conducts literary workshops to help students develop skills such as evaluating information, avoiding plagiarism, etc.

Placement: With the partnership with more than 400 enterprises, the college provides varied employment opportunities for graduates. Dublin is home to many tech giants, such as Google, Facebook, Mastercard, etc., for aspiring professionals can aim for. The college offers a 12-month post-student work permit that allows students to gain work experience. Industry-oriented teaching is one of the many reasons behind the high number of placements at Ibat College Dublin. The Placement Cell of the University organizes personality development programs, seminars, workshops, and industry visits to train its students for their respective industries. Some of the top recruiters at the University include Amway India Ltd., Bennett & Coleman, American Express, British Airways, Coca-Cola, Ernst & Young, Dabur India Ltd., HCL Group, Gillette India Ltd., Hindustan Times, HSBC, etc. The average starting salary for IBAT is around €33k.

Both sites are easily accessible from all residences and homes, which are well served by public transportation. Residences for students includeFully furnished communal self-catering kitchen with all utensils and crockeryBed linens, pillows, and duvetsElectricity, gas, and Wi-FiSecure housesBathroom Communal The college does not provide on-campus accommodation. Visit the college website to learn more about on-campus accommodation. Off-Campus Accommodation Single Room, Double Room, Twin Room, Shared Room, Apartment, House, and Flats are all residence optionsThe typical monthly rent is between €500 and €700The amenities include central heating, a washing machine, a microwave, Internet, and a free laundromat.The rooms are offered for a few weeks, during the summer or the semester. Visit this site to learn more about off-campus accommodation.

Name: Dun Laoghaire Institute of Art, Design and Technology
Overview: The Dun Laoghaire Institute of Art, Design and Technology is a university located in Dublin, Ireland. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study. The main campus of Dun Laoghaire Institute of Art, Design and Technology is located in Dublin. The university offers over 10 undergraduate programs and 5 postgraduate programs. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. Dun Laoghaire Institute of Art, Design and Technology offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Read more details about Dun Laoghaire Institute of Art, Design and Technology on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.
Eligibility Overview: Entry Requirements for IADTYou must meet the minimum admission requirements for each course, as well as any specific programme requirements, if you apply to IADT. Many of our courses also ask you to submit a portfolio.At www.iadt.ie/study/how-to-apply/leaving-cert-requirements, applicants should check the minimum entry requirements of each individual course, such as Math or English levels, the number of Honors subjects required, and any other requirements of a particular course, such as a portfolio, entrance test, or interview.
Accommodation: IADT does not currently have any on-campus housing and does not keep a formal housing list. We recommend that students visit appropriate websites (see below), newspapers, and local community notices for information on available housing.For more details:https://iadt.ie/for-students/accommodation/

Name: Institute of Technology, Sligo
Overview: The Institute of Technology, Sligo is located in Sligo, Ireland. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study. The main campus of the Institute is located in Sligo. The university offers over 39 undergraduate programs and 2 postgraduate programs. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. The University offers scholarships, work-study and also has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Read more details about Institute of Technology, Sligo on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate – Year 1 EntryStandard XII examinations from CBSE, CISCE or State Boards of Higher Secondary Education with a minimum score of 70% overall including 65% in Maths & English. Postgraduate Taught3 or 4-year Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant subject from a recognised higher education institution that is considered comparable to a 2:2 Irish Bachelor (Honours) Degree (NQF Level 8)
Accommodation: Why live on campus?For its strong sense of community, Sligo is well known. Living there is safe, pleasant, and enjoyable. This sense of camaraderie creates a very encouraging environment. Students immediately develop lifelong connections and cherishable memories. Sligo provides the ideal lodging to suit any individual, with a wide variety of options accessible  More than 30 times a day, the Sligo City bus service makes stops on campus, giving students more alternatives for where to live. Some people opt to reside around the college. Others select lodging in the city centre to enjoy the commotion of the stores, restaurants, cafes, and nightlife. Some people choose the stunningly beautiful coastal communities of Rosses Point and Strandhill. In comparison to many of Ireland's other college towns and cities, the price of student housing is significantly lower. A single room costs €63 per week, while a twin room starts at €57. The funds allow you to enjoy your time as a student without worrying that it would be financially ruinous.

Name: Technological University of the Shannon: Midlands Midwest (TUS)
Overview: "Technological University of the Shannon: Midlands Midwest, Athlone is located in the heart of Athlone, a big town on the river Shannon, Republic of Ireland. It is a public technological university established in October 2021. Owing to the Technological Universities Bill, it comes as a merger of Athlone Institute of Technology and Limerick Institute of Technology, the third such establishment within Ireland. This educational institution offers a wide variety of undergraduate, postgraduate and diploma programmes on a full time and part-time basis, along with online learning. This institution has introduced and developed programmes to meet changing international, regional and national needs. It primarily ventures into 4 faculty facilities of Business and Hospitality, Engineering and Informatics, Science and Health, and continuing, professional, online and Distance Learning. It focuses on research activities, and with the cooperation from industrial and commercial organisations, it ensures the relevance and technological expertise of courses. Further, ensure that graduates from the university receive enhanced employment prospects over the years from various commercial and industrial organisations. This institution is nationally and internationally regarded as a centre of excellence for its academic and practical training programmes. Furthermore, this institution offers various pioneering courses such as Physical Activity and Health, Microbiology and Animation and Illustration. Technological University of the Shannon: Midlands Midwest, Athlone has received accolades from the Places of Sanctuary. This institution is the first recipient to be designated as a College of Sanctuary for a range of initiatives. It has made efforts to welcome and include asylum seekers and refugees in the college community to foster a sanctuary culture that calls for inclusion for all. With updated tools and technologies, the online courses offered to students follow a market-oriented evolving curriculum, helping to enhance the learning experience. Further, this institution has strong industrial links that ensure excellent placement options and partnerships with third-level institutions provide the opportunity to spend a year around the world. "
Eligibility Overview: Evidence of your greatest level of education is necessary for admission to the first year of a programme.Transcripts from any previous programmes you have participated in are required if you want to earn advanced entrance into an undergraduate programme.Score on the English Language AssessmentA minimum IELTS 5.5 (or equivalent) score is required for First Year Undergraduate programmes.A minimum IELTS 6.0 (or equivalent) score is required for Advanced Entry and Postgraduate programmes.Other than IELTS, TUS accepts Duolingo, TOEFL, Cambridge, and Pearson as proof of English language ability.
Placement: TUS is proud of its capacity to cultivate our students' interest and excitement through a blended learning method that combines theory and practise. All of our courses provide students with the skills they need to succeed in the profession.Many of our courses include job placement options, allowing students to practise their skills and knowledge in a real-world setting. We have several solid links with industry companies, allowing our students to establish career connections before they even graduate!'Work placement is included in over 70% of TUS courses.''Every year, about 1,200 TUS students participate in national and international work assignments.'
Accommodation: Students arrange their housing using the list of available places provided in this portion of the website, and they are responsible for negotiating terms and conditions. To ensure that their preferred housing is available, prospective students should contact the Accommodation Office as soon as possible.The accommodation service works on a referral basis and does not recommend or favour certain dwellings/accommodation; all information provided by the accommodation service is based on information provided to us. We do not confirm or verify accommodations because the tenant is responsible for doing so during their inspection. We do not get involved in or resolve contract disputes or difficulties involving renters or landlords.

Name: University of Limerick
Overview: University of Limerick (UL) was founded in 1972 as the National Institute for Higher Education, located in Limerick, Ireland. UL houses over 11,000 full-time students and 1,300 staff members. The university has four faculties, Kemmy Business School, Faculty of Education and Health Sciences, Faculty of Science and Engineering, and the Faculty of Arts, Humanities, and Social Sciences. UL offers more than 70 UG and 100 PG courses at doctoral and postdoctoral levels. As part of their degree, the students are offered an eight-month work placement with one of the 1,700 cooperative employers associated with the university. Annually, more than 2,000 students secure placements in industry, public service, and commerce.On-campus accommodation is provided to students in 2,500 rooms across six student villages and can cost up to EUR 4,500 annually. The total average cost of living for University of Limerick students can be up to EUR 10,500 per year. The University of Limerick is known for its cooperative education programs. The University of Limerick accepts applications online for an application fee of 35 EUR. The general documents needed are the official academic transcripts, mark sheets, degree completion certificate, and English language certificate. The average annual fee for various courses may range from EUR 11,500 to 43,000. Students can avail of financial aid through the Faculty of Science & Engineering Scholarships, Kemmy Business School International Scholarships, and the Faculty of Arts, Humanities & Social Sciences Scholarships.

Name: Dundalk Institute of Technology
Overview: Dundalk Institute of Technology (DkIT) was founded as the Dundalk Regional Technical College in County Louth, Ireland. With about 4,500 students and 500 full-time staff, DkIT offers several undergraduate, postgraduate, and research courses in its four schools, namely the School of Business & Humanities, School of Engineering, School of Informatics & Creative Arts, and School of Health & Science. The popular courses include those in Accounting, Engineering, and Law. Students must produce proof of their English proficiency by submitting IELTS/TOEFL scores. The minimum requirements of these courses vary from course to course.The average annual tuition fee across different courses ranges from 10,000-15000 EUR. Students can apply for scholarships, such as the ABP Agri-Food Student Bursary, DkIT Sports Scholarships, Servisource Nursing Scholarship, and Academic Merit-based scholarships.More than 55% of the courses at DkIT have opportunities for work placement. Over 89% of the DkIT graduates find employment or are engaged in further studies within nine months of graduating.

Accommodation: Why live on campus?Dundalk Student Village is a 25-minute walk from Dundalk Clarke Train Station and is located on the Dundalk IT campus. There are 40 student units in this complex. Each apartment features five single bedrooms, each with a single bed and a study desk and chair, two bathrooms, a fully equipped kitchen, and a living area with a TV and DVD player. The town is only accessible by fob, with 24-hour security and a daytime caretaker.There are 100 PCs for student use, along with wireless internet access. Students can seek accommodation in the Halls of Residence, with one hall on campus and two other halls a short distance from the main campus. The cost of housing can be up to EUR 400 per month.DkIT students can avail of facilities such as the Learning & Development Center, Counseling Service, Student's Health Clinic, Career Services, Sports Clubs and Societies, and the DkIT Student Union. The institute library is located in the Whitaker building, with 400 study spaces, more than 50,000 journals and books, and a wide range of online databases.

Name: National University of Ireland Galway
Overview: Established in 1845, the National University of Ireland is a federal system of various Constituent Universities under the Universities Act 1997. The university manages 19,000 local and international students enrolled in more than 50 graduate, postgraduate, research, and part-time courses.The university is divided into five colleges (Social Sciences, College of Arts & Celtic Studies; College of Medicine, Nursing, & Health Sciences; College of Science and Engineering; Adult Learning and Professional Development; College of Business, Public Policy, & law) and 16 schools like School of English Creative and Arts, School of Health Sciences, School of Education, School of Engineering, and many more. Buildings designated for Human Biology, Biomedical Research Center, and Institute for Lifecourse and Society are located on the north campus. Accommodation costs around 5,000 EUR for a single bedroom while 5,700 EUR for a double bedroom. Using the online payment mode, students must submit an additional 375 EUR (Utilities Deposit) and 250 EUR (Booking Deposit). The eight other off-campus residences, like Galway Center, Donegan Court, Suite, etc., are privately owned and supervised with a monthly cost of 550-650 EUR. 94% of postgraduates and 96% of graduates from the National University of Ireland Galway get employment in medical science, engineering, and law.Students meeting the minimum eligibility criteria of 6.5 in IELTS and 88 in TOEFL can apply with a tuition fee of 2,600-4,800 EUR for graduate and 5,000 EUR for postgraduate degrees. The university provides scholarships to international students under the Postgraduate Merit Scholarship, NUI Galway Hardiman Scholarships, Undergraduate Merit Scholarship, Government of Ireland Scholarships, and other external funding sources.

Name: Letterkenny Institute of Technology
Overview: Letterkenny Institute of Technology, or LYIT, is located in Donegal, Ireland. Established in 1971, the institute has two campuses in Letterkenny and Killybegs. It has smaller class sizes and an excellent staff-to-student ratio. The students receive research opportunities for Master and Ph.D. programs at customized levels. LYIT has many strategic research centers focused on wireless sensors, marine biotechnology, innovation technology, and electronics production. Letterkenny Institute of Technology offers affordable quality education programs in Ireland. The courses offered by the university range from higher certificate programs to Ph.D. courses. LYIT offers support to its students through various student services such as counseling, a learning support unit, medical care, and career services. The institute encourages the holistic growth of individuals through its various clubs and societies that help them avail themselves of many social, sporting, or cultural opportunities. LYIT offers various courses and programs through its four schools of Business, Science, Tourism, and Engineering. The Erasmus mobility programs at Letterkenny Institute Of Technology provide students with study and work placements through partnerships with 50 other European institutions. Letterkenny Institute of Technology also offers other facilities for students, such as performance areas, recreation rooms, restaurant areas, and meeting spaces. Letterkenny Institute of Technology provides full-time courses at an approximate tuition fee of 12,000 EUR. Students can also choose from various societies and clubs such as the Canoe Club, Android App Society, International Society, Ethical Hacking Society, LGBTQ +, Public Speaking Society, Law Society, and Gaisce Society.

Name: National College of Art and Design
Overview: National College of Art and Design can be traced back to Robert West's drawing school in George's Lane, founded in 1746 and funded by the Dublin Society. The French Enlightenment, Victorian schools of design, particularly industrial design, the Arts and Crafts movement, the search for Irish national identity, and developments in British art education in the 1960s have all impacted this institution.  The school also influenced Irish social and cultural developments, significantly influencing the eighteenth-century Irish school of painting and sculpture and the standard of applied adornment in architecture and crafts. Most notable 20th Century Irish artists have studied at the college, including Sir William Orpen and Oliver Sheppard. There was an impetus for industrial design reform in the face of an independent Ireland's new economic future. As a result of this movement, a statute was passed in 1971 that re-established the institution and gave it academic autonomy. In 1975, the college was reformed again, and a wide range of degree programs was created.  After moving to Thomas Street in the early 1980s, the institution expanded its undergraduate program and added a variety of postgraduate courses and research-based alternatives up to the doctoral level.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: Bachelors: Students from outside Ireland who wish to pursue a bachelor's degree at NCAD must obtain a high school diploma from their native country equivalent to the Irish School Leaving Certificate.International applicants must provide certified copies of their second-level or equivalent examination transcripts.You must submit both the original language version and a verified English translation of your transcripts. Masters: International applicants must present certified transcripts of all past educational achievements, including second-level or comparative tests and bachelor's degree score cards.You must submit both the original language version and a verified English translation of your transcripts.  English Requirements:

Name: Dublin Business School
Overview: Founded in 1975, Dublin Business School (earlier known as Accountancy and Business College) is an independent college in Dublin, Ireland. It is spread across six locations on Aungier Street (Main campus), Dame Street, Balfe Street, and South Great George's Street. The three schools- Professional School, School of Business and Law, and School of Arts offer full-time and part-time learning programs with an opportunity to study in state-of-the-art buildings, the latest laboratories, and 24/7 access to libraries. Apart from joining 30+ sports clubs regarding cricket, football, and basketball, students can also participate in various societies like law, computer, psychology, debate, fashion, etc. With more than 100 courses (70 for international students), Dublin Business School provides undergraduate and postgraduate courses in Arts, Information Technology, Accounting and Finance, Law, Journalism, and many more. The annual tuition fee for undergraduate and postgraduate courses is 9,800 EUR and 13,500 EUR, respectively, along with an admission fee of 50 EUR. International students can get additional financial support from Dublin Business School through partial scholarships of 500 EUR for Level 6, Level 7, and Level 8 programmes and 1000 EUR for Level 9 courses. Also, you can be eligible for the Refer a Friend scheme to get 500 EUR (Ireland student) and 300 EUR (Overseas student). Student apartments and host family accommodation (privately owned) are provided at convenient locations from the main campus. Within walking distance from DBS, residences like Point Campus in Point Village have single, double, cluster, and ensuite room options at an average rent of 600 EUR- 1,100 EUR per month. Amenities like washing machines, free internet access, standard rooms, study space, bike storage, launderette, and security are included. The DBS Careers and Appointment Service organizes several events regularly to assist students in developing intellectual skills. Graduates from Dublin Business School can get placement with an average salary of 47,000 USD to 72,000 USD per year.
Eligibility Overview: For UG students :Grade 12 in a relevant discipline from a recognised board of educationSAT (not mandatory) For MS students: Bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline from a recognised universityGRE (not mandatory) For MBA students: Bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline from a recognised university (equivalent to Level 8 education of Ireland)GMAT (mandatory)Minimum 2-3 years of work experience is required English language proficiency requirements are:IELTS: 6.0 or higherDuolingo (DET): 95 or higher
Placement: Executive MBA graduates at Dublin Business School make an average income of $68,000, making it the most lucrative degree available.The Dublin Business School graduates making the least money are those with a Master's in Science, with an average salary of $36,000 per year.

The university helps students to find such accommodations. Private student residences Private student residences are in self-catering fully-furnished houses or flats with several single and occasionally double bedrooms, a shared bathroom, and a living/kitchen area. It is available throughout the city and offers facilities and services specifically designed for students. Free Internet access is open in every bedroom. Rent or share Students at Dublin Business School find and book their housing each year. These can all be long-term or short-term rentals or sharing arrangements. Hostels Hostels can be found online through certain websites and can be booked online through those websites. For more information, visit: https://www.dbs.ie/international-students/international-non-eu-students/accommodation

Name: Waterford Institute of Technology
Overview: Waterford Institute of Technology, located in Waterford, Ireland, is one of the largest institutions in Ireland offering technological education. The institute is home to over 10,000+ students from around 70 countries. The Waterford Institute currently offers 70 undergraduate and 14 postgraduate programs and courses across its various academic schools.WIT offers enrollment for fall semesters only. The six significant departments at the WIT include the School of Engineering, School of Science, School of Business, School of Humanities, School of Lifelong Learning and Education, and School of Health Sciences. The top programs offered by the institute are Computer Science, Business, Law, Mechanical Engineering, and Criminal Justice. WIT also provides financial aid to eligible students under various financial programs.Students can also opt for work at WIT after completing their postgraduate studies. WIT also has over 140+ international education partnerships with renowned academic institutions. Some of the notable alums of the institute include Gráinne Mulvey, an Irish composer, Ciara Conway, a politician, and notable businessmen like Philip Lynch (CEO of IAWS Group). On-campus accommodation comprises three 66 single rooms accessible to people with disabilities. The complex, built in 2002, consists of two four-story apartment buildings with 94 units and 360 beds. These residences are close to all Waterford amenities and services as they are situated on the main campus.International students' tuition fee for studying bachelor's degree is 10,269 USD annually.

Course Description: Institute of Technology - Carlow is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. Institute of Technology - Carlow was founded in 1970. Located in Carlow,Ireland the university is home to about 1598 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.Institute of Technology - Carlow is ranked 4901th in Top Universities by Webometrics - World. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 3 undergraduate and 3 postgraduate programs. Institute of Technology - Carlow has 3 intakes in Sep,Jan,Aug. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 3 years and master’s degree courses is 1 years.The average yearly tuition fee of Institute of Technology - Carlow is around 11926 Euro approx.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by Institute of Technology - Carlow include Centenary Scholarship Msc Marketing,Ontario Graduate Scholarships Ogs Western University ,Doris Dixon Scholarship,University Of Calgary International Entrance Award.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to Institute of Technology - Carlow is the post-study work opportunities in Ireland. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.Institute of Technology - Carlow has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: Santa Monica College
Overview: Founded in 1929, Santa Monica College is a public community college in Santa Monica, California. This college was founded as a junior college; this institution accepts more than 30,000 students in more than 90 fields. The main campus is situated on Pico Boulevard. Besides, this college manages five satellite campuses across Santa Monica. In recent times, 2/3rd of students from this college are appointed part-time. This college's Arts Mentor Program offers sure Fine and Applied Arts students graduate-level training by skilled professionals in specialised fields. This college offers courses in 7 areas of interest: Business, Education, People and Society, Arts, Media and Entertainment, Culture, history and languages, Science, Engineering, Technology and Math. Apart from these, Santa Monica College offers associate degrees, bachelor of science courses, general education etc. This institution provides a wide range of occupational certificate programs involving fashion design and accounting and also offers logistics and supply and chain programs at AAS and certificate levels. The college is one of the few community colleges that possess a Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy instrument for research purposes. The Accrediting Commission approves this college for Community and Junior Colleges. Besides, students can avail various student services which help them to achieve their academic goals. Some benefits include- tutoring, education planning, child care services, on-campus student employment etc. Special scholarships are available for eligible incoming students ranging from 250 USD to 2,000 USD.
Eligibility Overview: English Proficiency Test Scores Santa Monica College requires an English Proficiency score from international students from non-English speaking countries in order to guarantee a successful entrance. The minimal test scores needed at the time of application are listed below.

Name: Ferris State University
Overview: Ferris State University is a public institute headquartered in Big Rapids, Michigan, founded in 1884. Every year, over 11,165 students enrolled, with an acceptance rate of 87%. Undergraduate and graduate programs are offered by seven colleges, namely the College of Business, Michigan College of Optometry, and College of Health Professions. Some popular courses are Actuarial Science, Social Work, Marketing, Educational Leadership, and Criminal Justice Administration. The main Ferris State University campus is located in Big Rapids, Michigan, and the university has several state-wide satellite campuses like Alpena, Flint, Petoskey, and Warren. Various Associate Degree programs are available in Dental Hygiene, Accountancy, Digital Mouth, and Psychology. Some of FSU's Certificate Programs are Cloud Computing, Graphic Design, Mathematics Education, and Retailing. Students can opt for Doctorate and Professional Programs like Pharmacy, Optometry, and Community College Leadership. There are numerous online degree and certificate programs like Integrative Studies, Risk Management, Machine Learning, and Cybersecurity. The university also has a General Education Program and an Honors Program for highly motivated students. The Study Abroad program enables students to participate in short-term, semester, and exchange programs in countries like China, Haiti, Scotland, Martinique, etc. On-campus accommodation is available in residence halls, apartments, and suites at Cardinal & Flinch Court, Robin Court, Pine, Maple, Pickell Hall, etc. FSU has a graduate employment rate of 91%.The estimated annual undergraduate tuition fee is USD 12,404 and USD 20,020 for US/Canadian and international students. The graduate fee is USD 659 and USD 989 for US/Canadian and international students.

Name: Colorado School of Mines
Overview: The Colorado School of Mines is situated in Golden, Colorado. It has been ranked as the no. 1 institution for mining and mineral engineering institute in the world. The Colorado School of Mines attracts more than 1300 students every year. Since its establishment in 1874, the institute has offered several graduates, undergraduates, and doctoral programs. It also offers short-term certificate programs which are linked with engineering and science. Colorado School of Mines comprises 11% of international students from across the world. The college ensures that students learn in a friendly and peaceful environment. It welcomes students belonging to diverse cultures. It has a campus area of 373 acres with 17 different buildings for academic and residential purposes. Some of the renowned subjects offered by the Colorado School of Mines are- Mineral and Energy, Mining, Engineering, Environmental Geochemistry, Nuclear Engineering, Hydrology, Technology Management, Petroleum Engineering, and many more. It has around 18 athletic teams that take part in NCAA Division II and others. The institute has 625 skilled and professional faculty members. Along with that students generally opt for campus hostels for several advantages and basic amenities. The average cost of tuition fee is around 37,350 USD. Hence, the hostel charges, books, and other miscellaneous charges can reach up to 57,3936 USD. The university also offers scholarships and financial aid to international students. It offers a work-study program where students can work and they are paid every 15 days. The scholarship and financial aid are provided upon diverse academic performance such as athletic contribution, merit, etc. It also organizes workshops in February and September to enhance the relationship with employers and the graduates. Colorado School of Mines has its recruiting platform known as "DiggerNetäó to assist and train students for internships, interviews, and discover jobs.
Eligibility Overview: The SAT/ACT standardised test results are not required for admission to Colorado School of Mines. International students, on the other hand, are encouraged to submit these scores in order to improve their prospects of admission and to participate in NCAA sports. Average SAT verbal score: 550; average ACT English score: 23, ACT composite: 31; average SAT critical reading and math score: 1380GPA (unweighted) in high school – 3.8 out of 4.0Scores on English proficiency tests – International students from countries where English is not the native language must take and submit English proficiency exams as evidence. Name: Savannah State University
Overview: The campus of Savannah State University is located in Savannah, Georgia. It is the oldest public black university, established in 1890. Around three universities are controlled under Savannah State University- the College of Liberal Arts and Social Science, Business Administration, and the College of Sciences and Technology. It also offers various recreational facilities for students. The campus has tennis, basketball, gymnasiums, swimming, and others. Other than that, it has its radio platform that plays different genres of music, talk shows, commentaries, etc. The university offers study programs for master's, bachelor's, and master's degrees are Mathematics, English, Applied Sciences, Architecture, Technology, Engineering, Social Sciences, and many more. Some of the renowned courses offered by the university are Studio and Fine Arts, Television, Radio, Design, and Digital Communication. It also offers comfortable and secure living for the students with its on-campus housing. Students are offered different types of housing facilities according to their choices. It provides basic amenities and appropriate facilities to the students. The average tuition fee for graduates is 726 USD, whereas, for undergraduates, it is around 600 USD. Hence, the total cost of living and hostel fees, tuition fees, and miscellaneous charges can be around 7000 USD per annum. The university also provides financial aid and scholarships to eligible students based on merit, test scores, and academic performance. Students get assistance in constructing resumes, personal statements, and mock interviews.

Name: Boston University
Overview: Boston University, also known as BU is a private university in Boston, Massachusetts having 17 schools and colleges on three urban campuses. The teaching and research institution was established in 1839 by Methodists, originally in Vermont, which later moved to Boston. The campus is spread over 135 acres along the Charles River in Boston's Fenway-Kenmore and Allston neighborhoods. Considered one of the largest universities in Boston, it offers more than 300 educational and graduate programs. Computer Science, Economics, International Relations, Mechanical Engineering, Psychology, and Business are the most popular ones for which in-person, online, and hybrid classes are available. There are 224 postgraduate courses, 53 Ph.D. programs and 63 certificate courses, and research opportunities. The online MBA program attracts many students worldwide, and so does the Boston University School of Law, which is one of the top 50 law schools and the second oldest in Massachusetts. Also, around 500 student clubs and 450 active student societies covering various activities are there for overall development. The men's hockey team has won five national championships making the university proud along with many other sports that the colleges participate in. With an acceptance rate of 22%, BU ranked 42nd for its undergraduate programs nationally. The average tuition fee is 58560 USD, while the cost of living is $14,000 to $17,000 a year. Students can apply for scholarships, and the university provides on-campus accommodation as well. All students living in dorms are enrolled in a year-long meal plan and are provided access to Mugar Memorial Library, the largest on campus, at all times. Special houses are also there for students with particular interests, and security is of utmost priority at BU. According to Times Higher Education, graduates from Boston are offered well-paid jobs in diverse fields, contributing to making them the most employable.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements A minimum 3.0 GPA is required for admission to Boston University. This equates to a percentile score of 83-86% and a grade of B+ for Indian peoples.You must complete an audition, submit a portfolio, or both if you are applying to the School of Theatre or the School of Visual Arts.You must send a pre-screening recording if you are applying to the School of Music for cello, double bass, flute, percussion, piano, trombone, trumpet, violin, or voice.They must submit three Accelerated Degree Teacher Evaluation forms and one additional Accelerated Programs essay if they are applying to the Accelerated Medical Program (BU's BS/MD program). English Requirements

Accommodation: On-Campus AccommodationWithout question, BU is a large university. BU is a vibrant community of ambitious students, leaders, and global thinkers, with almost 34,000 students. Despite this, we're pretty close. A little town in the centre of a big cityYou'll be smack in the middle of everything if you live on campus. You'll find everything you require right here. You have access to classes, friends, professors, infinite study opportunities, extracurricular activities, a bustling social life, and award-winning cuisine alternatives. Select from a variety of dwellings, all of which are safe and secureYou'll discover a place on campus where you can not only belong but also call home, whether you live in a lovely brownstone on a tree-lined street or a smart high-riseVisit Off-Campus Accommodation While all of the areas mentioned below are popular with Boston University students, Allston/Brighton is frequently the top choice among off-campus students.Allston/BrightonDespite the fact that Allston and Brighton are two separate neighbourhoods with their own zip codes and personalities, this area is frequently referred to as "Allston/Brighton." This region is particularly popular among BU undergraduates due to its vibrant nightlife, affordable housing, and closeness to the western end of the Charles River Campus. Allston/Brighton is close to dozens of retail shops, restaurants, and bars and is only 20 minutes from downtown Boston via the Green Line. Despite the fact that BU and Boston College students predominate in Allston/Brighton, this residential region also houses families with strong ties to the area Back BayStately brownstones, Parisian-style boulevards, trendy stores, good dining, and upscale hotels characterize the Back Bay. Copley Square, the Boston Common, and the Commonwealth Avenue Mall a tree-lined park area set amid exquisite brownstones – are all part of the Back Bay, which spans from downtown Boston to the Kenmore/Fenway neighbourhood. Back Bay is house to some of Boston's most notable architectural structures, including Trinity Church, the Boston Public Library, and the Prudential Center. This area also includes Newbury Street, which has some of Boston's best shopping. Back Bay is one of Boston's most affluent neighbourhoods, and it shines brightest during the holiday season Brookline & Coolidge Corner This vast residential community, located south and west of the Charles River campus, attracts undergraduates looking for a quieter environment, as well as graduate students, faculty, and staff. The Brookline Community's heart, Coolidge Corner, is located at the intersection of Harvard Avenue and Beacon Street. Take-out restaurants, gourmet dining, bookstores, boutiques, and real estate firms may all be found around Coolidge Corner. College students, working professionals, and retirees all live in this neighbourhood Visit:
Course Ranking: The fourth-largest university in the US is Boston University. The Times Higher Education ranked Boston University at 5th and 6th, respectively, and claimed that its graduates are the most employable in the US and the rest of the globe. Some of the well-liked majors Boston University offers are Business Administration and Management, Economics, Computer Science, and Communication and Media Studies. More than 300 academic programmes, including doctoral, medical, dentistry, business, and legal degrees, are available at BU.Students have several options when choosing their field of study at BU because there are more than 300 distinct majors and minors available. BU also features a medical school, keeping with its broad range of academic specialties. Among BU's top schools are those of law, economics, and medicine. In addition to this, it is renowned for having a superb student-faculty ratio. Candidates with a strong academic background who intend to study medicine, economics, or law in the US may want to consider the programmes Boston University offers.
University Ranking: Boston University (BU), a nearly 190-year-old higher education institution, is one of the most well-known non-profit research colleges in Boston, Massachusetts, in the United States. BU is one of the 62 esteemed research universities in North America that make up the prestigious Association of American Universities. According to a detailed examination of the QS rankings, BU has fallen from 81 in 2018 to 112 in 2022. One may conclude that academic reputation has lost a little bit because it is so important to QS rankings.However, if we examine the Timer Higher Education ranking, which equally emphasises teaching, research, and citation, we can see that BU's position significantly improved from 74 in 2019 to 54 in 2021 before declining once more to 62nd rank in 2022. In addition to this, BU has constantly kept its position in the US. It has consistently been listed by US News as one of the top 50 institutions in the US for the past four years. As a result, Boston University has carefully upheld its standards for both teaching and research and has remained one of the greatest universities in the world. Boston University Ranking
