Name: University of Kentucky
Overview: Located in Lexington, Kentucky, the University of Kentucky is a public land-grant research institute established in 1865. With an acceptance rate of 96%, the 16 colleges, graduate schools, and The Lewis Honors College offer over 200 academic programs (undergraduate, graduate and professional) such as Anthropology, Business Administration, Data Science, Educational Psychology and Gerontology. The 31,110 enrolled students can pursue various degrees like BA, BS, BFA, Ed.D, GC, MA, MS, PhD etc. UK Online provides over 60 degree and certificate programs concerning subject areas like Applied Statistics, General Business and Liberal Studies. The University of Kentucky International Center manages the study abroad program, allowing students to study in over 100 countries for more than 230 programs or participate in exchange programs.The estimated undergraduate tuition fee is USD 31,646 for in-state and USD 50,910 for out-of-state students, while the graduate fee is USD 32,750 and USD 52,915 for in and out-of-state students, respectively. Scholarships, loans, grants and student employment are available as financial aid; Children of Fallen Heros, Federal Pell Grant, Federal Direct Loan, and Patterson Scholarship are some.The University of Kentucky engineering graduates have acquired jobs with an average starting salary of USD 61,467.
Eligibility Overview: University of Kentucky expects you to have a 3.5 GPA and be in the middle of your high school class. You'll need a mix of A's and B's, with a few C's thrown in for good measure. If you have a poor GPA, you can make up for it by taking more difficult courses such as AP or IB subjects.The University of Kentucky's admissions process is more stringent, with a 96 percent acceptance rate. Half of those accepted to the University of Kentucky had a SAT score of 1070-1280 or an ACT score of 22-29.

Name: Fontbonne University
Overview: The Fontbonne University is a university located in St. Louis, USA. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Business. The main campus of Fontbonne University is located in St. Louis. The university offers over 7 undergraduate programs and 17 postgraduate programs. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. Estimated average tuition and fees excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student is around $13,998. Fontbonne University offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Read more details about Fontbonne University on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.
Eligibility Overview: The following are requirements for the Eckelkamp College of Global Business and Professional Studies:1.Students must have a B.S. in Accounting or an equivalent degree.2.A minimum 2.75 undergraduate GPA on a 4.0 scale, with a total score of 475 or higher on the GMAT test taken within the past five years. If one of the following circumstances is met, this criterion may be waived:(a)Had an undergraduate degree from an AACSB or ACBSP-accredited programme with a cumulative GPA of at least 3.3 in the prior five years.(b)Have a cumulative GPA of at least 3.0 in an area requiring significant analytical or quantitative work, such as business, economics, engineering, statistics, computer science, or law.3.A 300-500 word self-statement outlining the necessity of earning a graduate accounting degree from Fontbonne University.4.An updated resume5.Proof of English language ability, which is required for people who do not speak English as a first language. Applicants must present TOEFL or IELTS exam results (or Fontbonne University approved equivalent). A TOEFL IBT score of 71 or IELTS 6.0 is necessary.Applications are evaluated based on the program's availability. Complete applications must be submitted 14 days before the start of the first term in which the student wishes to enrol.
Accommodation: Do you like learning with others and spending time together in your own space? Perhaps you yearn for a completely private space? Fontbonne University provides a variety of accommodation alternatives to accommodate various student needs and comfort levels. First- and second-year students usually live in traditional double rooms. On campus, there are single, double, and triple rooms, as well as suites and apartment-style four-person accommodations.for more information click on this link-https://www.fontbonne.edu/student-life/living-on-campus/housing-options/

Name: University of West Florida - Emerald Coast
Overview: Established in 1903, the University of Victoria is located in British Columbia, Canada. It started as Victoria College, an affiliation of McGill University, before receiving full autonomy in 1963. The university received its accreditation from AACSB (Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business) and EQUIS (EFMD Quality Improvement System). The University of Victoria serves more than 21,593 students with educational services at undergraduate and postgraduate levels. The infrastructure and qualified faculty members have helped the university attract attention. The Division of Continuing Studies provides a new and unique proposition to the students among the various facilities. With this, they can start a university degree, work on a new career, or even earn a professional designation. The division offers more than 200 credit and non-credit courses. Some of the popular courses in this division include Business studies, Environmental and Occupational Health, foreign languages, Ocean Acoustic Monitoring, teaching courses, Wound Management for Health Professionals, and others. University of Victoria ranking shows its 236th position in Universities, holding a maximum of 5 stars according to the QS World University Rankings 2022. Currently, it has about 3,668 international students, and the university maintains an acceptance rate to attract more. The classes ensure that a student-faculty ratio of 16:1 is maintained. There has been an increase in the graduation rate, currently at 65.9%. The tuition fees structure set for the international students might seem unaffordable for the majority, ranging from $20,000-$25,000. The placement offers available here have been active, evident from the alumni and their employment. In addition, the college website has a specific section for placements, whereby the students can see the regular updates for relevant employment offers.

Name: Central Washington University
Overview: Founded in 1891 as the Washington State Normal School, Central Washington University gained university status in 1937. The public university is in Ellensburg, Washington and has been accredited by the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities. With an acceptance rate of 85%, the institution is among the top 25 public schools. CSU operates eight campuses at multiple locations in Washington, USA, apart from the 380-acre main campus in Ellensburg. Around 135 undergraduate, 34 postgraduate, online and Summer programs are offered by CWU through its four colleges, namely the College of Business, College of Sciences, College of Arts and Humanity and College of Education and Professional studies. Chemistry, Education, Physics, Criminal Justice, Health Sciences, Psychology, Social Sciences, Computer Science, Law, Business and Mathematics are some of the top disciplines. On-campus accommodation in 19 residential halls and four apartments with fully-furnished single, double and triple occupancy rooms provides Wi-Fi, laundry, lounges, and study areas. The campus has a bookstore, library, Recreation Centre, Veterans Center, dining options and a radio station. More than 125 student clubs and organisations, around 23 sports clubs and 13 varsity teams. Central Washington University prepares students for placements with mock interviews, career fairs and workshops and has a graduation rate of 64%. Around 93% of graduates secure employment within two years of graduation with an average annual salary of 44,900 USD.The average undergraduate tuition fee is 23,262 USD for international students, for which they are awarded merit-based scholarships worth 12,500 USD.
Eligibility Overview: English Language Requirements1) A minimum TOEFL iBT score of 79 on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL). By contacting the TOEFL website at www.toefl.org, you can register for the TOEFL or request that your scores be delivered to you. The school code for Central Washington University is #4044.A TOEFL computer-based score of 213 or higherOn the internet-based TOEFL, a score of 79 or higher is required.A TOEFL score of 88 or above for English programmes taken online.Photocopies or the "examinee copy," scores from the Institutional TOEFL, or official scores older than two years are not accepted by the Graduate School. 2) A minimum academic score of 6.5 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) (scores should be no more than two years old at the time).3) A minimum of 105 on the Duolingo English Test

Name: University of Alabama
Overview: The University of Alabama in Tuscaloosa, Alabama, is a public research institute founded in 1831. With an acceptance rate of 83%, there are over 37,842 students enrolled in undergraduate, graduate and professional programs across 13 schools and colleges. Some colleges are the College of Arts & Sciences, College of Education, School of Law and College of Engineering. It offers approximately 200 programs (70 undergraduate and 120 graduate) concerning disciplines like Accounting, Communicative Disorders, Geology, Hospitality Management and Music Composition. To further the cause of distance learning, the University of Alabama offers over 70 online degree programs across all levels. The Emerging Scholars Program, UA Early College and Academic Common Market are among the university's special academic programs. Furthermore, the Education Abroad program allows students to study in over 60 nations worldwide. The estimated undergraduate attendance cost is USD 25,216 for in-state students and USD 44,686 for out-of-state students. By submitting the Free Application for Federal Student Aid, students can apply for financial aid like loans, scholarships, grants and work-study. Some of these are the Federal Direct Subsidized/Unsubsidized Stafford Loan, Federal Grad PLUS Loan, Federal Pell Grant, on/off-campus jobs etc.
Eligibility Overview: University of Alabama needs you to have a 3.71 GPA and be above average in your high school class. At the very least, you'll need a mix of A's and B's, with more A's than B's. You can make up for a low GPA by taking more difficult classes, such as AP or IB. This demonstrates that you can handle more challenging academics than the ordinary high school student.If you're a junior or senior, changing your GPA in time for college applications is difficult. You'll need a better SAT or ACT score to compensate if your GPA is at or below the school average of 3.71. This will enable you to effectively compete against applicants with greater GPAs than you.Many colleges claim that they do not have a SAT score cutoff, but the truth is that they do. This is based on the average score for the school.The New SAT score for the 25th percentile is 1060, and the New SAT score for the 75th percentile is 1280. To put it another way, a 1060 on the New SAT puts you below average, and a 1280 puts you over average.
Course Ranking: The University of Alabama offers more than 300 courses in various subjects, including business, sciences, engineering & technology, arts & humanities, social sciences, law, and education. According to US News & World Report's rankings for 2021, the University of Alabama is ranked #44 at the UG level for business courses. It now ranks in the top 50 UG business courses in the USA, up just 1 point from 2020. US News & World Report states that its Graduate Business School will be ranked #41 in 2021. For 2021, the University of Alabama's PG Economics and Business courses are ranked between 301 and 400, while its PG Engineering & Technology courses are ranked between 401 and 500. According to US News & World Report, a few PG Engineering and Technology programmes' various specialisations have been ranked among the top 100 - aeronautical engineering is ranked #56, civil engineering is ranked #75, electrical engineering is ranked #87, chemical engineering is ranked #98, mechanical engineering is ranked #94, etc. THE has also ranked PG Computer courses. According to US News & World Report's 2021 rankings, they fall between positions 501 and 600, while the PG Computer Engineering programme debuts at position 92.
University Ranking: One of the top 150 institutions in the USA is the University of Alabama. The University of Alabama is ranked #143 among all national universities in US News and World Report's 2021 rankings. Its ranking has improved compared to its 2020 ranking, which was recorded at #153 because it has a high acceptance rate of an astounding 83% (as reported for admissions in 2020). In addition to having a strong GPA and class rank, applicants to the University of Alabama must receive a high ACT or SAT scores. Additionally, letters of recommendation are given more attention. The university is ranked #419 globally according to US News and World Report's rankings for 2021. Since 2019, this position has been constant.The University of Alabama is ranked 601–800 in the THE - World University Rankings for 2021. Since 2020, when the range was between 401 and 500, this range has grown. Because this university does not rank among the top 500 universities in the world, the ranking breakdown according to THE rankings has not been disclosed. For 2021, the University of Alabama's QS - World University ranking ranges between 801 to 1000. For its numerous ranking categories, QS manages to give the institution lower-than-average marks: employer reputation: 27.7, citations per faculty: 14.5, international student ratio: 4, academic reputation: 9.4, and no total score because it is ranked over 500.

Name: University of the Pacific - Stockton
Overview: Formerly known as the College of the Pacific and California Wesleyan College, the University of the Pacific or UOP is a private Methodist university incorporated in 1851. It is recognized by the WASC. The University of the Pacific Stockton campus is situated in Stockton and allows students to be near Napa Valley, Sacramento, San Francisco, and Yosemite. The various schools at the University of the Pacific Stockton campus are Benerd College, Thomas J. Long School of Pharmacy, Eberhardt School of Business, Conservatory of Music, etc. As of fall 2020, this institute has a total undergraduate enrolment of 3,524 students. It follows a semester-based academic calendar. With a 71% acceptance rate, admissions at this institute are more selective in nature. About half of this university’s admitted candidates have an ACT score of 22 and 30 or SAT score between 1080 and 1340. The student-to-faculty ratio here is 14:1, and around 44.4% of this institute’s classes feature less than 20 students. According to the U.S. News & World Report, this university’s admissions are highly selective. It received 13,545 freshmen applications during the fall of 2018. Out of these, only 8,598 got admission - this accounts for 65% of the total candidate applications. Tuition and fees payable by students range between $50,000 and $55,000. According to U.S. News & World Report, this institute’s 2022 ranking was 136 among National Universities. About 72% of this institute’ full-time undergraduates are offered need-based financial aid. This grant or scholarship award is valued at around $30,000 to $35,000 on an average. Some notable University of the Pacific alumni includes baseball agent and founder of Boras Corp., Scott Boras; billionaire Alex Spanos. The median starting salary of this institute’s alumni is around $55,000 to $56,000.
Eligibility Overview: UoP seeks applications from students who have demonstrated a high level of scholarship, initiative and maturity, good character, and a sincere interest in learning via their previous achievements. Admission is competitive, and each applicant is assessed based on a number of variables that are analyzed in a very individualized manner. The university is looking for students from a wide range of ethnic, religious, economic, and geographic backgrounds.For the most up-to-date policies on all subjects in the next section of this catalogue, please visit the Office of Admission webpage. www.pacific.edu/admission.html is the website address.

We want you to feel comfortable at Pacific, and we'll do everything we can to make that happen.

Name: Kaplan International Languages - Chicago
Overview: Kaplan International Languages – Chicago is based on the famous shopping district of Chicago, the Magnificent Mile. It is located just across the street from the Tribune Tower. Students can benefit from the outstanding transport links at this location. There are Metra, “L”-train, and water taxi stops within a 10 minutes or less walking distance and two bus stops outside. The English school of Kaplan International Languages in Chicago hosts several English courses like Exam Preparation Courses, Long-Term English Courses, Business English Courses and Flexible English Courses. It has received accreditation from the Accrediting Council for Continuing Education and Training (ACCET). The Flexible English Courses are flexible with a duration from 1 week to a year. This helps students enhance their general English skills in their own time frame. The Long-Term English Courses are of more than 20 weeks duration and either General or Intensive in nature. The Business English Courses are also flexible, and their duration ranges for a few weeks. Through these accredited courses, students can enhance their level of English and learn vocabulary that would help them in a professional environment. The Exam Preparation Courses have a duration of 1 to 24 weeks based on the course or location. These are curated for improving a student’s English and chances of achieving higher test scores. This school has two classrooms and two student lounges. There is an average of 160 total students studying at this institute, and it sees a 96.5% recommendation rate. The staff at this institute speak five languages, namely, French, Italian, Russian, Turkish, Arabic. This institute also hosts three social activities per week through which students socialize and explore the city.

Name: Northeastern Illinois University
Overview: Northeastern Illinois University, located in Chicago, USA, offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programs for distance education students.The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses.The university offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship.
Eligibility Overview: Students must demonstrate English language competency as an international applicants by passing the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or the International English Language Testing System with a minimum score (IELTS). If students attended an English-medium high school or college/university in your country, students might be eligible to forgo the requirement. To discover if you qualify, fill out the English Proficiency Waiver or contact the Office of International Programs at international-programs@neiu.edu.If students don't speak English and wish to enroll in the university's Intensive English Program, the School for the Advancement of English Language and Learning (SAELL) at Northeastern Illinois University can help them satisfy the English language competency requirement.Minimum Graduate Admissions Scores:TOEFL-550 Computer-based TOEFL- 213 Internet-based TOEFL- 796.5 on the IELTS CompositeA minimum TOEFL score of 95 or an IELTS score of 7.0 is required for admission to the Master of Arts in Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages (TESOL) program.
Placement: The Student Center for Science Engagement at NEIU offers mentoring, tutoring, professional development, summer research opportunities, and scientific conferences specifically for science students. Students in the IT and Software department earn an annual salary of approximately 98,000 USD. Bachelor of Science graduates earn about 81,000 USD per year, while BA graduates earn approximately 45,000 USD per year.
Accommodation: Northeastern University provides on-campus student housing for local, national, and international students. The Nest, the university's first residence hall, is located west of the main campus. There are two and four-bedroom options available. All of the rooms are well-appointed and have access to a shared bathroom. Other amenities include a fitness centre with strength and cardio machines, a recreation centre with arcade games and billiards, furnished apartments, private bedrooms and bathrooms, and a swimming pool.Students have access to fully equipped kitchens with appliances, on-site laundry, and essential utilities. While submitting their application, applicants must pay a $50 non-refundable housing application fee and a $250 security deposit. Interested students can also look for off-campus student housing in the United States.

Name: Rider University

This university comprises four academic units: the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences, Westminster College of the Arts, The College of Education and Human Services and the Norm Brodsky College of Business. Name: Colorado Mesa University
Overview: Established in 1925 as a public university, Colorado Mesa University offers top-notch education in the form of undergraduate, postgraduate, certificate, and associate programs in professional, liberal arts, and technical programs. Name: Nebraska Wesleyan University
Overview: Nebraska Wesleyan University was established in 1887 in Lincoln, Nebraska, United States of America. Currently, the university serves a diverse team of students and aims at an inclusive lesson plan. Currently, the university serves more than 2,095 students across undergraduate and postgraduate levels. The classes in the university maintain a general student-faculty ratio of 13:1 to generate a standard quality of education. The prevailing student retention rate of 79% reveals that the students are mostly satisfied with the services here. For admission, students must have a minimum of 5.5 in IELTS or 71 in TOEFL.The University is moderately selective with the new applicants, as evident from its acceptance rate of 70%. Moreover tuition fees for international students range from $35,000-$40,000 USD approximately. The university offers financial aid to 98% of the students. The hi-tech laboratories, multimedia studios, and modern university classrooms have helped it stand out and attract students. The university has a placement section termed “Handshake”, which enables the students to join for updates on the latest employment opportunities.
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility criteria a student must meet in order to be considered for admission are: A cumulative high school GPA of 3.0 or higher and a composite ACT score of 20 or higher are the typical admission requirements (1030 SAT)English language proficiency requirements English language proficiency requirements are:

Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation The residential facilities on the Nebraska Wesleyan University campus are meant to actively involve you in the activities of the university, enrich your life experiences, and improve your contact with other students. First-year residential living In a residential liberal arts college, living on campus is a crucial learning experience. Because of the community built and fostered by the students on their floor, pod, or building, students who live on campus are frequently better connected to the University. Living in a residential setting teaches pupils essential life skills. Returning students live in suite-style facilities and townhouses, while first-year students dwell in traditional halls. The housing options provided by the university are as follows: Residence Halls Traditional residence halls, one all-women residence hall, and four coeducational residence halls provide a variety of living arrangements to accommodate students' requirements and interests. All are furnished and have access to Wi-Fi internet. A central living area with a community TV/lounge, laundry rooms, and kitchenettes is also provided at each facility. Centennial Hall Centennial Hall is a coed residential hall with single and double rooms built around shared lounge areas known as "pods." Gender-specific pods, as well as gender-neutral pods, are available in Centennial Hall. Centennial Hall is a residence hall for new Northwest University and international students in their first year on campus. For more information, visit: https://www.nebrwesleyan.edu/inside-nwu/living-campus/living-campus/centennial-hall  Johnson Hall Johnson Hall, Nebraska Wesleyan University's most historic residence hall, is an all-female residence hall with its charm and distinctiveness. The addition of air conditioning, remodelling interior spaces, constructing an elevator, replacing windows and the roof, expanding restrooms, increasing energy efficiency, refurbishing rooms and common spaces, and improving accessibility were all part of Johnson Hall's extensive renovation in the summer of 2012. For more information, visit: https://www.nebrwesleyan.edu/inside-nwu/living-campus/living-campus/johnson-hall  Pioneer Hall Pioneer Hall, NWU's most recently rebuilt residence hall, allows students to build tight, supportive communities. Pioneer Hall and Johnson Hall are connected by a big basement lounge with a small kitchen, ping pong table, study tables, pool table, and a television. It is also the most convenient residence hall in terms of proximity to the Story Student Center and dining hall. By half floors, Pioneer Hall, which houses first-year residents, is normally co-educational. For more information, visit: https://www.nebrwesleyan.edu/inside-nwu/housing/living-campus/pioneer-hall  Plainsman Hall Plainsman Hall is a coeducational, air-conditioned facility near the Elder Memorial Speech and Theatre Center as well as the Weary Center for Health and Fitness. It has built-in workstations and shelving to make the most of the available space. A small kitchen, study rooms with whiteboards, a pool table, a ping-pong table, and a TV/social lounge are all available in the basement lounge. Plainsman Hall is home to first-year students and is co-educational on most floors. For more information, visit: https://www.nebrwesleyan.edu/inside-nwu/living-campus/living-campus/plainsman-hall   Suites For sophomores and juniors, Heim and White Suites are air-conditioned, suite-style residence halls. These suites, which typically house four students, feature a central living area with a kitchenette that includes a small refrigerator and microwave, as well as two bedrooms and bathrooms. A lounge featuring a TV, pool table, foosball, computers, and study tables are located on each floor. A modest kitchen and a patio on the first level allow space for outside lounging. Townhouses The Townhouse Village provides self-contained living in 30 air-conditioned four-person flats. There are four individual bedrooms and two bathrooms in each unit. A 21-cubic-foot refrigerator, stove, microwave, dishwasher, and full-size, stackable washing and dryer are included in the townhouse. Student Apartments Air-conditioned student apartments provide living facilities for juniors and seniors alone. In most cases, each flat accommodates two students. Some apartments are efficiency units, while others have one or two bedrooms. The flats remain open for their inhabitants during the Fall, Winter, and Spring breaks without charging an additional break housing cost. Greek Living After two complete semesters in a residential hall, students who are active members in good standing can reside in a sorority or fraternity chapter house with the authorisation of the dean of students in consultation with each chapter president. Although the Greek system is self-governing, professional staff advisors, chapter advisors, and live-in chapter directors/parents aid students and particular chapters with the obstacles of living in Greek chapter houses and learning. Greek dwellings that meet the necessary criteria are deemed acceptable campus housing. The Center for Student Involvement and Residential Education has copies of "Approval of Greek Chapters as Approved University Housing," including the standards and "Procedure for Greek Chapter Houses to Fulfill University Residency Policy." For more information, visit: https://www.nebrwesleyan.edu/inside-nwu/living-campus/living-campus

Name: Boise State University
Overview: Boise State University, established in 1932 by the Episcopal Church is a public research university situated in Boise, Idaho. The university offers bachelor's and master's programs from various fields of study across 17 different colleges and more than 100 departments. The university offers various programs like principal, minor, master's, associate, and certification courses. The popular undergraduate programs offer nursing, psychology, biology, health studies, computer science, kinesiology, communication, and many more. Some of the popular areas of study offered in graduate programs include social work, business administration, organizational performance, and workplace learning. The annual fee of the course ranges from USD 24,988 to 26,566 for the full degrees in MS, BSc, M.Eng, and BBA. The total cost of rooms and meals amounts to USD 11,246. The university offers financial aid to students in merit-based scholarships for international students to study in the USA. Some of the scholarships offered are Gem scholarship, Treasure Scholarship, Global Excellence, and Global Distinction Scholarships. The university provides job assistance to graduate students through career service stations to assist and prepare students for placement. Students are provided with various internship opportunities by the universities. The career service office offers students connections to potential job offers.
Eligibility Overview: When considering students for admission to Boise State, the cumulative, unweighted high school GPA is used.3.00–4.00 GPA: You meet Boise State's automatic admission requirements and will be accepted once all of the above materials have been received and approved.2.60 – 2.99 GPA: After submitting two extra items, your application will be given a more thorough review:Personal statement in response to the prompt below, as well as a 7th-semester transcript showing grades from the first semester or quarter of your senior year.Personal Statement: Tell us about the goals you've set for yourself as a student at Boise State University in 500 words or fewer. Please also let us know about any personal or academic issues you've had that may have influenced your academic success.Letters of Recommendation (Optional): If you do not satisfy the automatic admission requirements, you are urged to submit up to two letters of recommendation, as well as a personal statement and your seventh semester transcript. We suggest that you select scholarly sources that can attest to your academic competence and motivation.
Accommodation: The greatest way to receive the entire Boise State experience is to live on campus. You'll be near classrooms, dining, and the leisure centre, right in the thick of campus life. You'll also have first-hand knowledge of all events taking place on campus. All of this while having access to the appropriate resources and support. Everything is available on campus. Right in your neighbourhood.Our Hours and Contact Information page lists our current operation hours. Hours and modes of service are subject to change, so please check back frequently.for more information click on this link-https://www.boisestate.edu/housing/

Name: Marist College
Overview: Marist college is a private liberal arts college situated in Poughkeepsie, USA, and was founded in 1905 by the Marist brothers. The main campus is located in New York, and the other campus is in Florence, Italy. The main campus is spread across 180 acres and is a great place to live and learn. The college offers 47 bachelor's programs, 11 masters programs, one doctoral program, and two certificate programs. The college offers graduate programs including MBA, MPA, MS, MA degrees, and additionally provides a doctor of physical therapy and physical assistance programs. The six schools and colleges offering these programs are the School of Communication and Arts, The School of Computer Science and Mathematics, the School of Liberal Arts, The School of Management, The School of Science, and The School of Social and Behavioral Sciences. The undergraduate programs include accounting, biology, cybersecurity, economics, art history, and many more. The popular majors provided by the college include business, management, marketing, communication, journalism, psychology, computer & information sciences, and biological & biomedical sciences. The college collaborates with IBM for concept and application testing in business, communication, and education. The per-year tuition fee for the courses is USD 45,430. The college provides on-campus housing facilities for undergraduate students in apartments, suites, and halls for great residential experiences for students. The college offers an athletics program that includes sports such as football, basketball, tennis, and swimming. The average cost of living is around USD 21,900. On-campus, the college maintains study centers, academic buildings, gymnasium, and library. The college offers financial assistance in the form of loans and scholarships. The center for career services provides programs and information to assist students with setting career goals and seeking employment. Career fairs are organized to offer students courses to write effective resumes, improve interview skills, and do professional networking.
Eligibility Overview: In order to be considered for admission, applicants must meet the following requirements:A fully completed applicationEssay on oneselfOne recommendation letterTranscripts from high school (evaluated ad with translation in English)Proof of English language abilityThe applicant's resumeFinancial support affidavit

Name: Purdue University Northwest
Overview: Purdue University Northwest (PNW) is a premier metropolitan university present at two campus locations that caters to roughly 8800 graduate and undergraduate students. These campuses are located at Westville and Hammond. This institute has received accreditation from the Higher Learning Commission (HLC). The five colleges of Purdue University Northwest provide over 70 areas of study for graduate and undergraduate students. In the U.S. News & World Report Best Colleges rankings, this institute was consistently recognized among the best regional universities. The various program types from which students can choose from are Major, Minor, Certificate, Graduate, Undergraduate, Concentration and Combined (4+1). A few colleges and schools in this institute include School of Education and Counseling, White Lodging School of Hospitality and Tourism Management, School of Engineering, etc. To name a few programs offered at Purdue University Northwest are Adult-Gerontology Clinical Nurse Specialist (Post-Master’s Certificate), Computer Engineering (BSCmpE/MSECE), Couple and Family Therapy (Master of Science), School Counseling (MSEd), and many others. The In-State Tuition fee for 1 Year Full-Time Undergraduate program ranges from $8,000 to $8100. For the same program, the Out-of-State Tuition fee lies between $11,600 to $11,700. These figures are depending on full-time enrolment (12-18 credit hours) for spring 2022 and fall 2021. Domestic non-resident students who are enrolled before fall 2018 will be assessed at international rate. The scholarships that this institute extends for recognising students achievement and providing financial assistance are classified as Admissions scholarships and Specialty scholarships. Students graduating from Purdue University Northwest find a career in some of the thriving sectors like manufacturing, education and healthcare. The top local employers of these graduates include Michigan City Area Schools, Parkview Health and La Porte Hospital. Purdue University Northwest alumni hold positions in one of the most reputed organisations in the world such as Amazon and Microsoft.
Eligibility Overview: Admission to Purdue University Northwest is based on demonstrated academic quality rank factors, which include a high school diploma or GED, meeting subject matter requirements, grade average in degree-related subjects, overall grade average, class rank, SAT, rSAT, or ACT test scores, and the strength of the college preparatory programme (Core 40 diploma is required for applicants who graduated in 2011 and forward from an Indiana public high school).Provide one of the following as proof of English proficiency: (Tests must have been completed within the last two years)79 iBT or 550 paper-based test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL)6.5 IELTS (International English Language Testing System)Critical Reading 480 or higher on the Scholastic Assessment Test (SAT)Ordinary Level English Language Exam (GCSE/IGCSE) in the United Kingdom A or B in English as a first language

You'll be able to walk everywhere - our fitness centre is just a few steps away, and every building on campus is less than a mile away.The Peregrine and Griffin residence halls in University Village are at the heart of many school events. Without leaving the house, attend movie screenings, ice cream socials, game nights, and pancake study breaks.Furnished apartments with living rooms and kitchens in 4-bedroom/2-bathroom and 2-bedroom/1-bathroom configurations.Free printing is available in computer laboratories.Patio and study space outsideRooms for study and meetings

Name: Concordia University Chicago
Overview: Established in 1864, Concordia University was initially founded as a college for teachers but now serves as a whole university. Located in River Forest, the Concordia University Chicago proffers different undergraduate programs that lead to bachelor’s degrees along with graduate, master’s and doctoral programs. This university is affiliated with the Lutheran Church and is an essential member of the Concordia University system. At this educational institute, students learn by associating with applied research, internships, service activities and more. By gathering experiences through these, students can develop the versatility to meet the 21st century workplace requirements and continue exploring opportunities in future. Concordia University Chicago aims to be one of the most affordable educational institutions in Midwest America. It provides financial aid to undergraduates, postgraduates as well as adults enrolling themselves in specialised academic programmes. Concordia University Chicago maintains a student to faculty ratio of 10:1. As per U.S. News & World Report, Concordia University Chicago ranks at the 74th position in the current year. At Concordia University Chicago, students are given special attention in small size classes. The experienced professors, staff and advisors provide necessary assistance to develop their personalities and establish productive connections. This institution offers work permits - CPT and OPT that benefit students for up to 12 months. The Career Centre department assists in recruitment for internships in more than 60 companies. Moreover, scholarships are available for deserving international students. With an acceptance rate of nearly 75%, this university is a bit selective regarding its application. The main campus of this university is well-designed with essential facilities and amenities to provide the best for the students. Moreover, appropriate location, practical learning programs and top-notch education make it convenient for the students to apply and get employed in reputed companies after completing their graduation.
Eligibility Overview: To Apply You will need:A completed Concordia University Chicago admissions application.Official transcripts of all college courses taken at each institution attended.A Concordia-Chicago-approved international credentialing service evaluates foreign transcripts. Educational Credential Evaluators' evaluations are accepted by Concordia-Chicago (ECE).A verified document guaranteeing financial support for your first year of education, assuming no unforeseen circumstances, as well as sufficient financing from the same or a similar source for the following years.Proof of secondary school graduation is required.For students moving from a school in the United States, a transfer verification form is required.One of the following will suffice as proof of English proficiency:A score of at least 72 (internet-based) on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) — Concordia-Chicago’s DI code is 1140A score of 6.0 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS)Successful completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language School (ELS) or a certificate of completion of program from an English Language Institute (ELI), along with a recommendation of the program director.
Placement: Nil
Accommodation: Housing at CUCYou will live as a residential student in River Forest, a safe and lovely community that surrounds Concordia University Chicago. Everything you need to meet your everyday needs is just a few steps away. You can also visit the world-class city of Chicago, which is only 10 miles away.The Residence Life Department at Concordia University Chicago strives to provide a structured environment for all students living on campus. Their structured programming structure promotes academic success on campus and a smooth transition to college life and life beyond college.Check here for more details: https://www.cuchicago.edu/concordia-experience/campus-life/living/

Name: Western Washington University
Overview: Western Washington University, founded in 1893, is a well-known public university in Bellingham, Washington. The university has several colleges, which include the College of Business and Economics, College of Fine and Performing Arts, College of Humanities and Social Sciences, College of Science and Engineering, and Fairhaven College of Interdisciplinary Studies.One extraordinary and famous aspect of the university is that it allows the students to design custom degree programs at Fairhaven College while symbolizing the importance and inclusive nature of interdisciplinary programs.A minimum score of 86 iBT in TOEFL or 7.0 in IELTS is required to qualify for Western Washington University.The average annual tuition and accommodation fee can come to around $35K, but through scholarships and grants provided by the college, the price is reduced to approximately $26K. Students earn an average of 54,976 USD after graduation
Eligibility Overview: Students must obtain at least the minimum TOEFL (86 iBT) or IELTS (7.0) scores to be eligible for admission.Exceptions:English is your native language, orStudents have earned, or are in the process of earning, a bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited U.S. institution, or Great Britain, Australia, New Zealand, or English-speaking provinces of Canada.Official IELTS or TOEFL scores must be on file in the Graduate School office when the application is received. Test scores must be no older than one year at the time of application.
Placement: Western Washington University hosts on-campus job placement and internship fairs during the winter and spring semesters. Graduates with the highest-paying jobs include Software Developers, Operations Managers, Account Managers, and Marketing Directors. The average annual salary of Western Washington University graduates is approximately $69,130, according to PayScale.
Accommodation: The main campus of Western Washington University is located on the ancestral homelands of the Coast Salish Peoples, who have resided in the Salish Sea basin for thousands of years throughout the San Juan Islands and the North Cascades watershed. Our Indigenous neighbors have the utmost respect and thanks for their ongoing care and protection of our shared lands and waterways.  Covering 215 acres of green land, the university overlooks Bellingham Bay and plays host to the Public Sculpture Collection featuring artists like James Fitzgerald and Anthony Caro. It remains equipped with libraries, residence halls, laboratories, organizations, transport facilities, and athletic centers. A brilliant alumni network also ensures a reasonable placement rate for the graduating batch. for more information click on this link-https://admissions.wwu.edu/visit/accommodations

Name: Chemeketa Community College - Woodburn
Overview: The Woodburn Centre of Chemeketa Community College is based in downtown Woodburn. It works with a broad range of non-profit organizations and agencies, Woodburn Chamber of Commerce, and local schools for delivering services for English language learning, employment skills, and continuing education. The various programs and courses that students can opt for at Chemeketa Woodburn include GED preparation (Spanish and English), English for speakers of other languages, Business Technology, Personal enrichment opportunities, Developmental Education and AAOT courses (transfer degree courses). This college offers several student services, including an Official GED testing facility, Administrative Services, Academic Advising, Accuplacer Placement & CASAS testing site, Textbook pickup (when requested for Woodburn campus delivery), Financial Aid, Student Club, etc. When it comes to affordability, Chemeketa extends low-cost textbooks and classes along with a flexible schedule. Over 60% of students at Chemeketa receive financial aid and scholarships. The Chemeketa Foundation extends more than 100 different scholarships that are available to apply for. Students seeking to earn their GED or simultaneously take both college and high school credits would find a suitable program for themselves. Through Chemeketa Woodburn’s GED program, individuals can earn their GED certificate with individualized pacing in a college environment. This will help them get better job opportunities while entering the workforce. Moreover, students completing their GED here will earn free college credits. They can then use these for furthering their education. Chemeketa Community College Woodburn campus also offers an Early College Program. Enrolled students of this program will work closely with their Early College advisor for creating an education plan suited for their future goals.
Eligibility Overview: English language requirements: Admissions do not require TOEFL or IELTS scores. Chemeketa University provides comprehensive language and college-level studies to students of all levels.• During orientation, all Chemeketa students will take required English and/or college placement tests.• Test scores supplied during the admissions process are exclusively utilised for advising placement, and this approach ensures a successful class selection for the student.
Placement: Assessment of a Position  Before you register for classes, Chemeketa uses a variety of methods to assess your current reading, writing, and math skills. Begin by filling out the Placement Assessment Form. Within 3-5 business days, you will receive a response with information on your placement and future steps. For More :https://www.chemeketa.edu/admission/enroll/placement-assessment/
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation  For your first term as an international student, we strongly suggest homestay. It is one of the most efficient methods for improving your English language skills. You will have a family to talk to as well as assistance in getting to know the area. Our host families are located throughout the Salem-Keizer area and all reside near a bus stop, ensuring that you have convenient access to the campus. You should apply for homestay as soon as possible because we only have a limited number of families available and cannot promise that you will be placed with a homestay family. Students will get homestay forms through email once they have finished their application.On-campus housing can be found here.https://www.chemeketa.edu/admission/international/housing/

Name: Claremont Graduate University
Overview: The Claremont Graduate University, located in Claremont, USA, offers undergraduate, postgraduate, certificate, and online degree programs for distance education students. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. The estimated average tuition fees, excluding an international student's miscellaneous expenditures, are around INR 44,68,580.Claremont Graduate University offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. Claremont Graduates earn an average salary of 73,000 USD per annum. Name: University of South Florida
Overview: Established in 1956, the University of South Florida is a public research university located in Florida. Currently the 4th largest university in the state, it was set up to provide students with world-class academic facilities for education and research. The university offers over 180 programs across various fields. Undergraduate, graduate, doctoral degrees and diplomas are awarded by the university for numerous courses and certifications.The best courses at the University of South Florida include M.S. and Ph. D in Nursing, B.A. in Language, Speech and Hearing Sciences, and B. Sc in Civil Engineering. The main campus of the university is located in Tampa. It is home to 14 colleges and doctoral programs. A 45-minute drive to the southwest of Tampa leads to the University of South Florida St. Petersburg Campus. University of South Florida Sarasota-Manatee was the last of the three campuses to be opened.The average fee for completing a degree here is around USD 23,500. The university provides financial aid to international students, with scholarships paying up to USD 12,000 per semester.
Eligibility Overview: English Proficiency Required  Academic Requirement Minimum 3.00 (on a scale of 4.00) grade point average (GPA) in an Undergraduate or Postgraduate course.

Placement: Seminars  Workshops are aimed to assist all USF students in developing the necessary career-ready skills to succeed now and in the future. Build a CV, compose a cover letter, update your LinkedIn profile, choose a career path, prepare for interviews, and conduct your internship or job hunt with the help of their seminars. Events and Career Fairs Each semester, Career Services offers a variety of programmes to assist you in exploring various occupations and learning about your career prospects. These events and fairs allow you to network with employers and look for part-time, internship, co-op, and full-time jobs.
Accommodation: On-Campus You will benefit from peer support and a physical setting that is conducive to academic performance if you live in a resident hall. In the halls, many residents organize study groups. Despite the fact that USF is one of the country's largest colleges, its students have numerous opportunities to have their opinions heard on campus. The Residence Hall Association represents the entire residential population, while Eating Advisory Councils allow residents to have input on the dining experience. NOTE: Update on Housing ApplicationsUSF Housing & Residential Education is no longer accepting accommodation applications for the Fall/Spring 2022-23 term due to strong demand for on-campus housing for the fall 2022 session.As rooms become available, Housing & Residential Education will begin a Standby List process to assign any remaining beds to students who have completed the first four steps to living on campus.
Course Ranking: More than 50,000 students pursue graduate, undergraduate, specialised, and professional degrees on the campuses of the University of South Florida. Undergraduates at USF can select from more than 200 majors, minors, and concentrations across the university's 13 colleges, ranging from business and engineering to the arts and USF Health.According to the 2023 U.S. News and World Report Graduate School Rankings, USF's graduate-level programmes are still among the finest. Some USF graduate programmes rank among the top 50, including Industrial and Organizational Psychology, which is ranked third, Public Health, which is ranked sixteenth, Audiology, which is ranked eighteen, Library and Information Studies, which is ranked twenty-seven, and Industrial Engineering, which is ranked forty-seven. Name: Concordia University - St. Paul
Overview: Concordia University: St. Paul is a privately owned university in Saint Paul, Minnesota. Established in 1893, this university registers nearly 5600 students, and the current name was adopted in 1997. This educational institution offers a wide range of undergraduate majors and minor programs, adult undergraduate degrees, education classes and certificates, graduate programs, and licensure and discussion programs. Concordia University - the Higher Learning Commission has approved St. Paul since 1967. This St. Paul campus of this university extends 80 student programs comprising undergraduate, post-graduate, and doctoral degrees. This educational institution is considered one of the best private universities in Minnesota, providing affordable education and several financial aid opportunities. The St. Paul campus has consistently maintained its position and is ranked 88th among regional universities in the Midwest as per the US News. Besides, as per the QS World University rankings, this institution is positioned among the top 500 universities in the world. This institution offers as many as 176 academic programs for aspiring students. Some of the popular Concordia University - St. Paul undergraduate degree courses include Management, Kinesiology, Marketing, Business Administration, Psychology, and graduate degree courses include Bachelor of Arts in Business, Bachelor of Arts in Exercise Science, Bachelor of Science in Nursing etc. Some of these programs are offered in online degree format. The MBA degree offered at this university is available online. This university uses a semester-based academic structure and calendar. Considering the 69% acceptance rate, this university is selective with its admissions. Most aspiring applicants here have an ACT score of 17-24. Concordia University - St. Paul offers eligible students financial aid and scholarship funds to cover tuition expenses. This university follows a student-centric and responsive approach, making students well-prepared to meet their academic goals.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: Saint Paul's Concordia University has an open admissions policy. As long as specific minimal prerequisites are met, all applicants will be admitted to open admission colleges, which often have low admission thresholds. Throughout the year, new admissions are frequently made continuously. Contact them directly to discover more about the specifics of Concordia University-Saint Paul's open admission policy. English Requirements:

Name: Jackson State University
Overview: Jackson State University is among the biggest Historically Black Colleges in the United States and is located in Jackson, Mississippi. Established in 1877, Jackson State University has also been classified in the R2 category for Doctoral Universities, classifying it as an area of high research activity. Over 87 undergraduate programs ranging from Bachelor's of Business Administration (BBA) in Accounting to Bachelor's of Music (BM) in Jazz are taught in the colleges of Jackson State University. There are five colleges within Jackson State University, including the College of Business, College of Education and Human Development, College of Health and Sciences, College of Liberal Arts, and the College of Science, Engineering and Technology. Jackson State University also offers 13 graduate degree programs that range from M.A, M.A.T, M.B.A., and Ph.D.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate Admissions at Jackson State UniversityThe freshman admissions process is overseen by the office of undergraduate admissions. If students require additional information or assistance with any aspect of the admissions process, they are urged to contact the office.The following documents must be submitted by students:Transcripts: All high school course work, the date of graduation, the average GPA, and the class rank should be included on the official transcript.ACT or SAT exam scores (the ACT College Code for Jackson State University is 2204, and the SAT College Code is 1341).Vaccination historyGraduate Admissions at Jackson State UniversityThe graduate council at Jackson State University is in charge of admissions, as well as the formulation and coordination of general rules and processes for graduate programmes. It maintains uniform admissions requirements for pupils.The following are the graduate admissions requirements:A 3.0 GPA or a Master's degree at the undergraduate level.All transcripts must be in one official copy.Official transcripts can be emailed or mailed to gradtranscript@jsums.edu using e-script, parchment, or another approved electronic provider.All applicants must present proof of immunisation.International Students' Language RequirementsInternational students must demonstrate their English language proficiency by passing one of the following exams:Test ScoreTOEFL iBT: 69 cBT: 194 pBT: 525 IELTS 6.0PTE-A 53English 19 (ACT)Critical Reading 480 on the SAT
Placement: PlacementEmployers can connect with JSU students through a variety of channels.One of them is on-campus recruiting, which allows them to screen and pick applicants for their respective companies' interviews.When it comes to scheduling campus interviews, the JSU Career Services Centre uses an employer pre-screening method.Students are assigned to the position on a first-come, first-served basis.

Name: Rivier University
Overview: Rivier University, a Catholic private liberal arts college founded in 1933, is located in Nashua, New Hampshire. In addition to undergraduate and postgraduate courses, the university offers several hybrid and online courses. Rivier University is also well-known for its academic programs, including more than 50 bachelor's, associate's, master's, and doctoral degrees and several hybrid and online courses. Students at this university develop leadership qualities and an appreciation of various global cultures. It has a School of Undergraduate Studies with traditional programs, a Professional Studies Division with undergraduate online and evening programs, and a School of Graduate Studies. Rivier University, noted for its excellent educational and research programs, is one of the most reputed colleges to pursue nursing sciences in New Hampshire. Computer science and nursing science are two of the most popular majors at this university. The Student Employment Program helps students gain essential work experience that will benefit them throughout their careers. Rivier University also has a one-of-a-kind placement training program that prepares students for success in the industry through professional development programs and hands-on learning and helps them find work after graduation.

Name: Dartmouth College
Overview: One of the oldest universities in the US and a member of the Ivy League, Dartmouth College is situated in Hanover, New Hampshire, USA. It is a private liberal arts and research university and was founded in 1769. Dartmouth College is a highly competitive college having an acceptance rate of 10.4%, and around 9% of the total student population consists of international students. Dartmouth College's undergraduate faculties include arts, sciences, and engineering departments and four main graduate programs. The arts and sciences department has about 56 undergraduate programs, including- Computer, Engineering, Biology, Psychology, and History. The schools include Tuck School of Business, Thayer School of Engineering and Geisel School of Medicine, and Frank J. Guarini School of Graduate and Advanced Studies.The fee for the undergraduate program is 55,605 USD annually, not including the apartment or room fees.
Eligibility Overview: What are the requirements for participation? Dartmouth has requirements for specific programmes and courses. Some majors may also have subject-specific requirements. International students, on the other hand, must meet the following requirements in order to be considered for the relevant programmes:UG Admissions: Applicants must have a GPA of 3.0 or more and a high school diploma or certificate from a recognised school. Scores on the SAT or ACT are required. Only the Class of 2026 is required to take the SAT or ACT.PG/Engineering Admissions: Applicants should apply for a bachelor's degree in engineering or a bachelor's degree in science in engineering, chemistry, or computer science. GRE scores are required for those applying to fields other than the Dartmouth AB and Thayer School Dual Degree.MBA Admissions: Applicants must submit their GRE or GMAT results in addition to a legitimate bachelor's or master's degree.MD Admissions: Candidates with a bachelor's degree who have done a variety of Humanities and Science research provide a strong foundation for a scientific foundation in Health, Human Behavior, and Society. They must also have completed three years of post-secondary education at US or Canadian colleges or universities. All applicants must have an MCAT score of 503 or better. Despite the fact that the admissions board analyses each application on its own merits, qualified applications have a combined median MCAT score of 515 and a median GPA of 3.65.

Accommodation: On-Campus AccommodationOn-campus housing is available.Dartmouth College provides safe and secure on-campus housing for its students, with separate housing for undergraduates and postgraduates.Residence halls, approved co-ed, fraternity, or sorority homes, and undergraduate society and affinity houses house about 90% of Dartmouth undergraduates.The North Park Graduate Housing complex, the Tuck School of Business, and Sachem Village all include graduate student housing.On-campus housing information can be found here.https://home.dartmouth.edu/life-community/residential-life Off-Campus AccommodationOff-campus housing is available.The average monthly rent is between 500 and 700 dollars.Studio apartments, three-bedroom apartments, four-bedroom apartments, and communal apartments are among the residential types.All basic services like as electricity, central heating, and unrestricted internet access are included in the fee for the student homes.Most apartments feature hot water, garbage pickup, off-street parking, snow removal, and grass maintenance.Off-campus housing information can be found here.https://www.apartmentguide.com/apartments/New-Hampshire/Hanover/https://www.apartments.com/off-campus-housing/nh/hanover/dartmouth-college/https://collegestudentapartments.com/college/dartmouth-college-hanover-new-hampshire/apartments/
Course Ranking: Dartmouth's business programmes are well-liked domestically and abroad. Since 2016, Bloomberg has put Dartmouth among the top 20 business schools in the USA. The Financial Times also ranked it among the top 20 MBA programmes worldwide from 2016 to 2020. In its global MBA rating from 2018 to 2021, QS (Top universities), another reputable ranking organisation, ranked Dartmouth among the top 50 universities worldwide. Dartmouth has also been placed by Times Higher Education (THE) in the top 50 spots in its PG Business and Economics list since 2018. According to US News & World Report's rating of finance MBA programmes, Dartmouth is in 26th place for 2021. From 2018 through 2021, US News continued to rank Dartmouth among the top 20 graduate business schools. Let's now discuss Dartmouth College's engineering course rankings. In its ranking for Engineering and Technology for 2020, QS placed it between places 451 and 500. According to THE's PG Engineering and Technology ranking for 2021, Dartmouth is between 176 and 200. THE's PG Computers ranking has likewise continuously ranked Dartmouth between 126 and 150 since 2019. Dartmouth is 52nd for 2021 in US News' Computer Engineering PG ranking. Dartmouth was ranked between 301 and 400 in the Academic Ranking of World Universities' (Shanghai Ranking) university ranking for 2020, and it was raised to 201-300 for 2021. Despite being an Ivy League institution, Dartmouth's standing has declined across all major ranking lists. Since 2018, US News has maintained Dartmouth's ranking among the top 20 US institutions.

Placement: CAS Internship Stipend Program The CAS Internship Stipend Program is a very competitive and selective programme that awards a limited number of $2,000 scholarship stipends to students participating in a semester-long internship or student teaching placement during the fall and spring semesters. Students who complete a full-time (20+ hours per week) summer internship may be eligible for a stipend of up to $3,000 in scholarship funds.  Information about internships for academic credit The Internship Program at SUNY New Paltz is an academic programme in which students work/intern at businesses linked to their academic major or minorInterns can earn anywhere from one to fifteen credits toward their degree requirementsEach intern will be supervised by a SUNY New Paltz faculty member from the student's major or minor department. The professor will assign academic work and provide a grade at the endIt is possible to have a paid or unpaid internship  Office of Field Experiences Students are placed in the Mid-Hudson Valley, Lower-Hudson Valley, NYC, Long Island, Utica, and Australia via the Student Teaching Office. In any one semester, this typically comprises 45 to 50 school districts. These districts were chosen because they are close to where students live, have a long history of cooperation, and have supervisors accessible. Education programme advisers and education chairs must be consulted for placements outside of these regions. In most cases, this is possible due to compelling circumstances. Students are placed within 45 miles of where they will be residing while student teaching by the Student Teaching Office. To commute back and forth, you must supply your own vehicle.
Accommodation: On the New Paltz campus, there are 14 residence halls. This gives students the choice of living in a variety of settings, such as corridor or suite-style housing, or special interest group housing.Every residence hall is coed. A washing room, computer terminals, a primary meeting space for hall government meetings and activities, and a study lounge are among the student-oriented amenities and services available in each resident hall. Each hall also features at least one television lounge, a kitchenette space, and a microwave that is available to all residents. Parker Complex, Hasbrouck Complex, and South Complex are the three residence life complexes on the New Paltz campus. Parker Complex Capen Hall, Bliss Hall, Bouton Hall, Gage Hall, Scudder Hall, and Shango/College Hall are the six residence halls that make up the Parker Complex. All of the residence halls are classic corridor layouts, with a restroom used by all of the floor's inhabitants. Rooms are connected by a common hallway with an entrance and exit. Each room has a telephone, internet, and cable television connection. Capen Hall Capen Hall is a residence hall and the Department of Residence Life's administrative offices within the Parker complex. The Parker complex is made up of classic corridor-style halls with a restroom that is shared by all inhabitants of the floor or house and is kept clean by the Custodial Staff. Students who live in corridor-style buildings have a lot of engagement and activity with their housemates. On each of the floors, there are lounges. Two laundry facilities with washers and dryers, a bike rack, a computer lab, a recycling room, and the offices for the Residence Hall Student Association and National Residence Hall Honorary are all located in the basement of Capen Hall. On the first level, there is a large study lounge, the Department of Residence Life, vending machines, and a microwave oven. T.V. lounges are located on the second and third floors, and each floor contains a kitchenette. Capen Hall provides a convenient campus location and resources for physically challenged students to its diverse student community. Note: New Paltz Normal School's second principal, Frank S. Capen (1888-1899)  is honoured in this hall. For more information, visit: https://www.newpaltz.edu/reslife/capen/index.php  Bliss Hall Within the Parker complex, Bliss Hall is a residence hall. The Parker complex is made up of classic corridor-style halls with a restroom that is shared by all inhabitants of the floor or house and is kept clean by the Custodial Staff. Students who live in corridor-style buildings have a lot of engagement and activity with their housemates. On each of the floors, there are lounges. Two laundry facilities with washers and dryers, a recycling room, a bike rack, a study lounge, and a computer room are all located in the basement of Bliss Hall. Vending machines and a microwave oven are located on the first floor. On the first and third floors, there are television lounges. Bliss Hall is a co-educational residence hall with a diverse student body. Residents and staff collaborate to build community and traditions. Residents at Bliss Hall are encouraged to share and create mutual interests and aspirations. The theatres, Health Center, campus gym, track, and tennis courts are all within walking distance of Bliss Hall. Note: New Paltz Normal School's fourth principal, John Carlton Bliss (1908-1923) is honoured in this hall. For more information, visit: https://www.newpaltz.edu/reslife/bliss/index.php  Bouton Hall Within the Parker complex, Bouton Hall is a residence hall. The Parker complex is made up of classic corridor-style halls with a restroom shared by inhabitants of the floor or house and kept clean by the Custodial Staff. Students who live in corridor-style buildings have a lot of engagement and activity with their housemates. On each of the floors, there are lounges. A laundry room with washers and dryers, a study area with computers, and a recycling room are all located in Bouton Hall's basement. Vending machines, a microwave oven, two side lounges, and one main study lounge are all located on the first floor. T.V. lounges and culinary facilities are located on the second and third floors, respectively. Bouton Hall, the second-largest residence hall on campus, is a place where diversity and respect are not only respected but expected. Most academic buildings, as well as the Administration and Student Union Buildings, are all within walking distance of Bouton Hall. Note: Eugene Bouton, the first principal of the State Normal School in New Paltz, died in 1951 at the age of 100, and the hall is named after him. For more information, visit: https://www.newpaltz.edu/reslife/bouton/index.php  Gage Hall Within the Parker complex, Gage Hall is a residence hall. The Parker complex is made up of classic corridor-style halls with a restroom that is shared by all inhabitants of the floor or house and is kept clean by the Custodial Staff. Students who live in corridor-style buildings have a lot of engagement and activity with their housemates.On each of the floors, there are lounges. Two laundry rooms with washers and dryers, a T.V. lounge, and a garbage/recycling room are all located in the basement of Gage Hall. There is one large study lounge on the first floor, as well as vending machines, a microwave oven, and two tiny study lounges. T.V. lounges may be found on the second and third floors. The basement, second, and third floors all have cooking facilities. On the third floor, there is also a computer lab with 10 machines. Gage Hall, the largest residence hall on campus, is noted for its diverse inhabitants' active participation in Hall Government and many aspects of school life. The Health Center, Elting Gymnasium, and outdoor tennis courts are all within walking distance of Gage Hall. Gage is also a ten-month hall that is available during all scheduled vacations (unless otherwise specified by the Director of Residence Life) to allow students who require housing to stay on campus when other halls are closed. To stay over breaks, you must live in ten-month housing. Note: Kitty Augusta Gage, a teacher of classical and modern languages at New Paltz Normal School from 1886 until her retirement in 1913, was honoured with the name Gage Hall. Kitty Gage was well-known for her wit, brilliance, enthusiasm, and, most importantly, her giving to students. For more information, visit: https://www.newpaltz.edu/reslife/gage/index.php  Scudder Hall Within the Parker complex, Scudder Hall is a residence hall. Traditional corridor-style halls with a restroom used by all inhabitants of the floor, which is maintained daily by the Custodial Staff, make up the Parker complex buildings. Students who live in corridor-style buildings benefit from a lot of activity and engagement with their peers.On each of the floors, there are lounges with microwave ovens. Two laundry rooms with washers and dryers, as well as a garbage/recycling area, are located in the basement of Scudder Hall. Vending machines may be found on the first floor in the main lounge. Televisions are available in the lounges on the first, second, and third floors. On the third floor, there is a kitchen, and in the basement, there is a computer lab with five PCs. The Health Center, Athletic and Wellness Center, and outdoor tennis courts are all within walking distance of Scudder Hall. Note: Scudder Hall is named after Myron Tracy Scudder, New Paltz Normal's third principal from 1899 to 1908. Scudder established the New Paltz intercollegiate athletic programme, as well as the practice of inviting international students. For more information, visit: https://www.newpaltz.edu/reslife/scudder/index.php  College Hall Within the Parker complex, College Hall is a residence hall. The Parker complex is made up of classic corridor-style halls with a restroom that is shared by all inhabitants of the floor or house and is kept clean by the Custodial Staff. On the first story of College Hall, only male residents live, and on the second floor, only female residents live. Students who live in corridor-style buildings participate in a variety of activities and interactions with their housemates. On the basement level, there are lounges. College Hall, which was the first residence hall on campus, is noted for its unique construction and traditions, as well as the fact that it houses a varied student population. A study lounge with a computer lounge and a kitchen with a lounge space is located in the basement of College Hall. Small laundry facilities with washers and dryers, as well as a recycling area and a microwave oven, are located on the first and second levels, respectively. On the first floor, there are also vending machines. College Hall has a close-knit community and is conveniently located near academic institutions. Through in-hall programming and development, the hall's small, diversified population provides opportunities for growth and experiences. College Hall is the village's nearest hall, located five minutes from Main Street New Paltz. Shango Hall Within the Parker complex, Shango Hall is a residence hall. The Custodial Staff maintains the typical corridor-style passageways with bathrooms that make up the Parker complex. Students who live in corridor-style buildings have a lot of engagement and activity with their housemates. On the basement level, there are lounges. Shango Hall, the first residence hall on campus, is noted for its distinctive architecture and traditions of sheltering a diverse student population. A study area with a computer lounge, one T.V., and one T.V. are all located in the basement of Shango Hall. V. lounges, as well as a kitchen. Small laundry facilities with washers and dryers are placed on the first and second levels, and the kitchen includes a recycling station and microwave oven. On the first floor, there are also vending machines. Shango has a well-knit neighbourhood and is close to academic buildings. Through in-hall programming and development, the hall's small, diversified population provides opportunities for growth and experiences. Between Shango and College Hall is College Hall (The Music Building), which is the academic component of Shango/College Hall.   The offices, practice studios, and clinics for the Music and Music Therapy departments are located in this section of the building. The Max and Nadia Sheppard Recital Hall is located in the heart of the Music Building's first floor. Shango Hall is the village's nearest hall, located five minutes from Main Street New Paltz. The Scholar's Mentorship Program (SMP), a networking programme aimed at enhancing the academic careers and social experiences of general admission students of colour during their college years, is also housed in Shango, next to the Dr Martin Luther King Jr. Educational Center. Note:  Originally known as the College Union, College Hall functioned as the campus's social and cultural hub. There were various lounges and dining areas in the building. Leisure activities were aided by a music room, reading room, mail room, and snack bar. The Music and Music Therapy departments, as well as the Honors Center, are now housed in the College Hall (Music Building). For more information, visit: https://www.newpaltz.edu/reslife/shangocollege/index.php  For general enquiries, visit:  https://www.newpaltz.edu/reslife/halls.html
