Name: Baylor University
Overview: Baylor University was established in 1845 by the Republic of Texas and is one of the oldest universities in Texas, located in Waco. The university offers 126 undergraduate degree programs, 79 masteräó»s programs, 47 doctoral programs, an academic specialist program, and a master of law program. The university has been awarded the first law diplomas and has established the first law school in Texas, ABA-approved schools in the U.S. The university is divided into 12-degree academic units in 3 colleges, eight schools, and one seminary. The university provides programs that cover a broad range of areas of study, including arts, sciences, advertising, accounting, languages, mathematics, business, and management. It also provides programs including communication, law, computer science, education, engineering, design, philosophy, psychology, journalism, and theatre. Baylor University offers its students both Army and Air Force ROTC, and military schooling started in 1888. The university additionally has a research and innovation collaborative that supports the development of ideas and skills. The tuition fee for undergraduates is around USD 47,364, and the overall cost of living is USD 12,682. The institution offers various speciality scholarships for students who meet specific qualifications such as academics and athletics.
Eligibility Overview: Admissions to the undergraduate programmeStudents must have a high school diploma or certificate from a recognised institution or school. There are no explicit course requirements for entrance consideration at Baylor. It does, however, recommend that students take the following courses as part of their high school education:4th year of English2 years in a foreign language2 years of mathematics4 years of natural science3 years in social scienceApplicants can also apply using their SAT or ACT results. This is, however, an optional step, and students who do not submit their test scores will not be penalised.International applicants must also meet the English language requirements and submit a test score from one of the following tests:  Admissions to Graduate SchoolStudents must have a minimum GPA of 3.0 and an undergraduate degree (US equivalent) from an approved university. To be eligible for admission, Indian applicants must have a four-year bachelor's degree in medicine, engineering, or technology from an institution recognised by the Ministry of Education, or a master's degree.The admissions procedures and processes for Baylor Law School and Truett Seminary are distinct. For further information, applicants should go to the various websites. As part of the course requirements, GRE and GMAT scores are necessary. Placement: In the year 2021, Baylor University had a stellar job placement record, with an astounding 86 percent placement rate (based on data from 99.6% of the class) within six months of graduation. As a result, many recent grads were able to secure full-time employment rather quickly. According to the National Association of Colleges and Employers' November 2021 statistics, Baylor outperformed the national UG placement average, which was only 50%.Within 90 days after graduation in autumn 2020, 73 percent of students were working or pursuing their education. The number of students who took a full-time job, completed their education, or joined the military or volunteered climbed as well. The success percentage of the 2021 batch, according to the university's career centre, was 88 percent, which was 5% higher than the previous year (83 percent in 2020). The students' success percentage illustrates Baylor's dedication to shaping the futures of all current and former students, both within and outside of the classroom.

Name: University of Houston - Clear Lake
Overview: University of Houston - Clear Lake (UHCL), located in Houston and Pasadena, Texas, is an educational institution under the University of Houston System. Its colleges comprise multiple centers, institutes, and departments dedicated to general business, accounting, healthcare administration, information systems, decision sciences, management, economics, finance, and marketing. All four UHCL colleges, namely the College of Education, College of Business, College of Science and Engineering, and College of Human Sciences and Humanities, offer various undergraduate and graduate degrees, specializations, professional certificates, and minors. UHCL also offers three doctoral programs for students who wish to pursue higher education. The university also offers online graduate, undergraduate, and certificate programs. With an acceptance rate of around 80%, the university commences its admissions intake in the spring, summer, and fall semesters and has an annual turnover of 9,144 students. An international student looking to study at the university can expect a living cost of around 30,000 USD to 35,000 USD annually.The university also has many scholarship opportunities for international students that help them with their cost of study. Some scholarship opportunities offered by the university are CSE Dean Scholarship, Qatar Harvey Fund Scholarship, Ann Wilke Memorial Nursing Scholarship, Hawk Advantage Scholarship, and The Bennett and Timm Family Endowment for Veterans.

Name: Long Island University Brooklyn (LIU Brooklyn)
Overview: Established in 1926 and located in 1, University Plaza, Brooklyn, NY 11201, Long Island University (LIU) is a globally acknowledged university for providing top-notch education through its teaching and research opportunities. This university earned the approval of the Middle States Commission on Higher Education (MSCHE). The programs offered by this university are sanctioned by different well-known accreditation organisations such as The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB), The Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (CCNE) etc. Being the first campus, Long Island University (LIU) Brooklyn comprises nine academic buildings that feature different facilities and amenities for the students. Furthermore, this campus offers a specialized four-year undergraduate program known as LIU Global, which allows students to study and live in eight different countries throughout eight semesters. This campus also provides professional programs in the health care sector through College of Pharmacy and Health Science and School of Nursing. Besides, this institution offers more than 275 courses, including graduate, undergraduate and post-doctoral programmes through 12 schools and colleges, offering approximately 15,000 students every year through different campuses. Some of the areas where these courses are offered include business, accounting, computer science, health science, psychology, arts, theatre, sciences, journalism etc. With a student-faculty ratio of 12:1, this university has nearly 488 full-time professors offering necessary guidance to the students based on their course. Besides, students are granted $100 million scholarships every year. The Long Island University ranking is 272 as per U.S. News & World Report- National University Ranking. This university is equipped with more than 500 faculty members who hold prestigious degrees in their respective fields. Furthermore, these faculties include multiple Fulbright Scholars, Academy Award winners, and top-notch scientists whose research activities significantly contribute to medical advancement. The Brooklyn campus of this university was ranked as the best school and college for different disciplines and by various ranking websites.

University Ranking: According to US News & World Report's national rankings, Washington State University comes in at number 176 and is included in the top 200 universities in the country. In terms of overall rankings, Washington State University is ranked #297 by US News & World Report, up 7 places from the rankings for 2020. For the year 2021, THE rates Washburn State University between 301-350. In contrast to the ranking range in 2021, the rank range in 2020 was between 351-400. THE has given Washington State University an average ranking across all categories, including citations (70.3), industry income (50.3), worldwide view (50.1), and more.However, QS has moved Washington State University up 11 spots in the rankings since 2020, placing it at #11 for the coming year. The ranking criterion for Washington State University received an average score from QS, with 38 citations, a 27 academic reputation score, a 26.2 employer reputation score, and an overall score of 27, which is below average. The 2020 admissions to Washington State University, which are the primary determining factor for both national and international rankings by various agencies, strongly influence all rankings.

Name: LIM College
Overview: Established in 1939 and situated in Manhattan, New York, LIM is known as the Laboratory Institute of Merchandising, offering undergraduate, master’s, and associate degree programs for fashion-oriented courses. This college primarily focuses on the connection between real-world experience and academic study. The Middle States Commission approves it on Higher Education, and its other degree programs, such as BPS, and BBA, are certified by the Accreditation Council for Business School and Programs. Most exam requirements are course specific. Typically you may need GRE, GMAT, SAT, or ACT scores. English proficiency tests like IELTS or TOEFL are mandatory.Students can avail scholarships and grants to make education affordable in the UK. Many students of this college participate in various events such as New York Fashion Week and participate in competitions sponsored by top-notch industries. Besides, various skilled fashion professionals visit the campus to share their knowledge with the students. With a student-to-faculty ratio of 16:1, this college has nearly 1781 students. With a high graduate employment rate, nearly 94% of students get employment after completing their post-graduation courses. As per Niche, in 2020, this college holds the 44th ranking for being the best college location in America. In addition, in 2019, the Business of Fashion recognized this college as one of the Best Schools in the World.
Eligibility Overview: Scores on the English Proficiency Test International students must submit the test score of any of the following English language proficiency exams to be considered eligible for LIM College Admissions.

Accommodation: Accommodation on-campus: 100% of first-year students and 74% of all undergraduates live on campus. All Undergraduates are required to live on-campus for a minimum of six semesters, except for married students, the Resumed Education Program students, and local students living with parent(s).There are 49 residence halls on campus that are all co-ed and smoke-free.All rooms are furnished with the following items; bed frame, mattress, couches, chairs, a desk and desk chair, bookcase, closet, a trash can per occupant, Wi-Fi, etc.A limited number of one-bedroom and two-bedroom apartments are available on campus for graduate students.Meal Plans are available for on-campus and off-campus residents, including graduate and medical students.University features two all-you-care-to-eat dining halls, three coffee carts, four campus restaurants, and two convenience markets.Special Interest housing on campus offers students the chance to live and learn with others of similar interests.Undergraduates who have spent more than 6 semesters and graduates who wish to live off-campus are required to apply for permission to live off-campus.for more information click on this link-https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/accessibility-services/accommodations-services
Course Ranking: Outstanding courses in English language and literature, development studies, and economics and econometrics are all offered at Brown University. 93% of Brown University's 2018 alumni began working or attending graduate or professional school within six months of receiving their diplomas. Computer science, biology/biological sciences, engineering, entrepreneurship/entrepreneurial studies, econometrics, and quantitative economics are a few of the well-liked degrees that Brown University offers. PG Computers was ranked by THE as a subject from position 47 in 2017 to position 86 in 2021. The PG Engineering and Technology ranking of Brown fell as well, from 68th in 2018 to 83rd in 2021. Even with the Engineering and Technology rankings of QS, it has struggled to maintain its rankings. It held the 141st position in 2017 but dropped to the 167th position in 2020. The open curriculum offered here is one of the unique and significant experiences that students can acquire. Candidates are free to enrol in any courses they want at Brown University, with the exception of those that are required for the major programme they are pursuing. There are no prerequisites for general education that applicants must meet.
University Ranking: Brown University was founded in 1764, making it the seventh-oldest research-based higher education institution in the country. It belongs to the esteemed group of eight Ivy League institutions. Most of the top-ranking services and illustrious academic institutions have ranked Brown University among the top 100 universities in the world, whether it be QS (Top Universities) or Times Higher Education. Brown is among the top 150 institutions in the world according to the Academic Ranking of World Universities (Shanghai Ranking), which places a high value on the calibre of the faculty, including Nobel Prize winners and widely cited research. Brown University's undergraduate programmes are highly competitive, with an admittance rate of just 7.1%. Candidates have the possibility to get into Brown if they have strong academic records. Because of its emphasis on research, Brown academics and researchers are renowned for producing output that has a long-lasting effect on the community.

Name: University of the Pacific - San Francisco
Overview: Established in 1851, the University of the Pacific is a private Methodist-affiliated university in the US. Initially, the University was known as the College of the Pacific. Accredited by the Accrediting Commission for Senior Colleges and Universities of the Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC), the University offers educational services for degree and diploma programs. It imparts educational services through four of its major campuses. The University offers over 80 undergraduate areas of study and more than 30 graduate and professional programs. These areas include Applied science and mathematics, Engineering, Computer science, Film studies, Graphic designing, Healthcare, Foreign languages, Media and others. The facilities for the students include a garage and parking lot, central AC and Wi-Fi, mail services, service centres, libraries and resources. The San Francisco campus of the University of the Pacific is located on the west coast in San Francisco. The campus mainly handles the clinical faculties, with first-hand dental and audiology training courses. The University of the Pacific ranking is currently at 1001st position in QS World University Rankings. The present acceptance rate of 71% makes the University moderately selective. The classes ensure that a student-faculty ratio of 14:1 is maintained. It has helped them generate a retention rate of 84%. However, the current fees structure might seem unaffordable to international students, between $50,000 and $55,000. The University offers industry-specific training modules to the students for helping them develop employability skills. Students are prepared to face the employers within months from their graduation. They learn to apply the theories with practical guidelines from the University.
Eligibility Overview: Admission RequirementsWith a GPA of 3.52, University of the Pacific requires you to be around average in your high school class. TranscriptsPersonal StatementTest Scores (Optional)

Name: American University Washington D.C.
Overview: Based in Washington D.C., American University is a Carnegie-classified private research university incorporated in 1893. The 90-acre university campus is located in a residential district of the city, thereby forming a students’ community beyond borders. Besides the state-of-the-art campus offering the best-in-class learning experience, this institute sources the entire campus electricity from renewable resources. This institute provides graduate, undergraduate, doctoral, executive and pre-college degree and certificate programs across disciplines. Students can tailor personalised interdisciplinary programs at the bachelor’s level. American University extends online courses at bachelor’s and master’s levels. Some of the colleges and schools of this university include the Washington College of Law, School of Professional & Extended Studies, School of Communication, School of International Service, School of Education, College of Arts & Sciences, Kogod School of Business, and School of Public Affairs. The academic offerings of AU include 11 doctoral, 80 bachelor’s, and 98 master’s degrees. Additionally, it includes the Washington College of Law’s JD, LLM, MLS and SJD programs. This university has created over 30 specialized research institutes and centres. Students from all the U.S. states and over 140 countries come here to pursue their desired courses. The institute offers study abroad programs every semester, and these provide global exposure to the students. AU allows students to amalgamate theoretical knowledge with hands-on, real-world experiences. The university features over 250 student organizations and clubs involved in performing arts, sports, and other recreational activities. Notably, 94% of American University faculty members possess the highest degree in their concerned fields. The institute’s distinguished faculty includes public representatives, former diplomats, and winners of Oscars, Pulitzers, Emmys and the National Book Award. Furthermore, students can get engaged in different community services. AU works towards building a progressive and sustainable global society by nurturing a community of future leaders.

Name: University of Hawaii at Manoa
Overview: The University of Hawaii at Manoa is a public university located on the island state of Hawaii, United States. The university was founded in 1907 as an agriculture and mechanical arts college. The university's main campus is located in the Manoa Valley of Honolulu. Over the years, the university expanded throughout the island, eventually becoming the flagship campus of the University of Hawaii program. The Hawaii Institute of Geophysics and Planetology and the Hawaii Institute of Marine Biology provide state-of-the-art research facilities to assist students in their academic curriculum.The university comprises 17 schools and colleges which offer 200 bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various fields of education. The best programs at the University of Hawaii at Manoa include MA in Economics, Masters in Accounting and MS in Civil Engineering. The university has a diverse student community that attracts students worldwide. With over 200 student clubs, students can interact and collaborate outside their academics, ensuring holistic development during their education. Alumni of reputation to have graduated from the University of Hawaii at Manoa include US senator Daniel Inouye, former astronaut Ed Lu and Richard Parsons, the former chairperson of Citigroup.The average cost of attending university here per annum can come to around USD 30,000, with tuition fees varying depending on the course chosen and its duration.

Name: Bowie State University
Overview: Bowie State University, or BSU, is the first black university in Maryland. It was founded in 1865 by the Baltimore Association for Educational & Moral development. Bowie University is situated in Prince Georges's County, Maryland. The main campus of Bowie State University is spread across an area of more than 988 square feet, located in Bowie, Maryland, amidst the metropolitan areas of Washington D.C. and Baltimore. Bowie offers 22 undergraduate, 19 master's degrees, 2 PhD and 14 certificate programs in many demanding streams. Some popular majors students can opt for at BSU are Criminal Justice/Safety Studies, Business Administration & Management, Psychology, Biology/Biological Sciences and Radio & Television Broadcasting Technology. All the colleges offer a wide range of subject knowledge to students. At Bowie State, the student-faculty ratio is about 15:1. While studying at BSU, students can opt for different career options like Internship programs, Fellowships, Co-op Jobs, Enterprise Management Training programs, and placements after completing the program. At BSU, students have 50+ clubs to meet and connect with new people and build strong global networks. In addition, the university offers traditional on-campus residential facilities for students across six residence halls fully furnished with all the essential amenities.The annual average in-state cost of attendance at Bowie State University is $8,444 per year. The average out-of-state fee is approximately $19,136 annually, excluding all the extra expenses. The university provides some need-based financial aid or scholarship for full-time undergraduates for up to $7,535.

Name: Bluffton University
Overview: Bluffton University, located in Bluffton, Ohio, is a private Mennonite university. The Higher Learning Commission has granted programmatic accreditation to four programmes: dietetics, education, music, and social work. There are over eighty majors, minors, and interdisciplinary programmes at the university and sixteen NCAA DIII athletic teams.Candidates require at least 6.0 in IELTS or 61 in TOEFL to be considered for admission.The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. The estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student, is around 26,92,590 INR.Bluffton University offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Graduates earn an average of $72k, as reported by 6figr.
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility criteria a student must meet to be considered for admission are: GPA of 3.0 or better in high schoolA minimum of 19 points and a high school GPA of 2.3 to 2.99 are requiredACT/990 SAT. Class rank or College Credit Plus classes may also be taken into accountEnglish language proficiency test  English language proficiency requirements are:

Placement: Internship and Service Learning Hands-on learning experiences are encouraged and available at Bluffton University. Make the most of your cross-cultural experience by taking advantage of internships and research opportunities, as well as participating in a service-learning project. Service-learning and cross-cultural options Service-learning is a method of combining classroom instruction, personal development, and community service. You can participate in service learning at Bluffton through general education or major-specific course. You could also look for service-learning activities that are either short-term or semester-long. The requirement for graduation is cross-cultural learning which enriches every Bluffton student. During the May term, many students fulfil this requirement by participating in a foreign or domestic adventure. Other students choose a semester-long immersion experience. In a Forum presentation and picture contest, students talk about their cross-cultural experiences. Student research and internships Make the most of your education by participating in internships, practicums, and field placements. Many degree programmes mandate an internship, practicum, or field placement, but if yours does not, you should consider doing one on your own. Through Discovery Grants, Pi Delta Research Grants, Professional Enrichment Grants, and/or the Ministry Inquiry Program, we provide financial support for student learning experiences.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation Bluffton University thinks that "it's all about relationships". Classrooms, The Commons, the court, field, or pitch, and the residence halls are all places where lifelong connections are made.Unless they live at home with their parents or spouse and live within an acceptable commuting distance, traditional undergraduate students at Bluffton are expected to live in one of the university's residential halls. Living in a resident hall alongside others is a crucial element of the whole educational and social experience of college life, according to the institution.The residence life programme is responsible for six halls and one set of apartments. Your classmates work as support personnel, hall directors, resident advisers, and ministry assistants in these facilities. Residence halls Bren-Dell Hall Bren-Dell Hall, which seats 95 students, is located on Riley Creek's bank. It's a gender-segregated residence, with men and women residing on separate floors. There is a kitchen in each of the three stories. On the second floor, there is a huge study lounge. In 2015, the building's main entrance's vast main lobby was restored. In 1962, Bren-Dell was completed. Hirschy Annex Hirschy Annex is a 107-student building. It's a gender-segregated residence, with men and women residing on separate floors. Rooms on the second and third floors lead to a passageway that wraps around a level lobby and computer lab. A big lobby and kitchen are located on the first floor. In 1966, the Hirschy Annex was built. Hirschy Hall Hirschy Hall, a residential hall for 97 men and women, is divided into three storeys, each with a kitchen. The main lobby on the ground floor is vast and open, with large windows. Hirschy Hall first opened its doors in 1963.The bronze cast of Noah Hirschy, Bluffton University's first president, is a legendary feature of Hirschy Hall. It is stated that rubbing your nose before taking an exam can bring you good luck. Neufeld Hall Neufeld Hall first opened its doors in 2003. On all floors, there is a divided hall with 108 men and women divided by wing, with men in the east wing and ladies in the west wing. Seniors and juniors are given priority when it comes to living in Neufeld.Each floor has its own lobbies and kitchens, as well as suite-style hallways, a game room, a conference room, and a computer lab. Each room has furniture that can be reconfigured, as well as high ceilings and huge windows.The novel furniture is intended to provide students with more freedom in how they arrange their rooms. A bed, chest of drawers, desk and desk organiser, bookcase, and chair will be provided to each student. Each component interlocks with the others to create 50 possible configurations. When stacking and rearranging, no tools, hardware, or college staff are required. Without the wobble of traditional lofted furniture, heavy steel pegs ensure safety and stability.Voice mail, Internet, and cable TV are all available in each accommodation. The hall is totally handicap accessible and air-conditioned. Ramseyer Hall Ramseyer Hall is a divided hall with separate levels for men and women, holding 109 students. Air conditioning, an elevator, a wide, light main lobby, and level lobbies with kitchenettes on the second and third floors are just a few of the amenities. The first floor has a fully equipped kitchen and conference room, while the basement has a fitness facility. Each room has a high ceiling and opens onto a wide corridor. Ramseyer first opened its doors in 1994. Ropp Hall Ropp is Bluffton University's largest residence hall, with 231 students.Near the main entrance of the building, a big central lounge known as "The Pit" is a popular gathering area for students. Six of Ropp Hall's nine floors offer study lounges and cooking facilities, while the first Ropp Annex has a bigger, fully equipped kitchen. The building also has two computer laboratories in the halls. The Bluffton Centre for Academic Excellence for students in the honours programme, as well as the Health Center, are located on the ground level of Ropp Hall.Ropp was the first women's residence hall at Bluffton University, opening in 1914. Ropp Annex, a second wing, was constructed in 1958, and Ropp Addition, a third wing, was finished in 1967.On different floors, Ropp houses both men and women. The following amenities are provided in all the halls: Main lobby with basic cable televisionKitchenette with refrigerator and stove or microwaveLaundry facilities (cost is included in room and board fees)Soda vending machineStorage space for small items only (suitcases, boxes, trunks)Ramseyer, Ropp and Hirschy Halls have ironing boards in designated areas For more information, visit: https://www.bluffton.edu/studentlife/residencelife/residencehalls/index.aspx

Name: Stony Brook University
Overview: Established in 1957, Stony Brook University is one of the best public universities in the USA. This university is located at Stony Brook in New York and is famous for its contribution to NASA. The Universities Research Association considers it to be an honorary member. Stony Brook University is one of the best research institutes in the USA. It offers both undergraduate and graduate-level admission to the students. The university also consists of different colleges and schools like the College of Business, College of Engineering and Applied Sciences, Renaissance School of Medicine, School of Health Technology and Management, School of Professional Development, School of Nursing, College of Arts and Sciences, Graduate School, School of Dental Medicine, School of Journalism, School of Social Welfare, and School of Marine and Atmospheric Sciences. Biomedical Engineering, Nursing, Computer science, and psychology are some of the most popular programs available at the institute. Stony Brook University offers programs like National Student Exchange, Study Abroad, SUNY Korea, and Semester by the Sea. The top programs at Stony Brook University include MBA, M.Sc in Finance, B.Sc in Business Management, M.Sc in Mechanical Engineering, and M.Sc in Computer Engineering. The fee structure depends on the courses chosen by the students. The minimum fee taken by the university is USD 10,175.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: UndergraduateApplicants must have completed their home country's highest level of secondary education. A solid secondary academic programme with math, science, and English courses is preferred. Postgraduate:A minimum overall GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 is necessary for a US bachelor's degree or the equivalent. If students have not finished their undergraduate curriculum, admission will be conditional on providing a final transcript that includes the degree and the date it was awarded. MBA:Admission requires a 3.0 GPA in prior academic work. In extreme situations, a GPA of less than 3.0 may be considered for conditional admission to the College of Business. Students admitted on a conditional basis must earn a 3.0 GPA in the first semester to continue their chosen study programme.The admissions committee requires a minimum GMAT score of 550. If the scores exceed the minimum, applications are nevertheless considered for admission. The official copy of the GMAT score must be submitted for the admission application to be processed. English Requirements:

Placement: Software Engineer, Software Developer, Mechanical Engineer, Physician Assistant (PA), Project Manager, Data Analyst, and Data Scientist are the most prevalent employment profiles among university alumni. Senior Software Engineers from the institution are the highest-paid employees, with an average salary of $111K. Physician Assistants and Software Engineer grads are next on the list, with wages of roughly $96K and $87K, respectively. Software developers make an average of $70,374 per year. A Master of Science (MS) graduate can earn between $49,220 and $101,774 per year. Stony Brook University, Stony Brook Hospital, J.P. Morgan Chase & Co. (JPMCC), Amazon.com Inc, and Lockheed Martin Corp. are among the top employers of university graduates.Scott Abbey (CTO of UBS), John L. Hennessy (President of Stanford University), and Jeff Raskin are also famous Stony Brooks alumni (Author and co-creator of the Macintosh at Apple Computer Inc).
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation: Undergraduate Lodging: There are two types of housing for undergraduates: corridor style and suite-style. For individuals who like a typical dorm-style room, Corridor Style is an option. There is a double/single bedroom, a common bathroom, and a lounge space available.For those who like some privacy, Suite Style was an option. There are two or three rooms here that may accommodate four to six people, as well as a shared bathroom and a common room. The West Apartment, Chavez Hall, Tubman Hall, Eleanor Roosevelt, H Quad, Kelly Quad, Mendelsohn Quad, Roth Quad, and Tabler Quad are among the accommodation possibilities.Graduate and Family Living: The University provides on-campus apartment-style housing for students who have graduated or are married, as well as domestic couples with children. The Schomburg Apartments, Chapin Apartments, and West Apartments are among them. The following are the semester rates for the residence halls, broken down by room type:

Name: Indiana University
Overview: Indiana University is one of the top-ranked multicampus public research institutions in several districts across Indiana. A leader in liberal arts and science, Indiana University has two centuries' worth of achievements in education and research. The institute has set its vision to keep Indiana University on the course toward greatness. Its mission is to provide accessible education to students throughout Indiana, the United States, and beyond. Indiana University offers several undergraduate and professional graduate programs. Indiana University Bloomington is the flagship campus and home to important academic departments such as the Jacobs School of Campus, the Maurer School of Law, and the Kelley School of Business. The Purdue Campus is the second flagship campus. Besides, there are seven extension campuses throughout Indiana, including Kokomo and Fort Wayne.The average tuition fee at Indiana University is CAD 13,428. International students are eligible for merit-based scholarships. The principles of diversity and inclusion guide campus life at Indiana University. Freshmen are welcomed to the campus with the Welcome Week festivities. The university has more than 750 registered social clubs and societies. Indiana University's extensive career resource team helps students find suitable internships and placement offers. Students are motivated to pursue their passions along with their ambition.
Eligibility Overview: For admission to Indiana University, you must submit academic records that reflect your high school accomplishments. Original, official documentation issued by your school or issuing organisation must be submitted. You must also submit an English translation of these documents if they are not written in English. Unless otherwise specified, photocopies or notarized translations are acceptable.All overseas undergraduate applicants must also demonstrate English competency at Indiana University. Applicants who have not met this requirement in the last two years must provide additional confirmation of English competence.Below are given the minimum test scores required at the time of application.

Name: Old Dominion University
Overview: A public university in Norfolk, Virginia, the Old Dominion University was established as a branch of the College of William and Mary in 1930. It gets its name as King Charles II of England bestowed the nickname of Old Dominion to Virginia on account of its loyalty during the English Civil War. The university promotes the value of tradition as well as innovation to ensure the future of its students as compassionate and critically aware leaders with potential to leave an impact in the global world. Organised into 8 colleges and one graduate school College of Arts and Letters, Strome College of Business, Darden College of Education and Professional Studies, Batten College of Engineering and Technology, College of Health Sciences, College of Sciences, Perry Honours College, School of Cybersecurity, and The Graduate School, the university is one of the critically recognised and celebrated educational institutes with 89% of acceptance rate. It offers diverse areas of study by hosting over 90 undergraduate, 43 postgraduate and over 50 doctorate degree programs. Offering a vibrant campus life at all four campuses, the university serves as a home for the students hailing from different parts of the world. Its academic excellence gets reflected through courses from the programs of Gender and Cultural Studies, Modelling and Simulation, and Social and Behavioral Sciences. The average annual cost including the on-campus living cost can come around $ 40K but with various grants and scholarships offered at the university it can be brought down to $ 29K. With its main campus covering over 251 acres of beautiful land, the university remains equipped with residence halls, recreational halls, libraries, athlete centres, laboratories and conference halls. While maintaining a successful alumni network of notable alumni, it ensures a promising placement rate with personal and professional triumph for students.
Eligibility Overview: Required CredentialsThe Office of International Admissions examines all foreign academic credentials as a service to candidates. Academic documents not written in English must be accompanied by certified official translations by a licensed or professional translator. The student's translations of official documents will not be accepted.Check: https://www.odu.edu/admission/international#tab165852398370=2&done1612907281342

Name: Massachusetts College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences (MCPHS University)
Overview: Accredited by the New England Commission of Higher Education, Massachusetts College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences (MCPHS University) is a private university located in the Longwood Medical and Academic Area of Boston in Massachusetts. This institute extends accelerated and traditional study programs focused on professional education in health sciences and pharmacy. It provides undergraduate and advanced programs ranging from the whole healthcare industry. The courses are extended at the Worcester, Manchester, and Boston campuses. The Direct Entry Doctor of Pharmacy (Pharm.D) program offered on this institute’s Boston campus provides students with a chance to participate in clinical experiences at the laboratories. Every Massachusetts College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences online program is part-time. This allows students to work full-time while completing their certificate or degree. MCPHS students can access research, internships, and clinical placements opportunities in some of the best healthcare firms. Those who complete any full-time MCPHS degree are offered a 100% tuition scholarship for one of the six part-time, online master's programs. These include Master of Public Health, Master of Science in Regulatory Affairs and Health Policy, Master of Health Sciences, MBA in Healthcare Management, Master of Science in Clinical Management, and Master of Science in Clinical Research. The Wall Street Journal/Times Higher Education College Rankings for 2018 ranked MCPHS the #1 University for Earning Power. There are roughly 7,100 students presently enrolled across this institute’s three campuses. Besides this, it also features 826 faculty members, out of which 292 are full-time members. Around 90% of all the well-qualified teachers at this institution hold terminal degrees, and the student-faculty ratio is 13:1. Few notable Massachusetts College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences alumni include businessperson Ronald A. Matricarian, who is currently the Chairman at Systems Oncology LLC and American politician Robert Goforth from the state of Kentucky.

Name: Clark University
Overview: A private research university in Worcester, Massachusetts, the Clark University was established in 1887 as one of the first modern research universities in the United States. After over a hundred years of establishment, it has become an elite presence offering world-class education focused to change the shape of the world. The university works to promote the significance of modern values like innovation and questioning in ensuring the future of students as critical, inspiring and guided world leaders. The academic structure of the university is organized into Clark College, Adam Institute for Urban Teaching and School Practice, Strassler Centre for Holocaust and Genocide Studies, Frances L. Hiatt School of Psychology, Graduate School of Management, Graduate School of Geography, Gustaf H. Carlson School of Chemistry, and School of Professional Studies. The university becomes an anticipated choice among students by maintaining a 53% acceptance rate. It offers over 30 undergraduate majors, 19 postgraduate, 12 interdisciplinary concentrations and 8 doctorate degrees. Some of the popular and highly ranked courses offered at the university belong to the physics, liberal arts, geography, psychology, biology, and entrepreneurship programs. The university hosts a vibrant academic and cultural environment for thousands of students so that they can enjoy inclusive college life. The average annual tuition and accommodation fee can come to around $58K but through many of the scholarships and grants provided by the college, the cost can be brought down to $ 28K. Spread across 50 acres of beautiful land, the university campus, although a small and intimate space, remains equipped with 7 libraries, athletic centres, seminar halls, recreation centres, and residence halls. With a brilliant alumni network of notable alumni like Pulitzer recipients and Emmy winners positioned at the apex of leading industries, it also ensures a promising placement rate for the graduating batch.

Placement: Internships Whatever your professional interests, getting outside-the-classroom experience will aid in career exploration, skill development, and the expansion of your professional network.Internships at Clark might be paid for or count toward academic credit. You can find internships and jobs, connect with alumni, and more with the aid of Clark's Career Connections Center.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation The University's eight traditional resident halls and ten houses, including three graduate student houses, are home to about 1,665 graduate and undergraduate students.To establish a residential community that is inclusive, egalitarian, and secure for students, the Office of Residential Life & Housing works with Clarkies and other campus partners.Students at Clark have access to a range of housing choices. First-year students can get to know one another in three coed housing halls. One of our two mixed-class halls is exclusively for women. Juniors and seniors are the main populations of three different coed residence halls. Additionally, ten coed residences are available, three of which are designated for graduate students.  First-year Halls Students in their first year can get to know one another better because all housing is a traditional lifestyle. There are communal restrooms on every floor, a full kitchen, several social lounges, quiet study spaces, multimedia study rooms, and laundry facilities in every building.  Bullock Hall At Clark University, Bullock Hall is one of the residence halls reserved only for first-year students. Bullock Hall has many wonderful qualities, but the activities and sense of community that are only available to first-year students are just the beginning. The Higgins University Center, Kneller Athletic Center, Goddard Library, Carlson Hall, University Police Station, Parking Garage, and Dana, Hughes, and Maywood Street Residence Halls are all within a minute's walk of Bullock Hall, which is situated in the exact centre of campus directly across the street from Jonas Clark Hall. For more information, visit: https://www.clarku.edu/offices/housing/residence-halls-and-houses/bullock-hall/  Dana Hall One of our living halls for first-year students only is called Dana Hall. 157 students are housed at Dana Hall in a variety of room arrangements. On the south side of the campus, Dana Hall is situated along Florence Street. Dana Commons, Carlson Hall, the Lasry Center for Bioscience, the Higgins University Center, and the Maywood Street, Hughes, and Bullock Residence Halls are all conveniently close to Dana Hall. For more information, visit: https://www.clarku.edu/offices/housing/residence-halls-and-houses/dana-hall/  Dodd Hall For students who identify as women, there is Dodd Hall. Students from all class years reside at Dodd, which is situated in the Fuller Quadrangle between Wright and Johnson-Sanford on the north side of Downing Street. The Kneller Athletic Center, the Goddard Library, the Administration Building, Estabrook Hall, the Little Center, the Wright Hall, and the Johnson-Sanford Center are all conveniently close to Dodd. For more information, visit: https://www.clarku.edu/offices/housing/residence-halls-and-houses/dodd-hall/  Hughes Hall Hughes Hall is a mixed-class facility. Between Dana Hall and Bullock Hall, along with the Shirley Street extension, lies Hughes Hall, which has 148 students living there in a variety of room arrangements. Dana Commons, Carlson Hall, the Kneller Athletic Complex, the Lasry Center for Bioscience, the Higgins University Center, and the Maywood Street, Dana, and Bullock Residence Halls are all easily accessible from Hughes Hall. For more information, visit: https://www.clarku.edu/offices/housing/residence-halls-and-houses/hughes-hall/  Wright Hall 202 students are housed at Wright Hall. Wright Hall is only for first-year students, just like Bullock Hall and Dana Hall. Wright Hall has many wonderful qualities, but the activities and sense of community that are only available to first-year students are just the beginning. Due to Wright Hall's size, you'll be a part of a huge, vibrant community that is exciting and lively. Whether it's a spontaneous movie night with friends or a planned event put on by one of the seven Wright Hall Resident Advisors, there's usually always something going on in Wright Hall. The Kneller Athletic Center, the Goddard Library, the Administration Building, Estabrook Hall, the Little Center, the Dodd, and the Johnson-Sanford Center are all within a minute's walk of Wright Hall, which serves as the focal point of the north side of campus. The Higgins University Center, Atwood Hall, Jonas Clark Hall, Jefferson Hall, and Bullock Hall are all accessible from Wright Hall through a short stroll from the campus centre. For more information, visit: https://www.clarku.edu/offices/housing/residence-halls-and-houses/wright-hall/  Mixed-class Halls The university maintains two coeducational resident halls with mixed-class populations that offer Traditional Lifestyle and Suite Lifestyle living options. Every floor has a private bathroom, and the majority of floors have a kitchen. Dodd Hall For students who identify as women, there is Dodd Hall. Students from all class years reside at Dodd, which is situated in the Fuller Quadrangle between Wright and Johnson-Sanford on the north side of Downing Street. The Kneller Athletic Center, the Goddard Library, the Administration Building, Estabrook Hall, the Little Center, the Wright Hall, and the Johnson-Sanford Center are all conveniently close to Dodd. For more information, visit: https://www.clarku.edu/offices/housing/residence-halls-and-houses/dodd-hall/  Johnson Sanford Center A rooftop terrace, new, upgraded laundry facilities, elevator access to all levels, and social, study, and multimedia lounge areas are all available at the Johnson Sanford Center. Located in the Fuller Quadrangle between Florence and Charlotte Streets on the north side of campus, the Johnson Sanford Center has 297 apartments. The Kneller Athletic Center, the Goddard Library, Estabrook Hall, the Little Center, and the Wright and Dodd Residence Halls may all be reached by foot in only one minute from the Johnson Sanford Center. The Higgins University Center, Atwood Hall, Jonas Clark Hall, Jefferson Hall, and the Bullock Residence Halls are all just a walk away from the Johnson Sanford Center and the campus centre. For more information, visit: https://www.clarku.edu/offices/housing/residence-halls-and-houses/johnson-sanford-center/  Hall for Women-Identified Students The university currently provides lodging for students who identify as women. It is set up with singles and doubles in a quad configuration. Upper-class students have limited housing options for the apartment lifestyle. Dodd Hall For students who identify as women, there is Dodd Hall. Students from all class years reside at Dodd, which is situated in the Fuller Quadrangle between Wright and Johnson-Sanford on the north side of Downing Street. The Kneller Athletic Center, the Goddard Library, the Administration Building, Estabrook Hall, the Little Center, the Wright Hall, and the Johnson-Sanford Center are all conveniently close to Dodd. For more information, visit: https://www.clarku.edu/offices/housing/residence-halls-and-houses/dodd-hall/  Junior/Senior Halls Particularly serving junior and senior college students. Four, five, or six persons can fit in these spaces. Maywood Street Hall Particularly serving junior and senior college students. Four, five, or six persons can fit in these spaces. With 225 inhabitants, Maywood Street Hall is the actual largest dorm on campus. The only residence hall on campus that only has suites is Maywood. As its name suggests, Maywood is situated along Maywood Street on the south side of campus and is home to some sophomore, senior, and junior students. Dana Commons, Carlson Hall, the Arthur M. Sackler Sciences Center, the Lasry Center for Bioscience, the Higgins University Center, and the Dana, Hughes, and Bullock Residence Halls may all be reached quickly by foot from Maywood Street Hall. For more information, visit: https://www.clarku.edu/offices/housing/residence-halls-and-houses/maywood-street-hall/  Blackstone Hall Blackstone Hall, a brand-new apartment-style residence hall, was officially opened by Clark University in May 2006. This cutting-edge building, which welcomed students for the 2007–2008 school year, primarily houses junior and senior students as well as some graduate students. 208 students are housed in 44 apartments at Blackstone Hall, which is situated near Beaver Street and Florence Street. Mixed with double and single rooms, each unit can accommodate 4 or 6 students. On the southern edge of the campus, Blackstone Hall is next to the Lasry Center for Bioscience. The Dolan Field House is the nearest residence facility nearby it as well. For more information, visit: https://www.clarku.edu/offices/housing/residence-halls-and-houses/blackstone-hall/  Johnson Sanford Center A rooftop terrace, new, upgraded laundry facilities, elevator access to all levels, and social, study, and multimedia lounge areas are all available at the Johnson Sanford Center. Located in the Fuller Quadrangle between Florence and Charlotte Streets on the north side of campus, the Johnson Sanford Center has 297 apartments. The Kneller Athletic Center, the Goddard Library, Estabrook Hall, the Little Center, and the Wright and Dodd Residence Halls may all be reached by foot in only one minute from the Johnson Sanford Center. The Higgins University Center, Atwood Hall, Jonas Clark Hall, Jefferson Hall, and the Bullock Residence Halls are all just a walk away from the Johnson Sanford Center and the campus centre. For more information, visit: https://www.clarku.edu/offices/housing/residence-halls-and-houses/johnson-sanford-center/  RLH Houses The university has eight residences available for undergrads. Some are designed like little residence halls, while others let residents live in apartments.Eight homes are available for undergraduate residence at the university, and two houses are available for graduate residence. Some are designed like little residence halls, while others let residents live in apartments. There are three zones for Clark residences, each of which is run by a RA.Each co-educational house is set up according to the preferences of the residents during the housing lottery. Except for 1 and 3 Maywood Place, 914, and 926 Main Street, which only have single rooms, all of the residences have both single and double rooms. There are fully equipped kitchens and communal living rooms in every home. Students residing in all homes have access to washers and dryers. Each room has an extra-long twin bed and mattress, a desk, a chair, a bookcase, built-in closets and/or a standing wardrobe, as well as window coverings or curtains for each occupant. Cable and high-speed internet access are also available (wired and wireless). Please take note that we are unable to provide precise or even approximate room dimensions due to the almost infinite variety of room sizes and shapes in the houses. For more information, visit: https://www.clarku.edu/offices/housing/residence-halls-and-houses/rlh-houses/  For general enquiries, visit: https://www.clarku.edu/offices/housing/

Name: Hawaii Pacific University
Overview: A private university in Honolulu, Hawaii, the Hawaii Pacific University was established in 1965 and had an acceptance rate of 75% and a student enrollment of over 5,000. Some popular programs include Cinematic Multimedia Arts, Psychology, Business Administration, Criminal Justice, and Nursing Practice. In addition, there is over 400 Study Abroad, and International Exchange Programs wherein students can study at partner institutes or participate in affiliated programs and internships in countries like Austria, Brazil, and Turkey. Students need a minimum score of 6.0 in IELTS to be eligible for admissionThe estimated annual undergraduate cost of attendance is USD 49,774- USD 57,554 and USD 54,154- USD 59,554 for Hawaii and non-Hawaii residents, respectively. Financial aids include Graduate PLUS Loans, Federal Pell Grant, Federal Work-Study, Phi Theta Kappa Scholarship, etc. On-campus accommodation is available at the Waterfront Lofts, Hawaii Loa Residence Halls, Park Shore Waikiki Hotel, etc. In addition, there are numerous academic, professional, cultural, recreational, and special interest clubs like the Neuroscience Club, Black Student Union, Hiking Club, and Gameshark. HPU graduates earn a median salary of USD 35,600- USD 49,900.

Name: New York Tech - Long Island (NYT)
Overview: Established in 1955, New York Tech or New York Institute of Technology is a private research university. It holds affiliation with NAICU, and MSCHE accredited this institute. It has campuses in New York, Long Island, Jonesboro, China, and Vancouver. The campus at Long Island is one of the safest campuses in the U.S. It approximately takes an hour from New York City to reach this campus. In New York Tech Long Island campus, students can apply for Adolescent Education (Master of Arts in Teaching), B.S. in Applied and Computational Mathematics, B.S.A.T. in Architectural Technology, etc. The campus is equipped with a fitness center, WIFI-enabled lounges and parklets, an on-campus café, library, bookstore etc. Students can access tutoring services, Supplemental Instruction sessions, First-year Guide Program etc., for academic support. The institute offers financial assistance to eligible students through New York State Scholarships, New York State Awards, etc. Riland Health Care Center is available on this campus to provide healthcare services to students. According to the U.S. News & World Report, the New York Institute of Technology acceptance rate was approximately 75% in 2020. It ranks between 151 to 160th among U.S. universities in the QS World University Rankings 2021. According to the Times Higher Education (2022), the New York Institute of Technology ranking in the United States is 253rd. Besides, it is designated as one of the country’s ‘Colleges of Distinction’ in 2021-22. It ranks 6th for housing the most international students in the U.S. News & World Report 2022. It ranks 4th based on encouraging on-campus ethnic diversity in the U.S. This institute also offers online programs in M.S. in Clinical Nutrition, Energy Management etc. Approximately 94% of graduates have found jobs within a year of graduation. Leading companies such as Apple, Citi, Microsoft etc., recruit graduates. Besides academics, the Long Island campus of the New York Institute of Technology allows students to join 60+ student clubs. Moreover, campus organisations hold events throughout the academic year.

To be a member of the university's postgraduate programme, students must also obtain an undergraduate or bachelor's degree from a recognised institution.Undergraduate and postgraduate courses must meet the following minimal English language requirements: English Requirements for Undergraduate and Graduate Students: The following are the language requirements for overseas students:TOEFL (iBT) score of 79 or higherPTE 53 or higher on the Pearson scaleIELTS 6.0 or above is required.Duolingo level 105 or above

Name: Musicians Institute
Overview: Musicians Institute, formerly known as Guitar Institute of Technology and Musicians Institute of Technology, is located in Los Angeles, California. This for-profit college is an accredited member of the National Association of Schools of Music, certified by the US Department of Education and Council of Higher Education Accreditation. This institute offers 500+ programs covering the field of Music Performance, Music Production and Recording, etc. It specialises in providing Bachelor of Music, Master of Music, Associate of Science in Music, and Associate of Arts. Students can also opt for the certificate or non-certificate courses depending upon their requirements. It houses well-equipped professional studios with advanced technology. Students can access 75+ private practice labs,12 rehearsal rooms and 30 recording studios 24x7. Open Counselling, small sizes of the classrooms, private lessons provides personalised guidance from instructors. Musicians Institute Scholarships such as Musicians Foundation Scholarships, Mi Online Scholarships etc., are available to finance eligible students' education. The average acceptance rate is 68.7% (2020). Musicians Institute tuition fees vary with each course on which students have enrolled. For example, students enrolled in Master of Music degrees need to pay approximately $27,540. Students who apply for Bachelor of Music Degrees in Composition may need to pay between $80,820 and $82,512. According to Hollywood Reporter's annual list 20198, it ranked 14th among the top music schools for television and film. Besides, students can access MI Online from anywhere to earn degrees in Associate of Arts, Associate of Science and certificates etc. The Musicians Institute's affiliation with leading companies such as Serato, Sony BMG Music Entertainment, Virgin Records, etc., allows graduates to access the prospective music industry. Musicians Institute's alumni include some popular names such as Bishop Briggs, Antonio Geary, Gaby Moreno and Mark MacKay.

Name: Grand Valley State University
Overview: Founded in 1960, Grand Valley State University is a public institution having a total undergraduate enrollment of 21,112 and has a campus size of 1391 acres. It is located just outside the Grand Rapids zone, Michigan's second-biggest metropolitan locale and is ranked 28th in the list of Regional Universities Midwest ( US News and World Report 2021).The university consists of eight-F.E. Seidman College of Business, College of Community and Public Services, College of Education, College of Liberal Arts and Sciences, Seymour and Esther Padnos College of Engineering and Computing, College of Health Professions, Kirkhof College of Nursing, and Brooks College of Interdisciplinary Studies. Among the many majors available the most popular majors include Business, Management, Marketing, and Related Support Services; Health Professions and Related Programs; Communication, Journalism, and Related Programs; Psychology; and Parks, Recreation, Leisure, and Fitness Studies. The university provides various housing options both on and off-campus. It has a traditional-style, suite-style, or apartment-style living center or an actual on-campus apartment with all the basic amenities needed. There is also a provision for campus dining for the students, with some reasonable meal plan options. There are over 400 student organizations that allow students to engage in extracurricular activities. Some of the clubs include- Advertising Club, Alcohol Drug and Awareness Courses, American Red Cross Club, Arab Culture Club, Baseball Club, and many more. The total fees including tuition fees, cost of room and board, books and supplies, transportation, and personal expenses for in-state students is 24,460 USD and for out-state students is 29,896 USD. Both need and merit-based scholarships or financial aid are provided by the university. Need-based aid is determined by the student's family's demonstrated ability to pay for college, as calculated by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid, known as the FAFSA.

Name: University of South Alabama
Overview: A public research university in Mobile, Alabama, the University of South Alabama was founded in 1963 by the Alabama Legislature. The university is invested in bringing out the leadership qualities in its students as it promotes the values of hard working, learning and innovation. With campuses at Baldwin County, Gulf Shores, USA Health Locations and the main Mobile location, the university hosts state of the art educational resources and facilities for its students. It is organized into ten academic colleges - Pat Capps Covey College of Allied Health Professions, College of Arts and Sciences, Mitchell College of Business, College of Education and Professional Studies, College of Engineering, College of Medicine, College of Nursing, School of Computing, Honors College, and the Graduate School. With a 79% acceptance rate, it is listed amongst some of the most effective university choices for students aiming for a quality education.It offers over 50 undergraduate, 38 postgraduate and 13 doctorate degree programs. Some of the popular and highly ranked courses offered at the university belong from the Medicine, Business, Finance, and Dramatic Arts programs. The university serves as a home to the thousands of students hailing from different parts of the world because of its inclusive, vibrant and diverse academic and cultural environment. The average annual tuition and accommodation fee can come around $ 30K but through many of the scholarships and grants provided by the college, the cost can be brought down to $ 21K. Spread across 1,200 acres of land, the university is an environment friendly space with tree shaded campuses. It delivers some of the essential resources for academic and cultural development of students including libraries, residence halls, laboratories, cultural halls, and athletic centers. With a brilliant alumni network, it also ensures a promising placement rate for the graduating batch.

Name: University of Dallas
Overview: The University of Dallas is one of the top private Catholic universities in Texas, established in 1965. With a focus on interactive learning, the university has been recognized internationally for undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral programs in Business, Liberal Arts, and Ministry. The University of Dallas became the youngest university to have earned the reputable Phi Beta Kappa chapter. It offers 50 undergraduate courses, 26 graduate courses, doctoral programs, and continuing education programs in business, arts, science, humanities, sciences, nursing, and education. Some of the top programs at the University of Dallas include B.A. in Biology, Economics, English Language Social Sciences, Psychology, M.S. Cyber intelligence, Business Analytics, M.A. in Theology, and MBA. Spread across 215 acres, the University of Dallas has unique campus facilities, including the award-winning Church of the Incarnation, the Cowan-Blakley Memorial Library, and the J.M. Haggar University Center. In addition, university students can register themselves to 50 student clubs, 80 student organizations, and several events like arts and music, cultural, athletics, fundraising, group business, social service, social, learning, spirituality, etc. The University of Dallas offers on-campus hostel facilities only to undergraduate students below 21 or fewer than 90 credit hours. Accommodation is not available for students above the age of 25. There are traditional halls with lounges, shared bathrooms, showers, laundry rooms, etc., and can accommodate 31 to 96 students. The yearly hostel and meal expenses would be around USD 16,137. Tuition fees range between USD 24,709 to 44,477 per year for different courses and programs. The University of Dallas also offers the opportunity to find employment through Handshake, an online database where employers post more than 250,000 job requirements. The university has integrated traditional teaching methods and perspectives for over 50 years, and it provides a transformational experience to the students.
Eligibility Overview: International students must meet minimal eligibility standards equivalent to US academic requirements in order to be admitted to the University of Dallas. To be considered for undergraduate admission, applicants must have completed Grade 12 and have a certificate of completion. The SAT and ACT score requirements vary depending on the major. For the years 2021-2022, however, the university will not need students to take an exam.A bachelor's degree in any discipline (US equivalent) is necessary for entrance to graduate programmes. A minimum cumulative GPA of 2.0 from a regionally approved institution or university is required for international applicants (or US equivalent). Any graduate-level curriculum must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, and all colleges attended must have good academic standing.International applicants from a non-English speaking country need to provide English proficiency scores
Placement: At the University of Dallas, 96.65% of graduate students found work within six months of graduation.A graduate with a master's or higher degree from the university may expect to earn an average salary of 78,244 USD.AT&T, Citi, T-Mobile, Verizon, CHRISTUS Health, and Southwest Airlines were the university's biggest employers.After finishing their courses, approximately 97.8% of graduates from the undergraduate class of 2021 have either found work or continued their education.The average pay provided to university graduates with a bachelor's degree is 51,929 USD.The best-paid degree at the university, according to Emolument, is an MBA, which pays over 145,000 USD per year.According to PayScale, the following are the average incomes of University of Dallas graduates by job profile:

Name: University of Wisconsin-Eau Claire
Overview: Established in 1916 and one of the Midwest's top public universities, the University of Wisconsin provides students various career, life, and school advantages with diverse learning experiences and a dynamic community that helps them learn and grow. This university is approved by the NCAA's Division III and the Wisconsin Intercollegiate Athletic Conference (WIAC). The Eau Claire campus comprises four colleges: the College of Arts and Sciences, the College of Nursing, the College of Business, and the College of Nursing. It offers degrees involving 109 undergraduate majors, 66 undergraduate minors, 11 graduate degrees, and 48 undergraduate certificates. The student enrollment is approximately 10,000 undergraduates and 500 graduates. The University of Wisconsin-Eau Claire associates with the Center for Excellence in Faculty and Undergraduate Student Research Collaboration to motivate students to incorporate research into their undergraduate experiences. Besides, students working with top-notch faculties also publish papers in academic journals. Also, Eau Claire's student/faculty research programs are internationally acknowledged. This university offers its students the opportunity to participate in nationally acknowledged research programs and provides scholarships and funding. Also, students can participate in various clubs and professional organizations. With an acceptance rate of nearly 54%, this university follows a moderately competitive admission procedure. As per US News and World Report, among 157 public and private colleges, this institution holds a ranking of 41st out of other regional universities. Also, this university's honours program provides opportunities for students to develop themselves professionally, intellectually, and personally.
Eligibility Overview: Maximize your potentialThe University looks for students who are curious, imaginative, and compassionate at UW-Eau Claire. When it comes to admissions, we take a holistic approach. This implies that we examine not only your academic achievements in high school, but also your extracurricular activities that demonstrate your ambition and perseverance, compassion for others, and ability to succeed here. If this describes you, fill out an application to join the Blugold family! The guidelines below are used in part to evaluate traditional first-year applicants.

Name: Quinnipiac University
Overview: Quinnipiac University in Hamden, Connecticut, is a private university with an acceptance rate of 70% that was established in 1929. There are three Quinnipiac University campuses; Mount Carmel Campus, North Haven Campus, and York Hill Campus. Over 6,800 undergraduate and 3,000 graduate students enrolled across 140 programs (100+ undergraduate and 30+ graduate programs) offered by nine academic schools like the College of Arts and Sciences, School of Law, School of Health Sciences, etc. Some of the courses are Applied Business, Civil Engineering, History, Biomedical Sciences, and Instructional Design. Dual Degree programs in Computer Science/ Cybersecurity, Theater/Accounting, and Business Administration allow students to complete their Bachelors's and master's degrees faster. Several online degrees and certificate programs like Business Analytics, Cybersecurity, and Occupational Therapy are available.Pre-Professional programs like Pre-Dental Studies and Pre-Law Advising help prepare for professional programs. Some summer programs and courses for school and college students include Medical Microbiology, Fundamentals of Digital Photography, and Interactive Communications. The Honors Program for motivated students includes extensive coursework and extracurriculars. The Study Abroad program allows students to participate in the semester/short-term and service programs in 32 countries, including Barbados, Belgium, Kenya, and Thailand. The estimated undergraduate cost of attendance is USD 56,800 to USD 69,760. Financial aids include the Multiple Sibling Award, Athletic Scholarships, Federal Direct Loan, Resident Assistants Stipend, etc. Quinnipiac University has a graduate employment rate of 97.4%.
Eligibility Overview: English Language RequirementsQuinnipiac University's primary language of instruction is English. You must be able to communicate clearly in both speech and writing in English. Students who do not speak English as a first language must take Quinnipiac's preferred English proficiency assessments.The following are examples of acceptable standardized exams for demonstrating English proficiency:Cambridge B2 First, C1 Advanced or C2 Proficiency — minimum score: 176TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) — minimum score: 550 (pBT)/85 (iBT)DUOLINGO — minimum score: 105IELTS (International English Language Test System) — minimum score: 6.5SAT (administered by The College Board)ACT (American College Testing)Check here for details: https://www.qu.edu/admissions/undergraduate/apply/international/

Name: Mercy College
Overview: Established in the 1950s by Sisters of Mercy, Mercy College is a private co-educational institution in Dobbs Ferry, New York. Mercy College offers more than 90 undergraduate and postgraduate programs and some online courses within its five faculties. Some popular majors at Mercy College are Business, Management, Marketing, Psychology, Health Profession & related programs, Social Sciences, Homeland Security, Law Enforcement, and Firefighting. The College is divided into five schools: School of Liberal Arts, School of Business, School of Health & Natural Sciences, School of Social & Behavioural Sciences and School of Education.The average cost of attendance is about $20,378 per year, regardless of additional expenses for an undergraduate course. The average financial aid or scholarship students receive at Mercy College is approximately $10,698. International Students are permitted to work while studying as a form of financial aid in various ways like On-Campus Employment, Economic Hardship, Curriculum Practical Training (CPT), and Optional Practical Training (OPT). The College runs the Nationally recognized program, Personalized Achievement Contract, that mentors and guides students throughout their academics and supports them in the flexible transition of their careers.
Eligibility Overview: All applicants must be either a high school graduate with a grade point average (GPA) of at least 2.0 or a GED recipient with a score of at least 500. (score of 53 prior to 2002).To be deemed programme ready for admission, all direct from high school students aged 24 and under must take the ACT or SAT and achieve an ACT composite score of 21 or a SAT combined score of 990. (For exam codes, contact Admissions.)For entrance, any direct from high school students aged 25 and up who have not attended a college or university are not required to submit ACT or SAT scores. Students aged 25 and up must also complete the program's other prerequisites.Students who do not have an ACT or SAT score may be accepted into a Mercy College pre-program or a certificate programme that does not require an ACT or SAT score. Students with Math sub-scores below the requirement on the ACT or SAT are invited to take the math placement assessment to determine their math course placement. Applicants who do not fulfil the minimal Algebra, Biology, or Chemistry criteria for admission to the major are urged to start as a pre-major at Mercy College in order to complete the requirements for admission to the major.
Accommodation: One of the most rewarding aspects of college is living on campus. It's an opportunity to gain independence, broaden your horizons, and make long-lasting friends.There are a variety of alternatives for living on campus at Mercy College, including residence halls on the Dobbs Ferry Campus and our brand renovated Dorm34 at MercyManhattan.for more information click on this link-https://www.mercy.edu/campus-life/residential-life

Eligibility Overview: REQUIREMENTS FOR ENTRYFor first-year overseas students who have never attended another college or university, the following requirements must be met:Submit a transcript with a 2.75 GPA on a 4.0 scale or a 2.75 GPA on a 4.0 scale.Transcripts with a 2.25 GPA and an ACT score of 18 or a SAT score of 960 or above are required.After credit review by our Registrar's Office, a 2.3 cumulative GPA is necessary if you are transferring from another institution or university. Name: University of Charleston
Overview: The University of Charleston is a private academic institution established in 1888, located in Charleston, West Virginia. Initially known as the Barboursville Seminary, later in 1978, it was renamed the University of Charleston. Apart from the main campus at the banks of Kanawha River in Charleston, West Virginia, it has additional campuses in Beckley, West Virginia. The university provides full-time, part-time as well as online programs. Courses at the University of Charleston include disciplines like English, Biology, Chemistry, Business Analytics, Management, Nursing, Psychology, Political Science, Data Analytics, Digital Marketing and others. According to niche.com, the university ranks 71 out of 326 in Best Online Colleges in America and 206 out of 1,422 in Best College Athletics in America. With an acceptance rate of 50%, the University of Charleston is one of the most sorted institutions in the U.S. Additionally, 90% of the students get employed within two years after graduation.The average tuition fee at the University of Charleston is $31,400, which is less than the national average of $41,281. The University of Charleston offers scholarships for deserving students. All the students at the university receive some kind of financial aid for their studies. Types of financial aid available at the institution include work-study, WV State Grant and Scholarship Programs, Federal Grant programs, Loans, and Scholarships. Some most sought-after scholarships at the University of Charleston are Innovation Scholarship, Presidential Scholarship, Student Ambassador Scholarship, Band Scholarship, IDEA Scholarship and others.

Internship and placement opportunities are available with corporations such Arnett Foster Toothman, the West Virginia State Auditor's Office, Real Corp Inc., Fripp Island Resort, and others.The Center for Career Development provides services to both current and former students. It acts as a conduit between students and employers. Individual career coaching, support in graduate school selection, and access to job search resources such as Quinncia for resumes and mock interviews, Handshake for job and career management, and Career One Stop to assist in career pathways are just a few of the university's services. The CCD hosts activities such the Annual Career Fair, Graduate School Fair, Career Development Week, and the Etiquette and Networking Dinner.
