Name: Midwestern State University
Overview: Midwestern State University is a public university located in the state of Texas, United States. The university was founded in 1922 as the Wichita Falls Junior College. It has since developed into a full fledged university, making it the only public university in Texas dedicated to liberal arts. The university comprises seven colleges that provide programs in undergraduate and graduate studies in various disciplines of education. The best programs at Midwestern State University include MA in Psychology, Bachelors in Business Administration and BS in Dental Hygiene (BSDH). The university main campus is located in Wichita Falls, Texas. It is spread over 255 acres of land, with all the buildings in campus having a similar architecture with red bricked walls, arched entrances and tiled roofs. The Moffett Library provides students with the academic literature and books required to meet curriculum requirements of various fields. The university is also home to the Dalquest Desert Research Station that promotes research in various nature sciences like geology and biology. It was donated to the university by former professor Dr. Dalton Dalquest to promote scientific research by educators and scientists. The average annual costs of studying at this university can come to around USD 22,000. The university has a closely knit student community that is active thanks to the numerous events held on campus. There are over 100 student clubs and organizations, providing students with a platform to showcase their skills in co-curricular fields. The university also has fraternities and sororities to help students build professional networks with alumni and peers. The Mustangs represent the university at multiple national level sports tournaments, producing a number of renowned athletes over the years. Notable alumni include TV personality Phil McGraw, American footballer Marqui Christian and Lanham Lyne, former mayor of Wichita Falls.

Name: University of Redlands
Overview: Established in 1907, the University of Redlands is a private liberal arts university located in Redlands, California, in the United States. The 160 acres of the university with more than 3,200 students have five schools: the School of Education, the School of Continuing Studies, the College of Arts and Sciences, and the Graduate School of Theology. The University of Redlands offers more than 50 undergraduate, graduate, and bachelor's programs in over 50 study areas like biology, business, computer science, chemistry, health, literature, etc. The University of Redlands claims a 90% placement rate for graduates with an average salary of 51,200 USD per year in companies like Cisco, Nike, IBM, Disney, and many more.The on-campus facility at the University of Redlands comprises 15 residential halls (Anderson Hall, East Hall, Williams Hall, Melrose Hall, Grossmont Hall, etc.) for UG students and 23 apartment complexes (Student Village, Central Avenue, etc.) for graduates. First-year students can stay in apartments, air-conditioned halls, and single rooms at an average rent of 6,000 USD. Students who meet eligibility criteria in IELTS (6.5 and above), TOEFL (80 and above), and SAT (550 and above) can apply online (75% acceptance rate) for spring and fall intakes with an admission fee of 50 USD. The average yearly tuition fee for postgraduate and undergraduate programs is 32,000 USD and 51,000 USD, respectively. The university provides financial aid as various awards, grants, and scholarships to almost 84% of students under merit-based programs like the Art Award (3,500 USD), Music Award (10,000 USD), Achievement Award (30,000 USD), Pell Grant, Cal Grant, and many more.
Eligibility Overview: The only GPA criterion that matters is the one you need to have a realistic chance of getting in. We do this by looking at the school's current students' average GPA.The University of Redlands has a 3.65 average GPA.Many colleges claim that there is no SAT cutoff, but the truth is that there is a SAT requirement. This is based on the average score for the school.On a 1600-point scale, the average SAT composite at University of Redlands is a 1210.
Placement: Graduates of the University of Redlands go on to have successful careers in a number of sectors, including business, education, and the arts. They take their broad perspective, problem-solving ability, and critical thinking skills learned at Redlands with them wherever they go, and they join a network of over 50,000 fellow Redlands alumni.Visit:- https://www.redlands.edu/student-outcomes/

Name: Whittier College
Overview: Founded in 1887, Whittier College is a private institution in Whittier, California. The institution is located in a private setting and follows a 4-1-4 academic calendar. With an acceptance rate of 57%, this private college is one of the most-sorted colleges in Southern California. Whittier College offers both undergraduate and postgraduate programs in a variety of disciplines. Placement: One of the most crucial choices a medical student will ever have is selecting career objectives, which may include a specialisation. The Suny Downstate College of Medicine Office of Career Advising is committed to assisting its medical students in exploring medical careers throughout their years of study, developing mentorship relationships with faculty, pursuing dual degrees, and navigating the residency application process. All College of Medicine students have access to the centrally located Office of Career Advising. Each stage of the student's career development is addressed by a four-year schedule of activities developed and managed by the office. Events include peer guidance workshops, speciality educational sessions, and class presentations. The career advising office assigns early career advisers, clinical advisory deans, and departmental speciality advisors. They are in charge of advising students during the Foundation and clinical years, offering assistance with the Electronic Residency Application Service (ERAS), reviewing personal statements, and setting up mock residency interviews during the residency application process.

Name: Webster University
Overview: Established in 1915, Webster University is a private institute headquartered in Webster Groves, Missouri, with an acceptance rate of 57%. Over 12,000 students enrolled across 200+ undergraduate and 50+ graduate programs offered by five schools and colleges, including the School of Communications, School of Education, and College of Arts & Sciences. Some of the courses are Legal Studies, Cybersecurity, Journalism, Music Composition, and European Studies. While the main Webster University campus is situated in Webster Grove, the university has over 50 campuses and sites in the U.S., including Texas, Kansas, Washington D.C., and Virginia. The Webster University Library houses numerous books, journals, articles, media, online resources, and study spaces. It offers more than 70 undergraduate and graduate certificate programs, including Data Analytics, Marketing, Corporate Entrepreneurship, and Environmental Sustainability. There are numerous online degree and certificate programs to choose from, such as Criminology, Educational Technology, and Gerontology. Students can pursue Pre-Professional courses like Pre-Law, Pre-Dentistry, and Pre-Veterinary to prepare for professional programs. Undergraduates excelling academically, meeting credit and course requirements, and achieving a current semester GPA of 3.80 are placed on the Dean's List. The Study Abroad program enables students to participate in exchanges or study programs at 50+ locations worldwide, including Japan, Austria, Switzerland, and Ghana. The estimated undergraduate tuition fee is USD 28,500 per year, while the graduate tuition fee is USD 650 per credit hour and above. Financial aids include scholarships, loans, grants, and student employment like the Access Missouri Grant, Direct PLUS Loans, Leadership Scholarship, and Proud to Serve Scholarship. Accommodation is available at East Hall, Maria Hall, Big Bend Apartments, Glen Park Apartments, and shared and private suites or one/two/three/four-bedroom apartments. There are over 50 student organizations like Anime Club, Commuter Council, Green Fuse, and several sports teams like soccer, tennis, and volleyball. Webster University has an employment rate of 90%.

Name: Chemeketa Community College - Eola
Overview: Chemeketa Community College at Eola is home to the Northwest Wine Studies Center. Chemeketa is regulated by Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities. Holding the status of an accredited college, Chemeketa qualifies for federal financial funds and aid for services and teaching. Chemeketa Eola is available for hosting meetings, conferences, and special events. The Northwest Wine Studies Center is situated in Eola-Amity Hills, which is just west of downtown Salem. This educational center houses the Wine Studies program at Chemeketa. It is also home to Chemeketa Cellars tasting room, student-operated winery, and classrooms. The Northwest Wine Studies Center holds a close relationship with the Oregon wine industry. Several pioneers of the Oregon wine industry actually supported the construction of this facility. This center operates as a leading wine industry resource and responds to educational demands of the growing Oregon wine industry. Chemeketa Eola offers the landscape for an 8-acre test vineyard that students of the Wine Studies program manage. Along with a winery and tasting room, on-site laboratory, the Chemeketa Wine Studies program proves to be an excellent hands-on training platform for someone willing to work in the wine industry. The Oregon wine industry presents Chemeketa students with many career and job opportunities. The state’s wine industry offers several career options to individuals ranging from being a winemaker, vineyard manager, tasting room manager, cellar master, or anything in between. Chemeketa Community College is governed by its Board of Education that comprises seven officials. These officials are elected from this region’s geographic districts. They direct and hire the district president on college policy matters.
Placement: Assessment of a PositionBefore you register for classes, Chemeketa uses a variety of methods to assess your current reading, writing, and math skills. Begin by filling out the Placement Assessment Form. Within 3-5 business days, you will receive a response with information on your placement and future steps. For More :https://www.chemeketa.edu/admission/enroll/placement-assessment/
Accommodation: On-Campus AccommodationFor your first term as an international student, we strongly suggest homestay. It is one of the most efficient methods for improving your English language skills. You will have a family to talk to as well as assistance in getting to know the area. Our host families are located throughout the Salem-Keizer area and all reside near a bus stop, ensuring that you have convenient access to the campus. You should apply for homestay as soon as possible because we only have a limited number of families available and cannot promise that you will be placed with a homestay family. Students will get homestay forms through email once they have finished their application.On-campus housing can be found here.https://www.chemeketa.edu/admission/international/housing/

Name: Northeast Wisconsin Technical College - Green Bay
Overview: Founded in 1975, North Island College is primarily a community college situated in Vancouver Island, British Columbia. This college has four campuses and three centres. The largest campus of this university is Comox valley, and the other three campuses are Port Alberni, Campbell River and Port Hardy. This institution provides more than 100 courses and 80 programs in different fields such as fine arts, health care, business, university trades, trades and technical, tourism and hospitality etc. Every year nearly 4, 000 students are enrolled this year. At the Port Alberni campus, Tebo Vocational Centre is situated. On this campus, students attend various lectures in Early Childhood Care and Education, University Transfer, Nursing etc. This college is also equipped with a library and bookstore. NIC also offers various bachelor’s diplomas, associate degrees, certificate programs etc. The only undergraduate program provided to the international students includes Bachelor of Business Administration in Accounting and General Marketing and Management. Besides, eligible students can also avail financial aids, scholarships and grants. Furthermore, this college offers various placement services to the candidates. Besides, North Island College’s career central page is equipped with many resources that will allow them to crack the interviews successfully. Students can gather knowledge from top-notch faculties who are Ph.D. holders and dedicatedly support students in pursuing education. Special small class sizes provide students and lecturers to develop bonding among each other. Applied research facilities at North Island College provide students with exclusive opportunities and the staff to manage challenges determined by the local business, community groups, industries, etc. This college focuses on expanding domestic and international education pathways and opportunities for students.

Name: Clarkson University
Overview: Clarkson University is a private national research university located in Potsdam, New York. It was established in 1898. The university has three campuses, with the main campus at Potsdam. The Potsdam campus is spread over 540 acres and offers undergraduate degree programs, masters, and Ph.D. programs. Clarkson has eight institutes and schools under the university, including the School of Arts and Sciences, Reh School of Business, Lewis School of Health Sciences, Coulter School of Engineering, Beacon Institute for Rivers and Estuaries, and Institute for a Sustainable Environment. Clarkson University offers degrees in bachelor of science, master of business administration, master of engineering, master of science, bachelor of professional studies, master of arts in teaching, doctor of philosophy, and doctor of physical therapy. The popular graduate programs are basic science, bioethics, computer science, and data analysis. The university houses a center for advanced research programs. The tuition fee is around USD 53,100 per annum. The university also focuses on sports with baseball, basketball, skiing, hockey, swimming, and many more. Clarkson's global faculty pursue interdisciplinary research focused on rapidly solving real-world problems for a better future. The institute offers four-year residence facilities for students through its nine halls. The residential halls have basic amenities like beds, desks, TV, parking, and more. The cost of living is around USD 17,614 per annum. The university campus also offers 200+ clubs, professional societies, 182 intramural teams, greek life, leadership & student government. Clarkson University provides various forms of financial aid in the form of awards and scholarships for international students. The amount of scholarship ranges between USD 5,000 to 30,000. The graduate students are offered placements and have been ranked as one of the highest-paid graduates.
Eligibility Overview: - Students that are accepted have a SAT score of 1160 to 1350 or an ACT score of 23 to 30.- Approximately 89 percent of the approved fall 2019 class provided SAT scores, while 32 percent submitted ACT scores.- Applicants must submit two letters of recommendation from individuals who are academically related to them, such as a school counsellor, principal, or teacher.- Some graduate programmes may demand GRE/ GMAT scores for admittance. If the applicant has adequate job experience, the requirement may be waived.To study in the United States, international applicants must establish their English competence. These tests are waived for students from English-speaking countries or those who have spent at least two years in an English-medium college.

Name: Emory University
Overview: Established in 1836, Emory University is a private research university located in Atlanta, Georgia. The Atlanta campus is situated in Druid Hills, a notable and walkable piece of the city that permits simple admittance to the energetic social and business openings in the worldwide city of Atlanta. The institution has about 15,500 students including undergraduate candidates welcoming students from over 100 countries. The university is internationally recognized for its graduate and professional schools, liberal arts college, and leading health care systems. The university offers 70 undergraduate programs, 40 Ph.D. programs, and professional courses in business, law, health nursing, and theology. The bachelor's classes are provided in the field of arts and science, business, and nursing. The masters program degrees include MA, MS, MBA, MDP, and more. The top 5 majors offered by the university are business administration and management, biological sciences, registered nursing, economics, and psychology. Emory University offers a highly selective honors program for high-performing students in many areas. The total tuition fee for undergraduates per annum is USD 53,804 and the tuition fee for graduates ranges between USD 43,800 to 60,000. The university provides financial aid for international students including scholarships and merit-based. Liberal Art Scholarship is an award-winning scholarship for students who excel academically. The institution provides benefits like Emory's online community, library research, business services such as banking and insurance, Emory travel program for international students as well as domestic students. The average cost of living is around USD 15,000. The university holds events like career fairs, networking guides, and workshops to help the students with job placements and provide services including resume guide and document critique services to help their students build their portfolio. The university offers 14 residence halls for students living on the Atlanta campus with dining facilities.

Course Ranking: Emory University's Goizueta Business School offers management courses at the undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral levels. The Goizueta Business School offers a variety of well-liked courses, such as BBA, MBA (1 year), MBA (2 years), Executive MBA, PhD, etc. Compared to its ranking of #15 since 2018, this Business School was ranked at #12 by US News & World Report - UG Business in 2021. While Emory University has been ranked at #22 since 2020 by US News & World Report's Graduate Business School. Emory University's MBA in Business Analytics programme appears to have gained popularity only recently, as the school is now placed by US News & World Report's MBA Business Analytics rankings at #18 for the first time in 2021.Emory University's QS - Global MBA rankings have irregularly risen since 2019, when it was rated #48. For its MBA programmes, Emory University is ranked #60 in 2021. The following factors were taken into consideration while determining this university's ranking for the Global MBA programme: academic reputation (62.1), employer reputation (52.9), per paper citations (90.1), and overall score (63.9).
University Ranking: In 2021, US News & World Report's Global Universities ranking for Emory University, a private research university in Atlanta, places it at number 71. Emory University's ranking has remained at #71 till 2019, with the exception of 2018, when it was ranked at #73. The acceptance rate at Emory University in 2020 was 16%; admission was solely based on the applicant's GPA, recommendation letters, and above average results on aptitude tests. The rank is derived based on many areas of admission criteria and standards. Emory University Admissions reports a higher admission rate for selection, and as a result, since 2019, US News & World Report has consistently ranked this university at #21—putting it among the top 100 universities in the country.According to the QS University and THE rankings, Emory University's ranks have improved for 2021. Emory University is ranked #158 in the QS Universities Ranking 2021, up from #156 in 2020 and #148 in 2019. This university's decline in rankings is the result of worse scores across all assessment categories, including academic reputation: 25, 66.7 citations per faculty, 99.4 faculty students per 1,000 faculty, 33.1 international students per 1,000 faculty, and a 48.6 total score. While Emory University has dropped in THE 2021 rankings from #80 in 2020 to #85 as a result of its high acceptance rate and research output, it has gained points in the eyes of prospective overseas students. In spite of this, the university received scores of 98.7 for citations, 59.2 for global outlook, 53.9 for teaching, and a total of 63.7.

Name: University of New Mexico - Albuquerque
Overview: The University of New Mexico – Albuquerque was established in 1889 and occupied an area of nearly 800 acres. This flagship university in New Mexico is located at the heart of Albuquerque near old Route 66. The University of New Mexico – Albuquerque offers more than 200-degree programs, with 96 undergraduate degrees and 27 certificate programs. An average of $6,943 financial aid is awarded yearly, with 94% of the students receiving the aid. For undergraduate admissions, the preferable SAT score is between 1030 to 1250, while the preferable ACT score is 17 to 25.The university also offers graduate programs, including doctorate studies. Available schools and colleges include the College of Fine Arts, College of Arts and Sciences, Anderson School of Management, School of Engineering, and others. Additionally, graduate programs are available in subjects like Economics, History, Earth and Planetary Sciences, Computer Science, Nutrition, Public Health, Statistics, and others. The university is selective about its admissions, and for fall 2020, the acceptance rate stands at 54%. After financial aid, the cost of studying at the University of New Mexico – Albuquerque is $11,638 per year.  Furthermore, the student-to-faculty ratio at the university is 11:1, with an average freshman retention rate of 77%. The median earning after 6 months of graduation from the University of New Mexico – Albuquerque is approximately $36,400 per annum. Additionally, about 85% of the students are employed after 2 years of graduation.
Eligibility Overview: Documents Required & EligibilityWhat are the requirements for participation?For international students, the following are the eligibility criteria and English language requirements:Undergraduate Admissions: During the application process, international students are not needed to submit SAT or ACT scores. However, if students have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 to 3.5, these examinations can aid in scholarship selection. The transcripts must include the institution's designated officials' original stamps, signatures, and seals. UNM graduates earn an average of $67,000 per year, according to PayScale.

Name: University of Maryland
Overview: The University of Maryland, situated in Central Park, Maryland, is the largest in the Washington metropolitan area. Established in 1856, the public research university has a beautiful suburban campus spreading across 1,340 acres, famous for its red-brick Georgian buildings. McKeldin Mall, the central lawn at the campus, is the largest academic mall in the United States. Having been ranked 24th among public universities, UMD has an acceptance rate of 44.2%. TOEFL/IELTS scores and GPA are to be submitted for admission.The average undergraduate tuition and fee is 36891 USD, and postgraduate programs are 19,500 USD, for which scholarships like the Banneker Scholarship are there, which can cover almost the total tuition fee. North Campus and South Campus are the two residential areas providing on-campus accommodation in fully furnished single, double, triple and quad occupancy rooms at 13,315 USD, including meal plans. The Department of Resident Life manages residential halls and offers its residents various student programs. MBA, Masters in Finance, Masters in Management, B.Sc. and Engineering are the courses with a high placement rate. Maryland offers great job opportunities with an average salary of 77,900 USD for graduates.
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility criteria are different for different courses, and the English language proficiency test requirements are common for all non-native English-speaking nations. English language proficiency requirements are:

Placement: The University Career Center and The President's Promise are eager to create recruiting plans for businesses. The University of Maryland hosts a variety of career fairs to introduce students to companies and raise their visibility on campus. There will be online career fairs for the School of Public Health Career Expo, Smith School of Business Undergraduate, Fall Career & Internship, Computer Science Career & Internship, and Language Career & Internship Fair. Students may be interviewed on-campus for full-time, part-time, or internship opportunities in suite rooms. The interview procedure occurs during the spring and fall semesters. Graduates have found employment at prestigious government, nonprofit, and international organisations like the Federal Reserve Board of Governors, the World Bank, the International Monetary Fund, and the Inter-American Development Bank, as well as in the private sector at Bates White and the Brattle Group.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation Accommodation for students with disabilities The Department of Resident Life (DRL) is dedicated to offering students with disabilities the proper housing accommodations. The University Counseling Center's Accessibility and Disability Services (ADS) office administers all requests for reasonable accommodations for people with disabilities, using university best practices for assessing and approving requests to give students a uniform quality of care. To identify the unique accommodation(s) required, students who request any disability-related housing accommodation must first register with Accessibility and Disability Services. The need for air conditioning, single room requirements, access to a private or single-use bathroom, a kitchen-equipped apartment requirement, a mobility-accessible room requirement, the need for assistance or emotional support animal, etc. are examples of housing accommodations. For more information, visit: http://reslife.umd.edu/housing/housingaccommodations/  Apartment living A fully working kitchen is provided in each flat, a furnished living/dining area, at least one bathroom, and typically four bedrooms for six students. In the Leonardtown Community, behind Fraternity Row and roughly a 10- to 12-minute walk from most classes, are garden-style apartments for about 625 students. In the South Hill Community, close to the Chapel and South Campus dining hall, there are apartments for an additional 350 students. St. Mary's Hall houses the Language House living-learning program's 100 student apartments.Apartment dwellers are not compelled to use the campus dining plan because all apartment units have kitchens. However, many apartment dwellers opt to acquire a Terrapin Express membership or an eating plan. Suite living Suites are similar to apartments. However, they don't have a kitchen or dining area. For 4–8 students, each suite contains a furnished living room, 1-3 bathrooms, and 3-5 bedrooms. The South Hill Community, close to the Chapel and South Campus dining hall, has apartments for roughly 1,000 students. Suites lack kitchens. Thus, cooking is not permitted there, and all residents are expected to participate in a dining plan that has been approved. For more information, visit: http://reslife.umd.edu/housing/aptsuites/  Graduate students Priority for housing in the residence halls owned by the institution. Undergraduates who are enrolled full-time are provided lodging in residence halls. Accommodation in residence halls is available for graduate students at the University of Maryland. The living halls do not have any amenities for postgraduate students or students' spouses, partners, or families. Graduate students have extremely little access to residence hall space. For more information, visit: http://reslife.umd.edu/housing/graduate/  Housing Options and Assistance for LGBTQ Students The Department of Resident Life is dedicated to creating a welcoming environment where everyone has a legitimate position in the community. Resident Life thus promotes each resident's academic and social achievement. Resident Life asserts that regardless of differences in identification, one's dignity and membership should be acknowledged and respected within the multicultural community of residence halls. A legitimate threat to the health and welfare of society is any deliberate attempt to suppress, undermine, or harm any individual or group. Such actions are naturally at odds with the objectives. As a result, any instances of discrimination, harassment, intimidation, abuse, assault, or verbal or written threats (direct or indirect) will be addressed immediately and taken seriously. For more information, visit: http://reslife.umd.edu/housing/lgbt/  Extended Housing Capacity in Triples and Quads There are many triple and quad rooms among the more than 4,900 student accommodations on campus. 1,201 beds (13 per cent of the total) of the 9,180 beds in 37 residence halls are in triples and quads.73 per cent of the rooms in the residence halls are doubled in that two students can share. Most upper-division students who participate in the room selection procedure take up about 14 per cent of the single rooms. For more information, visit: http://reslife.umd.edu/housing/triplequads/  For general enquiries, visit: http://reslife.umd.edu/housing/housingaccommodations/
Course Ranking: The 12 schools and colleges of Maryland University offer about 200 degree programs, 92 of which are for undergraduate students, 107 for master's students, and 83 for doctoral students. The University of Maryland's business programmes have been ranked as the best in the world by reputable ranking agencies. According to the Financial Times, its Global MBA rankings have decreased from 51 in 2016 to 73 in 2020. In a similar vein, its Master in Finance rankings from FT have fallen from 38 in 2017 to 45 in 2020. Maryland's Engineering and Technology rankings from QS have significantly improved. In 2017, it was ranked 177th, and in 2020, it was ranked 129th. Its rankings for PG Computers from THE have also declined over time, falling from 19th in 2017 to 49th in 2021. Since 2018, US News has routinely ranked its information systems MBA among the top 10 programmes. Additionally, for the past four years, US News has listed its UG Business programme as one of the top 25 programs. In addition, the faculty at the university includes Nobel Prize winners, which is a definite indication of the calibre of education provided to students.
University Ranking: The University of Maryland, the oldest university in the Washington Metropolitan Area, is located in Maryland and has been operating for more than 150 years. If we carefully examine the rankings from leading academic institutions, we can see that the majority of ranking companies have ranked Maryland below the top 100 worldwide. Universities are evaluated based on a variety of criteria, including publications, citations (a measure of the impact of their research work), academic standing, and international partnerships. Additionally, Maryland is among the top 100 universities in the world according to the ARWU (Shanghai Ranking), a ranking system that emphasises the quality of faculty and research output. The University of Maryland is moderately selective in its admissions process, with an acceptance rate of 44.2%, but applicants must also have an outstanding academic record. The esteemed Association of American Universities counts it among its members (AAU). It has been ranked lower than the top 100 educational institutions in the US by US News, which places focus on graduation and retention rates, faculty resources, and undergraduate academic reputation.

Name: Oakland University
Overview: Oakland University is a globally recognized doctoral research institution located in Auburn Hills and Rochester Hills, Michigan. Founded in 1957, Oakland University is a student-centred university with a global frame of mind. The university offers more than 130 graduate programs and 138 postgraduate certificates, including doctoral degrees. The top programs at Oakland University are B.S. in Biomedical Sciences, B.A. in Criminal Justice, M.S. in Information Technology Management, etc. The University boasts of its intensive Internship Resources and Career Services for students. With the support of their Career Services Team, the students explore unique opportunities that are a gateway to the future. The average tuition fee at Oakland University is CAD 12k. International students can apply for Oakland University Scholarships, Tuition, and Financial Aid.
Eligibility Overview: What are the requirements for participation?The following are the eligibility requirements:Admissions to undergraduate programmes require a cumulative high school grade point average of 3.2 or above. Applicants with cumulative grade point averages of less than 3.2 but greater than 2.5 may be admitted if their academic preparation is of sufficient quality. For the incoming classes of 2021, SAT or ACT scores are no longer necessary, but they may be required for future entry intakes. Students must also complete their state's graduation requirements. Students are particularly encouraged to pursue a college prepared curriculum that includes:English for four yearsThree years of mathematics, including intermediate algebra, are required.A minimum of three years of experience in the social sciences is required.A minimum of three years of experience in biological or physical sciences is required.A minimum of two years of study in a foreign language is required.Graduate Admissions: While each programme has its own set of criteria, in general, students must have earned a bachelor's degree equal to a four-year US baccalaureate degree from a government-recognized college or university. Certain programmes may demand GRE or GMAT scores.Requirements for English ProficiencyAs confirmation of English proficiency, international applicants must produce one of the following English exam scores:TOEFL (interactive) 796.5 on the IELTSAcademic PTE 53100 or higher on the Duolingo English Test

Name: INTERLINK at Seattle Pacific University
Overview: INTERLINK at Seattle Pacific University (SPU) is a small, private university in Seattle city in Washington State, U.S. Located just a few minutes north of downtown Seattle, this institute is based in a safe residential neighborhood. Ranked as the most educated city in the U.S. in 2006, Seattle is home to renowned organizations like Boeing, Amazon, Microsoft, and Starbucks. It is also popular for its shopping districts, high-tech industries, coffee shops and music scene. Owing to its excellent public transportation system, students would find it easy to get around. INTERLINK extends a rigorous course curriculum on the university campus. This covers in-class and out-of-class assignments like library research, community involvement, interviews, group discussions, presentations and writing projects. It provides intensive English as a Second Language (ESL) training, academic preparation, and cultural orientation for speakers of other languages, particularly those willing to study at an American university. The in-person and online programs at INTERLINK feature small class sizes of around 8 to 12 students in each class. The students receive these programs in 5-week sessions of 10 or 20 hours duration per week. INTERLINK programs are among the first 13 programs internationally to get accreditation from CEA. After successfully completing a program, there is no requirement of IELTS or TOEFL for university admission. It also complies with the standards for intensive English programs established by the Association of Teachers of English to Speakers of Other Languages (TESOL); English USA (Formerly American Association of Intensive English Programs (AAIEP)); NAFSA: Association of International Education. Students can also benefit from INTERLINK scholarships which are divided into several categories. Scholarships are available for alumni family members and students who have received scholarships by the affiliated institutions or partner universities of INTERLINK.
Eligibility Overview: Requirements for English Proficiency Test ScoresThe following is the minimal English proficiency test score required for general undergraduate admission to SPU:79 on the TOEFL (internet-based)550 on the TOEFL (paper-based)Overall band score of 6.5 on the IELTSAcademic PTE: 56Pre-level 1 EIKEN105 points on DuolingoCOMPLETION OF LEVEL 6 WITH FULL RECOMMENDATION FROM INTERLINK LANGUAGE CENTERIf you are a first-year applicant, please arrange for official transcripts from each high school or secondary school attended for grades 9, 10, 11, and 12 (if available), or the corresponding years in your country, to be delivered to SPU.Include grade 9, even if it was part of your country's middle school/junior high school.Please submit an official copy of your final exam certificate or diploma that demonstrates all coursework done and grades received if you have finished secondary school examinations (A levels, HKCEE, WAEC, SMA, etc.).
Placement: Placements at Seattle Pacific University Career counselling, mock interviews, network building, job search, internships, experiential learning, and other services are provided by the Center for Career and Calling to all of its students and alumni. Students can also get help with CV and resume writing, drafting cover letters, and improving bargaining abilities at the centre.

Name: Texas Wesleyan University
Overview: Texas Wesleyan University, located in Fort Worth, USA, offers undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs and online degree programmes for distance education students. The cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses.Texas Wesleyan University offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship.
Eligibility Overview: Academic RequirementsTexas Wesleyan University admits students three times a year for fall, spring, and summer sessions, and has an acceptance rate of 42%. Admission depends on the students' GPA, official transcripts, and test scores.
Placement: Approximately 86% of Texas Wesleyan University graduates believe they got their money's worth out of the degree. A graduate's median earnings two years after graduation is approximately 36,600 USD. Two years after graduation, about 90% of students get employment.

Name: Valencia College - West Campus
Overview: Valencia College is a premier institution based within the state's college system and caters to the Orange and Osceola counties in Central Florida. Valencia College West Campus is situated on a 180 acre site in West Orange County. Over 60 study programs are offered at Valencia College West Campus through its two-year Associate in Science (A.S.) and Associate in Arts (A.A.) degrees. Besides these, students can also opt for Continuing Education Programs. The Associate in Arts (A.A.) degree is curated for students planning to get transferred to a Florida public university as a junior for completing their Bachelor’s degree. It demands 60 eligible college-level credit hours that include 24 credit hours of electives and 36 credits of general education. For the Associate in Science degrees, students can choose from more than 30 degree programs. Valencia College extends financial aid assistance via several options – loans, grants, work study programs, and scholarships. The various kinds of grants, namely Pell Grant, Florida Student Assistance Grant (FSAG) and Supplemental Educational Opportunity Grant (SEOG) come with their own eligibility criteria. Subsidized Stafford Loan, Parent PLUS Loan and Unsubsidized Stafford Loan are the different kinds of loans available for eligible students. Among the scholarships, eligible students can avail the Valencia Honors Scholarship, Valencia Advantage Scholarship, Valencia Foundation Scholarships and some others. As of 2012, Valencia College featured in t Washington Monthly's list of the top 50 community colleges nationally. Students of this institute stay connected with more than 196,000 Valencia College alumni. The average entry-level salaries of Valencia College graduates for 2018-2019 ranged from $39,000 to $63,000.
Eligibility Overview: Requirements for Applications A high school diploma or a General Equivalency Diploma (GED) from the United States - Submit proof that you hold the equivalent of a high school diploma or a General Equivalency Diploma in the United States (GED).Official secondary school transcripts (academic records), graduation certificate, and/or exam results (where applicable) must be submitted in English or accompanied by a certified English translation.Submit official transcripts from all schools attended if you attended college or university. Transcripts from non-US colleges and universities must be evaluated course by course by a professional evaluation company that is a member of the National Association of Credential Evaluation Services (NACES).English Proficiency - One of the following requirements must be met to demonstrate English proficiency:Your country of origin is on the list of countries that are exempt from the English proficiency requirement.Official TOEFL score (minimum 45) given to 5869 school code.IELTS official score (minimum score 5.5)Official LOEP result (minimum score 86 – Valencia College offers it)With a grade of C or better, you must pass English Composition or its equivalent (as assessed by Valencia).SAT minimum Writing and Language score of 25 and SAT minimum Reading score of 24 | ACT minimum English score of 17 and Reading score of 19Duolingo English Test (minimum score 75)* is only used for admission and not for placement.Proof of Finances - For an associate degree, you must provide proof of finances (minimum $23,338) in the form of an associated bank statement in English or a certified English translation. You have the option of having up to three sponsors. More information can be found on the page Tuition Costs.Passport - A copy of a valid passport is required.SEVIS Transfer Eligibility, copy of visa, copy of I-94 card, and copies of previous I-20s are required only for F-1 Transfer Students.

Name: SUNY Buffalo State
Overview: SUNY Buffalo State, located in Buffalo, USA, was established in 1871. It provides 64 graduate programmes, 11 postbaccalaureate teacher certification programmes, 79 undergraduate programmes, 11 honours choices, and various minors and certificates.The Buffalo State Alumni Association cultivates and maintains its connections with the school's former students. Among the well-known individuals connected to this college are the artists Julia Bottoms-Douglas, BuomKuoth Thot, Megan Sweeney, and Scott Hamula.The average tuition fee to pursue graduate courses for international students is $36,200. SUNY Buffalo State offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Read more details about SUNY Buffalo State on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.
Eligibility Overview: Admission Requirements International English Language Testing System (IELTS): The University demands a minimum band score of 5.5 on the IELTS exam.International Test of English Proficiency (iTEP): The University requires an iTEP Academic score of 3.5.A minimum score of 61 iBT on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) is required (Internet-based test). Please use their code 2533 while completing the TOEFL registration papers to have your official TOEFL score forwarded to Buffalo State. Test your English skills with Duolingo. They require a score of 90 on the Duolingo English Test.Academic PTE (Pearson Test of English). A PTE Academic score of 44 is required.

Name: Chemeketa Community College - Yamhill Valley
Overview: Chemeketa Community College at Yamhill Valley is a public community college. The full, state-of-the-art campus in McMinnville of Chemeketa College serves the whole of Yamhill county. The college comprises a remote learning hub, virtual learning center and student resources based on the campus and community. The college provides degrees and certificates in 15 diverse fields. The major programs include General Studies and Humanities, Health Professions and Related Programs, Liberal Arts and Sciences, and Business, Management, Marketing and Related Support Services. The highest degree the college offers is an associate degree. The college executes its educational curriculum in a quarter based academic year. It has an open admissions policy and offers credit for life experiences. The Chemeketa Community College Yamhill Valley maintains a student to faculty ratio of 22:1. The campus provides several academic and non-academic facilities and services to improve the students’ educational experience. It provides distance education, a library, on-campus accommodation and grants to its students. The college also provides the students academic and career counselling services and service opportunities. Chemeketa Community College offers programs in all modes of education that are full-time, part-time and online. The overall student retention rate for full-time is 64%. The part-time retention rate is 43%. The college generates a graduation rate of 15%. The college offers GED and ESOL classes along with Test Proctoring Services. Some of the other services offered to students are academic advising, counseling support services, student accessibility centres, and electric vehicle charging stations. The Chemeketa Community College Yamhill Valley also focuses on developing the capability to pursue the students' desired occupation through an exceptional learning experience and providing comprehensive knowledge of subjects leading to diverse areas of study.
Eligibility Overview: Language RequirementsAdmissions do not require TOEFL or IELTS results.Chemeketa University provides comprehensive language and college-level studies to students of all levels.Test scores are solely utilised for advising placement purposes after they are submitted throughout the admissions process.During orientation, all Chemeketa students will take compulsory English and/or college placement tests.
Placement: Nil
Accommodation: Housing As a new Chemeketa International Student, you must decide where you will live. To help you with this, we've put up a list of options that will help you find a safe and comfortable place to stay.HomestayFor your first term as an international student, we strongly suggest homestay. It is one of the most efficient methods for improving your English language skills. You will have a family to talk to as well as assistance in getting to know the area. Our host families are located throughout the Salem-Keizer area and all reside near a bus stop, ensuring that you have convenient access to the campus.

Name: Johnson and Wales University
Overview: Situated in Rhode Island, the Johnson and Wales University is a private university. It has a student strength of more than 13000 students among various campuses pursuing graduate, undergraduate, and Ph.D. Degrees. The Johnson and Wales University was initially established by Mary T. Wales and Gertrude I. Johnson in 1914. More than 95% of students are provided with scholarships and financial aid. The university has over 15 scholarship programs for undergraduate students. It is provided based on SAT score, rank, and academic performance. It offers various study programs for the students on Communication, Accounting, Business Management, Biology, Criminal Justice, etc. It is accredited with the New England Commission of Higher Education's. The annual cost of the tuition fee can reach up to 37,736 USD for studying at the Johnson Wales University. The campus is situated in an urban area that has all the modern facilities and refreshments for the students. It covers around 126 acres with several academic and residential buildings. It also has more than 100 student clubs where students can take part in various activities and refresh themselves. The main attraction is that it has the first culinary lab that is certified by LEED in the US. It provides a comfortable and world-class on-campus facility to the students. It is estimated that half of the population stays in the hostel accommodation of the university. Every residential building is equipped with all the necessary amenities and refreshment centers. Culinary Arts, Hospitality Management, Food Safety, Global Tourism, Marketing Management are some exclusive programs offered by John and Wales University. Thus, the average cost of living with the tuition fee, hostel fee, and miscellaneous charges can be around 56,000 USD per annum. Multinational companies such as Disney, Compass Group, Hilton, Google, Hyatt, and others offer internships to students after graduation.
Eligibility Overview: Applicants who are neither citizens or permanent residents of the United States (carrying a "green card" or permanent resident card) must meet the same admissions requirements as all other applicants, plus some additional documents.The following documents must be submitted by international applicants:ApplicationAn international application that is correct, comprehensive, and legible must be submitted. All schools attended, along with dates of attendance, must be provided.TranscriptsOfficial secondary school transcript including graduation date and topics and grades received. If relevant, diplomas and other external examination results should be presented. Students who have not yet completed secondary school must present a transcript containing all completed work, as well as projected results and graduation date.All non-English documents must be accompanied by certified word-for-word translations.Transcripts, mark sheets, diplomas, or certificates from all post-secondary schools attended, as well as course descriptions and credit values, must be submitted for transfer evaluation by applicants who have attended any college or university.Proficiency in EnglishThe results of the English Language Proficiency test (if applicable or available, please see the English Proficiency Requirements).To be reviewed, all English Proficiency documents must be uploaded to the student's applicant portal.Processing of I-20The application portal was used to submit the reservation deposit.a copy of the applicant's current passport's biographical sectionFinancial support for one academic year, as evidenced by a certified bank statement or a government sponsorship letter. Bank statements must be no more than three months old when they are issued.Both the applicant and the sponsor must sign a financial declaration.If the student is currently studying in the United States on an F-1 visa, a transfer verification form is required. As needed, this form will be distributed to pupils.To be reviewed, all I-20 paperwork should be uploaded to the student's applicant portal.All documents and information should be clear and legible; if the International Admissions team cannot see critical material, the admissions process will be delayed.

Name: Institute of Health and Nursing Australia (IHNA) - Melbourne (CBD)
Overview: Institute of Health and Nursing Australia (IHNA) provides training and education which aims at advancing the career of those in the healthcare sector. It has 4 campuses, 3 in the biggest cities of Australia, Melbourne, Sydney and Perth and one of its campuses is in Cochin, India. IHNA was founded in 2007 to provide training in specific medical fields, and it has a faculty of 250+ highly trained medical staff. The Melbourne (CBD) campus is located in the heart of the Central Business District and is close to the Yarra River. Students at this campus have easy access to travel around Australia’s second-largest city. They are surrounded by many tourist attractions like Great Ocean Road, Yarra Valley, Melbourne Zoo, Crown Casino, etc. The Melbourne Airport is just a 25-minute drive away. Institute of Health and Nursing Australia (IHNA) has trained over 14,000 students. It has five schools, each specializing in different fields of nursing, health, and community services. There is School of Management, School of Community Services, School of Education, School of Allied Health and School of Nursing. IHNA is renowned for its laboratories and facilities, which allow students to gain hands-on, real-world experience and have career-focused learning. Institute of Health and Nursing Australia (IHNA) has gained international recognition and has received multiple awards. The institute was the finalist at the Victorian Training Award 2016; it won the McMillan Woods Global Award 2018 in "Nursing & Healthcare Training Excellence" and the Victorian International Education Award 2016. Recognizing the financial needs of students and continuing its promise to enhance the healthcare industry, IHNA came up with the 50 over 50 initiative, which allows students to pursue any course at 50% of the tuition fee.

Name: Western Carolina University
Overview: Western Carolina University, a public university in Cullowhee, North Carolina, was established in 1889. Working as part of the University of North Carolina System, it is the fifth oldest institution among the other sixteen universities. The university remains invested in creating learning opportunities while promoting the importance of community, knowledge, and collaboration. It aims to ensure the future of its students as compassionate and responsible world citizens with the potential to lead.With an acceptance rate of 69%, the university has established itself as a popular and anticipated choice for higher education. It offers over 120 undergraduate, 40 postgraduate, and various other certificate degree programs in diverse areas of study. Some of the university's famous and highly ranked courses are the literature, business, chemistry, engineering, criminal justice, and forensic science programs. Hosting an inclusive, sustainable, and vibrant academic environment with an equal focus on extracurricular activities, the university serves as a house for thousands of students from different parts of the world.Spread across two campuses and 589 acres of land, the university remains equipped with libraries, residence halls, research facilities, auditoriums, laboratories, organizations, counselling centres, recreation halls, and athletic centres. A brilliant alumni network also ensures a reasonable placement rate for the graduating batch. The average annual tuition and accommodation fee can come to around $ 19,000, but through many of the scholarships and grants provided by the college, the cost can be brought down to $ 15,000.

Name: Chemeketa Community College - Salem
Overview: Chemeketa Community College-Salem is a public institution that offers a broad range of courses and programs, including workforce training. Established in the 1960s, the institution is accredited by the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities. To provide quality education, it has appointed veteran faculty members who take care of popular courses like liberal arts and sciences, nursing, etc. The student-to-faculty ratio is 22:1, and the college serves over 7,000 FTE students yearly. Chemeketa Community College secured the 3rd position in the Best Associate Degree Schools in Oregon Rankings. With a 100% acceptance rate, it follows an open admissions policy, where the SAT or ACT score is not required. Besides quality education, it also ensures a good campus experience with library facilities, remedial services, career counselling services, etc. There are several college transfer courses and more than 70 technical-vocational fields and transfer programs for international students from over 30 different countries. One may enroll in English language classes offered at five proficiency levels, from beginners to advanced. It has an open-door admission policy; students get around $1,200 as a scholarship award from the Chemeketa Foundation. Chemeketa Community College's Salem campus also provides the facility of choosing online classes to avoid inconvenience. The out-of-state tuition fees are approximately $35,150; however, to meet such educational costs, including other expenses, nearly 86% of the students receive financial aid each year. Apart from that, optional practical training, accommodations, internship participation, a conditional offer letter, etc., are valuable facilities one can get after completing the courses here. International students also benefit from facilities like healthcare resource assistance, monthly cultural excursions to Oregon locations, volunteer opportunities, leadership and training opportunities, etc.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for the award, you must have a minimum 3.50 GPA. There will be no exceptions to this rule, and there will be no appeals for decisions regarding ineligibility based on grade point average.Admissions do not require TOEFL or IELTS results.Chemeketa University provides comprehensive language and college-level studies to students of all levels.Test scores are solely utilised for advising placement purposes after they are submitted throughout the admissions process.During orientation, all Chemeketa students will take compulsory English and/or college placement tests.
Accommodation: As a new Chemeketa International Student, you must decide where you will live. To help you with this, we've put up a list of options that will help you find a safe and comfortable place to stay.HomestayFor your first term as an international student, we strongly suggest homestay. It is one of the most efficient methods for improving your English language skills. You will have a family to talk to as well as assistance in getting to know the area. Our host families are located throughout the Salem-Keizer area and all reside near a bus stop, ensuring that you have convenient access to the campus. You should apply for homestay as soon as possible because we only have a limited number of families available and cannot promise that you will be placed with a homestay family. Students will get homestay forms through email once they have finished their application.

Name: Brandeis University
Overview: Brandeis University is a private research institution established in 1948. The university primarily focuses on liberal arts and is located west of Boston, at Waltham, Massachusetts. The college has five campuses that give various courses at undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral levels. The campus consists of 100 academic and residential buildings spread across 235 acres. The University labs and research facilities enable the scholars to build sustainable communication, creativity, collaboration, and critical thinking. The School of Arts and Science offers 43 majors and 47 minors in an undergraduate course, 40 masters, and 17 doctoral programs in graduate courses in science, social sciences, interdisciplinary Ph.D. programs, humanities, and creative arts. Brandeis International Business School provides undergraduate programs in anthropology, American studies, and classical Studies. It offers graduate programs in MBA, MSF, MA, and MSBA. The known international course offered is master of business & administration and master of science in finance. The campus has educational essentials like library facilities for study and research materials. Well-being and health associations provide awareness of mental health, physical fitness, and counseling services. The university has more than 200 student clubs and organizations as well as service facilities, cultural awareness teams, performing groups, games clubs, student leadership & activism groups, student publications, and radio stations. The hostel and meal expenses amount to USD 16,000. And the per-year tuition fee is around USD 57,360. The university offers on-campus and off-campus housing facilities, including 19 residential halls, apartments, and suites. The on-campus conveniences incorporate internet services, laundry, and many more. The university additionally organizes multiple career and industry fairs like technology and innovation career fair, government and public services fair, business, consulting, and finance career fair for internship and placement purposes. Brandeis University offers merit scholarships and need-based grants for international students to study in the USA.
Eligibility Overview: Above all, the admissions officers looking over your transcripts will be looking for evidence that you've taken on new challenges. You must be engaged in a college preparatory course of study or an equivalent homeschool environment to be considered for first-year admission.At the very least, this should include:English has been studied for four years.Mathematics for three years.Three years of laboratory science training.Social sciences for three years.Studying a foreign language for two to three years is recommended (s).When honours, advanced placement, or international baccalaureate-level curriculum was available at their school, the majority of applicants took it. Although there is no minimum GPA requirement for admission to Brandeis, more than three-quarters of those who are accepted graduate in the top 20% of their high school class.
Accommodation: The Disability Accommodations Committee for Housing, a collaboration between Student Accessibility Support and Community Living, oversees the process of requesting and obtaining disability accommodations in campus housing.Students who qualify under the Americans with Disabilities Act, the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, and the Fair Housing Act get support services and reasonable accommodations. Every year, all requests for accommodations must be submitted and granted.Both needed forms must be submitted by March 11, 2022 for Fall 2022 accommodation requests for currently enrolled students. Late requests will be delayed in processing. After matriculation, incoming first-year and transfer students will receive information and deadlines.for more information click on this link-https://www.brandeis.edu/dcl/accommodations/index.html

Name: Yale University
Overview: Yale University is the third-oldest institution of higher education in the USA. It was founded as a collegiate school near Saybrook, Connecticut, in 1701. It is a Colonial College leased before the American Revolution. Yale was relocated to New Haven, Connecticut, in 1716. It was officially renamed Yale College in 1718. In 1861, Yale became the first university in the USA to award a Doctor of Philosophy.Yale University is a part of the Ivy League of 8 American colleges and universities. Yale University is home to about 5,200 undergraduates, of which 10% are international.The university consists of fourteen constituent schools, including the Undergraduate Liberal Arts College, the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences, and Professional Schools. It offers Undergraduate, Graduate, and Professional courses across various fields. More than 50 Bachelor's Degree and Certificate Programs are offered at Yale. The university also offers online learning and non-degree courses, along with Study Abroad and University Exchange programs for deserving candidates. Indra Nooyi, Hillary Clinton, George H.W. Bush, and Alexei Navalny are a few notable alumni of Yale. The placements are from industry sectors like Consulting, Investment Banking, Private Equity, Venture Capital, Government, E-Commerce, Media/Entertainment, and the list goes on. Yale's most prominent feature is that it offers financial aid awards to fulfill 100% of explained financial needs without any loans. Statistics on the university's website show that in the class of 2023 first-year students, 100% of students whose annual family income was less than $65000 qualified for financial assistance.
Eligibility Overview: To enroll at Yale University, candidates must achieve test scores ranging between 25th to 75th percentiles in the following exams: SAT Reading & Writing Test: 720 - 780SAT Mathematics Test: 740 - 800ACT Composite: 33-35 Although there are no set score cut-offs, the university prefers academic performance over standardized testing. A strong performance in a demanding college preparatory program may compensate for low standardized test scores. Still, high test scores are also unlikely to persuade the admissions committee to overlook an unremarkable secondary-school record.English Proficiency Test Scores Yale firmly instructs those non-native English speakers who have not taken at least two years of secondary education where English is the medium of instruction to take any of the proficiency tests listed below. TOEFL - 100 on the internet-based and 25 on each of the 3 divisions of the paper-and-pencil TOEFL Paper-delivered TestIELTS - scores of 7 or higherPTE - scores of 70 or higherDET - scores of at the minimum 120 or higher
Placement: Yale University organizes placement exams to ensure students are at the appropriate level for their respective courses. Approximately 75% of Yale University graduates are employed in full-time, part-time, or temporary positions earning an average starting salary of about $76,359. Students interested in exploring potential career paths can apply for an internship at Yale and later participate in placement and career fairs. In terms of placements, MBA, English, management, history, economics, and law programs, are among the most successful. Yale University offers students with placements in reputed organizations. Here is a concise list of some of the companies :  The salaries for a few other different roles are as given below. Course Ranking: Yale places a priority on providing students with high-quality education, pays particular emphasis to undergraduate education, and mandates that all of its professors teach at least one undergraduate course each year. People who want to go to college should think about Yale University. The theatrical, art, and music programmes are well-known. With a 99% freshman retention rate, Yale has a very high level of student satisfaction.Social sciences, history, mathematics and statistics, as well as biological and biomedical sciences, are a few of the well-liked majors Yale offers. Yale's business courses have been ranked in the top 20 by Bloomberg, QS, and US News & World Report, but its engineering programmes have been ranked below the top 20. In contrast to its engineering programmes, Yale is therefore more well-known for its MBA and other business schools.
University Ranking: The first university in the USA to grant Doctor of Philosophy degrees is the 300-year-old Yale University. For the past five years, Yale has consistently been rated as one of the top 5 universities. In the previous five years, the Ivy League University has not been ranked among the top 10 institutions by prestigious ranking companies QS and Shanghai. Yale is a good choice for those who value the university's reputation for research. Yale is ranked fourth in the 2021 US News & World Report rankings, which heavily emphasise the significance of the university's research output. Since its overall influence has been acknowledged by professionals, Yale's research is valued for many reasons than merely its high calibre.Yale behind other Ivy League universities in terms of reputation, including Harvard and MIT, which have consistently been included among the top 5 universities in the world by reputable ranking agency QS. Yale has consistently fallen in QS's rankings of the top universities over the past five years, landing at 15th or below. Conversely, Times Higher Education has continuously raised Yale's position in the list of top universities. This shows that Yale's teaching standards have improved.

Name: Sterling College
Overview: Founded in 2001, Sterling College is a private college in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. Initially, it was known as Stewart College, which focused on providing ESL training for international and domestic candidates to furnish their English skills. But in 2016, the institution transformed itself and became a part of Canadian Tourism College. Courses at Sterling College are offered from a variety of departments like Writing and Editing, Sports Management, Theatre Arts, Mathematics, Psychology, Music, Health Science, History, Independent Interdisciplinary, Health and Human Performance, English, Communication and Media Arts, Education, Criminal Justice, Business Administration, Christian Thoughts, Chemistry, Christian Missionaries, Interdisciplinary Studies, Biology, Biblical Studies, and Art and Design. Sterling College also provides two master’s programs, which are M.S. in Athletic Training, and M.A. in Sports Ministry. The average tuition fee per year is CAD 17,785, whereas the cost of living is CAD 12,960. In 2021, for M.S. in Athletic Training, the tuition is $495 per credit hour, and for M.A. in Sports Ministry, the tuition is $400 per credit hour. Sterling College offers financial aid for its students through scholarships, grants, employment and loans. At Sterling, 100% of full-time campus students receive a Sterling College Scholarship through any one route between Academics, Arts, and Athletics. The respective coaches determine the Sterling College Athletic Scholarship awardees based on students’ potential, background, and talent, along with their academic record. Apart from these, 100% of the full-time students at Sterling College are offered an institutional scholarship. Additional scholarships include Knight Family Scholarship, Park Presbyterian Grant, Evelyn Phinney Make a Difference Scholarship, John Knox Presbyterian Church Endowed Scholarship, and others. As Sterling College is a part of the Council for Christian Colleges and Universities, it offers numerous travel opportunities for its students to Russia, Oxford, Latin America, Australia and other parts of the globe. It is also a wireless campus, thus providing internet facilities all over the campus.

Name: Arcadia University
Overview: Beaver College, a private university in Glenside, Pennsylvania, became Arcadia University in 1853. The main suburban campus spreads over 76 acres, and admissions here are moderately selective, with an acceptance rate of 74%. Arcadia is regarded as the "Best in the Northeast" by the Princeton Review. College of Global Studies, College of Arts and Sciences, School of Education, College of Health Sciences, and the School of Global Business offer 35 undergraduate, 15 postgraduate, and ten doctoral programs in 65 diverse areas of study. The College of Global Studies offers 130 programs from 15 countries, and Arcadia also has administrative centres in 8 countries. For admission into the Fall and Spring semesters, applications are accepted on a rolling basis using the Arcadia Application portal or Common Application. Academic transcripts, LORs, essays, CVs, and scores of TOEFL, SAT, ACT, GMAT, GRE, etc., should also be submitted with an application fee of 30 USD. With a high graduation rate, the average salary of graduates is 66,053 USD.On-campus accommodation in four residential halls with fully furnished rooms, lounges, dressers, complimentary laundry services, and social spaces is provided. Apartment-style housing options are available through the Oak Summit Apartments, and the campus is equipped with dining options, shops, the Benton Spruance Art Center, and the Boyer Hall of Science. The average undergraduate tuition fee is 43,740 USD and is program-dependent for postgraduate courses. Need-based and merit-based scholarships like Campus Achievement Award and Arcadia University Distinguished Scholarship worth 31,065 USD on average are awarded.

Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation Arcadia University provides full-time accommodation for all of its undergraduate students, and there are currently more than 1,200 students living in the university's resident halls. Anyone is not required to reside on campus, though.  Even while resident halls allow for the possibility of living alone, many students share a place with four or five other people. In addition, every floor or wing of housing in Arcadia is coed. A coed-by-floor living arrangement is also available in several resident halls. Coed room, suite, or apartment placement will only be done upon request. Kistler, Dilworth, Heinz Halls: Traditional first-year students are housed in these living halls. The only residence hall exclusively for first-year students is The CastleGrey Tower Castle: In wings, rooms with 2 to 7 students each accommodate men and women. In each wing, there are shared restrooms. There is a washing facility and a microwave in the communal sitting areaKnight Hall: Both new students and returning students can live there in suite-style dorms. Each suite may accommodate 5-8 upper-class students. A huge closet, a communal area with furniture for relaxing, and a bathroom are shared by each apartment On-campus housing link

Name: Western Michigan University
Overview: A public research university in Kalamazoo, Michigan, the Western Michigan University was established in 1903. The university spreads into five beautiful campuses all located in and around Kalamazoo. Committed to the idea of passion and research, the university aims to translate wisdom into actions through its students who are trained to become innovative, intellectual and global leaders. It is organized into nine college Neon Colleges of Arts and Sciences, College of Aviation, Haworth College of Business, College of Education and Human Development, College of Engineering and Applied Sciences, College of Fine Arts, College of Health and Human Services, Lee Honors College, Graduate College, Thomas M. Cooley Law School, and the Homer Stryker M.D. School of Medicine. By maintaining a promising student teacher ratio of 16:1, the university extends some pertinent departments with world class resources. It offers over 150 undergraduate, 73 postgraduate and 30 doctorate degrees. Some of the popular and highly ranked courses offered at the university belong from the Aviation, Theatre, Art History, Cybersecurity, English, and Music programs. The university becomes an accessible and popular educational institute with an acceptance rate of 80%. The average annual tuition and accommodation fee can come around $ 32K but through many of the scholarships and grants provided by the university as financial aids, the cost can be brought down to around $ 23K. Spread across 1,200 acres of land, the five campuses of the university promise a vibrant and inclusive campus life as it serves as a house for students hailing from different parts of the world. It remains equipped with most of the essential resources for academic and cultural development including libraries, residence halls, cultural halls and athletic centres. With a productive alumni network of notable alumni, the university ensures a 93% placement rate for its graduating batch.
Eligibility Overview: The most crucial piece of information is your transcript. It details the courses you've attended as well as your grades, allowing us to assess:Preparation for school. We want to make sure you're ready for the demands of college-level work by making sure you're prepared. We suggest*:- four years of English - three to four years of math (through second year algebra or pre-calculus)- Natural science courses for three years (two or more with a lab component)- A minimum of two years of study in the same foreign languageGPA stands for Grade Point Average.Grading Pattern. What grades you received in your most recent classesStudents whose high school does not submit official transcripts for an entrance determination might scan and submit unofficial transcripts. Financial aid will not be issued without official final high school transcripts (federal rules), and/or a spring registration hold will be put on the student's account.WMU superscores ACT or SAT scores, and the testing information you give in your application will be included in our decision-making process. Western Michigan University announced a test-optional policy for students in 2020, which applies to both admission and scholarship consideration by the Office of Admissions."Test optional" means that students can report/submit their ACT or SAT test scores if they want to, but it is not necessary. If a student wants their test score to be used in the admissions process, they can self-report their results on the application. Following that, these kids would adhere to our testing guidelines.

Before this, the course ranked 195 for 2020 and 199 for 2018 and 2019.Candidates should be aware that while THE - Times Higher Education's subject rankings consider all aspects of the course, including the curriculum and job prospects after graduation, US News & World Report's subject rankings also consider student selection (25%), the opinions of business school leaders (25%), and employment outcome (21%) among other factors. The PG Engineering and Technology course will be ranked between 401 and 500 by THE (Times Higher Education) by 2021. Additionally, PG Civil Engineering (137), PG Electrical Engineering (178), and PG Mechanical Engineering (160) have received rankings from US News & World Report for 2021. The PG Computer Engineering course is ranked 146 for 2021 by US News & World Report.
