Name: Southeast Missouri State University
Overview: The Missouri State University, founded in 1873, is a public institution in Cape Girardeau, Missouri, USA. Missouri focuses on providing top-notch education while utilizing technology, new teaching methods, and other innovations. The university offers over 200 programs, including over 75 graduate, 145 undergraduate majors, and 100 minor programs. The institution's cybersecurity staff has excellent relationships with the industry that help it ward off cyberattacks. Additionally, it collaborates with Apple to offer K–12 education using the most up-to-date technological approaches. The institution offers popular majors: business, biology, liberal arts, and humanities. Additionally, the River Campus focuses on dance, music, visual arts, and theatre.The 400-acre university is located in an urban area. Southeast has about 12,000 students, making it a mid-sized institution. Both academic and extracurricular possibilities are provided. In addition, almost all majors offer students experiential learning opportunities and internships. Students can also take advantage of the possibility to study abroad for two weeks to a year in other nations.Southeast Missouri State University's noteworthy alums are Steven Tilley, Joe Tuineau, Peter Kinder, Linda Godwin, a NASA astronaut, Neal E. Boyd, the 2008 America's Got Talent champion, and Antonius Cleveland.The NCAA Division I has included Southeast Missouri State. Cross-country, football, basketball, and baseball are among the male-dominated sports. Soccer, tennis, basketball, cross country, gymnastics, softball, track (indoor/outdoor), and volleyball are among the sports that are popular with women.

Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation Students have access to both on-campus and off-campus residence living. Residence halls Towers East and Towers South. All Southeast Missouri State University full-time students are required by the Board of Regents to reside on campus for the duration of their two academic years. There are several exemptions offered. The university offers its students ten dining halls and ten housing halls. Towers East, Towers North, Towers West, Towers South, Vandiver, and LaFerla are a few of the residence halls on the list. Merick Hall includes double occupancy suite-style rooms that are joined by a common entryway and bathroom. There are also other little living rooms scattered throughout the structure, along with a sizable game, laundry, and fireplace room. 4 four-person suites and a few triple rooms are available at Myers, and each has an attached bathroom. The sitting space, kitchenette, and laundry facility must be shared by the students. All of the residence halls allow pets. Name: Mount Mary University
Overview: Mount Mary University is a university located in Milwaukee, USA. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Science. The cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses.  The university has 1,200 total students, 639 undergraduate and 561 graduate students.Mount Mary University offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. The majority of the graduates are placed within 6 months of graduation. Name: Pratt Institute
Overview: The Pratt Institute, founded in 1887, is a private university located in New York and serves as a center for arts, culture, business, and design studies. The institute has been accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education and is affiliated with the American Collegiate Athletic Association and the Hudson Valley Intercollegiate Athletic Conference.Some of the popular courses offered by the institute include AAS in Building and Construction, AOS in Illustration, BFA in Writing and Photography, BFA in Game Arts, PLAB in Poetics Lab, etc.The institute ranked 227 in the TIMES Higher Education University Ranking 2021 and has an alumni base of around 62,000 graduates residing in over 83 countries. International students can also avail themselves of scholarships funded by the institute.The acceptance rate is about 56%, and the maximum tuition fee for students is around CAD 46,000. The campus offers several facilities, such as the Library Rose Garden, Newman Mall, Canon Court, and the Engineering Quadrangle. It also has six residential houses, with student lounges and fitness centers that house 1600 students.
Eligibility Overview: Candidates must submit proof of the following eligibility requirements: Students should submit the results of the Scholastic Aptitude Test (SAT 1) or the American College Testing Program if they have taken a test or tests (ACT). The essay section of the SAT is optional. The ACT writing test is optional. Pratt accepts the TOEFLWhether or not you take the SAT or ACT has no bearing on your admissions chances. English Language Proficiency  TOEFL, TOEFL Home Edition, TOEFL ITP Plus, PTE, IELTS, IELTS Indicator, or Duolingo are required for all overseas candidates and students for whom English is a second language. Below is a list of minimum requirements accepted at Pratt.If students prefer, they can submit their SAT or ACT scores instead of one of the language examinations indicated above (no minimum score requirement). International students with English as their first language can take the SAT or ACT, as well as the TOEFL, TOEFL Home Edition, TOEFL ITP Plus (Mainland China students), IELTS, Duolingo, or PTE. Please have the testing company send official results and familiarise yourself with the international criteria.

Name: Fairfield University
Overview: Fairfield University is a private-run Catholic university situated in Fairfield, Connecticut. Fairfield is located in Fairfield County of the United States. It is considered one of the best places to live in the US with a population of 62,105. More than 5000 students enroll for admission every year. It offers various study programs for bachelor's, master's, and doctoral degrees. The population of international students is around 5%. Fairfield University was established in 1942 by the "Jesuits." Currently, it is run by "The Society of Jesus." It controls about five colleges and schools called the Charles F. Dolan School of Business, Mariam Peckham Egan School of Nursing and Health Studies, Fairfield School of Arts and Sciences, Graduate School of Education and Allied Professions, and the School of Engineering. Renowned subjects offered by Fairfield University are Psychology, Accounting, English, Communication, Finance, Nursing, Biology, and Marketing. The university has spread across 200 acres which is near New York City. Hence, it has several facilities such as theatres, shopping malls, and restaurants nearby. More than 100 student clubs are present for the students. It also offers world-class hostel facilities with shared rooms and residential halls with all the basic amenities. Hence, the average cost of studying is 60,000 USD per annum. Fairfield University also offers work on campus and other part-time job options for the students. It has a separate career centre to prepare and groom students to crack job interviews and other skills. Also, it offers career workshops to provide internship and training to the students. Ralph Lauren, NBC, NFL, Disney arrive for campus placements to the students. The average salary of the graduates of Fairfield University is 58000 USD.
Eligibility Overview: Fairfield University admissions is more selective, with a 56 percent acceptance rate and a 57.9% early acceptance rate. Half of Fairfield University's admitted students had a SAT score of 1190 to 1340 or an ACT score of 27 to 30.Fairfield University does not have an absolute SAT requirement, however they do want to see at least a 1190 to be considered.
Accommodation: Fairfield University is a residential institution with roughly 3,000 full-time undergraduate students living in residence halls, townhouses, and apartment complexes on campus.Fairfield University is a residential campus, thus life in the halls, townhouses, and flats is an important aspect of the undergraduate experience. Resident assistants and area coordinators sponsor programmes and activities specific to a hall or residence area, or in collaboration with other offices and departments, to provide students with a variety of educational, social, cultural, service, and spiritual programmes and activities for personal growth, development, and fun. Game nights and movie nights, mentoring sessions and getaways, professional development workshops and guest lecturers, and community athletic game fundraisers are just a few of the programmes available.for more information click on this link-https://www.fairfield.edu/undergraduate/student-life-and-services/student-services/residence-life/index.html

Eligibility Overview: Admissions for International FreshmenYou fall into this category if you are not actively studying in the United States or if you do not have a permanent resident or citizen status in the United States. This is true for the majority of international students applying from outside the United States. This would imply that you would have to complete your full application online and mail or electronically submit your documents to us. Applicants must show that they have completed their secondary education (typically 12 years) in their native country and are eligible to attend institutions in their home countries. Because of the vast disparities in educational systems among countries, entrance standards varies based on the applicant's home country. You'd also have to finish your visa application in your home nation. It will appear difficult at first, but we will assist you throughout the application process.Applicants must have a cumulative grade point average (GPA) of 2.0 (out of 4.0) or better to be considered for admission. Applicants who have completed fewer than 24 credits must also submit official secondary transcripts.

Name: Auburn University
Overview: Established in 1856, Auburn University is a public research university located in Auburn, Alabama, United States of America, and is spread across 1841 acres of land. The university offers 140 courses and 40 majors in 13 colleges and schools. Every year around 30,440 students are enrolled for undergraduate, postgraduate, and professional courses. The institution follows the semester system as an academic calendar. The university offers courses in the fields of agriculture, architecture & design, business, engineering, forestry & wildlife, human sciences, liberal arts, nursing, pharmacy, sciences, veterinary medicine. Top programs offered by the university M.Sc. in computer science and software engineering, M.B.A, M.Sc. in biosystem engineering, and B.Sc. in computer engineering. The Office of University Scholarships awards a variety of scholarships to potential students once a year and to international students. Every year about 60% of freshmen are provided with scholarships by the university. The total tuition is around USD 30,524. The university is ranked one of the best places to live for students and around 300 organizations on campus. The total cost of living is around USD 15,000. The Auburn University additionally provides opportunities in sports and athletes divisions in basketball, volleyball, soccer, and many more for both men and women category. The university has 32 residence halls with around 4800 residents who reside on-campus with study lounges, meeting rooms, and laundry rooms. The sports team at Auburn University is part of the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics (NAIA). The college encourages active student involvement through 70 clubs and organizations incorporating Greek life and student government.
Eligibility Overview: In all majors, admission to Auburn is competitive and very selective. International applicants, like all other students, must have a strong academic record in order to be evaluated for admission.Requirements for UndergraduatesAll international freshmen and freshmen transfer applicants with less than 30 semester credit hours must take the ACT or SAT. Applicants must also pass the following core curricular requirements by the conclusion of their final year of high school:English (four years)Social sciences (three years)Algebra I and II, as well as Geometry, Trigonometry, Calculus, or Analysis are required (three years)Biology and Physical Sciences with a Laboratory Component are included under Science (two years)Requirements for PGA bachelor's degree (or its equivalent) from an authorised college or university is required.GRE (optional)Management, Finance, Master of Business Administration, and Master of Accountancy degrees all require the GMAT.Requirements for English ProficiencyTOEFL (interactive) 79213 TOEFL (CBT)550 TOEFL (PBT)PTE 536.5 or higher on the IELTS
Placement: You can confidently look forward to your future with a PhD in Business, Management from the Harbert College of Business. Our goal is to place students at peer or aspirational schools, and we've succeeded: our graduates have gone on to become professors at top universities around the country. Check out where they went:For More:https://harbert.auburn.edu/degrees-programs/doctoral/phd-business-management/placements.html

Course Ranking: Auburn has majors and degree programmes at the undergraduate and graduate levels in a number of different fields. Auburn University's business programmes are well-liked by the companies that issue rankings. Bloomberg listed it among the 100 best b - schools in the US for both 2018 and 2019. In a similar vein, it is among the top 100 undergraduate and graduate business programmes in the US according to US News & World Report. Numerous engineering programmes provided by the institution have been listed by US News & World Report among the top 100 in the country for 2021. The PG Engineering and Technology ranking of Auburn has significantly increased. In 2020, it was listed between 401 and 500, but in 2021, it was moved to 301 to 400. Additionally, US News has ranked Auburn's Computer Engineering programme at 69th place for 2021.
University Ranking: Alabama, in the United States, is home to Auburn, a public research institution. It is the second-largest university in Alabama and one of the two publicly funded flagship institutions for the state. It has continually kept its position as one of the top ranked services. Between 2017 and 2020, Auburn was ranked by ARWU (Shanghai Ranking) between 501 and 600, and by THE (Times Higher Education) between 601 and 800. In the QS World University Ranking, Auburn dropped from position 701-750 in 2017 to position 801-1000 in 2018. It has been ranked by QS between 801 and 1000 since this year. As a result, the university has mostly maintained consistency across all rating criteria, including teaching, research, and global perspective. Looking at Auburn's position in the US, we can see that it rose significantly in the US News National University Ranking from 115 in 2017 to 97 in 2021. Therefore, we can conclude that Auburn has worked on all the ranking criteria, including publications, citations, and the reputation of its research both globally and locally. For five years running, Auburn has been included in the top 100 universities in the United States, which speaks much about the school's reputation.

This institution is a public university with a campus size of 1,600 acres in a suburban setting. The University of West Florida – Pensacola offers undergraduate, graduate, and research degrees from its 5 colleges.The colleges available at the university are College of Arts Social Sciences and Humanities, College of Education and Professional Studies, College of Business, Usha Kundu, MD College of Health, Hal Marcus College of Science and Engineering. The University of West Florida – Pensacola offers rolling admissions with an acceptance rate of 31%. For undergraduate admissions, the preferred SAT score is 1080-1260, whereas the preferred ACT score is 22-28. In addition, the university also offers financial aid for its deserving students. With an average financial aid of $8,432 per year, nearly 90% of the students receive it. The tuition fee at the university depends on the student’s residency. For example, the cost per credit hour for Florida residents is $212, whereas, for Non-Florida residents, the fee is $642. Similarly, for graduate studies, the fee for Florida residents is $378 per credit hour and $1,037 for Non-Florida residents. As per U.S. News & World Report, the University of West Florida – Pensacola ranks at 35 in Regional Universities South and 58 in Best Value Colleges. Additionally, the University of West Florida – Pensacola has a student-faculty ratio of 20:1, with 35.2 of the classes having less than 20 students. It has a large alumni base of 92,717, with 51,737 living in Florida.

Name: University of California, Davis
Overview: The University of California, Davis is a university located in Davis, USA. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. The University of California, Davis (UC Davis) offers undergraduate and graduate programmes in a variety of disciplines, including engineering, agriculture, sciences, mathematics, anthropology, social sciences, media, design, computer science, arts, economics, languages, environment, pharmacy, philosophy, medicine, and psychology. UC Davis provides 1,300 students with the chance to participate in study abroad programmes annually. Numerous students have been placed in reputable companies by the university with a strong placement record.University of California, Davis offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship.

Qualifying Exams - SAT/ACT Scores: No standardised test will be required of any freshmen applicants to UC Davis for the Fall Semesters of 2021 through 2024. Name: Johns Hopkins University
Overview: Johns Hopkins University in Maryland is a private research institute founded in 1876. It has an acceptance rate of 11% and has over 24,000 students enrolled in full-time and part-time programs. Spread out across 9 schools, including Business, Education, Arts & Sciences, Medicine and Nursing.The university offers more than 260 disciplines for undergraduate, graduate, doctoral, certificate and non-degree programs. Some of the most popular Johns Hopkins University majors are Africana Studies, Biology, Computer Music, Anthropology, Anatomy Education etc. Johns Hopkins University, though based in Baltimore, has ten campus divisions across three continents. The campuses in Baltimore are located in Homewood, East Baltimore, Harbor East and Peabody, while several satellite campuses are in Montgomery County, Columbia and Laurel, all in Maryland. Moreover, the university also has a campus in Washington, D.C, Italy and China. The different schools also provide online programs, some for credit, and people can also find Johns Hopkins University online courses on Coursera. Many undergraduates have taken advantage of the study-abroad program, thus spending a semester or year in Paris, Tokyo, Barcelona etc. Moreover, several summer programs are organized for high schoolers. The estimated undergraduate cost of attending is USD 57,000. Students can avail the need-blind financial aid system; some financial aid programs awarded are JHU Grant, Clark Scholarship, National Fellowships Program, Federal Pell Grant, Private Scholarships, Federal Work-Study etc. Housing is available for undergraduates, especially for the first two years. They can opt for residence halls with doubles (few singles) or suites with singles, doubles or triples, with various dining services. Students can join one of the 400 clubs and organizations, 24 varsity sports teams, enjoy the Spring Fair, and participate in over 50 events each year. Placement surveys show that 96% of graduates tend to find employment with lucrative packages.

Placement: English Graduate Program The Johns Hopkins English graduate programme is well-equipped to assist students in locating rewarding employment that uses their skills. Due to the modest size, the university can help each student find a job. In addition to hosting visitors to discuss with graduate students about professions inside and outside of academia, the university allows students with publications, applications, and interviews. They also tap into the vibrant Hopkins alumni network, which is dedicated to helping current students.  Students who are applying for academic jobs have years of experience doing the kind of work that is required by the field. Students who are searching for non-academic professions have participated in workshops and presentations that the department and other campus divisions have sponsored, frequently including Hopkins alumni, to help them get ready for their desired careers. The university's newly reorganised and well-resourced Office of Integrative Learning and Life Design is also available to all students. 17 per cent of PhD graduates since 2009 have found employment in industries like publishing, speechwriting, the law, and professional editing. The remaining 83% have moved on to post-doctoral fellowships or academic posts in institutions. At Stanford University, Cornell University, City College of New York, Case Western Reserve University, St. Mary's College of Calgary, and the University of Rochester, this includes tenure-track positions.  Economics Department Some companies where the students of Josh Hopkins University are placed are the International Monetary Fund (IMF), Bates White Economic Consulting, Economist at Bank of Mexico, Economist at Amazon, Assistant Professor, University of North Texas, Post-Doctoral Fellow, University of Rochester, Federal Reserve Board, Ernst & Young, Singapore Monetary Authority etc.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation The Hopkins undergraduate experience is incomplete without living on campus. Most Homewood campus-based undergraduates live in residence halls for their first two years, and some stay longer. First-year students have two choices:The majority of rooms in traditional residence halls are doubled (you and a roommate), with a few singles and shared bathrooms.suite-style accommodations with private bathrooms, doubles, singles, or triples, as well as central heating and air conditioning (some also have small kitchenettes) Off-Campus Accommodation All four Baltimore locations are easily accessible by foot from a wide selection of rental homes and apartments. The Off-Campus Housing Office at JHU, which posts ads for vacant properties, can be of assistance. For more information, visit: https://www.jhu.edu/life/housing-dining/
Course Ranking: Popular degrees offered by Johns Hopkins University include molecular biology, neuroscience, biomedical engineering, chemical engineering, and bioengineering. The average freshman retention percentage, which is a sign of student satisfaction, is a promising 98%, according to US News. Therefore, one may attest to the calibre of academic life and instruction at JHU. If we're talking about rankings for specific subjects, JHU's master's degree in biomedical engineering is one of the best and has been ranked first by US News since 2018. The JHU Nursing programme was ranked third by QS Rankings in 2020. (top universities).The JHU Computer Engineering programme has received recognition from prestigious ranking suppliers. In 2019 and 2020, US News consistently placed it in position 22, while THE increased its ranks from 30 in 2019 to 27 in 2021. John Hopkins University is a great option for those looking for a top-notch research university. However, it is one of the most difficult colleges to enter, with an acceptance rate of 11.2% in 2020. Candidates with exemplary academic records and good test scores for admission are allowed to experience life at JHU. Name: Chicago State University
Overview: Chicago State University (CSU), Illinois, USA, is a public university founded in 1867. CSU is a member of the Thurgood Marshall College Fund and is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission. The university offers 56 degree programs under various disciplines - Business, Education, Health Science, Pharmacy, Arts, Sciences, Design, Psychology, Computer Science, Mathematics, Social Work, Languages, Engineering, Communication and Philosophy. In addition, CSU offers graduate programs in various courses - Master's in Teaching, Fine Arts, Occupational Therapy, Public Health, Science in Education, and Doctoral Degrees in Education (Ed.D) and Pharmacy. The university has sessions in Spring, Summer and Fall, and accordingly, the tuition fee and other program-related expenses vary.In addition, CSU has one campus providing academics and on-campus accommodation. The campus has a three-story coeducational, residential hall where approximately 330 students can be accommodated. The average hostel and meals expenses would be 6,028 USD yearly for the students. The approximate cost for a hostel would be 3,000 USD per semester ( all single rooms), and the meals would cost from 1,256 - 2,453 USD (10 to 19 meals). The accommodations are allotted for an 8 month academic period. The university's other amenities include a gym, a fitness center, 3 swimming pools, a dance studio, an auxiliary gymnasium, and many others. Another building also houses the university's athletic department, among others. In addition, the Chicago State University, in partnership with Chicago State Foundation, hosts a scholarship gala once a year.

Name: Pacific Lutheran University
Overview: Established in 1890 by Norwegian immigrants, Pacific Lutheran University is a private Christian university in the Parkland neighbourhood of Tacoma, Washington. The Evangelical Lutheran Church in America sponsors it. PLU provides 54 minors and 44 majors and professional and graduate programs in creative writing, finance, marketing analytics, marriage, education, nursing, business administration, and family therapy. This institute sees a total enrollment of roughly 3100 students. Of these, 38% are international students, representing 28 countries and 38 states. The average student-to-teacher ratio in a classroom at this institution is 13:1. This university has accepted more than 80% in the last five years. For the Class of 2024, the average GPA is 3.0 on a scale of 4.0. Notable alums include American film, stage, and television actor Connor Trinneer, renowned American epidemiologist William Herbert Foege, and former American competition swimmer and Olympic Games gold medallist Megan Jendrick. Since 1975, this university has produced 100 Fulbright Scholars. About 90% of the students of Pacific Lutheran University have received employment or are in graduate school six months after graduating.The tuition fees were $45,000 to $50,000, and the cost of meals and rooms featured was $10,000 to $12,000. The total costs for the year 2021-2022 were in the range of $55,000 to $60,000. Around 98% of students from PLU received financial aid, and for the year 2020–21, the average offer of financial assistance was $37,197.

Name: Bowling Green State University
Overview: Located in Bowling Green, Ohio, the Bowling Green State University was established in the year 1910. It is a public university that has various research programs and facilities. The university has various campuses around the state other than the main campus in Bowling Green. It has the oldest campus in the southwest corner of the city. Its main campus covers a vast area of land for about 1,338 acres. The university enrolls more than 19,000 students. Out of them, around 900 international students take admission from various countries. The university has 4 schools with 21 departments across its campus. It provides various educational programs for bachelors, master's, doctoral, and other short-term courses. Some of the renowned subjects of Bowling Green University are Musical Arts, Human Development, Engineering, Education, Business Management, and many more. It also provides online courses for endorsement and procuring online graduate certificates. Along with that, it provides 16 courses for a master's degree through an online facility. It has a 50-year-old library comprising more than seven million books for its students. Also, the college regularly holds sports competitions, fests, and many other cultural programs. It has a vast running track, exercise rooms, squash courts, cafeteria, labs, swimming pools, theatre rooms, and many more. The university also provides awards, financial aid, grants, and scholarships to most of its students. It has various facilities such as on-campus accommodation for students. The students also get the option for furnished and unfurnished rooms along with laundry, food, and others. The city is safe and provides a favorable environment for the students to live in. It is estimated that the average cost of living or studying and living in the city can cost up to 10,000 USD. The graduates from BGSU get jobs at various multinational companies around the world.

They can take any standardised exam, such as the TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, MELAB, and so on. The institution accepts the following English language tests and requires the following minimum scores:

Name: Methodist University
Overview: Methodist University is a private university located in Fayetteville, North Carolina. It has been accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges. Methodist University is a dynamic community of students, faculty, staff, and administrators who live, study and work together.  The college provides doctoral programs in physical therapy and occupational therapy. The bachelor's degree is in communications, justice studies, business administration, education, and social work. The master's programs include engineering, entrepreneurship, forensic science, graphic design, and applied communication. The complete tuition fee amounts to USD 36,960. The university provides housing facilities in 19 residence halls. All residence halls include air conditioning, free cable TV, laundry facilities, and internet access. In addition, off-campus accommodation is provided by the university. The living cost, including meals and housing, is around USD 19,230. Methodist University offers merit-scholarship programs for students who demonstrate high academic achievement, leadership qualities, and commitment to service. Along with this, the career services provide resources to students to obtain employment and work satisfaction and succeed in life-long career strategies.
Eligibility Overview: A freshman candidate with a 3.0 high school GPA, a New SAT score of 980 or higher (19 or better on the ACT), and a solid college preparatory coursework should be considered for normal admission. Students who do not meet those requirements will be assessed for admission on a case-by-case basis. Every student is encouraged to apply and have their application evaluated by our admissions committee.A student who was admitted to Methodist University based on his or her high school achievement and has a 2.0 GPA on any amount of college level work is normally acceptable to Methodist University. If the student was not admitted based on his or her high school grades, he or she must complete 12 to 31 semester hours of transferable credits in order to be admitted. All transfer students are encouraged to apply so that their files can be reviewed by our admissions committee.
Accommodation: We have found value in the unique experiences that residence hall life affords, and we are confident that you will as well. Our staff understands that living in a resident hall is an important component of the educational process.Our goal is to provide you with a healthy, clean, and safe environment, whether you reside in a typical hall or a suite.One of the main goals of the Division of Student Affairs is to help students make the most of their time at Methodist University. The resident halls offer a controlled atmosphere in which students can live, work, and grow together while benefiting from shared experiences. According to research, students who live in residence halls are more likely to achieve a better grade point average and finish their courses.

Eligibility Overview: Cal Poly Pomona expects you to have a GPA of 3.51, which means you should be in the middle of your high school class. You'll need a mix of A's and B's, with a few C's thrown in for good measure. If you have a poor GPA, you can make up for it by taking more difficult courses such as AP or IB subjects. This will help you raise your weighted GPA and demonstrate your college readiness.If you're a junior or senior, changing your GPA in time for college applications is difficult. You'll need a better SAT or ACT score to compensate if your GPA is at or below the school average of 3.51. This will enable you to compete effectively against applicants with better GPAs.Requirements for the SAT and ACTEach school has its own set of standardised testing standards. The SAT or ACT is required by most schools, and many also need SAT subject assessments.To apply to Cal Poly Pomona, you must take either the SAT or the ACT. More significantly, you must do well in order to submit a strong application.SAT Requirements at Cal Poly PomonaMany colleges claim that they do not have a SAT score cutoff, but the truth is that they do. This is based on the average score for the school.Cal Poly Pomona's average SAT composite score is 1140 on a 1600-point scale.

Name: University of Michigan
Overview: The University of Michigan is a dream university for millions worldwide. The university is located in Ann Arbor, a bustling city in the Midwestern state of Michigan. Quite remarkably, the campus was initially based in Detroit in its foundation year in 1817. After two decades, it moved to Ann Arbor. The University of Michigan now has a sprawling 780-acre campus. It has been consistently ranked in the top 20 universities in the world by QS rankings.  Michigan University is widely known for its academic vigour. It has one of the best research cultures globally and consistently ranks high on the research and innovation parameters. Offering a wide range of undergraduate and graduate programs ranging from arts and sciences to music, theatre and dance, it also provides a whopping 65 language courses- thereby catering to the students' wide range of interests. Various courses in the fields of Business, Data Analytics, Education, and Arts and Culture are also offered online, making the learning process an inclusive one. The University of Michigan's application procedure involves filling out a long drawn application form and essay writing. It is highly selective, with an acceptance rate below 33% in the last five years. Most courses require both  SAT/ ACT or GRE/GMAT scores for undergraduate and graduate programmes. A full-time degree program's average annual fee is around 31,000 dollars.  The campus houses extensive residential facilities, which also include recreational provisions for sports and fitness. Michigan University is well known for its spectacular libraries featuring close to 13 million volumes and a rich repertoire of books and journals. The libraries also have the privilege of being the fourth most prominent research libraries in the world. Over the years, the institution has produced notable alumni who have carved a niche for themselves in various fields, such as Larry Page, Arthur Miller, Michel Phelps, and Madonna.

Additionally, the 2023 edition of U.S. News & World Report's best graduate schools lists the University of Michigan as having some of the top graduate programmes. In these most recent school-wide rankings, the university kept its top 20 positions. The School of Social Work is ranked first, followed by the School of Public Health, the School of Education, the College of Engineering, the School of Law, and the School of Public Health. University Ranking: One of the top universities in the world has consistently been the University of Michigan. It has been ranked among the top 50 universities worldwide for 2023 by prestigious publications including QS World University Rankings, Times Higher Education (THE) World University Rankings, and U.S. News & World Report. The University of Michigan is ranked No. 23 in the Times Higher Education (THE) World University Rankings for 2023 when it comes to university rankings. If we compare it to last year's rating in THE, its position has increased by one spot. The University of Michigan is ranked #24 in the Times Higher Education rankings for 2022.In terms of the University of Michigan's position in the globe, according to U.S. News & World Report's 2022–23 edition, it was ranked No. 19 among the best worldwide universities. Worldwide research reputation, regional research reputation, books, publications, conferences, total citations, etc. are the variables that are utilised to determine the university's overall ranking of the finest global universities. The University of Michigan has been placed at No. 25 in the category of national universities according to the 2022–23 Best Colleges edition of U.S. News & World Report. The University of Michigan is ranked No. 25 in 2023 according to the QS rankings. In the QS World University Rankings, it was ranked 21st in 2020 and 2021, 23rd in 2022, and 23rd in 2020.FAQs on University of Michigan RankingsQ. Is the University of Michigan a prestigious university?A. In the category of public universities, the University of Michigan holds the same third-place ranking as the previous year. According to U.S. News & World Report, it was ranked 25th overall in the national universities category in the best colleges edition for 2022–2023Q. Name: Northern Illinois University
Overview: Northern Illinois University was established in 1895 by Governor John P. Altgeld with its main campus in Dekalb, Illinois. Operating in multiple locations like Chicago, Naperville, and Rockford, Northern Illinois University has seven extensive colleges dealing in business, education, law, health, human science, engineering and technology, liberal arts and sciences, and visual and performing arts. The university is ranked 298 in the National Universities Ranking and 703 in the Global Universities category by the US News and World Report 2021. Acclaimed as one of the best business colleges, the university holds 157 in UG Business by the US News and World Report 2021. NIU holds a special place in research and is accredited by the Carnegie Foundation as a Ru/H high research activity. The main campus of Northern Illinois University in Dekalb is spread across an area of 765 acres. It provides 100+ undergraduate and 80+ graduate programs, minors, certificates, pre-professional studies, integrated program, specialist degree program, doctoral and research programs, and off-campus programs. There are 42 schools and departments in its seven degree-granting colleges. It is a member of the Association of Public and Land-Grant Universities, and Universities Research Association. It maintains a student-faculty ratio of 13:1 for better performance of the students. NIU offers 300+ student organizations, clubs, and active community services, cultural resources centers, and sports clubs for healthy on-campus student life. The university offers on-campus residential facilities for students in its six residence halls, namely Gilbert hall, Grant Hall, Neptune hall, Steveson tower, Northern View Community, and Residence hall. The availability of different types of rooms like single room, suite rooms, and double rooms has options for mixed co-ed floors, public workstations, in-hall laundry, Wifi, and others. The estimated cost of attendance for undergraduate students with full-time enrollment ranges between USD 27,000 to USD 35,000.

Name: Butler University
Overview: Established in 1855, Butler University is affiliated with independent colleges and is located in Indianapolis, Indiana. The college offers 19 graduate programs, eight pre-professional programs, and more than 60 majors programs. The university has six colleges offering liberal arts & sciences, business, communication, pharmacy, and health sciences. The top master's programs are offered in the medical sciences, master of science in risk and insurance, experiential program for preparing school principals (EPPSP), and master of arts in English. The college's three-year major program is in anthropology, biochemistry, chemistry, communication sciences & disorder, computer sciences, criminology, English literature, German, and history. The college provides more than 200 study abroad programs worldwide. The tuition fee per annum is USD 42,410, and the cost of living is around USD 14,700. The institution offers financial awards, grants, and scholarships for international students to study in the USA. The scholarships are offered based on the student's performance, capabilities, academic potential, and competencies. Butler's educational scholarship program ranges from USD 10,000 to 20,000. ﻿Additionally, the institute offers placement programs and employment services to its students.
Eligibility Overview: INTERNATIONAL STUDENT ADMISSION REQUIREMENTS Completed application for admission, including a major and a foreign address noted under "Home Country Address."Bank statements showing at least $16,690 USD are currently available (scanned copy acceptable).Each sponsor must submit a hand-signed and dated Sponsor Letter/Financial Guarantee Form within 6 months of the semester's start date (scanned copy acceptable).English Transcripts from High School (scanned copy acceptable).A statement stating where you intend to live while attending Butler University.A copy of your current passport is required. If your birth certificate isn't available, a copy will suffice.TOEFL 500 (PBT), 173 (CBT), 61 (iBT), IELTS 5.0 are all acceptable proofs of English proficiency. A secondary English grade of "C" or better and an overall grade point average of "C" or better for pupils whose country's official language is English.Proficiency in EnglishEnglish competence can be demonstrated by a secondary English grade and an overall secondary grade point average of 2.0 or higher for pupils whose country's official language is English. Otherwise, one of the choices listed below may be utilised. Scores must be from the last three years.TOEFL 61 (internet-based), 173 (computer-based), and 500 (paper-based) (Butler institution code: 6191)5.0 on the IELTSEnglish Test 90 on Duolingo50 PTEWichita State University's Intensive English Language Center requires Advanced Level II or above completion (IELC). In all classes, the student must receive a "C" or better.12 hours or more of college or university credit (or one year of high school credit) from a U.S. college or institution with a 2.0 or "C" grade point average

Name: Louisiana State University
Overview: A public land-grant research university in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, the Louisiana State University was established in 1853 as the flagship institution of the Louisiana State University System.The academic structure of the university is organised into the College of Agriculture, College of Art and Design, E.J. Ourso College of Business, College of the Coast and Environment, College of Engineering, College of Human Sciences and Education, College of Humanities and Social Sciences, Manship School of Mass Communication, College of Music and Dramatic Arts, College of Science, School of Veterinary Medicine, Roger Hadfield Ogden Honours College, University College, LSU Paul M. Hebert Law Centre, Graduate School, and Health Sciences Centres. With a 75% acceptance rate, the university has become a comprehensive and quality education institute offering hundreds of undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctorate degree programs. Some of the university's highly ranked courses are Theatre, Engineering, Business, Law, Architecture, Fine Arts, Library, and Entrepreneur programs. The average annual tuition and accommodation fee can come to around $ 33K, but through many of the scholarships provided by the college, the cost can be brought down to $ 15K. With a brilliant alumni network of notable alumni positioned at the apex of leading industries, it also ensures a promising placement rate and generous annual salaries for the graduating batch.
Eligibility Overview: You must have a 3.0 unweighted academic GPA based on 19 core units to be considered for admission.In addition, students must pass either the ACT or the SAT:A 22 composite ACT score, with an 18 English subscore and a 19 math subscore, or a 1030 composite SAT score, with at least a 450 critical reading score and a 460 math score.If you choose to have your SAT or ACT scores considered as part of your application on the Common App, your admission and scholarship decisions will be based on your highest submitted score.For admission and scholarship consideration, LSU uses a super score.You can submit your ACT or SAT scores in a variety of ways to be considered for admission:SRAR ratings based on self-report (Self-Reported Academic Record)Scores on the Common Application based on self-reportingWhen registering for the ACT or SAT as an institution that receives scores automatically, enter LSU's code.1590 is the ACT code.6373 is the SAT code.

Name: The University of Findlay
Overview: The University of Findlay (UF) is a private Christian university in Findlay, Ohio. Courses are offered on a part-time, full-time and online basis. UF offers 86 Undergraduate courses of study, 11 Master's degrees, 5 Doctoral degrees and Baccalaureate degrees under the schools - College of Education, College of Business; College of Health Professions, Humanities and Social Sciences; College of Arts, College of Pharmacy; and College of Sciences.Candidates need a minimum of 6.0 in IELTS or 61 in TOEFL to be considered for admission.The top programs at UF are MBA costing 21,289 USD, BS in Computer Science, 32,343 USD and BS in Chemistry, costing 30,569 USD. The tuition for a full-time study (12-18 credit hours) would cost approximately 35,174 USD, and other expenses on student fees and general service fees would cost 1,310 USD.  A merit scholarship of 8,000 to 15,000 USD annually is awarded for the entire 4-years study duration to incoming first-year undergraduate students based on their GPA. The top graduates placed are from the programs Business Administration and Management (salary 43,000 USD), Pharmacy (salary 121,200 USD) and Animal Sciences (salary 30,3000 USD).
Eligibility Overview: The following criteria will be used for students who are unable to take the ACT or SAT due to COVID-19 closing testing centres: high school grades (minimum 2.5 cumulative grade point average) and class rank; American College Test (ACT) (minimum 20 composite ACT) or Scholastic Aptitude Test (SAT) (minimum 950 composite SAT) scores; for those students who are unable to take the ACT or SAT due to COVID-19 closing testing centres, the following criteria willA letter of recommendation from a professor;a written example of past academic work that has been graded;An interview with a representative from the university's admissions office;International students must have a TOEFL (iBT) score of at least 61, an IELTS score of at least 6.0, a Pearson Test of English (academic) score of at least 50, or an International Test of English Proficiency (iTEP) score of at least 3.5 to be admitted to The University of Findlay's undergraduate programme. International students who received their secondary and/or post-secondary education in English may petition for an exemption from this requirement. Students who meet these language criteria can enrol in the Intensive English Program (IELP) at The University of Findlay before beginning their academic studies. The TOEFL, IELTS, Pearson Test of English (academic), and/or iTEP requirements are waived if you complete the IELP.
Accommodation: The university provides on-campus 8 residence halls accommodation with facilities including furnishing, tech support, free tickets to events and movies, 100+ clubs etc. The students can live in residential halls, apartments or Greek housing. The on-campus accommodation expenses, including the meals, would cost approximately USD 4,800 per semester.Students with permanent or temporary disabilities or impairments are accommodated through the Office of Accommodation and Inclusion.for more information click  on this link-https://www.findlay.edu/offices/student-affairs/accommodation-and-inclusion/

Name: University of Arkansas
Overview: Established in 1871, the University of Arkansas is one of the top-graded universities in the USA. Located in Fayetteville, Arkansas, USA, it has more than 27,500 students enrolled in this university in various fields, which include business, communication, agriculture, architecture, creative writing, law, and many more. The university offers 200 doctorate, graduate, and undergraduate courses to its students. Admissions are conducted in Fall and Spring. The university's acceptance rate is 66%, so it is considered quite competitive. The university's most popular courses include Engineering, Journalism, Communications, Business, Health Professions, Management, and Fitness Studies. The university also provides online degree courses. The course fees usually depend on the type of course and its duration. The average cost of living in Fayetteville, Arkansas, for undergraduates is USD 42,632, and for graduates, it is USD 47,081.The university provides various awards and scholarships to its international students, including Sturgis Fellowship, Honors College Academy Scholarship, Transfer Scholarship, Honors College Fellowship, Chancellor's Merit Transfer Scholarship, and Freshman Academic Scholarship.The university is also known for providing excellent placement opportunities to its students. John Boozman, Joe Johnson, and Ricardo Martinelli are some of the most famous alumni of the University of Arkansas.

Name: University of Central Missouri
Overview: The University of Central Missouri is a university located in Warrensburg, USA. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Computer Engineering. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. The University of Central Missouri offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic requirements: For undergraduate students Students must have a 2.0 high school GPA or above to be admissible For postgraduate students Students must hold a bachelor's degree from a 4-year regionally recognised institution in the United States or an overseas institution equivalent to a 4-year regionally accredited institution based on transcript evaluation.Must have a 3.0 GPA English language proficiency requirements: Candidates must submit proof of the following academic and English language proficiency requirements:

Placement: The University of Missouri's professional outcomes is one of the factors that attract applicants from all around the United States and the world. Holding true to its motto of 'Education for Service,' the multi-disciplinary education it offers prepares students for careers in the business world, allowing them to obtain reputable and lucrative professions with good pay while also allowing them to use their education to benefit the business community. Graduate students either continue their studies or find work in government organisations, the US military, and other enterprises across the country. Many of them are also being offered work by corporations in other countries.  A 'Career Services Center' at the institution assists students and graduates in finding intriguing internship and job opportunities. The accessible facility polishes a student's job-search skills and assists in the formation of future networks and connections. Prior bookings, resume help days, face-to-face and virtual job fairs, interviews, hall tables, and other methods allow students to contact with potential employers. From Monday through Friday, students can meet with counsellors and seek their assistance in designing potential career choices, exploring internships, writing applications or cover letters and more. There is also a 'Career Readiness Course,' which is a one-hour credit programme in which students receive training on how to deal with the industry or potential employers. The UCM Career Services Center will issue a certificate of career preparedness to those who attend. Some companies who recruit from here are Dell, Infosys Limited, Tesla Motors, Tata Consultancy Services, United States Army Cyber Corps, Delta Airlines, Deloitte & Touche LLP, Commerce Bank, Amazon etc.
Accommodation: For students, UCM has five apartment complexes on campus (Todd, Foster-Knox, and Nickerson) and near campus (Todd, Foster-Knox, and Nickerson) (Greenwood Park and Central Village).On-campus housing is furnished, however off-campus housing is not. Rent is charged to student accounts at the beginning of each semester. Because campus-affiliated housing is first-come, first-served, we encourage making top choices to ensure housing.If residing in campus dorms, each student must pay a deposit (deposits vary by apartment), a portion of which is refundable at the end of the contract. You will not be allowed to check into UCM housing until all paperwork has been completed. You have three possibilities as an international student at UCM for housing:  Student ApartmentsResidence HallsOff-campus lodging For more information, visit: https://www.ucmo.edu/offices/graduate-and-international-student-services/international-students/housing/index.php
University Ranking: Regarding the ranking of the courses offered at the University of Central Missouri, the Undergraduate Business programme at the university currently holds the 402nd spot for the year 2021. The business programme offered by the University of Central Missouri (UCM) previously held a ranking of 380 for the year 2020 and 405 for the year 2019. As part of the methodology behind their subject rankings, US News & World Report takes into consideration a number of factors including, but not limited to, student selection (25%), the opinion of business school leaders (25%), and employment outcome (21%), among other things.

Name: Victory Institute
Overview: The Victory Institute was created in 1993 by LGBTQ activists and philanthropists who saw a need to train LGBTQ candidates to run for government across the country. With less than 50 openly LGBTQ elected officials at any level of government in the United States, our founders recognised that increasing our numbers in public service would be critical to promoting equality.  They realised the need to teach more LGBTQ persons to run for government and to assist them once they were elected when they founded Victory Institute. The Foundation has begun educating future candidates and campaign workers in order to assist LGBTQ leaders in pursuing careers in government. The Foundation also initiates a Presidential Appointments Project, with Roberta Achtenberg becoming the first out LGBTQ presidential appointee to a Senate-confirmed position when she is appointed Assistant Secretary of Housing and Urban Development.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate students of all genders, orientations, abilities, ethnicities and political affiliations are welcome to apply for the Victory Congressional Internship. Women, people of colour, trans people, persons with disabilities, and people from low-income families are all urged to apply.  To be eligible, you must be LGBTQ+.U.S. citizen, legal permanent resident, or work permit holder (Foreign students with F-1 visas are not eligible)Before arriving in Washington, D.C., you must be 18 years old.By the start of the programme, students who are currently enrolled full-time in an undergraduate degree programme will have completed at least one year. Participants in the summer programme must have at least one full semester left after the programme ends (i.e., students who graduate before or during the summer programme are not eligible); spring and fall programme participants must not graduate before the programme ends.Applicants from a variety of fields are welcome to apply.Active involvement in public and/or community service projects Note: “allies” of the LGBTQ community do not qualify.
Placement: The Victory Congressional Internship at the Victory Institute is preparing the next generation of LGBTQ public leaders. The Victory Congressional Internship brings outstanding LGBTQ college students to Washington, DC each semester for an intense leadership programme, which includes: An eight- or ten-week Congressional internship with a member of the LGBTQ+ Equality Caucus or an LGBTQ-friendly member of Congress to learn about the federal legislative process firsthandAn educational and leadership development programme that allows participants to learn about careers in policymaking and interact with subject-matter experts from many industries in the District of Columbia. Students will spend three days learning, networking, and discussing with hundreds of openly LGBTQ leaders in government, politics, activism, business, and community organisations at the Victory Institute's biennial International LGBTQ Leaders Conference. The Victory Congressional Internship helps young LGBTQ people become informed decision-makers and influential leaders who can create a good impact on the areas in which they live, and around the world.
Accommodation: There is no on or off-campus accommodation provided by the university.

Name: Sonoma State University
Overview: A public university in Sonoma County, California, Sonoma State University, was established in 1961 with an acceptance rate of 91%. The 269-acre Sonoma State University campus is located in Rohnert Park. The University Library holds over 670,000 volumes, 35,000 periodicals, 160 databases, study spaces and computer facilities. ﻿It offers eight certificate programs, including Audio and Recording Production, Business Administration, Compassion Cultivation Training and Family Nurse Practitioner. Some courses are Anthropology, Counselling, Global Studies, Spanish and Women's and Gender Studies. The School of Extended and International Education provides overseas students access to the university's education; it offers academic and professional development programs, summer sessions/winter intersessions, international programs, and more. On-campus student housing is available at six residential villages, including Verdot Village, Tuscany Village and Beaujolais Village; there are singles, doubles and triples. Off-campus accommodation comprises privately rented apartments, houses, rooms or shared living spaces. Over 120 student clubs and organisations are involved in academic, professional, cultural, spiritual, and political activities like the French Club, K-Pop Club, Hillel and Feminist Coalition. Sonoma State University graduates earn an average salary of USD 41,000.The estimated undergraduate tuition fee is USD 2,788 to USD 3,994 per semester, and the estimated post-baccalaureate tuition fee is USD 3,205 to USD 4,711 per semester. Financial aid options include scholarships, loans, grants and student employment like the Federal Pell Grant, Federal PLUS Loans, Federal Work-Study, Athletic Talent Awards and University Scholarship Program.
Eligibility Overview: All applicants to Sonoma State University must submit all relevant government documentation with their application. All transcripts (academic records) must be evaluated by a third party and official transcripts must be sent to Sonoma State University immediately. For third-party evaluation services, see the How to Submit Transcripts to Sonoma State page and the Foreign Coursework Evaluations section. Instructions on how to submit official and unofficial documentation can be found on the admissions webpage.Requirement for English Language ProficiencyInternational student applicants must demonstrate that they have the minimal English proficiency required to attend Sonoma State University in addition to meeting the basic admissions standards. International applicants must demonstrate competency in English by:Having spent three years full-time at a secondary or post-secondary institution where English is the predominant language of instruction OR having been educated in one of the countries that qualifies for an English waiver (listed below) OR Submit formal verification of English ability via an exam OR Complete GE Area A2 (Written Communication) at a US university with a C- or better.
Accommodation: You can live on campus at Sonoma State University and experience college life while also taking advantage of the opportunities and resources available right outside your door. Living on campus is a place to call home, where friends are made, ideas are developed, and lifelong memories are made.Make the most of your time at SSU by living on campus, where you'll have everything you need right outside your door. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. Eligibility Overview: Florida National University has an open-door admissions policy, which means that all qualified applicants are accepted regardless of ethnicity, gender, religion, national origin, age, or physical disability.Enrollment is available at any time. According to the admissions rules, any student with a high school diploma or a GED certificate is eligible to attend. Open admissions procedures, which guarantee admittance, are all about access and opportunity: any student who has completed high school can pursue a college degree.Although SAT or ACT test scores are not required for Open Enrollment Admission universities, students are required to complete a diagnostic test to assess their ability. The test will be used to evaluate if students will need to complete remedial or developmental courses before enrolling in college-level courses.The policy of open admission does not imply that entrance to specific programmes is unrestricted. It does, however, imply that these limitations are flexible enough to allow pupils to improve their academic standing by removing inadequacies through remedial work. To meet prerequisites/co-requisites, new students seeking admission to a certain programme must submit relevant transcripts and participate in a placement testing. When new students meet the precise entrance requirements for a given curriculum, they can be enrolled in that curriculum and stay in it as long as they make adequate progress and stay enrolled on a continuing basis as required by their curriculum.

Name: Valparaiso University
Overview: Established in 1859, the Valparaiso University is situated in Valparaiso, Indiana, in the US. It is considered as one of the first universities in the US which began co-educational programs for students. Previously it was named Valparaiso Male and Female College and was closed due to the civil war. Later, it was opened in 1871 and its name was changed to Valparaiso University. It covers a huge area of 350 acres that comprises more than 60 academic and residential buildings as well. The campus is located in a beautiful, suburban location and nearly one hour distance from Chicago. Students apply for part-time and full-time courses as well. Every year, around 4000 students, also comprising the international students, take admission in Valparaiso University. It has high-end research labs, computer labs, a huge library with thousands of books, an indoor track, a swimming pool, a gym, and many more. The university provides various educational programs for bachelors and masters degree for students in various subjects such as Physical Education, Engineering, Sports Media, Accounting, Business, Greek and Roman Studies, Data Science, and many more. The college has its residential complex where students can stay on-campus. It has several apartment complexes with furnished and hygienic rooms and furniture. Around 2000 students can stay in the housing facility. The average tuition fee for studying at Valparaiso University is around 40, 500 USD per annum. Also, the average cost of living that includes books, on-campus facilities, and other miscellaneous expenses can reach up to 59, 0000 USD per annum. The college also provides scholarships and grants to the students. Valparaiso University also assists students to get a room or apartment for rent. Hence, the average cost of living for studying here can be around 50, 000 USD per annum.
Eligibility Overview: UG students' eligibility requirementsInternational students wishing to pursue graduate studies at Valparaiso University must have a valid English Language Requirement score. They must submit test results from a variety of examinations, including the ACT, SAT, IELTS, TOEFL, IGCSE A and O Levels, iTEP, and the International Baccalaureate (IB). Due to the COVID-19 epidemic, Valparaiso University is now accepting Duolingo Test scores. Aspirants can take the test online from the comfort of their own homes. English test scores are not required for applicants who are permanent residents of Australia or the United Kingdom.For PG students, there are some conditions that must be met.Aspirants must have a valid UG degree from an approved institution or college to pursue PG courses in any discipline. Applicants must have a 3.0 GPA (B-Average) in graduate and undergraduate studies to be considered.Indian students' eligibility requirementsTo enrol in any UG or PG programme, Indian candidates must pass English proficiency tests. ACT, SAT, IELTS, TOEFL, IGCSE A and O Levels, iTEP, or the International Baccalaureate (IB), for example. They should submit two professional recommendation letters via the internet.
Placement: After graduation, Valparaiso University boasts a 97 percent employment rate. The university's career centre offers students and alumni a variety of alternatives by supporting them in finding internships and jobs in the United States following graduation. The university's graduates work in fields such as health care, management, manufacturing, accounting, engineering, and marketing. Internships have been available at NASA, Adidas, Caterpillar, and Paramount Studios for university students.
Accommodation: On Campus AccommodationInternational students can stay on campus at Valparaiso University.The majority of undergraduate students live on or near campus in one of nine university resident halls and apartment structures, as well as six fraternity homes.Visit:- https://www.valpo.edu/reslife/residence-halls/
Course Ranking: US News & World Report has placed the university's UG Business programme at number 201 for 2021. The UG Business course had previously received rankings of 195 for 2020 and 179 for 2019. The approach used by US News & World Report to rank subjects includes, among other things, considerations such as student selection (25%), the views of business school administrators (25%), and employment outcome (21%).
University Ranking: The university has received a 1001+ ranking from THE (Times Higher Education) - University Ranking for the past two years in a row. Teaching, Research, and Citations are each given 30% weight in Times Higher Education's (THE) rating methodology. Additionally, the university has been ranked by US News & World Report, where it now holds the 1108th spot for Global Universities in 2020. The university is also mentioned in the US News & World Report lists of the best national universities and the top regional universities in the Midwest, where it ranks 160th (2021) and fifth (2018), respectively. In addition to other rating factors, the US News & World Report bases their rankings on the number of publications cited, global research reputation, and regional research reputation (12.5% each).

Name: University of Massachusetts Boston (UMass Boston)
Overview: University of Massachusetts Boston (UMass Boston) is a public university in Boston. The institution was established in 1964. It is the second university in the UMass system and was initially known as Boston State College. In 1982, it was incorporated into UMass Boston by eliminating duplicate programs. UMass Boston offers courses on 207 undergraduate, graduate, and certificate programs. The programs are provided through 8 schools and colleges and have more than 50 interdisciplinary research centers. In 2020, approximately 4000 students graduated from UMass Boston. For fall 2020, the total student enrollment stands at 16,259 and is engaged in academic programs, public service, and research centers. Additionally, UMass Boston offers 30 Ph.D. programs, and it is famous for its expertise in Health, biomedical, and life sciences, sustainability, and inclusion. The institution is partnered with Dana-Farber/Harvard Cancer Centre, Sanofi and Genzyme, IBM, Boston Public Schools, and New England Aquarium. The university also has a vibrant international student community, which is represented by students from 136 countries. The University of Massachusetts Boston (UMass Boston) has consistently ranked among the top universities in the world. As per QS World University Rankings 2022, it is currently ranked 651-700, with a research output ‘Very High.’ For the fiscal year 2019, the university has $62 million in research funding for natural and social sciences. Apart from this, as per U.S. News and Report’s 2022 Graduate School list, UMass Boston’s courses in education, nursing, clinical psychology, and public affairs is ranked among the top 100 programs. The Ph.D. program in Gerontology has produced the highest number of gerontology PhDs in the world. The University of Massachusetts Boston (UMass Boston) is recognized worldwide, and in 2019, Forbes ranked the university at No.247 as the 300 Best Value Colleges in its 4th annual ranking.
Eligibility Overview: Admission RequirementsAll non-native English speakers must demonstrate their ability to communicate in the English language. Students can demonstrate their understanding by taking the following exams:TOEFL (79+) is a test that measures your ability to communicate in English.(6.0+) IELTSSAT (480+ on the Evidence-Based Reading and Writing (ERWS) component)TAKE ACTION (Reading and English component scores totaling 34)English Test (100+) on DuolingoYour official test scores must be sent directly to UMass Boston from the testing agency. When you register for the test, you can request that your results be transmitted to UMass Boston. If you've already taken the test, you can get your official results by contacting the College Board, ACT, TOEFL, IETLS, or Duolingo.The SAT/TOEFL and IELTS code for UMass Boston is 3924, and the ACT code is 1925.

Name: University of North Carolina at Charlotte
Overview: The University of North Carolina at Charlotte is a public research university in North Carolina, United States. Founded in 1946 as the Charlotte Centre of the University of North Carolina, it became a full-fledged university following its merger with the Consolidated University of North Carolina in 1965. Since then, it has become a premier academic institute renowned for its research activity. Its nine colleges offer 79 undergraduate, 66 graduate, and 24 doctoral programs in various fields. The best courses at the University of North Carolina at Charlotte include MS in Mechanical Engineering, MS in Electrical Engineering, and Bachelors in Business Administration (BBA). The university's 1000-acre campus is home to several academic buildings, classrooms, and offices. Facilities like the J. Murrey Atkins Library, labs, and lecture theatres help students excel in their academic work. The Center City Campus is located in Uptown Charlotte, offering many courses, including the highly ranked MBA program. The university has many student organizations, fraternities, and sororities to promote an active social life amongst students. It also has a strong alumni network to help students in their careers. The 49ers sports team, known as Charlotte, represents the university in numerous college sports tournaments. The tuition structure for each course varies depending on the type of program and its duration. The average annual costs of attending university here come to around USD 25,000.
Eligibility Overview: Admission to UNC Charlotte requires completing particular high school academic courses, a competitive cumulative high school GPA in those academic areas, and competitive SAT or ACT scores from a recognized high school.
Placement: 30.55 percent of students obtained employment after graduation, whereas 69.45 percent did so at or just before graduation. 31.61 percent of students found jobs within 3 to 6 months of graduation, while 56.61 percent of graduates did so within 3 months. Within six to twelve months following graduation, 11.49 percent of graduates found employment.

Placement: The Career Development and Internships Office (CDIO) at NPU is an essential component of the North Park student experience, offering professional assessment, resume development, local and national internship opportunities, career counselling, and industry-specific job fairs. Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation There are several on-campus housing options at North Park, including apartments and homes. You may use the University's amenities, community, and safety no matter where you live. The halls provided are: 1. Anderson Hall Up to 228 women, primarily freshmen and sophomores can live in Anderson Hall, which has six stories on the south side of campus. 2. Burgh Hall Burgh Hall, a coed residence with a western river view, has four stories with space for up to 200 students, most of whom are first- and second-year students. 3. Ohlson House Ohlson House is a restored apartment building that can accommodate 136 students, most of whom are sophomores. It offers double, triple, and occasionally single apartments, each of which has its personality and style. The CRUX show is also aired at Ohlson House. 4. Park North Apartments Up to 70 students are housed in the coed Park North building, which combines the advantages of an apartment with those of a regular residence hall. 5. Sawyer Court Sawyer Court, an apartment building with space for up to 100 students, is situated nearby the core campus and primarily houses juniors and seniors. 6. Apartments and Houses In the neighbourhood, the University owns a range of homes and apartment complexes used as campus housing. For more information, visit: https://www.northpark.edu/campus-life-and-services/residence-life-and-housing/living-areas/  For general enquiries, visit: https://www.northpark.edu/campus-life-and-services/residence-life-and-housing/

Name: University of Utah
Overview: The University of Utah, established in 1850, is a Salt Lake City centre of powerhouse sports, academics, and research. It is also known as the U of U or simply The U. It has received accreditation from the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities (NWCCU). The institute comprises 17 colleges and schools dealing in different areas- business, cultural & social transformation, architecture + planning, engineering, fine arts, dentistry, education, health, humanities, pharmacy, and several others. On a national scale, the University of Utah is the best for technology commercialization, as per Milken Institute rankings. According to U.S. News & World Report, this university's 2022 ranking was 99 among National Universities. It also features roughly 100 academic departments and many academic interdisciplinary programs. This institute's student-to-faculty ratio is 17:1 - the lowest among Utah public institutions. Besides this, it also boasts of having the highest graduation rate of any public university in the state - about 70% of first-year students graduate in 6 years. This university strongly focuses on the commercialization procedure of its research. It received 547 million dollars for the method of its research spending in 2019. It also recorded 69 start-ups and generated $212 million in the procedure of licensing income. A University of Utah alumni's median starting salary ranges between $50,000 and $55,000.
Eligibility Overview: University of Utah expects you to have a 3.66 GPA and be above average in your high school class. At the very least, you'll need a mix of A's and B's, with more A's than B's.
