Name: Drexel University
Overview: Established in 1891, Drexel University is a private research university located in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The university was founded as Drexel Institution of Art, Science, and Industry and later renamed Drexel Institute of Technology. The university provides about 120 online degree programs in doctorate degrees, master's degrees, bachelor's degrees, and certified programs that supply the identical curriculum as on-campus equivalents. The university offers several exceptional cooperative educational accredited degrees and certificates online. The university provides a masteräó»s program in the field of computer science, business analytics, information system, quantitative finances, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, and a bachelor's degree in business administration and mechanical engineering. These programs are designed for professionals who want to advance their education in a very convenient online format while not compromising quality.The course fee is USD 54,766 per annum for international students. The university provides housing facilities within the campus, and the average cost of living, including rooms and meals, is about USD 16,488. Full-year students' scholarships include federal, state, and institutional aid. The institution additionally provides professional employment experiences for students, allowing them to work and have future career benefits of participating in up to three different co-ops, which equals 18 months of professional work. Drexel is a world-class research university and sponsors more than USD 110 million for annual expenditure. Research in medical and health science enhances basic sciences, biotechnology, and information science. The university has already established major research initiatives in engineering cities, plasma medicine & biology, and neuro-engineering.
Eligibility Overview: Drexel University needs you to have a 3.73 GPA and be above average in your high school class. You'll need a combination of A and B grades, with an emphasis on As. If you took certain AP or IB subjects, this will help you raise your weighted GPA and demonstrate your college readiness.Students with an average SAT score of 1190-1390 or an average ACT score of 25-31 are encouraged to apply. To be considered above average in your high school class, you must have a 3.73 GPA. You'll need a mix of A's and B's, with a focus on the A's.

Name: University of Albany, The State University of New York, Albany (SUNY Albany)
Overview: The University at Albany is a public institute incorporated in 1844. This open research university decided to reorganize its academic structure in 1905. Later on, it became New York City’s first institute of higher education to provide a bachelor's degree. The University at Albany—SUNY ranked 172 in National Universities as per the 2022 edition of U.S. News & World Report Best Colleges rankings. In the QS Global World Ranking 2020, UAlbany ranked #751-800 globally. The institute campus is divided into two regions - the Downtown Campus and the Uptown Campus. The former one was established in 1909, and it comprises the College of Information Technology, Rockefeller College of Policy and Public Affairs, School of Social Welfare and School of Criminal Justice. The latter one is the main campus and is situated at 1400 Washington Avenue in Albany. The setting of this institute is suburban, and its campus area measures about 610 acres. University at Albany follows a semester-based academic calendar. It provides over 50 undergraduate majors and around 120 master's programs. This includes those in the schools of business and education. Several graduate programs at UAlbany are highly ranked, and this includes social work, criminal justice, and specialties provided in the Rockefeller College of Public Affairs and Policy. This institute's in-state tuition and fees range from $10,000 to $10,500, and the out-of-state tuition and fees range between $28,000 and $28,500. As of fall 2020, this institute boasts of having a total undergraduate enrollment of 13,182. Some University at Albany alumni includes Joachim Frank (Nobel Prize in Chemistry), Richard E. Stearns (Turing Award winner), Omar Yaghi (Wolf Prize winner), Alanna Schepartz (Renowned Chemist), Carolee Carmello (Famous Actress), Harvey Milk (Gay rights pioneer), and William Kennedy (Pulitzer Prize winner).
Placement: Nil

Name: Monroe College
Overview: Founded in 1933, Monroe College is a private college in New York City, USA. The institution has three main campuses situated in New Rochelle, Saint Lucia and The Bronx, along with an additional site in Manhattan. With an acceptance rate of nearly 52.2%, Monroe College is among the top 100 universities in the country. Monroe College has accreditation from the Middle States Commission on Higher Education and is appreciated for social mobility. Comprising eight schools offering 25 undergraduate, ten postgraduate, several associate degrees and several certificate courses. Business Administration, Management, Marketing, Health Sciences, Nursing, Homeland Security, Law, Firefighting, Protective Services, Computer Science, Information Technology and Personal and Culinary Services are some popular courses provided. Applications through the official website are to be filled for intake into the Fall and Spring semesters. Academic transcripts, LORs, essays, CV and scores of English Language Proficiency tests, SAT, ACT etc., should also be submitted, and an application fee of 35 USD for undergraduate and 50 USD for postgraduate applicants. The average undergraduate tuition fee is 15,860 USD, whereas that for doctoral programs is 16,275 USD, and international students are awarded various merit-based scholarships to provide financial aid. On-campus accommodation is provided in Gaddy Hall and Locust Hall in the New Rochelle campus in single, double, triple and quad occupancy rooms with compulsory meal plans. Gaddy Hall can accommodate up to 300 students and consists of classrooms, faculty offices, Gaddy cafes, and a courtyard. At the same time, Locust Hall is equipped with facilities like fully-furnished rooms, TV, refrigerators, laundry, fitness center and computer rooms. Basketball, soccer, track and cross country are famous sports at Monroe College apart from the 50 student clubs for extracurricular activities. Monroe College assists students in placements through career fairs, workshops and by providing personal career counsellors. With a graduation rate of 72%, the average salary of graduates is around 51934 USD.
Eligibility Overview: Monroe College admits overseas applicants who have finished secondary school with a college prepared curriculum, met the minimum grade point equivalent, submitted the certified academic records, met the appropriate deadlines, and had their financial assistance validated for admission.To demonstrate English competence, international applicants from non-native English speaking nations must submit TOEFL, IELTS, or equivalent scores. Accommodation: The university provides a safe and comfortable place for students who choose to study over here. It ensures that the environment is friendly and inclusive so that the students can make happy memories that will last a lifetime.Housing options provided are: Gaddy Hall On Main Street, Monroe's newest building is called Gaddy Hall. This six-story mixed-use structure houses 300 students on-campus and bears James Gaddy's name, a former superintendent of New Rochelle Schools and a longstanding trustee of Monroe. The main dining hall for students to eat breakfast, lunch, supper, and late-night meals is Gaddy Café, which is situated on the first level and was inaugurated in February 2016. Several options are available to students, including a variety of delectable pizzas, pasta, salads, and more. Seven classrooms, a patio outside, and administrative and faculty offices are also located on the lower floors. Allison Hall A short distance from the classroom on Main Street is Allison Hall, a six-story housing complex. Each student's room in Allison Hall has a twin bed and mattress, a chest of drawers, and an armoire. A mini refrigerator and television with a basic cable connection are provided in each bedroom. There are no kitchens or kitchenettes in Allison Hall. Thus, all occupants are required to be on the meal plan. The flat has a bathroom and central air conditioning. Every level features a common space with cable TV accessible to students at all hours of the day and night for study and socialising. The building also offers a laundry room, computer lounge, and fitness center. Safety is offered consistently. Standard Apartments Apartment-style dorms are available at Monroe College in the heart of New Rochelle, just steps from the academic building. Apartments provide double or triple bedrooms and full kitchens with a refrigerator, stove, sink, microwave, cabinets, and dining table and chairs. A common space with a couch, chairs, coffee table, and television with basic cable is a feature of every apartment. The bedrooms are outfitted with a twin bed, a chest of drawers, and an armoire in spaces without a closet. To know more, click: https://www.monroecollege.edu/student-life/new-rochelle-ny-campus/housing-options

Name: St Francis College
Overview: With an ethnically diverse student population of more than 2,413, St. Francis College is focused on providing quality education and service-oriented leadership to help students excel in their careers. Located in Brooklyn Heights, New York, minutes from Manhattan, this institution is popularly known as one of the most affordable private colleges in this region. It boasts 19 academic departments in total which comprise over 72 major and minor fields of study, from Communication Arts to Medical Technology, Nursing, Liberal Arts, and so on.  Accredited by Middle States Commission on Higher Education, the college held a ranking of #501-600 in US Rankings 2018. Even though the total cost of attendance varies depending on the course students choose, the annual full-time cost remains around $49,598. This includes all the necessary aspects, from study materials to room and boarding, etc. However, 97% of St. Francis College students receive financial aid including state grants, federal loans, etc. to finance their education costs. The admission process gets slightly competitive and the acceptance rate is 77%.  Students applying to this college are required to be academically sound; hold a decent high school GPA and SAT score (preferably between 920 and 1200) and must score 21 on their ACTs. The college possesses an exceptional faculty and a student to faculty ratio of 15:1. This is one of the primary reasons why its full-time retention rate stays at 77%. The campus life at St. Francis College is quite interesting as students get several facilities from the institution’s end. From on-campus housing facilities to access to 21 NCAA Division I athletic teams, the college has so many things to offer. It boasts a strong alumni network with popular names like William G. Parrett, Brendan J. Dugan, Peter King, etc.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Entry RequirementsStudents with a GPA of 71 or higher in high school will be fully admitted to the university (with the exception of the nursing program). On a case-by-case basis, students with a GPA of 65 to 70 may be considered for our conditional entry programme.

Name: University of Massachusetts Lowell (UMass Lowell)
Overview: Incorporated in 1894, University of Massachusetts Lowell is a nationally ranked research university situated in the historic mill city of Lowell on the Merrimack River. This institute has received accreditation from the New England Commission of Higher Education (NECHE). It is also a member of several associations of higher education - American Association of Colleges of Nursing, Council of Colleges of Arts and Sciences, National University Continuing Education Association, College Entrance Examination Board and many others. As per U.S. News & World Report, University of Massachusetts Lowell 2022 ranking was 179 in the National Universities category. It also ranked 112 in the Best Colleges for Veterans category. The Fall 2020 acceptance rate of this institute was 75%. About half of the candidates admitted to this institute possess an ACT score of 23 and 29 and a SAT score between 1150 and 1320. Students pursuing undergraduate majors at UMass Lowell's can transition to master's programs. They can opt to pursue undergraduate majors and minors in several areas - Applied Biomedical Sciences, American Studies, Biochemistry Option: Chemistry, Bioinformatics: Interdisciplinary, Clinical Option: Exercise Science, Art History, Criminal Justice, etc. Besides these, UMass Lowell offers over 100 areas for graduate study. The total University of Massachusetts Lowell fee for undergraduate for in-state students that is payable annually for the year 2021-2022 lies in the range $29,000 to $29,300. For undergraduate out-of-state, this amount ranges between $47,000 and $47,300. This institute also extends financial assistance to its students. The total aid awarded is valued over $192 million. The average mid-career salary of the graduates of this university lies in the range of $109,000 to $109,500. Around 95% of this institute’s graduates either receive employment in their respective field or pursue advanced studies within six months of acquiring their degree. As per Payscale.com, alumni of this institute receive one of the highest returns on their college investment nationally.

Name: Oklahoma State University
Overview: Oklahoma State University, located in Stillwater, is a public university in the US. They were established in 1890 as Oklahoma Agricultural and Mechanical College by the university. More access to college education is the main motto of the college. The university offers around 200 undergraduate programs, 79 masters programs, and 45 doctoral programs. The Stillwater campus at Oklahoma is the institution main campus, and OSU additionally has four campus locations. The campus in Tulsa offers degrees, research programs and is the center for health sciences. The campus in Oklahoma City is a technical college offering two-year degree programs. Library access is provided on-campus and off-campus for students. The undergraduate programs offered are in agriculture, engineering & technology, veterinary medicine, and business. The top courses of the university are the masters program in MSc management, M.Sc. computer science, MS mechanical & aerospace engineering, and MS business analytics & data science. The tuition fee for the UG course is USD 28,220 and USD 18,903 for the PG course. The university offers on-campus accommodation facilities to the students in 31 residential halls in suits, deluxe suites, and apartments. The accommodation fee ranges between USD 9,340 to 11,310 depending on the residence, room type, and amenities. The central campus, spread across 700 acres, provides a recreational room consisting of training areas, basketball and volleyball courts. The college has around 500 student clubs and organizations. Community engagement and extension service engages students in leadership and management of resource facilities. The university offers financial aid in the form of grants, loans, and scholarships. The scholarships are offered based on GPA, leadership and community service, written essays, and interviews. The college offers career services that allow students to seek internships and placements in their field of interest.

Name: George Mason University
Overview: Established in 1972, George Mason University is the largest public research university in Fairfax, Virginia. Under the presidency of Gregory Washington, the university offers 211 degree programs, including master's, doctoral, professional levels, and graduate-level certificate courses. Students from more than 130 countries are enrolled in the ten colleges and schools of the university and have access to 500 student organization groups. Mason holds the highest rank amongst doctoral universities and is highly reputed in law, economics, and research. It offers 38 doctoral degrees, 78 UG and 94 master's degrees, and a law school. The estimated budget or the Cost of Attendance (COA) for a full-time in-state undergraduate student is approximately $13,000, while for an out-state student is $36,474. The cost for graduates is slightly less, which is $ 9,446 for a full-time in-state student and $25,430 for a full-time out-state student. Almost 60% of students at Mason receive financial aid through grants, scholarships, and loans. Offering more than 4,000 internship opportunities via the HireMason database of the university, students have interned in the White House Internship Program, ESPN Wide World of Sports Complex, and other places. 80% of students in Mason get employed within six months of competition for their respective degrees.

Placement: Mason is dedicated to training students for fulfilling jobs in an increasingly globalised world. Internships are valuable opportunities to obtain experience in the actual world of work while also learning knowledge and skills by applying classroom theories to real-world challenges. All Mason students are encouraged to do at least one internship before graduation in order to improve their job prospects and earning potential. You can clarify professional goals, get résumé-building experience, and become a stronger candidate when applying for full-time jobs and graduate school by working in your chosen field before graduating. Experiential learning can pave the way for future job chances. You may also be able to receive transcript recognition for a paid internship or co-op that is not for academic credit. Major companies which recruit from GMU are Nestle, Amazon, World Bank Group, Disney, Apple, Marriott, Microsoft, Accenture etc.
Accommodation: The university provides a safe and peaceful place for students where they can have the best time of their lives. With over 40 residence halls to choose from, including regular rooms, suites, and apartments, you'll be able to choose a home that fits your needs.Although some students reside in suites, the majority of freshmen dwell in standard rooms. Suite-style or apartment-style halls are available to all upper-class students. The houses are divided into three neighbourhoods: Aquia, Rappahannock, and Shenandoah, with professional and student personnel ensuring that you have access to the tools you require to live the life you desire.Each community, as well as the Mason Global Center, has a service desk that is staffed seven days a week, 24 hours a day.Housing also provides a variety of services, including free laundry, Wi-Fi, and TV. Suites There are eight suite-style halls with different floor plans. Some suites contain bedrooms that are accessible from the main corridor and share a bathroom with one or more additional rooms. Others have hallway entrances and contain two to four bedrooms, with up to four people sharing a bathroom.Bedrooms are available in doubles, singles, or triples. Only a few units offer kitchenettes (sink, microwave, small refrigerator). If you live in a suite, though, you must purchase a meal plan. Suite-style buildings include:Piedmont / Tidewater / Blue Ridge / SandbridgeEastern ShoreHampton RoadsAngel Cabrera Global CenterWhitetop Apartments Approximately half of our upper-class residential students live in one of our five apartment-style buildings, which provide a choice of floor configurations. These completely furnished flats come with full kitchens, dining spaces, living rooms, baths, and a mix of bedrooms that range from two singles to two doubles and two singles. The majority of the units can accommodate four people, while some may accommodate two, five, or six. All of the bedrooms can accommodate one, two, or three people.You can purchase a voluntary meal plan if you reside in an apartment, but it is not compulsory. Apartment-style buildings include:Liberty SquareNorthern NeckPotomac HeightsRogersTownhouses For more information, visit: https://housing.gmu.edu/

Name: University of Toledo
Overview: A public research university in Toledo, Ohio, the University of Toledo was established in 1872. It functions as the northernmost campus of the University System of Ohio and remains invested in guiding the present of its students in order to mould their futures into a success story. The academic structure of the university is organized into Aon College of Adult and Lifelong Learning, College of Arts and Letters, College of Business and Innovation, School of Healthcare Business Enterprise and Innovation, College of Health and Human Services, Judith Herb College of Education, College of Engineering, College of Graduate Studies, College of Health Sciences, College of Law, College of Medicine and Life Sciences. With a 96% acceptance rate, the university becomes a quality institution offering over 300 undergraduate and graduate degree programs. Some of the highly ranked courses offered at the university belong from the Occupational Therapy, Engineering, Business, and Law programs. The university hosts a nourishing academic and cultural environment for thousands of students so that they can enjoy an inclusive and diverse college life. The average annual tuition and accommodation fee can come around $ 29K but through many of the scholarships provided by the college, the cost can be brought down to $ 16K. Spread across 1,423 acres of beautiful land the university campus houses libraries, visual art centres, museums, parks, athletic centres, health centres, recreation centres, and residence halls. With a brilliant alumni network of notable alumni positioned at the apex of leading industries, it also ensures a promising placement rate for the graduating batch.

Accommodation: Unless a residency exemption request form has been filed and granted by the Office of Residence Life, students who come to The University of Toledo directly from high school are obliged to live in a university residence hall and participate in the food plan programme. For the first two years of their studies at UToledo, these students must live on campus.Domestic and international students share the Horton International House. This seven-story, air-conditioned structure in the heart of UToledo's campus has glass-enclosed lounge rooms, a computer lab, laundry facilities, a multipurpose room, and many locations for cultural presentations. For students with special religious traditions, a ceremonial washroom is also available.for more information click on this link-https://www.utoledo.edu/admission/international/housing.html

The University of Toledo's PG Engineering & Technology courses are ranked by US News & World Report among its numerous specialities, while THE lists them in the 251-300 range for the year 2021. Additionally, in 2021, the overall ranks had a 32-point increase. Rankings at the international and national levels are based on 2020 admissions to the University of Toledo, which had a 95% acceptance rate and higher final ACT or SAT test scores.The University of Toledo is ranked by THE in the 601–800 range for 2021, with no change from the range for 2020. THE reports a student-to-faculty ratio of 15:1 and a 10% acceptance rate for international students to the University of Toledo in 2020. In contrast, the ratio of female to male students in the prior intake was 51:49.

Name: Bryant University
Overview: Bryant University, earlier known as Bryant College, is a private university founded in the year 1863. With a campus size of 428 acres, it is located in Smithfield, Rhode Island, in the USA. It has 2 colleges - The College of Arts and Sciences and The College of Business. Bryant College offers both UG and PG courses but chosen mostly for Business Discipline. The major popular courses in this university are Finance, Accounting and Marketing. The College also offers other certificate programs that will aid in the success of the students. Bryant University is accredited by the New England Association of Schools and Colleges and AACSB International and has academic affiliations with Space Grant. The fee structure comes to around USD 46,885 per year. The University has a Student-Faculty ratio of 13:1 and also provides various financial aids and need-based scholarships. There are also multiple Club Sports and intramural teams throughout the academic year. They are the Member of the Northeast Conference and have 22 intercollegiate varsity athletic programs, out of which 11 for men and 11 for women. In addition, there are various other clubs for students to engage themselves in their college life. Bryant University provides residence throughout the academic year like dormitories, suites and townhouse apartments with all basic amenities and wireless internet connection. Bryant Students can participate in housing selection every Spring. Students from over 60 countries like India and China study at Bryant University. The Office of International Students and Scholars will help the students regarding Immigration and Visa problems. On tie-up with Amica Centre for career education, the College excels in placements with 99% of students employed within 6 months of their graduation with a starting salary of USD 57,600. They also provide internships with various global firms like BBC Worldwide, Coca-Cola, etc., which will give exposure to the students.

Name: State University of New York at Plattsburgh (SUNY Plattsburgh)
Overview: Established in 1889 and situated in Plattsburgh, New York, the State University of New York at Plattsburgh is a public college and approved by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education and certified by the Board of Regents of the University of the State of New York. It is considered one of the top-notch universities in New York, with a student population of nearly 4, 870 undergraduates and approximately 387 graduates. This university offers undergraduate and graduate courses with approximately 60 baccalaureate degrees and a wide range of minor programs. All the essential courses offered at this university are taught by expert professionals who hold top-notch post-doctoral degrees. This university was renamed Plattsburgh State Normal and Training School and is now home to many international students across 70 countries. The variety of courses of this university include expeditionary studies, human development and family relations, biology to broadcast journalism, music, nutrition, environmental studies, criminal justice, medical technology and more. With more than 70+ academic programs, this college offers a comprehensive range of internship programs at several reputed organisations in the US and abroad. The State University of New York at Plattsburgh provides an English Bridge Program to assist students in improving their English Language skills and preparing them for full-time academic study. Aspiring students willing to take admission in this university need to pay an application fee of approximately 50 USD, and the international graduate and undergraduate fees range from 35, 979.28 USD- 42, 099.28 USD, respectively. Besides, this institution also offers a wide range of scholarships for international students ranging from 2,000 USD- 1, 000 USD. As per US News& World Report 2021, this university holds the 75th position in Regional Universities and also ranked between 501-600th in the Times Higher Education.

Name: Babson College
Overview: Established in 1919, Babson College is a private business college situated in Wellesley, Massachusetts. The college has four campuses spread across Wellesley, Boston, San Francisco, and Miami. The main residential campus in Wellesley includes a student center, cafeteria, library, fitness center, and art center. The Boston campus in High Street, with classrooms, event space, the college office, and resources. It has a graduate center for career development and offers graduate programs. The San Francisco campus offers MBA programs. The Miami campus in Florida has programs in MBA, master of science in business and analytics (MSBA), and certificate in advance management (CAM). The college offers undergraduate programs in accounting & law, economics, entrepreneurship, finance, history & society, management, marketing, math & science, and operations and information management. The college offers a master's program in full-time and part-time master of science in business analytics, master of science in finance, and master of science in management in entrepreneurial leadership. The popular courses offered are business & management, applied & pure science, humanities, creative arts and design, and MBA. The college offers some excellent facilities to its students, including 22 varsity sports programs. A wide range of intramural sports is available for undergraduate and graduate students, depending on the level of interest, facility space, and equipment needs. The college has over 100 student clubs and organizations on campus by engaging the students in various opportunities to students who share the same passions and interests. The average tuition fee per annum ranges between USD 54,600 to 89,550. The institution has 18 residence halls and housing facilities with Wi-fi connections, electricity, cleaning services, etc. The college also provides off-campus housing facilities. The overall cost of living is around USD 13,788. The Babson research showcases faculty's research projects, curriculum development, and case writing activities. The college provides career services in developing an action-oriented, entrepreneurial mindset preparing its students for employment purposes. Babson College offers excellent placement opportunities for its students.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate programmes are open to students who have completed at least 12 years of high school education. Students who want to apply for postgraduate programmes must have a bachelor's degree or a certificate that is comparable. International students must also submit their SAT or ACT results in addition to these basic academic requirements. Students who are not from an English-speaking nation must also take English proficiency tests such as the TOEFL, IELTS, and PTE.English Language RequirementsIELTS : 7.0TOEFL (i-BT) : 100PTE : 65Official test scoresSAT : 1270 - 1490ACT : 27 - 36GPA : 3.6 or higher

Name: Florida State University
Overview: Established in 1851, Florida State University is the oldest site of higher education in Florida. The main campus of Florida State University is located in Tallahassee and branched out in Panama, London, Italy, Europe, Latin America, Asia, and Spain. The university aims to preserve and expand education in arts, science, technology, profession, etc. and is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools (SACS). The average tuition fee is between USD 18,799 and 20,043. The university is spread across 1,428 acres and provides several athletic services like a recreational centre, intramural sports, sports club, bowling arena, and various outdoor opportunities. The campus has facilities like a library, high-speed internet, and IT services. The university offers housing through 18 residential halls. The residence halls provide suites, apartments, kitchens, living rooms, and facilities, including furniture and wifi services. The living expense annually is about USD 16,890. The Office of Distance Learning upholds students, educators, and administrators to seek excellence in online course improvement, teaching, and learning. The university offers financial aid for international students, like national merit finalists, presidential scholarship programs, and out-of-state tuition waiver scholarships. The career centre at the university assists students at every stage of the career development process. The service organizes counselling, career fairs, and networking events for the students.

Name: Princeton University
Overview: Princeton University is a private Ivy League research university in New Jersey. It was established in 1746 and is the 4th oldest higher education institution. It has an acceptance rate of around 6%, with an average undergraduate enrollment of 5,267 students, a graduate enrollment of 2,946 students, and a faculty of 1,100 members. The university consists of 42 degree-granting departments, and the undergraduate program offers a Bachelor of Arts (A.B.) or a Bachelor of Science in Engineering (B.S.E.) with a choice of 37 concentrations. Some fields of study available here include Anthropology, Molecular Biology, Economics, Politics, etc. The Princeton University campus spans over 600 acres in metropolitan New Jersey and houses about 96% of its students. Furthermore, students must live in residential colleges for their first two years. The 6 Princeton University residential colleges famous for organizing freshman seminars, excursions, dances, movie nights, barbecues, and inter-college sports competitions are:ForbesRockefellerFirst CollegeMatheyButlerWhitmanThe Princeton University undergraduate cost of attendance is USD 77,690, inclusive of the tuition, room charge, board rate, and miscellaneous expenses. On the other hand, the graduate school tuition costs are USD 56,470. Princeton University has a unique financial aid system. The university only grants financial assistance based on need, and no merit-based scholarships are available. Even for international students, the cost of attendance has been reduced to USD 13,450 owing to financial aid. The university has over 300 student organizations, 17 chaplaincies, and 37 sports clubs when it comes to extracurriculars. There are numerous campus resources like The Pace Center for Civic Engagement, Davis International Center, and the Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender (LGBT) Center for students looking for support and empowerment.

Name: Jacksonville University
Overview: Jacksonville University, founded in 1934, is a non-profit private university in Jacksonville, Florida. The university was earlier known as Jacksonville Junior College. With more than 100 majors, minors and programs at the undergraduate level, the College also provides 23 master's and doctorate programmes. Name: Santa Ana College
Overview: Established as a public community college in 1915, Santa Ana College is situated in Santa Ana, California. This is primarily a mid-size institution with nearly 5 110 undergraduate students. The institution serves about 40,000 credit and non-credit students each semester and offers almost 136 associate and degree programs. Additionally, this college is widely recognized for its comprehensive range of academic programs and top-notch student services. Some significant popular courses include Fire protection and prevention, Liberal Arts and Humanities, International business, etc. With an enrolment of nearly 28425 students, this college follows a semester-based year. Students can explore 29 different fields and achieve degrees and certificates. Besides, an associate degree is one of the highest degrees offered by this college. The popular programs offered by this college include Multi/Interdisciplinary Studies, Business Management, Marketing, etc. Additionally, this college sponsors 18 sports programs. The in-state tuition fees of this college range from $1,000-$1,500, and the out-state tuition fee is $8,000-$9,000. The institution offers education for academic transfer and careers, specialized professional and personal development courses, customized training for industry and business, and professional training to train firefighters, nurses, and law enforcement personnel. Among 15 community colleges in California, Santa Ana is the only college that offers a Bachelor’s degree in occupational therapy. The graduates are engaged in manufacturing, health care services, digital media, information and computing, and a satisfactory graduate employment rate. This college offers eligible students financial aid and scholarships to pursue their courses without interruption. The acceptance rate of this college is nearly 100%.

Name: Adler university
Overview: Rudolf Dreikur founded the institute of Adlerian Psychology in 1952 in Chicago, naming it after the physician and psychiatrist Alfred Adler. It was renamed Adler University in 2015. In the field of teaching psychology, Adler University is the oldest independent school in the North American continent. Adler University provides degrees in the master of Psychology in collaboration with the Ontario Ministry of Advanced Education and Skill Development, making it the only such degree in Ontario. The two campuses of the university are in Vancouver and Chicago, and it maintains collegiate relations with other Adler institutions - The Graduate School in Minnesota, Adler University in Chicago and Vancouver. Adler University is a private independent organisation that provides degrees in the fields of Psychology, Professional Coaching, Psychotherapy and Mental Health Counseling. It was established to promote independent thinking and bring positive change within society. Adler University offers a master's degree in Counselling Psychology; Counselling Psychology in Art Therapy; Counselling Psychology in School and Youth Concentration; Industrial and Organisational Psychology; Public Policy and Organisation; and a Doctorate in Clinical Psychology (Psy.D).The accommodation facilities are available within the campus, and the residency time of the students depends on the requirement of the course they study because it can help them learn better. The program tuition and administration fees at Adler University cost an average of about $46,800 (depending on the course).
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility criteria a student should meet in order to be considered for admission are: A baccalaureate degree, by the date of matriculation, earned from an accredited college or university, or an equivalent degree from an international college or universityA Grade Point Average (GPA) of 3.0 or better on a 4.0 scale in their baccalaureate degreeEnglish language proficiency test English language proficiency requirements are:

Accommodation: Adler University will make every effort to ensure that qualifying students with disabilities have access to all of the university's programmes, activities, services, and facilities. The AVPSA accomplishes this in part by arranging for specific student lodgings. A student with a disability should provide the AVPSA with current proof of the impairment, functional limitations caused by the disability, and recommendations for particular adjustments in order to obtain accommodations. The AVPSA and the student will collaborate to determine any necessary academic changes, auxiliary aids and services, and/or other reasonable accommodations. For its courses, programmes, activities, and services, Adler University has the authority to define credentials and other relevant norms and requirements. With or without appropriate accommodations, all students are expected to satisfy these key qualifications, criteria, and requirements. For more information, visit: https://www.adler.edu/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Americans-with-Disabilities-Act-Policy.pdf

Overview: Fort Myers, Florida, has a private, nonprofit university called Hodges University. Hodges University was founded in 1990 as International College and was renamed in 2007 in honour of a $12 million endowment from residents Earl and Thelma Hodges. Classes and operations were moved to Fort Myers from the Hodges University campus in Naples, Florida, in 2021. Hodges provides several certificate programmes, including associate, bachelor's, master's, and other degree programmes. The Dr Peter Thomas Veterans Services Center, the Frances Pew Hayes Center for Lifelong Learning, and the Center for Diversity, Inclusion, and Cultural Competency are all run by Hodges University. Hodges University has awarded more than 10,000 degrees since its founding in 1990. The university is organized into five colleges: Fisher School of Technology, Johnson School of Business, Nichols School of Professional Studies, School of Health Sciences and School of General StudiesThe average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. The estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student, is around 13,26,285 INR. Hodges University offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship.

Name: University of Texas at Arlington
Overview: Arlington, Texas, is home to the University of Texas at Arlington. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Business. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programs for distance education students. A total of 420 acres make up the university campus. Along with housing and eating options, the campus provides all the amenities needed for the students. As student enrollment increased, the university decided to expand its campus and create more buildings, such as Nedderman Hall, Arlington Hall, CAPPA building, Texas Hall, the Common Room, the Engineering Research Building, and the College of Business. The university's academic program comprises various courses broken up into several colleges and schools, such as the College of Education, Science, Nursing and Health, and the School of Social Work. The College of Engineering, College of Business, College of Liberal Arts, College of Architecture, Planning & Public Affairs, and College of Education. 180 undergraduate and graduate programs are available through the university. Many business experts come to the institution for interactive sessions, guest lectures, and hands-on seminars. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship.The University of Texas at Arlington offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. Read more details about the University of Texas at Arlington on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.

Name: University of Bridgeport

The University of Bridgeport is accredited by the New England Commission of Higher Education and the Connecticut Department of Higher Education Board of Governors.There are 3 colleges on campus: the College of Health Sciences, Engineering, Business and Education and College of Arts and Sciences. Very popular UG majors and graduate programmes in this university are in Business, Education, Engineering, Acupuncture and Nutrition, and other doctorate programs in Education, Naturopathic Medicine and Chiropractic. They follow a semester-based academic calendar.The overall tuition fee at the University of Bridgeport is around 35,000 USD. The total expenses for room and boarding come to around 17,000 USD. About 99% of students receive financial aid, academic scholarships, need-based awards and additional merit-based scholarships up to 20.000 USD. The average cost of living would come to around 6600 USD per year.

Name: Western Kentucky University
Overview: Western Kentucky University is a public university in Bowling Green, Kentucky, United States, established in 1906. Bowling Green is the university's main campus, and the university has three more regional campuses located at Elizabethtown- Fort Knox, Glasgow, and Owensboro. The campus is spread across 200 acres, housing five academic colleges; the Gordon Ford College of Business, Ogden College of Science And Engineering, and Potter College of Arts and Letters. The university offers around 170 undergraduate programs and 125 graduate programs. The graduate and certificate programs are mainly in accountancy, arts, education, business administration, health & public administration, sciences, social work, physical therapy, and psychology. It offers undergraduate programs in arts, fine arts, interdisciplinary studies, music, science, nursing, and social work. The tuition fee is USD 24,496 per annum. West Kentucky University has men and women athletic teams in basketball, swimming, and football. The university has active 33 organizations on campus to promote social responsibilities and civic involvements of the students. Students are engaged in volunteering in Bowling Green, Warren County, and the surrounding areas, and many of our departments sponsor programs that benefit the community. The university has on-campus housing including hotels, suite-style residence halls, and a community. The campus has around 18 residence halls providing all basic amenities to the students. The amenities include a full kitchen and dining equipped, private washer, dryer, wifi access, etc. The university also has three only female residence halls. The average cost of living, including meals and rooms, is USD 11,467. The university uses a handshake career system to place its students with multinational companies and other companies. The career system allows the students to surf and apply online for various jobs and helps in enhancing their employable skills.
Eligibility Overview: Official transcripts of a high school diploma or a college diploma, or an equivalent. A minimum 2.5 GPA and a CAI score of 60 are necessary. The granting university or Board must certify these transcripts.Undergraduate students under the age of 21 must provide a SAT (460) or ACT (20) score, while graduate students must submit GMAT or GRE scores.For undergraduate international non-native English speaking applicants, IELTS 6.0 and TOEFL iBT 71 are required, and for graduate applications, IELTS 6.5 and TOEFL iBT 79 are required.To be submitted is an international certification of finances.Purpose Statement,
Placement: Handshake is a career placement system used by the university to place students with multinational and other firms. The career system allows students to search for and apply for employment online, as well as improve their employability skills.Internship opportunities with other companies are also available through the institution.In comparison to the national average of USD 33,028 per year, 91 percent of college students are able to find work within two years of graduation, earning roughly USD 34,700 per year.The university's career services assist students in honing their talents so that they can find work.Fulbright, Ohio Republican Party, Heaven Hill Distillery Brookings, and Run Switch Public Relations are just a handful of the well-known companies that often hire University students.
Accommodation: On-campus accommodation is available, including Community, Hotel, and Suite-style residence halls.The average annual cost is between $5,000 and $6,000 US dollars.The percentage of first-year and second-year students who stay on campus is 52 percent and 26 percent, respectively, but the percentage of seniors who stay on campus is around 8.The university includes three female-only residence halls, one of which is reserved for senior students.The campus is one of the safest places to reside, with liquor law breaches falling by 41% between 2016 and 2018.The students have access to all essential services in the 18 residential halls, including free washers and dryers.

Name: Aurora University

Placement: The link between students, alumni, and employers is important to Western New England University. The Kevin S. and Sandra E. Delbridge Career Center provides a variety of information and services to assist students and businesses in their career search.  Some Employer partners are : Clean Water Action, The Hangover Insurance Group, Monsoon Savings, ISO New England, Autism Care Partners etc. to name a few.
Accommodation: On-Campus AccommodationYou can meet with your classmates while living on campus in ways that can lead to lifelong connections and memories. From standard double occupancy halls to suites, flats, and townhouses, as you get closer to graduation and the life of a young professional, WNE offers alternatives that change as you advance through your studies. As long as there is space available, graduate, law, pharmacy, or doctoral students may continue to live on campus in Gateway Village Apartments.  1. First-Year students The University's classic first-year students' residential halls, like "The Quad" (Berkshire, Franklin, and Hampden Halls), or Windham Hall, will be your first on-campus housing experience. Depending on their learning interest community (LIC) or other housing needs and interests, some freshmen may also reside at Commonwealth Hall. Additionally, we provide first-year students with a limited quantity of premium singles on a first-come, first-served basis. The residence halls provided by the university are as follows: Quad Halls The "Quad" of residence halls comprises Berkshire Hall, Hampden Hall, and Franklin Hall. The quad halls have double occupancy rooms, a shared bathroom on each floor, and a building-wide shared laundry room. Each has a lounge with a TV, a kitchenette, and entertainment options. Tile floors and moveable furnishings are features of university housing. These halls are usually reserved for first-year students. The structures have air conditioning. Windham Hall For those first-year students who choose to live in three-person groups, Windham Hall also offers a limited number of triple rooms. There is a lounge with a television in the middle of the hallway. A washing facility, a study lounge, and a recreational space are also available in the common areas. Rooms have carpeting and movable furnishings. The structure has air conditioning.  2. Sophomore Year Sophomores have the option to live in Commonwealth Hall, Evergreen Village, the LaRiviere Center, Gateway Village, or Southwood Hall. Commonwealth Hall A variety of sophomores, juniors, seniors, and transfer students are housed at Commonwealth Hall. First-year students may choose to reside in a Commonwealth learning interest community. Each corridor has a kitchenette, laundry, and semi-private, individual-use restrooms. Each floor's "core" community centre contains a multipurpose room with a recreation area.  LaRiviere Center For juniors, sophomores, and seniors who choose to reside in suite-style accommodation, LaRiviere Center is an option. A multipurpose lounge, conference room, academic classrooms, and a computer lab make up the building's central portion. Students are housed in four suites—four double rooms—on each coed floor wing, three of which can hold six people, and one may hold eight. There are two private bathrooms in each suite. Each suite contains a "living area" with couches, a table and chairs, built-in cabinets, a full-size refrigerator, and counter space. The inhabitants are in charge of maintaining and caring for the suite. A dedicated study room, extra seating, recreational equipment, and laundry facilities are all part of the floor wing community living space, which all floor wing residents use. 3. Junior & Senior Years With full kitchens, bedrooms, living rooms, and bathrooms, Gateway Village Apartments, Evergreen Village Townhouses, and Southwood Hall Apartments provide upper-class students with the perfect setting to prepare for life after graduation. Gateway Village Apartments at Gateway Village provide living quarters for two to six students. Depending on available space, Gateway primarily houses juniors, seniors, and a small number of sophomores. The layouts of Gateway apartments might be efficiency, one bedroom, two bedrooms, or three bedrooms. Each apartment has a furnished living room, a private bathroom, and kitchen appliances. The maintenance and repair of a resident's living space is entirely their responsibility. Gateway Village contains an outdoor entertainment area and a communal laundry room. The property has a section of flats set aside for graduate housing. The apartment buildings in Gateway Village now have air conditioning. Tile floors may be found in every student unit in Gateway Village. Evergreen Village Students at Evergreen Village can live in two-story townhouse apartments with three bedrooms, double occupancy, and space for six students. Each townhouse apartment in the complex predominantly houses senior citizens and features a living room, kitchen, full bathroom, and half bathroom. The townhouse units include carpeting and tile floors in the kitchen, and the furniture is freestanding. The maintenance and repair of a resident's living space is entirely their responsibility. A multifunctional building at Evergreen Village has a study area, a recreation area, a social area, and laundry facilities. The building has air conditioning. Southwood Hall The newest addition to our housing options is Southwood Hall. The corridor-style residence hall with apartments for four students is close to the athletic fields. Each apartment has a bathroom, kitchen, living room, and two double or four single occupancy bedrooms. Tile floors and freestanding furniture are features of the units. There is a sizable first-floor lounge, a recreation area, and laundry facilities. Most upper-class (junior and senior) residents live in the hall. For more information, visit: https://www1.wne.edu/residence-life/housing/residence-areas.cfm Graduate Housing Graduate students can take advantage of on-campus living at Western New England University's Gateway Village apartment complex. A one- to a three-person apartment can accommodate different numbers of people. Each occupant of shared living space has a separate bedroom. The appropriate residency charge includes the price of utilities (heat, hot water, and electricity), as well as wireless internet service. For more information, visit: https://www1.wne.edu/residence-life/housing/graduate-housing.cfm

Name: University of the Incarnate Word
Overview: The University of the Incarnate Word is a Catholic and private institution. It offers students 20 graduate and 90 undergraduate courses and doctoral degrees. The University of Incarnate Word was established in 1881 by the "Sisters of Charity of the Incarnate Word." The main campus of the university is situated in San Antonio, Texas. It has a huge campus of 154 acres and is home to more than 5,827 students. It also offers online educational programs for distance learning. It has skilled and professional academic faculty with a ratio of 11:1. There are around 11 schools under the university's control. Students are admitted based on their GMAT or GRE score. Along with that, they should also have proficiency in the English language. The popular subjects offered by the University of the Incarnate Word are business, music therapy, criminal justice, nursing, medicine, psychology, theatre, and many more. The campus has a pharmacy school, research labs, and writing and learning centres. It is also a renowned institution for organizing various sports tournaments. It has around 23 sports teams for volleyball, basketball, soccer, and many more. The graduates get hired by various multinational companies after completing their education. The University of the Incarnate Word offers its alumni several discounts on suites, hotels, and facilities.For those attending the university, the average cost of living for one year is estimated to be around $49,000. More than 94% of students receive scholarships and financial aid every year. Students who maintain a 3.0 GPA can receive scholarships from $5,000 to $20,000.

Course Description: University of Dayton is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. University of Dayton was founded in 1850. Name: New York Institute of Technology
Overview: The New York Institute of Technology is a university located in Old Westbury, USA. Old Westbury is home to the main campus of the New York Institute of Technology. Since its founding in 1955, students have had access to various undergraduate, graduate, certificate, and online degree programs.The University offers 11 undergraduate programs and 14 postgraduate programs. Its learning is based on a variety of subject areas, including engineering. New York Institute of Technology provides residential accommodations in its Manhattan residence hall. Each room has a private toilet, a bed, a closet, a desk, a full-sized refrigerator, a microwave, and individually adjustable air conditioning.The institution also has a team dedicated to career planning that assists students in developing their resumes and locating employment, whether it be an internship, part-time work, a summer job, or a position after graduation.For various courses, the average cost of attendance for domestic and international students may vary. The spring term 2023 fee is $19,980. The New York Institute of Technology provides students with financial aid, work-study opportunities, and scholarships.Read more details about the New York Institute of Technology on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.
Eligibility Overview: Admission RequirementsB.S. degree or its equivalent from an accredited college or university in computer science, engineering, management, mathematics, information technology, liberal arts, and related areas.Minimum undergraduate GPA of 2.85 for full matriculation.GRE scores
Placement: Alumni Placement New York Tech takes a keen interest in the careers of its graduates. Six months following graduation, all New York Tech alumni receive Final Destination Surveys, which are compared to US Department of Labor statistics and quarterly Placement Council reports. According to survey results, 95% of New York Tech graduates get jobs in their specialties or enrol in graduate school within six months of graduation.  A lifetime engagement with New York Tech's Office of Career Success and Experimental Education provides alumni with the benefit of professional growth. Alumni looking for new job prospects can use Handshake, New York Tech's online career site, which allows users to book appointments with career advisors, upload résumés, search for employers, and apply for jobs.
Accommodation: Millions of people aspire to live (and leave their imprint) in the heart of New York City. Make that goal a reality by living in one of the city's most active areas at New York Tech's safe and secure Manhattan residence hall. It is staffed by a graduate hall director and resident assistants and is only a short bus or metro ride from school. Why Choose On-Campus?Live and learn in one of New York City's most vibrant neighbourhoods on the Upper East Side of Manhattan. 1760 Third, at 97th Street and Third Avenue, is an easy bus or subway ride from New York Tech's campus, offers 24/7 onsite security and maintenance; communal kitchen, fitness, social and study areas; and rooms for New York Tech students on designated floors. All rooms are furnished with a bed, closet, desk, full-size refrigerator, microwave, and individually controlled air conditioning and feature a private bathroom.
Course Ranking: Five schools and two colleges make up the New York Institute of Technology, all of which place a strong emphasis on technology and applied scientific research. When it comes to subject rankings, New York Tech's business programme has received high marks. For students interested in pursuing UG Business at the University, the university was ranked at 273 by US News & World Report in 2021. Prior rankings for the University's UG Business were 292 in 2020 and 312 in 2019. In addition to other considerations, the approach used by US News & World Report to rank subjects includes consideration of student selection (25%), the views of business school administrators (25%), and job outcome (21%).

Eligibility Overview: A good result on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) taken within the recent two years. To be considered for admission, you must have a 500 on the paper-based TOEFL exam or a 61 on the internet-based (iBT) exam. Students who want to apply for a post-baccalaureate programme must have a paper-based TOEFL score of 550 or an iBT score of 79 or higher.Documentation proving successful completion of freshman-level English writing at a regionally approved American college or university in the United States, as well as an overall acceptable GPA. If it has been several years since the student last took English classes or if the student has returned to school, non-native English speakers may still be asked to take the TOEFL.A good verbal score on the ACT or SAT taken within the previous two years. To be considered for admission, you must have an ACT score of 18 or a SAT score of 430 (until 3/15/16) or 25 (effective 3/16/16).Within the last two years, an official and satisfactory result from the International English Language Testing Service. To be considered for admission, you must have a minimum IELTS score of 5.5 with sub-scores of 5.0 or better in reading and writing. If you want to apply for a post-baccalaureate programme, you must have an IELTS score of 6.5 or above.Completion of the American English Language Program at NKU with an average of at least 80% in each AELP class.
Accommodation: The Office for Student Accessibility's (OSA) purpose is to guarantee that qualifying students with disabilities have equitable access to academic and co-curricular programmes by providing reasonable accommodations and student-centered assistance. We aim to empower students with disabilities by encouraging self-advocacy and encouraging them to achieve maximum independence. OSA works to raise disability and access awareness among all members of the campus community and is committed to full participation of people with disabilities as defined by federal law.for more detail click on this link-https://inside.nku.edu/osa.html

Name: University of North Dakota
Overview: Established in 1883, the University of North Dakota is situated near Grand Forks, North Dakota, USA. The university has various campuses in the state- northern, central, western, and eastern. The University of Dakota offers students bachelor's, master's, postgraduate, doctoral, and professional programs. Some subjects include Engineering, Human Development, Business and Public Administration, Medicine, Nurses, Education, and many more. The average tuition fee can reach up to 25,000 USD. The total cost of living, which includes the hostel, books, miscellaneous, and technology fees, can reach around 37,000 USD per year. However, the university also provides scholarships and financial aid to students based on their academic performance. The University of Dakota has one of the best placement records in the state. Its graduates receive around 67000 USD as salary on average.
Eligibility Overview: Your application will not be accepted unless you can demonstrate that you have a sufficient command of both written and spoken English to be successful in University courses taught solely in English. Test results must be reported to the University of North Dakota's Undergraduate Admissions Office.6.0 on the IELTS (International English Language Testing System). IELTS scores must have been taken within the last three years to be accepted by UND.You'll need to retake the test if your IELTS results are older than two years.Duolingo English Test - 95 PTE Academic (Pearson Test of English Academic) - 50Or, if you complete ELS Language Centers' Intensive Level 112, the College Entrance Exam Board will provide you a certificate.

Name: East Carolina University
Overview: A public university, East Carolina University (ECU) was founded in 1907. Having a campus size of 1600 acres, this university is located in Greenville, North Carolina. The college is ranked 28th in Best Medical Schools ( US News and World Report) and has an acceptance rate of 79%. Not only for medical courses but ECU's College of Business belongs among the 5% of World Business Schools accredited by AACSB. The university offers undergraduate courses, master's programs, 15 doctoral programs, 50 graduate certificates, and 6 first-professional programs. Along with offline courses, it also offers about 100 online courses in the fields of business, healthcare, education, technology, and many more. Some of the popular courses that are opted by a lot of students include- MBA, Accounting, Biomedical Engineering, Computer Science, Anthropology, Biology, and Biomedical Sciences. The university provides on-campus accommodation for its students. The Division of Student Affairs takes care of the residence life. There are 15 types of college residence halls as well as College Hill Suites (CHS) available only for upper-division students. All the rooms in the residence halls include amenities bankable beds, air conditioning, and a small fridge. The ECU housings maintain a tobacco-free environment. The university campus has over 500 student organizations which include organizations in the field of tourism, hospitality, and sports management.The students on campus are also allowed to participate in outdoor adventure trips, fitness classes which include yoga, pilates, and various sports events. The fees including tuition fees, room and board, books and supplies, personal expenses, transportation, and loan fees for the undergraduate program is 39,592 USD and the graduate program is 34,758 USD. The Gamma Iota Sigma Scholarship, The Daniel Gluckman Scholarship, and The Page Family Scholarship are the few scholarships that the university provides to its students.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for freshman admission, you must have completed the following courses when you graduated from high school:English: 4 course units focusing on grammar, composition, and literature in English.Algebra I, Geometry, Algebra II, and a higher level mathematics course with Algebra II as a requirement.Natural Sciences: A living or biological science, a physical science, and a laboratory science are included in the three course units.Two course units in social studies are required, one of which must be US history.Two course units of a language other than English are required. Both have to be written in the same language (i.e., Spanish 1 & 2). Both American Sign Language and Latin are accepted at ECU.We strongly advise you to study a foreign language, mathematics, and a natural science course in addition to English during your senior year. These courses will better prepare you for the curriculum of your freshman year.If you did not meet all of the above minimal course requirements, please read the Transfer Admission Guidelines for information on how to get into ECU.If you graduated from a Cooperative Innovative High School (Early College), please read the Supplemental Notices for further information on your application possibilities.
Accommodation: This policy was developed by ECU in order to increase student retention. Students who live on campus return to school the next year at a higher rate and have a higher GPA than those who live off campus their first year.By submitting this waiver, the student will be required to enrol in a section of COAD 1000, ECU's freshman seminar class, in the first semester that they are living at home under the freshman residency exception. Under the freshman residency exemption, they will also be forced to purchase a Gold 450 meal plan (or greater) each semester of enrollment in order to better engage with the school and other freshmen.for more information click on this link-https://campusliving.ecu.edu/

Name: SUNY Polytechnic Institute - Albany
Overview: Established in 1966, SUNY Polytechnic Institute or State University of New York is primarily a public university with different campuses in New York, Marcy and Albany. It is an essential part of the SUNY system. This institution is approved by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education. Previously this Albany campus was a significant component of the University of Albany and was founded in 2003. Among 5 polytechnic institutions, this college became the country's first to provide educational programs in nanotechnology. Besides, this college is approved by the Board of Regents of the State of New York and all the academic programs are certified by the State of Education Department. This university provides a wide range of degree programs, including 25 bachelor’s degrees, 18 graduate and 5 doctoral degrees within 5 separate colleges. The students from this college come for admission throughout the United States and other 20 nations. This college offers courses in business, communication and behavioural sciences, computer science, engineering, arts and sciences, nursing, and nanoscale engineering and nanoscale science. Apart from providing enriched classroom experience, SUNY Polytechnic Institute provides innovative internships and employment opportunities through different corporate organisations associated with the institution, some of which are located on-site at the campuses. With a student-to-faculty ratio of 13:1, the average class size is nearly 18, where the expert faculties conduct effective interactive sessions and connect with the students. The Albany campus of this college is also the site of a pilot-scale semiconductor research and development centre. Besides nanoscale science and engineering research, commercialisation efforts and development, there is a comprehensive range of research efforts by the students, staff and faculties on other campuses. With an acceptance rate of nearly 69%, this college follows a moderately selective admission procedure. As per QS- World University Rankings, this university’s position ranges from 751-800.

Placement: InternshipObtaining course credit for an internship validates the experience by adding it to your academic transcript. You can use the Handshake system to find and apply for internships, or you can find one on your own. Your internship course teacher will use these three documents in order to submit your final grade for the course, you must evaluate your academic achievement as an intern. Any changes in status at your internship site should be communicated to your internship course instructor as well as the Office of Career Services. The documents are:Choose a member of your program's faculty to teach your internship course. Consult your programme advisor if you're not sure who to ask. You and your internship course instructor will complete the Internship Learning Contract together. By establishing the academic significance of the work experience to your degree programme, the Internship Learning Contract will function as your course curriculum. You will select the frequency of interaction with your internship course teacher and the academic coursework that will be necessary to augment the work experience based on the number of credits requested for the course during this phase of the course development. Your site supervisor will also outline your obligations as an intern on the job site.The supervisor supervising the site will be requested to fill out a questionnaire. Student Internship Employer Evaluation at the end of your internship to provide feedback to the internship course teacher on your performance at the internship site. The student will also be requested to complete a Student Internship Evaluation at the end of the internship to provide their own comments on the value of the internship experience. Parker Dewey: non-credit, paid Microinternships To gain project experience with employers on a short-term basis Try out a job to discover if your academic programme is leading you down the right professional path. Microinternships are project-based work experiences rather than semester-based ones. Develop your talents and network in the industry. A microinternship is a short-term paid experience provided through the SUNY Poly collaboration site launchpad hosted by Parker Dewey. It is always remote and requires 5-40 hours of commitment. Internship Assistance The university can assist you if you are a SUNY Poly candidate partaking in an internship. Whether your internship is for course credit, non-credit, funded, unfunded, online, or at a job site, you are always welcome to contact out for help and support. The organisation that both the student and the employer uses is: Handshake
Accommodation: Off-Campus Accommodation SUNY Polytechnic Institute provides a reference to nearby lodgings for visitors' convenience. Name: Anderson University
Overview: Established in 1917, Anderson University is a private Christian institute in Anderson, Indiana, with an acceptance rate of 63%. It has a student enrollment of 3,000 and a full-time faculty of 112. Some courses are Biochemistry, Business Administration, Physical Science, Journalism and Worship Arts. The Anderson University campus is located in Central Indiana and is home to the Nicolson Library, consisting of numerous books, journals, articles, e-resources and study spaces. Anderson University's Honors Program is a competitive cohort-based program open to students who excel in academics and extracurricular activities. Student accommodation is available on-campus in five residence halls, Martin Hall, Myers Hall, Dunn Hall, Smith Hall and Morrison Hall, which comprise 1-4-person rooms. Fair Commons provides apartment-style accommodation. Students can join academic, social, service and interest clubs like Alpha Chi, Dativus and College Democrats. The university also has an Intramurals Program featuring 16 sports (spike ball, volleyball, basketball, Wiffleball etc.) and four annual tournaments. It also houses three galleries: The Jeeninga Museum, The Wilson Gallery and The Warner Sallman Collection. 98.9% of Anderson University graduates found employment upon graduation. The estimated undergraduate cost of attendance is USD 42,310. Financial aid options are scholarships, grants, loans, and student employment like the Frank Bannon Grant, Minority Teacher Scholarship, Esports Activity Award, Legacy Scholarship, Federal Direct Subsidized Loan, and Yellow Ribbon Program.

Eligibility Overview: All other applicants for whom English is a second language must demonstrate competency in English in one of the ways listed below.Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 67 on the Internet Based TOEFL from the Educational Testing Service (ETS) (IBT)On the International English Language Testing System, a minimum composite score of 6.0 (with at least 5.0 on each subscale) is required (IELTS)To get admitted unconditionally, you must have a cumulative SAT score of 920 or above on the evidence-based writing and reading tests, as well as the math test.A composite ACT score of 17 or above is required (the ACT score for YSU is 3368).PTE Academic (Pearson Test of English) [58] A minimum grade point average (GPA) of 2.00 (U.S. 4.00 scale) based on your high school grades.For international undergraduate admission review purposes, YSU accepts scanned copies of original credentials in PDF format (See detailed requirements for copied documents).Students who are admitted on the basis of scanned documents must:mail in or bring in the official transcripts and degree certificates;request the test center to send the official Language Test Report directly to YSU Office of International Admissions (code: 1975) (if English Proficiency is not waived).

Name: University of San Francisco
Overview: Established in 1855, the University of San Francisco is a private Jesuit university located in San Francisco, California, USA. The university is accredited by the WASC Senior College and University Commission. More than 10,636 students are enrolled in this university in the fields of Nursing, Marketing Management, Business Administration and Management, and Finance. The University of San Francisco offers more than 40 majors and over 70 minors in three colleges and schools: the School of Management, College of Arts and Sciences, and School of Nursing and Health Professions. The university also offers over 60 doctoral, master's, and credential programs. It is also known for offering around 6 M.B.As and Executive Business Administration (EMBA). The University of San Francisco provides two online programs to its students and around 34 graduate certificates. A student of the University of San Francisco can also opt for study abroad programs that the university offers in over 40 countries. M.Sc. in Data Science, M.Sc. in Computer Science, E.M.B.A, M.Sc. in Information Systems, and M.B.A in Organizational Development are some of the university's top courses. The university provides excellent placement opportunities. The university provides great scholarships and financial aid to its students, including the School of Management International Merit Scholarship, Academic Merit Scholarship Awards, and Athletic Scholarships.
Eligibility Overview: What are the requirements for participation?Before applying to USF, international students must meet the following requirements:Requirements in SchoolTo get admitted to an undergraduate programme, applicants must have a high school diploma, and to be admitted to a graduate programme, they must have an undergraduate degree. The following are the eligibility requirements:Candidates must have studied English for at least four years in school.Mathematics for three years (Engineering candidates are expected to have completed precalculus)Social Sciences for three yearsTwo years of laboratory science and two years of a foreign language (Nursing applicants must have taken either Physics or Biology during their senior secondary studies)Exams that Qualify for Standardized ExamsGraduate and postgraduate courses accept the GRE/GMAT.For undergraduate courses, the SAT/ACT is accepted.Proficiency in EnglishFor various undergraduate and graduate courses, the following are the minimal English language proficiency requirements:TOEFL IBT 80, with a minimum of 65.For master's students, the TOEFL PBT 580 is required.IELTS Academic 6.5 bands, with a minimum of 6 bandsFor master's students, PTE Academic 62 is required.105th Duolingo English Test (minimum score required: 95)
