Name: Central Queensland University (CQU) - Melbourne
Overview: In 1967, Central Queensland University, or CQU, was established as the Queensland Institute of Technology (QIT). In 1992, finally, this institution got the status of a university. Then in 2008, this institute became the CQ University and currently is offering about 30.000 students from across the world quality education. No matter your location or educational background, higher education should be accessible to all, according to CQ University. Our students may be anything they want to be because to our accessibility, flexibility, student support, and extensive range of TAFE and university courses available online and on-campus.It is the largest university in regional Australia that provides a wide range of courses in education, humanities, accounting, law, psychology, health, etc.  CQ University is the largest regional university in Australia, a pioneer in online learning, and one of the top 600 universities worldwide. We are known as one of the most diverse and active universities in the country. With a variety of TAFE and university courses available for on-campus or online study, we see you becoming whatever you want to be.The CQU offers graduation, post-graduation, short-term, certificate, and research programs. The CQU has about 16 campuses spread across Australia in Rockhampton, Melbourne, Adelaide, Noosa, Sydney, Mackay, Townsville, Gladstone, Perth, Cairns, Bundaberg, Brisbane, and Emerald. The university is famous for its research programs. They are involved in a research partnership with national and international researchers and research networks.

Name: The Kings University
Overview: The King’s University was established in 1979 as the King’s College and was renamed in 2015. Serving around 934 students including 102 international students and representing more than 24 nations in all, the institution has gained some popularity over the years. It got a STARS silver rating in recognition of its sustainability achievements and a ranking of #52 in Regional Universities South, as per US News World Rankings 2022. The campus, located in the capital city of Alberta, is close to Treaty Six territory. The private institution offers more than 650 courses in different areas of discipline, from Liberal Arts to Natural Sciences, Fine Arts, etc. The tuition costs vary across different programs; however, the average cost of education remains somewhat near 27,000 USD. The institution also provides numerous scholarships to international students that range between 1,000 USD and 3,000 USD. The acceptance rate of The King’s University is 70% which indicates that the admission process gets highly competitive for the international students. There are certain admission requirements set by the university, such as an overall grade must be an average of 60% or higher, courses should be standard 12 courses, etc. It also put an extra emphasis on English language proficiency while assessing the applications of international students. Apart from academic assistance, international students get multiple on-campus facilities. They get to take part in the Annual Globe Awareness Week festival, the International Students Assistants Program, workshops organized for personal development, etc. the student to faculty ratio of The King’s University is 22:1 and the retention rate stands at 77.6%. Students coming from foreign countries get accommodation facilities as well, even the preference to choose from tower rooms, tower suites and apartments. The King’s University alumni network is quite strong, possessing over 6,500 graduates. The institution also has a reputation of 98% employability rate as the students get access to the Centre for Career and Calling, career fairs, etc.

Name: Long Island University Post (LIU Post)
Overview: Founded in 1926 by the New York State Education Department, Long Island University was established in Brooklyn and sanctioned by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education. The academic programs, colleges and schools are approved by various top-notch accreditation agencies such as the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (CCNE), Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE), the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) etc. Situated in Brookville, this Long Island University Post is the second and largest campus in this location. Further, this university has four other campuses in different locations in New York. This university conducts different study programs for the undergraduate, graduate and postdoctoral programs along with online certification programs. This educational institution offers more than 275 graduate, undergraduate and doctoral degree programs, serving approximately 15, 000 students every year across multiple campuses. The LIU Post comprises the College of Veterinary Medicine, a business school and a recognised theatre program. Some of the courses and programs offered in different areas include business, arts, health, journalism, psychology, sciences, accounting, theatre, computer science, education etc. This educational institution is equipped with 500 top-notch faculty members involving Academy Award Winners, prominent journalists, Fulbright scholars, recognised authors and more. With a student to faculty ratio of 10:1, this institution provides an innovative college experience for every aspiring candidate who is looking for a professional opportunity. Besides, students are awarded $100 million scholarships and grants every year. The student body is composed of more than 70 organisations that take care of students’ welfare. Nearly 150 major courses are offered to undergraduate students. After completing graduation, students can join more than 275, 000 alumni to become recognised leaders in technology, arts, science, media, etc. As per U.S. News & World Report, this university is ranked at 271 in the current year.

Name: Mission College
Overview: Mission College is a public college located in the San Francisco Bay Area in Santa Clara, California. It is ranked No.32 as the Best Community College in California and No.298 as the Best Community College in America. According to Niche.com, Mission College has an acceptance rate of 100%.Mission College offers courses in Art and Design, Languages and Liberal Arts, Business and Hospitality, Health Sciences, Exploratory and General Studies, Public Services and Social Sciences, Science, Technology, Engineering and Math. Apart from these, there are also apprenticeship courses and ESL and non-credit courses.Among all the available courses, popular majors are Biology, Business, and Liberal Arts and Humanities. Mission College also offers scholarships for its students, such as Horacio Alger Scholarship, POINT Foundation Scholarship, Immigrants Rising Scholarships, Silicon Valley Community Foundation and others. The fee for Mission College depends on the student's residency. The in-state tuition fee is $1,192, while out-of-state tuition and fees are $6,280. Also, at Mission College, about 37% of the undergraduate students receive financial grants, with an average grant of $3,375. For Fall 2018, the total number of students who entered college is 2,606. Additionally, there is no application fee for undergraduates. If students are concerned, 54% of the students are female, whereas 46% are male. In Mission College, 37% of the students received Federal Grants, 33% received institutional grants, and 57% received State/local grants. There are a total of 337 faculty members, with a student-to-faculty ratio of 36:1. Students can earn degrees and certificates in 26 different fields. The graduation rate of this college is 20%, whereas the full-time retention rate is 72%. The total enrolment of students for fall 2018 is 7,780, with a full-time enrolment of 1,902 and a part-time enrolment of 5,878.
Eligibility Overview: Academic RequirementsAttended a California high school (public or private) for three or more years, or; Attained credits equivalent to three or more years of full-time high school coursework from a California high school, and attended a combination of elementary, middle, and/or high schools in California for a total of three or more years.Prior to the start of the term, you must have graduated from a California high school or obtained the equivalent (for example, passing the GED or California High School Proficiency exam) and filed an affidavit with the college or university stating that you have filed an application to legalize your immigration status (or will file an application as soon as he or she is eligible to do so.)
Placement: Not provided

Also, quoted apartment costs do not include utilities, internet, security deposits, or other fees. Additional housing questions can be directed to our office at iis@missioncollege.edu

Name: Milwaukee School of Engineering
Overview: A private university in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, is called the Milwaukee School of Engineering, or MSOE. Oscar Werwath founded it in 1903; originally, it was known as the School of Engineering. The college offers 16 four-year credentials through its eight academic departments, with 10 of those being in engineering. The college provides 11 graduate degrees in business, engineering, and nursing in addition to its undergraduate programmes. Engineering, business, science, and nursing are the main areas of study at MSOE. The primary area of emphasis for MSOE is undergraduate education, for which it has eight academic departments and 15 undergraduate majors. The college also offers 11 master's degree programmes for postgraduate students. In addition to a master's degree in civil engineering, the college offers Bachelor of Science programmes in engineering in the areas of architectural, biomedical, biomolecular, computer, electrical, industrial, mechanical, and software. The Rader School of Business the college grants degrees in business administration. In addition, four-year undergrad programmes are offered in actuarial science, computer science, technical communication, user experience, nursing, and construction management. Electrical engineering, engineering, and management all have two-year transfer programmes leading to B.S. degrees. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship.The estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditures for an international student, are around INR 35,31,527. Milwaukee School of Engineering offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students.

Name: Ohio Wesleyan University
Overview: The Ohio Wesleyan University was formed in 1842 as a nonsectarian institute in Delaware, Ohio. The Methodist leaders and Central Ohio residents were responsible for establishing the university. Accredited by the Higher Learning Commission, the university aims at serving students with educational services at undergraduate and postgraduate levels. The 200-acre campus in Central Ohio has successfully attracted over 1,600 enrolments annually for Ohio Wesleyan University. They currently offer over 70 majors and 55 minors. Some popular subjects focused on here include Accounting, Computer science, International Business, Social Justice, Zoology, Politics and government. The university supports diversity in the classes, encouraging over 400 international applications. It offers several facilities for the growth and development of the students, including an athletic field, auditorium, museum, library and others. The courses in business studies focus on the practical requirements for the student's future employment. The Ohio Wesleyan University ranking throws light upon its success. It was ranked 17th among "America's Most Entrepreneurial Colleges 2015" by Forbes and among the top 100 "Best National Liberal Arts Colleges" by US News & World Report. The classes here have maintained a standard student-faculty ratio of 13:1 for providing high-quality education. On average, about 96% of the students of this university get employed within six months of their graduation. The college's notable alums have shown success with their employment in the fields of their specification. The tuition fees set for international students might seem unaffordable, ranging from $45,000-$50,000. About 99% of the students receive merit-based scholarships every year.
Eligibility Overview: The Admission Committee has determined that students will be best prepared for academic success at OWU if they take a college preparatory course in high school. 4 years of English, 3 years of social science, 3 years of math and science, and 2 years of foreign language studies are the minimum requirements (3 years recommended)Ohio Wesleyan University expects you to have a 3.4 GPA and be in the middle of your high school class. You'll need a combination of A and B grades, with very few Cs. If you have a poor GPA, you can make up for it by taking more difficult courses like AP or IB.
Accommodation: Outside of the classroom, you will learn a lot in college. We're a residential campus because we believe that living in community teaches vital life lessons.You'll make new friends and learn a respect for various cultures whether you live in a residence hall, a small living unit (SLU), a house, or pledge a fraternity (sororities are non-residential).You'll also start making the kinds of decisions that come with living away from home. If you need support, Residential Life's professional staff and student assistants will work with you to solve problems, address personal challenges, and, if necessary, send you to additional resources. Students make Ohio Wesleyan their home for all four years of their studies because it is a residential campus.What distinguishes an Ohio Wesleyan education, in our opinion, is the immersion and engagement in a residential community where leadership skills are refined, enduring friendships are formed, and life lessons are acquired - all of which complement academic and classroom experiences.We hope that no matter where you reside on campus, you will discover a welcoming community to call home.for more information click on this link-https://www.owu.edu/about/offices-services-directory/office-of-residential-life/housing-options/

Name: Touro College
Overview: Touro College is considered a renowned Jewish university in the US. It has a student population of around 19,200 students currently. Touro College was established in 1971 and is also part of the "Touro College and University System." It has 30 campuses in California, New York, Berlin, Jerusalem, Moscow, Illinois, Nevada, and Berlin. It offers educational programs for students to obtain master's, bachelor's, and doctoral degrees to its students. The programs include Accounting, Mathematics, Banking and Finance, Business Administration, Law, Marketing, Communications, IT, and many more. Touro College has a brilliant faculty of knowledgeable professors to provide adequate student knowledge. Its decent faculty ratio of 13:1 helps the students to learn everything efficiently and clear their doubts.Touro College provides a comfortable environment for students from various sections and countries. The holistic environment and cooperative learning help students achieve their career goals. Many companies around the world hire Touro students. The college also provides the necessary training, and they have an excellent alumni network worldwide. Some of them are Anne Neuberger, David Greenfield, and Kathleen Rice.The average cost of studying at Touro College is around $2000 per annum. About 83% of the students receive scholarships and financial aid based on merit and performance. It also provides 100% scholarships to eligible students who enrol for the first time. Also, 25% of financial assistance is provided to the students opting for professional programs.
Eligibility Overview: Admission RequirementsA bachelor degree from an approved institution or its equivalent. A 3.0 undergraduate and graduate GPA is required (on a 4.0 scale) It is preferable to have a concentration that includes a minimum of 12 credits in both education and psychology.Check for more details; https://gse.touro.edu/academics/masters-programs/school-counseling/admission-requirements/#:~:text=A%20baccalaureate%20degree%20or%20its,education%20and%20psychology%20is%20preferred

Name: University of North Alabama
Overview: The University of North Alabama, located in Florence, USA, offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students.The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. The Estimated average tuition fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditures for an international student, is around INR 13,59,067. The University of North Alabama offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship.
Eligibility Overview: Academic RequirementsApplicants must acquire a composite score of 18 or more on the American College Test (ACT) or a score of 960 or higher on the Scholastic Aptitude Test (SAT)1 to indicate general aptitude.Applicants must have a grade point average (GPA) of at least 2.25 (4.0 scale) on an unweighted basis to demonstrate academic proficiency.
Placement: 90% of Honors College graduates are employed or pursuing graduate studies in their fields of study. The Career Centre is a free service for all University of North Alabama students and alumni seeking to advance their careers. The cell offers career counselling, personality assessments, interest-based opportunities, resume and cover letter assistance, mock interviews, and career fair events. HR Roundtables and course-specific career days are two features of the college that assist students in searching for and preparing for jobs in the United States.
Accommodation: Why live on campus?According to a large body of evidence, college students who live on campus in residence halls socialise and make friends more.  ResidencesMattielou HallMattielou Hall opened in August 2015 and houses 334 residents on four floors. Mattielou is co-ed by room and open to students of all academic classifications. It is located on the north end of campus across from the band practice field.Olive HallOlive Hall opened in January 2016 and houses 429 freshmen, residents, on six floors. Olive is co-ed by room and located on the north end of campus behind Rice Hall and Rivers Hall. Facilities24-Hour Card Access on all main entrance doors, elevators, and ground floor stairwells.Video surveillance on all exterior areas, main entrance, elevators, individual floors, emergency exit doors, ground floor lobby and laundry area.Common area lounges are located on each floor.Laundry facilities are located on the ground floor.Vending Machines and a Pool Table are located on the ground floor.

Eligibility Overview: The following is a minimal criterion for exam results and grade point average:A composite ACT score of 19 or higher, a composite SAT score of 1010 or higher on the RSAT scale of 1600, or a composite SAT score of 1330 on the previous SAT exam with a range of 2400, or a composite Next Generation ACCUPLACER score of 246 are all acceptable. It's worth noting that the ACT Writing exam isn't necessary for admission.Completion of secondary school graduation requirements from a public, private, or home education programme with a least 2.0/4.0 cumulative grade point average and completion of the university's secondary school core curriculum, OR a minimum GED score of 580.

Choose a structure that is close to our sporting fields, your classroom, or Baz-Tech.All of the halls and flats are fully furnished, with all utilities included. IP television, wired and wireless internet are among the other features. With the exception of Caraway and Phase I, all dorms on campus have wired and wireless internet connection. Name: Loyola University Chicago
Overview: Loyola University Chicago, founded in 1870 in Chicago, Illinois, is one of the largest Christian universities in the US. The private Jesuit research university operates four campuses: Lake Shore Campus, Health Sciences Campus, John Felice Rome Center, and Water Tower Campus, as well as guest programs in Beijing and Ho Chi Minh City. With an acceptance rate of 67%, Loyola ranks 104th nationally. Loyola University comprises 13 academic colleges, schools, and research centers offering over 80 undergraduate, 140 postgraduate, and professional programs in disciplines like Arts, Health Sciences, Business, Management, Communication, Continuing and Professional Education, Environmental Studies, Health Sciences, Law, Nursing, Pastoral Studies, Computer Science, Social Work, and Human Resources Management. Applications are to be filled for intake into Fall, Spring, and Summer semesters by undergraduates and postgraduates through the Loyola University Application and Loyola University Graduate Application, respectively. Academic transcripts, LORs, and scores of TOEFL, SAT, ACT, etc., are also to be submitted. The average undergraduate tuition fee is 22,750 USD and varies according to the program chosen for postgraduate courses, where MBA costs 92,064 USD, and Law amounts to 24,845 USD. Financial aid through merit-based and need-based scholarships like Presidential, Damen, Loyola, Trustee, and Dean's Scholarship worth 17,000 - 25,000 USD and Rambler Award worth 30,000 USD is provided. On-campus accommodation is provided by Loyola's Department of Residence Life in residential halls and apartments mainly located in Rogers Park and Edgewater neighborhoods. Single, double, triple, and quad occupancy fully-furnished rooms are available to choose from with facilities like shared suite-style washrooms, WiFi, kitchen, lounge areas, laundry, and social spaces. The campus is also home to laboratories, the E.M. Cudahy Memorial Library, various Greek letter organizations, a student-run radio station, and 11 varsity teams in sports like basketball, football, golf, etc. With a respectable graduation rate of 74.7%, the average salary of Loyola graduates is 54,100 USD.

Name: Harvard University
Overview: Harvard University, established in 1636, is among the oldest and most renowned institutions in the USA. The university operates across three campuses at Cambridge, Allston, and Boston and is home to more than 35,000 students enrolled in 12 schools.The institute offers 90 Undergraduate, 150 Master’s, and 100 Doctoral programs along with 129 free and paid online courses. The institute has a low student-faculty ratio of 5:1, and the median class size is 13, which ensures personalized attention to students. International students from over 80 countries make up around 11% of the student body at Harvard. There is an ultramodern research hospital in Mission Hill, the Harvard University campus. Students also have access to nine additional hospitals, 28 on-campus libraries, five museums, a stadium, a theatre, and various other on-campus facilities. The college is ranked 1 in US College Rankings by Times Higher Education, 2022.The institute guarantees a 100% placement, and there are hardly any firms where Harvard graduates are not welcome. The college has one of the most robust alum networks, which include well-known, notable personalities such as Barack Obama (44th President of the United States), Mark Zuckerberg (Co-Founder and CEO of Facebook), and Bill Gates (Co-founder of Microsoft), to name a few.

Name: University of Idaho
Overview: The University of Idaho is a Public land-grant University located in Moscow, Idaho, established in 1889. The Main Campus of U of I is situated in the rolling Palouse hills in Idaho, Moscow. The University campus is spread across an area of 1,585 acres. The Branch campuses of U of I are in Boise, Coeur d'Alene, and Idaho Falls. The university has 10 colleges, and two of them are for Law and Graduate studies exclusively. The University of Idaho offers more than 300 academic programs consisting of majors, minors, Master's Certified degrees, and Doctorate Professional Practice taught in eight educational campuses. The popular majors at the University of Idaho are psychology, marketing, business, mechanical engineering, finance, sociology, liberal arts and humanities, and accounting. At U of I, students have an opportunity to avail various career options like on-campus, off-campus, work-study, internships, etc. The Student-Faculty ratio in the University of Idaho is approx. 16:1. The average tuition fees for the on-campus study are about $31,608/year for Undergraduate programs. U of I also offers various scholarships and financial aids to both Domestic and International students. Spread across the campus arena of 253 buildings, The Campus of the University of Idaho comprises Memorial Gymnasium, Student Recreation Centre, and the Administration building. In addition, U of I offers various student services like Womenäó»s Center, Nonremedial tutoring, Daycare, Placement Cell, Health services and Health insurance. Also, there are 4 Residence Halls, 10 sororities, 18 fraternities in the U of I premises that offer on-campus accommodation mainly to the Freshmen students. In addition, the University of Idaho has been a part of prestigious institutions in Idaho to gather community engagement and provide a transformative education to students at the global level.

Name: Chemeketa Community College - Brooks
Overview: The Chemeketa Community College, Brooks is a recognized institution, situated in Salem, Oregon, US. It is primarily a public college and provides high-quality education in Engineering, Arts, Science, and Law etc. The primary objective of this institution is to provide top-notch education and improve the performance of individuals. This educational institution provides unique training programs in various research disciplines. Moreover, students can have flexible schedules along with low-cost classes and textbooks. Name: West Chester University
Overview: A public university in Chester County of Pennsylvania, West Chester University is the largest of the 14 universities in the Pennsylvania State System of Higher Education. Established in 1871, the university works to make its students honourable, serving and responsible citizens for the world. Situated about 35 miles from Philadelphia, the university is known for its Public Health, Mathematics and Formal Poetry Program. It hosts the annual conference on Poetry devoted to the style of New Formalism. The university ensures equal opportunities for all individuals while prohibiting harassment and biased actions. There are over 120 undergraduate and 80 graduate programs for the students to enrol in. By offering diverse fields of study for not just undergraduate and graduate degrees but also doctoral degrees, the university, with a 76% acceptance rate become a popular choice. The 403-acre lush campus of West Chester University offers residence halls, recreational centres, libraries, assembly halls, study halls and athletics centres to offer an engaged and holistic experience to its students and staff. Name: Briar Cliff University
Overview: Briar Cliff University has been a private institute training students since 1930. It offers academic programs in graduate, undergraduate, and professional streams. It has a religious affiliation with the Roman Catholic association. As of 2020, it enrols 817 students in an undergraduate program. Eligibility Overview: The prerequisites for admissionAs an international graduate student, you will need to meet specific prerequisites, just like any other student accepted to Dakota State University.Demonstrate your intellectual prowess.To demonstrate your capacity to effectively complete a graduate degree at DSU, you must achieve specific requirements. You'll need to do the following in particular:Have earned a baccalaureate degree in the United States, which is equivalent to a four-year undergraduate degree.We reserve the right to request that international transcripts be evaluated by a DSU-approved transcript review agency.Have a minimum 2.70 grade point average (GPA) on a 4.0 scale as an undergraduate (or the equivalent on an alternative grading system)Successfully complete the Graduate Record Examination (GRE)Within the last five years, you must have taken the GRE. The GRE test can be waived if one of the following conditions are met:A bachelor degree from a regionally approved US college or university with a cumulative grade point average of 3.25 or higher on a 4.0 scale.Admission to and achievement in a regionally approved graduate school in the United States. Grades of "A" or "B" in at least nine hours of graduate work constitute shown success.At least 15 years ago, you graduated from a regionally approved college or university in the United States.Be able to communicate well in English.One of the following methods must be used to demonstrate your English proficiency:76 on the TOEFL iBT550 on the TOEFL PBT6.0 on the IELTS (with no sub-score less than 5.5)Academic PTE: 53ELS Level 112 CompletionWithin two years of the exam date, you must submit your English proficiency scores. Please remember that the testing agency must send an official TOEFL or PTE Academic score.

Name: Kutztown University
Overview: Kutztown University, a part of the Pennsylvania State System of Higher Education, is a public institute. It was initially established in the year 1866 as Keystone Normal School. Accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education, it gained university status in 1983.The university has 7391 undergraduate students and 918 postgraduate students on campus. There are also 552 academic and 563 administrative staff with a student-faculty ratio of 17:1. Some of the most preferred majors at Kutztown University are Business Administration and Management, Psychology, Communication, and Media Studies, Criminal Justice/Safety Studies, and Parks, Recreation, and Leisure Studies. The College is in a rural setting across 326 acres and has four academic colleges. They are the College of Business, College of Education, College of Liberal Arts and Sciences, and College of Visual and Performing Arts. Kutztown University has 21 varsity teams, 8 for men and 13 for women.Around 49% of UG students and 4400 students live on-campus. They are a member of NCAA Division II and compete in the Pennsylvania State Athletic Conference. There are also many intramural and club sports programs for the students at the university. The College has facilities for students who wish to live on-campus. There are 14 residence halls, three apartment-style co-ed complexes, and one suite-style hall. There are all essential facilities for students living here. Total expenses, including Tuition fees, Room and Board, Books and other supplies, and Miscellaneous expenses, will come to around 35,366 USD. The university also provides need-based scholarships for eligible students. There is a Career Development Center at the university, where students are guided in their career-related choices. They also provide internships and job offers for students. Kutztown University has a graduation rate of 54%.

Name: Arizona State University
Overview: Arizona State University, founded in 1885, is a public research university in the Phoenix metropolitan area. Addressed as one of the most innovative schools, ASU has five academically divided campuses and four learning centres. The Tempe campus focuses on research-based studies. The Polytechnic campus offers professional and technological programs, and the West campus specialises in interdisciplinary courses. The Downtown Phoenix campus teaches programs like nursing, criminal justice, and mass communication, while the ASU-Mayo Medical School campus caters to all health-related programs.Arizona State has 17 colleges that offer more than 350 undergraduate programs, 100 graduate programs and various certificate programs. Chemistry, Psychology, Communications, Political Science, Anthropology, Sociology, Biology, Business, Economics, and Law are highly ranked courses. Sandra Day O'Connor College of Law, the ASU law school, is ranked 25th nationally. Barrett, The Honors College is one of the best colleges in the country for pursuing honours courses. The ASU library also finds its place among the top 40 research libraries in North America. More than 1000 student clubs provide a wholesome environment, and hockey, basketball, swimming, archery and football are some of the most popular sports. Arizona State receives thousands of applicants annually with a high acceptance rate of 86.5%. The average undergraduate tuition and fee is 31200 USD and for postgraduate programs is 25200 USD. International students are eligible for merit-based scholarships at ASU apart from the college and departmental scholarships. First-year students are supposed to live on-campus in residential colleges provided by the university. In contrast, all others can opt from the housing options, including suite-style rooms and shared apartments, with meal plans and proximity to classes. Business and Engineering courses have a high placement rate, and around 89% of graduates find employment within six months of graduation with an average salary of 54,000 USD.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate Program ASU demands TOEFL, IELTS, or PTE scores for undergraduate applicants in addition to grades in 10th, 11th, and 12th grades. The UG major determines the ACT or SAT requirements. Additionally, it grants AP, IB, and CLEP credit. Conditional admission candidates must present valid TOEFL, IELTS, or PTE scores within three semesters or successfully complete ASU Global Launch. Graduate Program Depending on the course or major, graduate programme requirements change. Higher levels of English competence could be required for some courses. Placement: The Career and Professional Development Services provide students with career interest communities, assessments of their career interests, career preparation, connections, professional development, resume and application reviews, etc. They also help students get ready for graduate school and careers. The United States Federal Government, American Express, Intel, and Amazon are just a few notable employers. Within 90 days of graduating, 90% of ASU grads looking for work receive at least one offer. Within six months of graduation, 89% of undergraduates and 93% of graduates (who said they were looking for work) were employed, had started their own business, or had gotten at least one job offer.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation The university offers on-campus housing to its undergraduate and graduate students.First-year students are required to live on campus in a residential college alongside other students who are interested in the same curriculum and career.Upper-division students have a choice of housing options, including suite-style rooms on campus and communal flats with kitchens.Residence halls include completely furnished rooms and communal spaces, as well as utilities, internet, and trained on-site residential staff who are available 24 hours a day, seven days a week. They are also conveniently located near classrooms, academic buildings, student services, and food options. On-campus housing can be found here. Off-Campus Accommodation The average monthly rent is between 750 and 950 USD.Studio flats, 3 bedroom apartments, 4 bedroom apartments, and shared apartments are also available.Each apartment has central air conditioning, free high-speed WiFi, a washer and dryer, and is fully furnished.There is a lot of storage space and walk-in closets in the bedrooms.The typical lease term is 12 months. Off-campus housing link
Course Ranking: The undergraduate programmes in journalism, business and finance, and agriculture offered by ASU are listed as outstanding colleges by The Princeton Review in 2021. The Walter Cronkite School of Journalism and Mass Communication was named the best journalism school in the US by The Princeton Review. When we thoroughly examine Bloomberg's list of the top business schools in the USA, we find that Arizona State University's rankings have significantly increased from 49th in 2016 to 2nd in 2020. It was ranked 55th in 2021.Since 2018, US News has routinely placed ASU's MBA in supply chain management in the bottom five spots. As a result, candidates searching for reputable business schools in the US may consider ASU. However, when we look at the QS (Top Universities) Global MBA rankings, ASU has fallen from 74th place in 2018 to 111-120th place in 2021. However, the rating has significantly improved, falling between 101 and 110th place in 2022.
University Ranking: Territorial Normal School, the predecessor to Arizona State University (ASU), was established in 1885. Arizona State University was subsequently established in 1958. Additionally, the calibre of its research and teaching has continuously improved. THE, a ranking system that places a strong focus on instruction, research, and citation, fell Arizona State from 126th place in 2018 to 184th position in 2021, but it again recovered its position with a 132nd rank in 2022. The Academic Ranking of World Universities (ARWU, Shanghai Ranking), which places a high value on faculty quality and research output, continuously ranked ASU between 101 and 150th from 2016 to 2021.Arizona State University has produced outstanding results in both its teaching and research. This is seen in the US News rating of the greatest national institutions, which places it at 103rd place among US universities, a rise of 14 points from the previous year. However, in 2022, its ranking once more declined to 117th place. When it comes to the US News global rankings, Arizona State has constantly held its position up until 2022, when it dropped to number 165 from the previous 146. The rating rose with 132nd position in 2022 despite THE, which lowered it from 131 in 2017 to 184 in 2021.

Name: Abertay University
Overview: Abertay University is a public college in Dundee, Scotland. The Abertay campus, located in the heart of Dundee, features excellent avant-garde infrastructure, including historic buildings such as the Old College, Bernard King Library, Hannah Maclure Center, etc. The university houses four academic buildings: the Kydd Building, Baxter Building, Graham Building, and Old College Building. The average tuition fee at Abertay University is 9,975 GBP. International students can apply through merit-based scholarships and financial aid.Abertay University has several part-time and full-time internship programs for its students.

Placement: Abertay University offers many opportunities for students who want to study and work simultaneously. The university provides various projects : 1. Erasmus Traineeships (work placements) :  The student can work for a European company or in a lab at one of Abertay's partner universities as an Erasmus trainee and earn up to €520 approximately per month. 2. Study Work Create :  This is a British Council initiative that provides possibilities to work and study overseas, such as as an English teacher in China or India. 3. Internships and Volunteering :  The university may refer you to a number of organisations that provide internship and volunteer opportunities all around the world, from Hong Kong to Guatemala. 4. Summer Schools :  Many of Abertay's partner universities run summer schools where one can study more about a subject while immersing oneself in a different culture and visiting intriguing new destinations.
Accommodation: Students can quickly find various housing options at the institute: Keiller Court, Lyon Street Halls, Meadowside Halls, and Parker House. The available rooms are comfortable and equipped with all the necessary amenities. Parker House and Keller Court Halls provide on-campus housing for international students. There are housing options with 2, 3, and 4 beds available. Additionally, students can also apply for private accommodation.

Name: Governors State University
Overview: Governors State University in University Park, Illinois, is a public university with an acceptance rate of 46% and a student enrollment of 6,000, established in 1969. It comprises four colleges (College of Business, Education, Arts & Sciences, and Health & Human Services) offering 85+ undergraduate, graduate, and certificate programs. Some popular courses are Accounting, Media Studies, Physical Therapy, Criminal Justice, and Public Administration. Some undergraduate and graduate-level certificate programs include Chemistry Education, Digital Forensics, Addictions Screening, and Data Analytics. The Dual Degree Program, in partnership with 17 Chicagoland community colleges, allows students to pursue associate and bachelor's degree programs. The university organises over 120 online classes every semester and offers degree and certificate courses like Business and Applied Science, Teaching, and Nursing. The Pre-Professional Pathway programs for positions like Clinical Psychologist, Chemist, and Accountant helped prepare me for the professional world. The School of Extended Learning provides continuing education programs like Career Training, Teacher Training, English Language Learning, etc. Prairie Place provides on-campus accommodation in apartments and suites. There are over 70 student clubs and organisations to join, like Alpha Iota Sigma, ArtForum and Black Student Union. Men's and women's sports teams include golf, soccer, cross country, basketball etc. Governors State University graduates earn a median starting salary of USD 43,900.The estimated undergraduate tuition fee is USD 313 per credit hour. Financial aids include the Freshman Presidential Scholarship, Federal Pell Grant, State of Illinois Monetary Award Program, GSU Graduate Assistantship, etc.

Name: Loyola Marymount University
Overview: Loyola Marymount University is a research university in California, United States. The university was founded in 1973 when two local colleges, Loyola College and Marymount College, merged. The university follows Jesuit and Marymount traditions on campus, with a strong focus on developing leaders with values and morals that these traditions imbibe. The university comprises six graduate colleges which offer undergraduate degrees, graduate programs and doctoral degrees. The best courses at Loyola Marymount University include MFA in Film and TV Production, BSE in Mechanical Engineering and BSE in Electrical Engineering. The university's campus is in Rey Hills of Westchester, Los Angeles. It is ranked one of the most beautiful in the country, known for its historic architecture and beach-facing views. The William H. Hannon Library on campus provides students with access to various disciplines' latest books and papers. The campus is also home to 17 centres that promote research and development on campus in multiple fields. It has also adopted several sustainable practices on campus, with buildings on campus having LEED certification. The average annual cost of studying at the university comes to around USD 70,500. The university caters to various student populations in the nation. It has a campus ministry to promote Christian values and morals amongst students. With over 200 student clubs and organisations on campus, students interact outside their academic work and enjoy a healthy social life. The university sports team called the Loyola Marymount Lions participates in several sports tournaments at the national level. They have found success in softball and basketball over the years.
Eligibility Overview: Applicants who have completed their postsecondary education from an institution outside the U.S. must hold a degree from a university recognised by the Ministry of Education as a degree-granting institution. English language proficiency requirements are:

Placement: Internship Internships offer priceless chances for skill development and career discernment, according to the university's Career and Professional Development department. Every year, more than 95% of new students declare that they plan to participate in at least one internship as part of their studies at LMU. A transformative educational experience, an internship allows students to contribute to and take on significant roles within an enterprise. Ninety-nine students who finished the MA programme by May 2019 have submitted applications for admission to different graduate schools. Of the 99 applicants, 91 have access to at least one programme. Our programme started in the fall of 2001, and from then until the spring of 2019, our placement rate was 92 per cent. Degrees with internship opportunities are: BusinessGraduateLawMedical & HealthTechnology and EngineeringGeneral
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation There are several attractive housing options available at Loyola Marymount University. More than 3,600 students live on the LMU campus in conventional residence halls, suites, apartments, and homes. Everything you need to live comfortably and achieve academic success is available at our facilities. Each student's educational and social experience at LMU is enhanced by Living Learning Communities, first-rate amenities, and a dynamic Residence Life programme. Residence Halls Most first-year students live in Loyola Marymount University's conventional residence halls. In these residences, a room is shared by two LMU students, and each floor's inhabitants have access to one or more bathrooms. The additional communal areas include study rooms, lounges, and laundry facilities. Additionally, the proximity of most first-year buildings to one another creates a unique and encouraging "First Year" community that encourages and supports each student as they adjust to college life. Del Rey North Over 200 first-year LMU students live at Del Rey North, a classic four-story residence hall on the university's north campus perched on a bluff overlooking Playa Vista and predominantly houses students in living-learning communities. Most students share a double room with a roommate. On each wing, there is a public restroom. There aren't many specially constructed triple and single rooms at Del Rey North. Additionally, Del Rey North takes part in the living-learning community. For more information, visit: https://studentaffairs.lmu.edu/housing/studenthousing/aboutlmustudenthousing/livingoptions/residencehalls/delreynorth/  Del Rey South  Over 200 first-year students live in this four-story typical residence hall on the north campus, which is set on a bluff overlooking Playa Vista and predominantly accommodates students in living-learning communities. Most students share a double room with a roommate. On each wing, there is a public restroom. There aren't many planned single and triple rooms in Del Rey South. PEEC, an engineering living-learning community, is located in Del Rey South. For more information, visit: https://studentaffairs.lmu.edu/housing/studenthousing/aboutlmustudenthousing/livingoptions/residencehalls/delreysouth/  Desmond Desmond is a building in the first-year area of Loyola Marymount University's north campus, next to other first-year structures. On each floor, two bathrooms are in the middle. The building is named in honour of Daniel and C.C. Desmond, supporters of the university. This structure also takes part in the LEAD theme community.For more information, visit: https://studentaffairs.lmu.edu/housing/studenthousing/aboutlmustudenthousing/livingoptions/residencehalls/desmond/   Doheny Doheny is located in the centre of Loyola Marymount University's East Quad. The first-year students at LMU live in this three-story residential hall with a conventional design, two students to a room. On-campus, it is the most prominent living hall. The LMU first-year women are housed in the three-story structure.The Carrie Estelle Doheny Building is named in her honour. For more information, visit: https://studentaffairs.lmu.edu/housing/studenthousing/aboutlmustudenthousing/livingoptions/residencehalls/doheny/  Palm North Palm North is a brand-new, traditional-style, four-story structure for first-year students on the Loyola Marymount University campus, next to Doheny Hall and our new upper-class student complex. Palm Hall offers both single and shared accommodations for students. Each floor has a bathroom in the middle. It is one of the newest buildings on the LMU campus and features contemporary features and architecture. For more information, visit: https://studentaffairs.lmu.edu/housing/studenthousing/aboutlmustudenthousing/livingoptions/residencehalls/palmnorth/   Rosecrans Rosecrans, a three-story structure with a conventional design for first-year students on the Loyola Marymount Campus, is situated between two other first-year residence halls. Two LMU students share each room. Each floor has a bathroom in the middle. Access to the third level is restricted to the women who reside there and their visitors to protect their privacy further. Rosecrans takes part as well. For more information, visit: https://studentaffairs.lmu.edu/housing/studenthousing/aboutlmustudenthousing/livingoptions/residencehalls/rosecrans/  Whelan  Whelan is a three-story building with a traditional design that is situated next to two other first-year residential halls on the Loyola Marymount University campus. Two LMU students share each room. Each floor has a bathroom in the middle. Access to the third level is restricted to the women who reside there and their visitors to protect their privacy further. The structure bears Edward Whelan, SJ's name, a previous president of Loyola University. For more information, visit: https://studentaffairs.lmu.edu/housing/studenthousing/aboutlmustudenthousing/livingoptions/residencehalls/whelan/ Suites The majority of the second-year students live in suite-style dorms. Two students share a room in a suite connected to another room, with two students by a bathroom, making a total of four suitemates. Study rooms, lounges, and a laundry facility are some of the additional communal areas in the building. McCarthy Over 200 sophomores reside in this four-story, suite-style resident hall on the Loyola Marymount University Leavey campus, which is set on a bluff overlooking Marina del Rey. Most LMU students share a room in a building with two other students and a bathroom. A few private double and single rooms are also available at McCarthy. The structure bears J. Thomas McCarthy's name as a donor. For more information, visit: https://studentaffairs.lmu.edu/housing/studenthousing/aboutlmustudenthousing/livingoptions/suites/mccarthy/  McKay On the Loyola Marymount University campus, McKay is the biggest building. More than 300 first-year and sophomore students are housed there. Most of the rooms in this four-story, suite-style residence hall on the LMU south campus are double-occupancy rooms connected by a semi-private bathroom. The structure bears the name of Raymunde McKay, RSHM, the president of Marymount College at the time of its 1973 merger with Loyola University. Iggy's Café is located in McKay. For more information, visit: https://studentaffairs.lmu.edu/housing/studenthousing/aboutlmustudenthousing/livingoptions/suites/mckay/  Rains Nearly 300 sophomores from Loyola Marymount University live in Rains. Most LMU students share a room in a building with two other students and a bathroom. A small number of private double and single rooms are also available at Rains. Students participating in the Rains Intercultural Suite Experience are housed in three six-person suites. The structure bears the benefactor Liliore Green Rains' name. For more information, visit: https://studentaffairs.lmu.edu/housing/studenthousing/aboutlmustudenthousing/livingoptions/suites/rains/  Apartments Most of the residents of the apartments are upper-division students. The apartments come fully furnished with living rooms, kitchens, and bathrooms. Our apartments are typically two-bedroom, one-bathroom homes that can house four students (two students in each bedroom). Palm South, the newest member of the LMU Housing family, offers pod-style living arrangements and 5-person flats (two doubles and one single room). Hannon The largest housing complex on campus is called Hannon, situated in the southern section of the Loyola Marymount University campus. LMU students reside in two-bedroom apartments, two to a bedroom. There are kitchens, living rooms, and bathrooms in each apartment. The mother of William H. Hannon, alumnus, donor, and honorary trustee, Eugenia B. Hannon, is the inspiration behind the name Hannon. For more information, visit: https://studentaffairs.lmu.edu/housing/studenthousing/aboutlmustudenthousing/livingoptions/apartments/hannon/  Leavey 4 Atop the Leavey campus of Loyola Marymount University, Leavey 4 is located on a hill with views of the city and Marina del Rey. It is perched on a bluff overlooking the city and Marina del Rey. LMU students reside in two-bedroom apartments, two to a bedroom. There are kitchens, living rooms, and bathrooms in each apartment. For more information, visit: https://studentaffairs.lmu.edu/housing/studenthousing/aboutlmustudenthousing/livingoptions/apartments/leavey5/  Leavey 6 At Loyola Marymount University's Leavey campus, Leavey 6 is the last structure to be finished. It is situated near University Hall and Leavey 5 on a hill. LMU students share bedrooms two at a time in one- and two-bedroom apartments. There are kitchens, living rooms, and bathrooms in each apartment. For more information, visit: https://studentaffairs.lmu.edu/housing/studenthousing/aboutlmustudenthousing/livingoptions/apartments/leavey6/  O'Malley O'Malley looks out over the city and Marina del Rey from a bluff on the Loyola Marymount University's Leavey campus. Most LMU students reside in two-bedroom apartments, while some three-bedroom apartments are also available. There are kitchens, living rooms, and bathrooms in each apartment. The former president of Loyola Marymount University, Thomas P. O'Malley, inspired the name, O'Malley. For more information, visit: https://studentaffairs.lmu.edu/housing/studenthousing/aboutlmustudenthousing/livingoptions/apartments/omalley/  Palm South Palm South is a brand-new, four-story, apartment-style structure for continuing students on the Loyola Marymount University campus. The location is on the east side of campus. In 5-person apartments, Palm South provides students with double rooms and a single room. Additionally, Palm South offers a brand-new housing option called a "pod." Large apartments with both doubles and singles, called pods, may accommodate 18 to 20 people. The pod has a sizable cooking area, communal area, numerous individual bathrooms, and choices for external sinks. Palm South features contemporary features and architecture in addition to a grassy courtyard and a short walk to a bluff with views of the Los Angeles region. For more information, visit: https://studentaffairs.lmu.edu/housing/studenthousing/aboutlmustudenthousing/livingoptions/apartments/palmsouth/  Tenderich Tenderich is situated on the southern campus of Loyola Marymount University, close to the Westchester area. Due to space restrictions, students must be qualified and submit an application through their housing application. 8000 House Since the early 1990s, Loyola Marymount University students have been housed in The 8000 House. Name: University of Pennsylvania
Overview: Founded in 1749, the University of Pennsylvania, popularly referred to as UPenn, is an Ivy League institution located in Market Street, Philadelphia, United States. The university is now spread over 299 acres, boasting 180 iconic buildings, a double-decker football stadium, the Penn Museum, and Arthur Ross Gallery.It has 12 schools, sharing one contiguous campus- Wharton, Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences, Nursing, Engineering, and Applied Sciences being some landmark ones. It offers over 70 undergraduate and graduate programs. Known for housing the nationäó»s first students union building - Houston Hall, the campus also has state-of-the-art training and recreational centers.UPenn is highly selective in its admission process, with the acceptance rate being a mere 7%. MBA, Computer and Information Science, Robotics, and Biotechnology are some of the most sought-after courses.Admission requirements include a mandatory English proficiency test, a reasonably high SAT/ACT/GRE/GMAT score for various classes, a long-drawn application form, writing samples, a Statement of Purpose, and so on. The average fees range between USD 55,000 to USD 70,000 for most courses. The university also offers a financial aid package of around 54,000 USD annually.

Course Ranking: The University of Pennsylvania comprises twelve graduate and professional schools in addition to four undergraduate institutions. The University of Pennsylvania has been named one of the best colleges to study business at both the undergraduate and graduate levels by the US News & World Report, which is focused on the US market. The university has held the top position for the last four years, from 2018 to 2021. According to US World News & Report rankings for the four years 2018–2021, the university also holds the top spot for those looking to pursue an MBA in Finance. For those interested in pursuing an MBA in supply chain management or an MBA in information systems, the university is ranked 17 and 11, respectively by US News & World Report. For those interested in studying a Global MBA, QS and Times Higher Education have ranked the university at number two, at number seven for accounting studies, and at number eleven for postgraduate business and studies. The university has consistently been listed among the top five for taking an MBA, and The Financial Times, which gives the most weight to Compensation (40%), Internationalization (20%), and Faculty Quality (15%), has ranked the university at number two for the current year, 2021. Candidates interested in pursuing engineering at UPenn will be pleasantly surprised to learn that the university is ranked in the top 10 for biomedical engineering and in the top 20 for other engineering majors like chemical engineering, electrical engineering, and mechanical engineering by US News & World Report. The institution does well in its computer courses as well, coming in at number 20 for studying computer engineering in US News & World Report and number 35 in THE (Times Higher Education) - PG Computers Ranking.
University Ranking: The University of Pennsylvania, sometimes known as UPenn or Penn, is a private Ivy League research institution that is situated in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. One of the nine colonial institutions established before the U.S. Declaration of Independence, the university is credited as being formed in 1740 by its founder and first president, Benjamin Franklin. For the current year, 2021, the university has received rankings from QS World University and Times Higher Education (THE) that place it at 16 and 13, respectively. While Times Higher Education (THE) accords equal weight to Teaching, Research, and Citations at 30% each, QS places the greatest emphasis on Academic Reputation (40%), followed by the Faculty/Student Ratio and Citations per Faculty at 20% each. UPenn has consistently been placed among the top 10 institutions by the US News and World Report, which ranks the university at number eight for the current year, 2021. View Admissions to the University of Pennsylvania for 2021. In addition to other rating factors, the US News & World Report bases its rankings on the number of publications cited, global research reputation, and regional research reputation (12.5% each). The University of Pennsylvania is ranked 16th according to the ARWU (Shanghai Ranking). In the Shanghai ranking, institutions are ranked based on the calibre of academic research they generate and the number of Nobel Prizes their faculty have earned rather than on their reputation among academics or employers. Name: Tufts University
Overview: Tufts University is a non-public research university set in Medford and Somerville, Massachusetts. The college was founded in 1852 and is ranked among the 30 best secondary schools in the country.The university provides 150 programs across eight professional and graduate schools in master's, certificates, dual degrees, and post-baccalaureate degrees; it has over 13 schools and colleges. The programs are offered in arts and science, engineering, medicine, and nutrition. The top courses offered by the university are M.Sc in computer science, data science, mechanical engineering, and electrical engineering, and masters in international business.Tufts University follows an interdisciplinary approach to help the students understand the courses and excel in their academic environment. The tuition fee is about USD 59,560 per annum. Tufts University provides financial assistance through student loans, work-study, and grants. The Student Career Center offers internships and job opportunities, organizing career fairs and recruitment programs.
Eligibility Overview: If students want to have their SAT or ACT test scores taken into account as part of their application, these exams are interpreted in light of their international background. Similarly, the admissions staff is aware of the wide range of extracurricular activities offered to international students. English language proficiency requirements: Unless they have been engaged in an English instruction school for at least three years, all applicants whose native language is not English must present proof of English competence. Students who have spent at least three years at a secondary school where English is the major language are not required to submit English proficiency tests, however, they may do so if they like. Students taking ESOL lessons in high school may be asked to show proof of competency.

Placement: An internship is one approach for a student to lay the groundwork for future job success. At least one internship was completed by 93 per cent of the Class of 2020 graduates, and 80 per cent completed two or more. The institution defines "internships" widely in the Career Center: students undertake research, study abroad, volunteer, work in summer employment, and complete internships. Many activities are beneficial to students who want to learn more about their job options, improve their resumes, and expand their professional networks.
Accommodation: Those with impairments, such as poor hearing, speech, mobility, or vision, as well as students with learning problems, are provided with appropriate accommodations at Tufts University. We also help students who are suffering from major medical or mental health issues. Academic, housing and other arrangements are coordinated through the StAAR Center as needed. For more information, visit: https://students.tufts.edu/staar-center/accessibility-services

THE routinely places its PG Engineering and Technology courses in the 251-300 level for four years. According to US News & World Report, PG Engineering and Technology has several disciplines that are among the top 50, including Biomedical Engineering (#41), Civil Engineering (#46), and Chemical Engineering (#47). THE has also placed Tufts University's PG Computer courses in the 501–600 range for 2021 rankings, which have been stable for three years. According to US News & World Report's ranking for 2021, the PG Computer Engineering course comes in at number 61.
University Ranking: Rankings for Tufts University indicate that it is among the top universities nationally and internationally. It is ranked #182 globally and #40 nationally for 2021 by US News & World Report. Tufts University can rank among the top 500 universities worldwide and the top 100 universities in the USA. Statistics relating to admissions form the basis of national rankings. Since just 15% of applicants were accepted, Tufts University admissions are extremely competitive. Along with recommendation letters, additional requirements include excellent ACT or SAT scores, GPA, and class rank. As a result, any university's rank range will lower the admission rate.According to THE - University Ranking 2021, Tufts University is ranked #155. THE rankings have changed significantly over time. Starting with a ranking of #135 in 2017, they rose to #169 in 2018 and dropped by 17 points in 2019. Tufts University is ranked #260 in the QS - World University Rankings for 2021, down 7 places from 2020. Additional QS ranking criteria are provided for Tufts University, including a faculty-student ratio of 73.9, several citations per faculty member of 50.7, a percentage of international students at 35.7, an academic reputation of 19.6, and an overall score of 36.5.

Name: Kaplan International Languages - Seattle (Downtown)
Overview: Formed in 2005, Kaplan International Languages has continued its strife to increase its brand name in academics and language training. With its partnership across 20 countries and growing visibility worldwide, the institute has served international students to help them achieve their dreams. Moreover, the institute has been able to secure about 20,000 students across the globe, thereby increasing the demand for bilingual interests. Currently, the Kaplan International Languages courses focus mainly on the English language for international students. After acquiring the Alpadia Language School in 2019, it also provides French and German courses. The institute's students have been on the rise since the purpose for learning another language can be personal, professional or even academic. The courses here can continue for up to about 50 weeks, depending on the level of proficiency. The stages include elementary, lower intermediate, intermediate, higher intermediate, advanced and proficiency. The students receive K+, which is a comprehensive collection of books and online materials. The Seattle campus of the Kaplan International Languages can be exciting for the students because of the convenience of the location. Attending students from a vast range of over 84 nationalities, the institute has helped them crack the IELTS examinations and move to foreign countries with an effective knowledge of the English language. The institute has, therefore, successfully generated high revenue for its services in the international languages field. Their success is evident from the recommendation rate of 97% among the previous students. Moreover, their contribution in the field for the past 80 years has helped the institute grow its brand name.

It enrols 4,400 full-time undergraduate students in over 70 bachelor majors in professional programmes, sciences, and humanities. Placement: Internships An internship is a learning opportunity that allows students to receive academic credit for their work experience. Internships are intended to improve a student's professional preparedness and job prospects. To gain credit, the internship must be done at a location where the supervisor has agreed to deliver structured learning experiences that support specific learning goals. Students must complete an Internship Application and have it approved by their school's Dean. Guidelines for Internships: Students must have earned a minimum of 60 creditsStudents must have a cumulative GPA of at least 2.5three internship credits require a minimum of 120 hours; students are allowed two internships in their degree programme, and they must complete a total of 6 credit hours of internshipAll parties must complete the Internship for Academic Credit application before the Add/Drop deadline for the corresponding semester, which is initiated by the student and requires action and response from the student, faculty advisor, internship location, and Dean of the School
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation The Office of Residence Life and Campus Housing encourages academic accomplishment, personal growth, and responsible citizenship by providing a secure, comfortable, and inclusive residential community. Living on-campus You'll spend late evenings here learning, making new friends, and having a great time.The majority of first-year students are assigned to traditional halls. Upper-level students have a variety of housing options to choose from, including classic halls, suites, apartments, and houses. The institution provides these to encourage personal development and independence. Residence Halls York Institution is a four-year residential college in Pennsylvania. As a result, unless they are enrolled as a commuting student, juniors, sophomores, and seniors must live on campus in their first year. This covers readmitted and transfer students. Commuters are students who live at their legal residence and commute from their parent's or guardian's house within a 35-mile radius of the campus.  The residential halls provided by the university are: Arnold HouseBeard HallBrockie CommonsCountry Club ManorCurry HouseKeiffer HouseLittle Run LodgeManor Hall EastManor Hall SouthManor Hall NorthManor Hall North EastManor Hall WestNewberry HouseNorthside CommonsPenn HallPershing HouseRichland HallSpring GardenSpringettsbury ApartmentsSpringettsbury HallSusquehanna HallTyler Run I and IITyler Run IIIWenger House For more information, visit: https://www.ycp.edu/about-us/offices-and-departments/student-development-and-campus-life/residence-life-and-housing/on-campus-housing-options/  For general enquiries, visit: https://www.ycp.edu/about-us/offices-and-departments/student-development-and-campus-life/residence-life-and-housing/

Name: Webster University - (Irvine, California)
Overview: Webster University is one of the oldest universities in Irvine, California, established in 1915. It is a not-for-profit university that aims to proffer best-in-class facilities to students from all over the world. Webster University was formerly a women's college founded by the Sisters of Loretto and was the first Catholic college for women west of the Mississippi River. Later, the university made its foray into Co-Education and allowed male students admission. Now the university is officially associated with The Higher Learning Commission. Webster intends to make education personal and celebrate their students' individualities. The university highly encourages students to be participative in society and to give back to the community by taking initiatives they're able to learn through their education. If you graduate from webster, there is no doubt that you will find an absolute change in your life, not just through employment or academics, but in terms of personal growth. What makes this university unique is its globalized curriculum across courses. By studying at this college, students get an opportunity to experience a global learning component. Students gain an excellent opportunity to network worldwide with people around the world.

Name: Saint Edward's University
Overview: The Saint Edward's University is a university located in Austin, USA. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Electrical Engineering. The main campus of Saint Edward's University is located in Austin. The university offers over 2 undergraduate programs and 2 postgraduate programs. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses.  Through its schools of Behavioral and Social Sciences, Education, Humanities, Natural Sciences, and The Bill Munday School of Business, St. Edward's grants bachelor's degrees in more than 50 fields of study and eight master's degree programmes. St. Edward's University was recognized by U.S. News & World Report as the ninth-best regional university in the west for 2022, third-best for veterans, and tenth-best for undergraduate teaching.Seven dorms and two apartment complexes on campus house more than 1,300 students. More than 125 campus groups, including the student government, service organizations, academic honor societies, cultural clubs, and intramural sports, are active among St. Edward's University students. Eligibility Overview: Admission RequirementsSt. Edward's University needs you to have a 3.52 GPA and be in the middle of your high school class. Name: Santa Clara University
Overview: A private Jesuit university, Santa Clara University was founded in 1851 by John Nobili, S.J., Located in Silicon Valley. The University is the oldest operating higher learning institution in California. It aims to blend avant-garde technological innovation with traditional Jesuit values of social consciousness. With a campus spread across 106 acres, Santa Clara University has a student base of more than 10,000. The institution boasts an experienced team of 500+ faculty members and an impressive alumnus. The university campus in Silicon Valley is at the southern tip of San Franciso Bay and lies over the border of San Jose. Some of the most in-demand courses at Santa Clara University are M.S. in Online Marketing, B.S. in Mechanical Engineering, M.A. in Counselling Leadership, Ed.D in Social Justice Leadership, etc. Housing over six colleges and schools, Santa Clara University Campus is equipped with libraries, research centers, laboratories, information resources, etc. The Malley Fitness Centre and the Kenna Hall are well-known. The University is committed to Arts and Culture, as is evident with more than 125 student clubs, including the Society of Women Engineers and The Redwood. Santa Clara University Housing operates eight Residential Learning Communities, each with a unique theme, and ten campus residence halls. Employing a global approach to education, the institute connects its students to internship opportunities that will help them connect with the outside world. The average tuition fee at Santa Clara University is CAD 37k. International Students have access to various merit-based scholarships and grants.
Eligibility Overview: Santa Clara University needs you to have a 3.69 GPA and be above average in your high school class. At the very least, you'll need a mix of A's and B's, with more A's than B's. You can make up for a low GPA by taking more difficult classes, such as AP or IB.Maintain a 3.68 GPA despite taking the most difficult courses offered. At Santa Clara University, course rigour and GPA are "very significant." SCU's Class of 2025 has an average high school GPA of 3.68, with 5% graduating with a 4.0 and 40% graduating with a GPA between 3.75 and 3.99.
Accommodation: RLCs (Residential Learning Communities) house all first-years and most sophomores in eight of our ten campus residence buildings. Each RLC is based on one or two topics, such as community service or current events. Because the themes are so diverse, it's simple to choose one that interests you.RLCs form close-knit communities where you'll live together, take classes together, and share your daily struggles and victories.You'll never be more than a short walk from the library or an 8 a.m. coffee before class because all of our residence halls are close to classes and the student centre.for more information click on this link-https://www.scu.edu/campus-life/housing/

Name: Virginia Commonwealth University
Overview: Founded in 1838, Virginia Commonwealth University is a public research university in Richmond, Virginia. Being one of the oldest universities in Richmond, VCU has a total enrollment of more than 30,000 students. Monroe Park Campus and MCV Campus are the two main campuses, along with a few local research centers and a satellite campus in Doha, Qatar. The university consists of 20 academic schools and colleges offering 68 undergraduate courses, 70 postgraduate, 46 online certificate courses, and several doctoral and professional programs in fields like Business, Management, Psychology, Physical Education, Nursing, Health Sciences, Marketing, Engineering, Political Science, Mass Communication, Journalism and Social Work. The Neuroscience Research program ranks 32nd, and the Addiction Studies Research program secures the 14th position nationally. Unique, one-of-a-kind programs like Homeland Security, Real Estate, Urban Land Development, and Emergency Preparedness are also available. The admissions are moderately selective, with a high acceptance rate of 87%. Applications are to be filled for intake into Fall, Spring, and Summer semesters by undergraduates and postgraduates through the Common Application and VCU Graduate Online Application. NACES evaluated academic transcripts, LORs, and scores of TOEFL, SAT, ACT, etc., are also to be submitted with an application fee of 70 USD. The average undergraduate tuition fee is 32,742 USD, while that for postgraduate programs is 25,956 USD. Scholarships like Presidential Scholarship and Provost Scholarship, both worth 16,000 USD, and Dean's Scholarship worth 8,000 USD are awarded to academic achievers. On-campus accommodation in 12 residential halls is provided to almost 6000 students who can choose amongst traditional, suite-style, and apartment-style housing options along with facilities like Swipes and Dining Dollars. Two student unions manage over 500 clubs and organizations, and the campus is equipped with one of Virginia's largest research libraries. With an above-average placement rate of 67.4%, the annual median package of VCU graduates is 44,000 USD.
Eligibility Overview: Freshman applicants need have a minimum GPA of 3.5 (on a 4.0 scale) and either a combined SAT score of at least 1330 on the critical reading and math parts of the test or an ACT composite score of at least 29 to be competitive for admission to the Honors College.VCU expects you to have a 3.65 GPA and be above average in your high school class. You'll need a combination of A's and B's, with an emphasis on A's. If you took several AP or IB classes, your weighted GPA will improve and you will be able to demonstrate your potential to take college classes.

The campus encompasses 441 acres of land that enrol more than 19,000 students annually. This institute is one of the best public universities that empower students with proper knowledge, educational degree, and practical exposure. It is one of the most sought-after colleges among students looking for higher education. The California State University, San Bernardino Palm Desert, has day, evening, and weekend classes. It has a well-driven and strong infrastructure. Besides academics, it offers several other extracurricular activities like sports, music, arts, etc. It offers 123 programs for Bachelor's degrees and 61 programs for Master's degrees. It also has Doctorate and certificate programs. San Bernardino Palm Desert fees for undergraduate students range between $2,300 to $3,700. For post-batch graduate students, the fee ranges from $2,720.32 to $4,424.74. For doctorate students, it ranges between $6,500 to $6,800. Presently, it has 84,000 alumni. To let all students get an education, it has online, on-campus, off-campus and virtual modes of teaching. California State University, The Palm Desert campus offers three subjects; hospitality management, cyber security, and entrepreneurship. The 4 years of graduation course ensures a life-transforming university experience. They groom the students in all aspects of academics, personality development, skill development, and leadership skills.
