Name: University of Texas at Tyler
Overview: The University of Texas at Tyler is located in Tyler, the USA was established in 1971. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. The main campus of UT Tyler is stunning, with 259 acres of scenic area with a lake and a dense forest of pine and oak trees. Excellent academic, office, recreational, and student support facilities may be found on the main campus.Students at UT Tyler can live on campus in one of five housing complexes close to the school's resources for learning and entertainment. Roughly 1,700 students are living in these houses, both male and female.An international student's estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditure, to study executive MBA at the University of Texas at Tyler is around $35000. The University of Texas at Tyler offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. The University of Texas at Tyler provides a variety of academic scholarships to first-year students with competitive holistic evaluation and merit-based selection. Eligibility Overview: The University of Texas at Tyler accepts students with a GPA of 3.38. It's fine to have a B average with some A's thrown in. It's better to stay away from Cs and Ds, as application readers may wonder if you can take the pressures of college.If you're a junior or senior, changing your GPA in time for college applications is difficult. You'll need a better SAT or ACT score to compensate if your GPA is at or below the school average of 3.38. This will enable you to compete effectively against applicants with better GPAs.Each school has its own set of standardised testing standards. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. The main campus of Stephen F Austin State University is located in Nacogdoches. The university offers undergraduate and postgraduate programs. There are six colleges at this university. The Elementary Education Department, Human Services Department, Secondary Education & Educational Leadership Department, and School of Human Sciences are all parts of the James I. Perkins College of Education. The Nelson Rusche College of Business houses departments for accounting, economics, finance, management, and marketing, as well as a master's programme in business administration.The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. The estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student, is around 2135841 INR.Stephen F Austin State University offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Read more details about Stephen F Austin State University on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations..

Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation From developing lifetime connections to participating in on-campus social activities and study opportunities, campus living is one of the most popular ways to have the whole "Lumberjack experience". Living on campus immerses you in the whole college experience, and data also shows students who reside on campus had higher GPAs and graduation rates, according to research. SFA offers a range of housing options, such as Griffith Hall At Griffith Hall, having a good time is a priority. This co-ed residence hall has one of the most active hall associations on campus. Throughout the year, residents participate in various activities ranging from community service and leadership initiatives to just-for-fun events such as axe handle decorating and Grocery BINGO.You'll feel perfectly at home at Griffith Hall if your ideal college experience includes hanging out with friends and getting engaged in every facet of campus life. Just make sure you have a good time. For more information, visit: https://www.sfasu.edu/life-at-sfa/housing-dining/housing/residence-halls/griffith-hall   Hall 14 Hall 14 provides everything you'd want in your new home away from home, including proximity to the library, Student Recreation Center,  and the East College Cafeteria. Hit the books in the study room, grab a bite to eat in the community kitchen, or play a game of Ping-Pong in the lobby.Look no further if you're seeking ways to get involved and meet other Lumberjacks: Residents of this hall enjoy intramural sports, study groups, and other activities sponsored by SFA's Residence Hall Association. For more information, visit: https://www.sfasu.edu/life-at-sfa/housing-dining/housing/residence-halls/hall-14  Hall 20 This co-ed residence hall is known for its strong feeling of community and a year-round calendar of events and innovative activities. You can take a self-defence class or join a game of Ultimate Frisbee at Hall 20. Play volleyball or video games. Take sides in the fabled Floor Wars in Hall 20, or test your creativity in a decorating competition.Of course, Hall 20 is about more than just having a good time. Each room offers an air conditioner, a microwave/refrigerator, and spectacular views of the neighbouring Ag Pond. You'll never be far from Lumberjack and Ladyjack sports or exciting events like Holler at Homer because Hall 20 is next to Homer Bryce Stadium. For more information, visit: https://www.sfasu.edu/life-at-sfa/housing-dining/housing/residence-halls/hall-20  Kerr Hall The university is a warm, accepting, and supportive environment where you will be treated as if you were a family member. Kerr Hall boasts one of the best communities and activities organised by the Hall Council. This all-female hall is part of SFA's First Year Commons. Many first-year residents enjoy Kerr Hall so much that they choose to stay until they graduate. For more details, visit: https://www.sfasu.edu/life-at-sfa/housing-dining/housing/residence-halls/kerr-hall  Lumberjack Landing This four-story co-ed residential hall contains everything you'll need to smooth the transition to college life. A monthly programme of entertaining activities will help you get to know your fellow Lumberjacks, and Lumberjack Landing's 16 study rooms will ensure you have plenty of opportunities to study.You don't have to look far for additional academic assistance. Lumberjack Landing's staff and community assistants offer a variety of educational programmes throughout the year. The Ed and Gwen Cole Student Success Center, located on the first level, includes amenities such as a residents computer lab and three private study spaces. For more information, visit: https://www.sfasu.edu/life-at-sfa/housing-dining/housing/residence-halls/lumberjack-landing  Lumberjack Lodge Two- and four-bedroom suites with fully equipped kitchenettes and furnished living areas are available in this co-ed residence hall.Lumberjack Lodge combines apartment-style living with student-friendly amenities such as coinless laundry (two per floor), TV lounges, and a game area with a pool table! Lumberjack Lodge is also conveniently located in the middle of the SFA campus, close to the East College Cafeteria, the R.W. Steen Library, and Homer Bryce Stadium. For more information, visit: https://www.sfasu.edu/life-at-sfa/housing-dining/housing/residence-halls/lumberjack-lodge  Lumberjack Village This coed residential hall, consisting of three buildings, has something for everyone. Do you want to be alone? Apartment-style suites with private rooms with full-sized beds and a communal bath are available in Buildings 1 and 3. Are you looking for a more communal living situation? The "quad" rooms in Building 2 are unique (two students per room and a shared bath). Do you enjoy cooking? The flats in Building three full offer kitchens and stackable washers and dryers.Regardless of which building you pick, you will have access to all of the amenities that make Lumberjack Village a terrific place to live. A fully equipped shared kitchen and a game area are available at the community centre. A sand volleyball court is open in the outdoor recreation area. You'll have many possibilities because Lumberjack Village is home to SFA's Residence Hall Association. For more information, visit: https://www.sfasu.edu/life-at-sfa/housing-dining/housing/residence-halls/lumberjack-village  South Hall South Hall, within walking distance of the Baker Pattillo Student Center, R.W. Steen Library, and the Student Recreation Center provides a calm, low-key atmosphere for Summer 2022 students in the centre of the SFA campus.This co-ed residence hall features everything you'll need for work and leisure, including a lobby with a flat-screen TV, a community kitchen, and coinless laundry facilities. South Hall, with a capacity of only 90 Lumberjacks, is one of the smallest on campus, so you'll never feel like just another face in the crowd. For more information, visit: https://www.sfasu.edu/life-at-sfa/housing-dining/housing/residence-halls/south-hall   Steen Hall Lumberjacks live large at Steen Hall. This coed, two-tower residence hall is the most extensive on-campus and offers a lot. Steen hosts over 100 exciting events throughout the year, ranging from karaoke nights in the lobby to community outreach activities. Do you need some time to study alone? It's no problem. Visit one of our study rooms equipped with dry erase boards and plenty of space for students to stretch out. If you're seeking a residence hall that genuinely gives you the "college feel," look no further than Steen Hall. For more information, visit: https://www.sfasu.edu/life-at-sfa/housing-dining/housing/residence-halls/steen-hall  Wisely Hall Wisely Hall is a co-ed honours residence hall for freshman and upper-level students interested in academics. Wisely Hall gives studious Lumberjacks a peaceful space to hit the books, with a capacity of only 77 students and 24-hour quiet hours.When residents are not studying, they like hanging out in the lobby and watching sports or participating in unusual activities and programmes like Friends and Family Weekend, Stay at Home Weekend, and the ever-popular Pancakes and Pajamas study break breakfast-at-night programme.The School of Honors must accept residents because Wisely Hall is an honours hall. A cumulative GPA of 3.25 or better is required of all Wisely residents. For more information, visit: https://www.sfasu.edu/life-at-sfa/housing-dining/housing/residence-halls/wisely-hall   Off-Campus Accommodation Living on campus allows you to immerse yourself in the college experience entirely, and studies show that GPAs are higher for students who live on campus and graduation rates than for those who do not. You can live off campus if you're an upperclassman with at least 60 semester hours or if you're at least 21 years old. You'll need to apply for off-campus permission if you don't have one. For more information, visit: https://www.sfasu.edu/life-at-sfa/housing-dining/housing/off-campus-living  For general enquiries: https://www.sfasu.edu/life-at-sfa/housing-dining/housing

Name: Villanova University36
Overview: Named after Saint Thomas of Villanova, the Villanova University is a private Catholic research university located in Pennsylvania. It was founded in 1842 and is the one of the oldest Catholic universities in the United States. The mission of the university is to build leaders who are morally grounded and intellectually inspired to change the world. The university consists of six colleges, four of which conduct undergraduate and graduate programs. Together, they offer 50 Bachelors programs as well as over 40 Masters programs. The university also offers doctorates and is classified as a high research university. The best courses in Villanova University include Bachelors in Management, Bachelors in International Business, Masters in Computer Engineering and Masters in Mechanical Engineering. The university campus covers an area of 254 acres and is divided into four parts. The Main Campus is home to many historic buildings, including the famous St. Thomas of Villanova Church. The West Campus is home to a number of performing arts groups and residences, while the South Campus and The Commons offer accommodation to students as well. The average cost of studying at Villanova University comes to USD 74,000. The fees structure is different depending on the type and duration of the program chosen. The student community is vibrant and has a number of sororities, fraternities and student clubs. The Villanova Wildcats represent the university at a number of collegiate tournaments including football and basketball. The largest Special Olympics run by students is conducted on the campus ground. The university also promotes Augustinian values through its Campus Ministry. Notable alumni from the institute include Jill Biden, the First Lady of the United States, track and field Olympian Sonia O'Sullivan and Ed Rendell, the former Governor of Pennsylvania.

Name: American English College - Main Campus
Overview: American English College is a Saudi Arabia Cultural Mission (SACM) approved and ACCET accredited institution. The institute aims to provide students with English as a Second Language (ESL). Hence, it extends a SEVIS-approved ESL program specialising in languages and test preparation. Helping students for the last three decades, AEC possesses the ability to issue Form I-20s for F-1 international students.This institute offers private tutoring and group classes at its two Los Angeles campuses. One of them is the Main Campus situated at Monterey Park. It is considered the safest and most affordable place to live in Los Angeles and is easily accessed by public transportation. The American English College Monterey Park is situated at a highly convenient location with Pasadena, Irvine, Hollywood, Downtown Los Angeles, and some popular beaches at just a 30 to 45-minute riding distance. Interested students can choose from more than 30 partner institutions and enjoy the benefits of TOEFL waivers guaranteeing admission. This institute provides three English programs for TOEFL preparation: semi-intensive and intensive English. The semi-intensive and intensive English programs are recommended for working professionals or academic students. Both of these have a maximum student-to-teacher ratio of 15:1. While the duration of the intensive one is 28 hours per week, the semi-intensive one is 18 hours per week. The TOEFL preparation program is 20 hours per week. The American English College is involved in mutual agreements with many institutions. Students can attend several community colleges, universities, private speciality schools and other institutes after finishing AEC’s Level 6. And that too without a TOEFL score.

Name: Southern New Hampshire University
Overview: Southern New Hampshire University is one of the top private universities between Manchester and Hooksett in New Hampshire. Established in 1932, the institution has received recognition from the New England Commission of Higher Education. With a 300-acre campus, SNHU is among the fastest-growing universities in the United States. Southern New Hampshire University has a student base of more than 3000 on-campus students and about 135,000 online students. The institution offers over 200 academic programs ranging from hospitality to health, business, education, etc. Some of the top programs at SNHU are Data Analytics, Marketing, Anthropology, Human Services, and Criminal Justice. SNHU's massive campus is along the Merrimack River. SNHU's faculty is world-class, including the Daniel Webster College's teaching staff and some of the country's best aviation programs. The campus also houses the Gustafson Center and the Monadnock Hall. With a mission to empower its students and challenge the status quo, SNHU believes in learning outside the classroom. The students are presented with internship opportunities, including summer research jobs and a spring break trip to Florida. A large portion of SNHU's students work with the local community and develop their skills. The average tuition cost at Southern New Hampshire University is CAD 40k. International Students have access to several merit scholarships and grants. The institution has all the requisite facilities to promote learning and well-rounded campus life. It has many student organisations on campus, including The Penmen Press and Radio SNHU. SNHU Accommodation supports on-campus housing with an array of residential halls and apartment complexes equipped with student lounges, fitness, and entertainment centres. SNHU is known for its student-run restaurants, such as the Last Chapter Pub and The Quill.

Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation ESL, undergraduate, and graduate students can live on campus except for married students and students with children. Because on-campus accommodation is limited, make your reservation as soon as possible. Traditional resident halls (furnished shared rooms often in suites with a shared ordinary parlour and bathroom) and apartments are both options (furnished single rooms with a shared kitchen, living and bath space). There is more to Southern New Hampshire University's campus than just classrooms and study spaces. They reside there. We work hard to help every student feel at home, which is why. Living on campus will allow you to fully immerse yourself in the SNHU community with housing options ranging from residence hall suites to shared apartments and a focus on student safety.  Residence Halls Numerous housing halls are dispersed throughout the campus, giving students easy access to the university's eating options, academic buildings, and other facilities. Most rooms in each gallery are double or single beds, with shared bathrooms and common areas. First- and second-year students are often assigned to residence halls. Residence halls are:  Kingston HallNew Castle HallTuckerman HallWashington HallWindsor & Hampton Hall Residence Apartments The residence suites are perfect for students who desire more autonomy while living on campus. Because of this, seniors and juniors typically favour this housing choice.Each apartment unit is completely furnished and may accommodate up to four people. Each team has four bedrooms, a kitchen, a living room/dining space, and a bathroom. Apartments provided are:  Lincoln & Conway ApartmentsMonadnock Hall For more information, visit: https://www.snhu.edu/student-experience/campus-experience/campus-housing  Temporary Housing There might be temporary lodging available in the university resident halls if you're unclear where you'd like to live once you get there. Off-Campus Accommodation In Manchester, the institution also provides off-campus accommodation choices. For instance, several apartment buildings are nearby with various prices to suit all spending levels. A list of available rooms in the residences of members of the neighbourhood is also available on the SNHU sites. Homestays Southern New Hampshire University and American Homestay Network have joined to offer homestay possibilities for students who want to live with a local family. Homestays are a fantastic choice for college students who wish to experience American culture firsthand, interact with the community more deeply, and feel more at home while attending Southern New Hampshire University. For more information, visit: https://www.snhu.edu/student-experience/international-experience/international-student-services/information-for-incoming-students/housing-information-for-international-students

Name: Georgetown University
Overview: Situated in Washington D.C, Georgetown University is a private Jesuit research institute founded in 1789 and the country's oldest Catholic higher education institution.Students can apply to one of the degree programs (bachelor's, master's, doctoral and certificate) and choose from over 40 undergraduate and 50 graduate disciplines, including English, Global Business, Human Science, International Politics etc. Georgetown University has three campuses within Washington D.C: the Main Campus, Medical Center and Law Center. Furthermore, as part of a global academic initiative, the university's nine schools offer around 213 undergraduate study-abroad programs in 57 countries, including Italy and London. Some of these program types are Area Studies, Direct Matriculation, Business, Language, Nursing and Service Learning. The estimated undergraduate cost of attending is USD 29,892, while the graduate-level tuition per credit hour is USD 2,278. The university grants need-based financial aid and not merit-based. Students must complete the College Scholarship Service and Free Application for Federal Student Aid. International students are considered for limited need-based scholarships. Placement records indicate that full-time Georgetown University MBA graduates have acquired packages with an average starting salary of USD 124,119.

Name: Tarleton State University
Overview: Located in Stephenville, Texas, Tarleton State University is a public university located just outside Dallas. It was established in 1899. The university offers 64 undergraduate, 27 postgraduate, and two doctoral courses offered through 7 academic colleges. The main campus is located in Stephenville. The other campus is located in Fort Worth, Texas. Tarleton State University offers courses in agricultural and environmental sciences, business administration, education, graduate studies, health and human service, liberal and fine arts, science, and technology. The popular programs are environmental engineering, nursing, business, and communications. Tarleton's research centres include the Texas Institute for Applied Environmental Research and the Southwest Regional Dairy Center. The tuition fee is around USD 17,448. The university also offers specialized programs at its Dora Lee Langdon Cultural and Educational Center and special programs and courses at McLennan Community College in Waco, Weatherford College in Weatherford, Bryan at the RELLIS Campus, and Fort Worth. On-campus housing facilities are available at Tarleton State University. Some of the housing options include Centennial, Heritage, Hunnewell, and Legacy. These residence halls include split-style rooms, lobbies, and houses. The campus has more than 100 student organizations and clubs, including athletics, recreational sports, health services, a counselling centre, university police, and emergency information. The cost of living, including housing, amounts to USD 10,480. The campus has library facilities with academic sources for the students. The university organizes football tournaments every year. Tarleton State University offers need-based financial aid, scholarships, and grants from the federal government for students. International scholarships are provided to international students to study in the US.

Name: Roosevelt University
Overview: Roosevelt Institution is a Chicago, Illinois-based private university. Roosevelt University offers 64 undergraduate majors, 38 minors, 54 graduate programs, and three doctoral programs. Bachelor's degrees are available in Psychology, Computer Science, and many others. A minimum score of 6.5 is required in IELTS for admission to Roosevelt University.The Master's courses can be done in Business Administration in Computer Science, among others. The tuition is calculated per credit hour basis and varies for each course.During the admissions process, Roosevelt evaluates all applicants for scholarships. These scholarships are awarded depending on your previous academic performance.The university has a 73% job placement rate and a 93% annual course completion rate (according to the data recorded in 2016-17). The Chicago College of Performing Arts is housed within Roosevelt University.

Placement: Internships provide essential work experience while you are still in school. An internship is a terrific way to advance professionally, learn about other career paths, create useful contacts, and build a network for your future job. It may lead to employment following graduation. There are internships available in a wide range of professions and the Career Development staff can help you find opportunities through the internship process. Reasons to Intern :  Clarification of professional objectivesImproved job-search abilitiesIncreased networking opportunities Professional experience to improve both your knowledge and your resumeApplicants who have undergone an internship are preferred by employers. the internship application process
Accommodation: The university center of Chicago is the main residency campus accommodating almost 1700 students from 3 colleges. The university provides on-campus residential facilities. It has two residential halls, including the new Wabash building. The second is the Fornelli hall with apartment-only options Its newest academic building, Wabash, are the tallest in Chicago, 2nd tallest in the United States, and 4th largest educational complex globally. In addition, the university provides a multicultural Student Support Services (MSSS) that offers academic support for first-gen students, students of color, financial literacy, and advocacy and assistance to students.For more information, visit:  https://www.roosevelt.edu/campuses/accommodations
Course Description: Roosevelt University is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. Roosevelt University was founded in 1945. Located in Chicago,USA the university is home to about 421 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.Roosevelt University is ranked 2732th in Top Universities by Webometrics - World. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 2 undergraduate and 2 postgraduate programs. Roosevelt University has 4 intakes in Sep,Jan,May,Aug. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 4 years and master’s degree courses is 2 years.The average yearly tuition fee of Roosevelt University is around Fee will depend on the course chosen.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by Roosevelt University include USC Associates Scholarships UG Business Programs,Horace W Goldsmith Fellowship,You Are Welcome Here Scholarship Bs In Kinesiology Michigan State University,Graduate Incentive Award MS Applied Economics.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to Roosevelt University is the post-study work opportunities in USA. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.Roosevelt University has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: Valencia College - East Campus
Overview: The Valencia College was founded as a Valencia Junior College in 1967, later naming it Valencia community college. It is a public college situated in Orlando, Florida. This college has various campus locations in Orlando, with additional campuses locations in Kissimmee and Winter Park. This institution is operational in 8 campuses and three sites, encompassing Orange County and Osceola County. The Valencia college especially trains next-generation people regarding public safety by utilising modern technology and advanced simulation training. This college is approved by the Commission on Colleges of the Southern Association of Schools and Colleges. Among multiple other campuses, the East Campus of this college is situated at 701, North Econlockhatchee Trail in East Orange County. This campus proudly boasts of serving nearly 21, 000 students yearly. Moreover, this campus is primarily home to three regional UCF campuses. The students of this particular campus enjoy general education classes and receive an A.A. degree. For friendly, professional, and caring staff and faculty, this campus has received acknowledgement in several academic areas. With more than 120 programs combining two and four-year degrees, students will receive similar education as a state university. At Valencia College, students need to complete an associate degree before shifting into a baccalaureate program. Students can explore a wide range of bachelor’s degrees in various disciplines such as Cardiopulmonary Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering Technology, Nursing, Radiologic and Imaging Sciences etc. In the East campus, students can attend various programs such as Finance specialisation, Associate in Science degree, Marketing specialisation, Web development specialisation, Graphic and Interactive design specialisation etc. Besides, each campus is equipped with top-notch libraries where students can get access to a comprehensive range of educational resources, periodicals, e-books, journals, online databases and multimedia resources etc. Moreover, with an acceptance rate of nearly 100%, students can explore multiple career opportunities and pursue higher education in other top universities in the U.S.
Accommodation: Valencia College is a primarily a commuter school, however our Downtown Campus offers student housing opportunities. There are plenty of student housing options around each of our campuses as well. We hold annual housing fairs on campus and provide rental information and roommate listings through the Student Development office.COSTIn general, the amount you spend for housing should be limited to one-fourth or one-third of the total amount you have planned to spend on living expenses. If the cost is one-half of your budget or more, you may be spending too much. Housing costs include:Down paymentMonthly rentUtilitiesElectricWaterTV/Internet/phoneROOMMATESHaving a roommate (or roommates) is a great way to save money on rent. Plus, it gives you someone to share the college experience with. Just keep a few things in mind when choosing someone to live with:Don't meet up with potential roommates by yourself-bring a friend and meet in a public place.Choose a roommate who has similar living habits as you. Before moving in together, discuss what you expect out of each other.Avoid money issues-ask your landlord if you and your roommate can have separate leases.

Name: University of Richmond
Overview: Founded in 1830, the University of Richmond is located on the border between Henrico County and the city of Richmond, in the state capital of Virginia. It is a leading liberal arts university ranked 22nd in the list of National Liberal Arts Colleges and follows a semester-based academic calendar.The college offers undergraduate majors and degree programs and postgraduate and doctorate programs. The college consists of 5 schools- School of Arts and Sciences, Jepson School of Leadership Studies, Robins School of Business, Richmond School of Law, and School of Professional and Continuing Studies. ﻿The popular majors at the University of Richmond include Business, Management, Marketing, and Related Support Services; Social Sciences; Biological and Biomedical Sciences; Multi/Interdisciplinary Studies; and Psychology. The college provides both need and merit-based scholarships to the students. Need-based aid is determined by the student's family's demonstrated ability to pay for college, as calculated by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid, known as FAFSA.
Eligibility Overview: Application Requirements: International students make up about 10% of the student body at Richmond. Some of the application materials/documents required of all overseas applicants are listed below (UG & PG)Academic records (formal transcripts, high school diplomas, undergraduate degree certificates, and so on)Scores from standardized tests (SAT/ACT/ GRE/ GMAT) are not required.Scores on English proficiency tests (TOEFL/IELTS)Form for international financial certificationa scanned copy of the passport's photo page (optional)Form to record your medical historyRequirements for English ProficiencyThe minimal ELP scores required for admission to Richmond are listed here. However, the university advises aiming for higher marks to increase admissions prospects.80 TOEFL-iBTPBT 550 on the TOEFL7.5 on the IELTSSAT 660:English 28 on the ACTA or B grade in A Level English/ IB/ AP
Placement: Placement at the University of RichmondThe institution has a spider-connect programme that connects students with companies, and the career services help students find a suitable internship for a job through career counsellors.To improve employability skills, the University also hosts Spider job fairs and holds workshops on areas such as safe job hunting, interview preparation strategies, resume writing workshops, and so on.The institution places its students in a variety of methods, including on-campus placements, career chats, career expos, and an international employment resources library.Within two years of graduation, 95% of the college's students are able to find work, and after six years, they earn roughly 64,200 USD per year, compared to the national average of 33,028 USD.
Accommodation: On-Campus AccommodationOn-campus housing is available.The University of Richmond provides its students with on-campus housing in a pleasant living environment.On-campus housing information can be found here.https://housing.richmond.edu/ Off-Campus AccommodationOff-campus housing is available.The average monthly rent is between 525 and 600 dollars.Studio apartments, three-bedroom apartments, four-bedroom apartments, and communal apartments are among the residential types.Each apartment is completely furnished with a washer and dryer, as well as gas for heating, hot water, and cooking. closets that are enormous, a large balcony or patio, FiOS (high-speed fiber-optics for TV, internet, and phone) is available, as well as 24-hour emergency service.The majority of the units are in close proximity to parks, shopping, dining, and entertainment venues.Off-campus housing information can be found here.https://www.apartments.com/richmond-va/student-housing/https://www.apartmentfinder.com/Off-Campus-Housing/Virginia/Apartments-Near-Virginia-Commonwealth-University-Mcv-Campus-pfbe09s

Name: Iowa State University
Overview: Iowa State University was known as Iowa Agricultural College. Located in Ames, Iowa, the university enrolled over 33,391 students in various popular fields, including Engineering, Biological, Biomedical Sciences, Journalism, Communication, Agricultural, and Business Management. The Iowa State University consists of 10 schools and colleges which offer over 100 bachelor's degree courses, more than 100 master's degree courses, more than 80 PhD courses, and one professional degree course. Most first-year students prefer on-campus facilities due to the university's number of activities and opportunities. On-campus students also can earn money while studying for a particular college course. Off-campus students also get the opportunity to work while studying, which includes the surrounding communities apart from the campus. Iowa State University also provides a number of awards and scholarships for international students, which include the Anne Doyle International Student Award, International Merit Scholarships, Freddy Miranda Professional Development Grant Application, and many more. The university is quite famous for its placement opportunities and invites reputed companies to recruit their students. The fee structure depends on the courses a student chooses. Still, the highest fee that a graduate student needs to pay is around USD 31,018.

Name: Salem International University
Overview: Salem International University is a university located in Salem, USA. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programs for distance education students.The main campus of Salem International University is located in Salem. The university offers over eight undergraduate programs and five postgraduate programs in the study areas of Biology, Nursing, Information Technology, Business Administration, Computer Science, Criminal Justice and Education. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. Salem International University offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Salem University's undergraduate degree programmes often require students to successfully complete a range of foundational liberal arts courses in English, mathematics, the natural sciences, social and behavioral sciences, and the humanities.The university processes applications on a rolling basis all year round for its fall, spring, and winter academic semesters. For international students, an IELTS score of 5.5 or a TOEFL IBT score of 61 is accepted as proof of English language competency. Read more details about Salem International University on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.

Name: Portland State University
Overview: Portland State University is a public institution located in Portland, USA, founded in 1946. The campus is located across 50 acres of southwest downtown Portland, blocks away from concert halls, museums, and much more. The university offers around 200 programs at undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral levels through its ten schools and colleges. The College of Liberal Arts and Science offers more than 100 programs. The College of Education offers over 40 programs and is the most compressive school of education. The university offers undergraduate programs in psychology, biology, computer science, accounting, and marketing. The top graduate majors are social work, education, computer science, education leadership & policy, electrical & computer engineering, multidisciplinary studies, and health professions & related programs. The university's graduate school is best known for its programs in social work, urban policy, public affairs, business, and healthcare management. The tuition fee is around USD 29,837. The College of Arts offers summer programs in art practice, design, music, film, and many more. The undergraduate and graduate students at Portland State University are eligible for on-campus housing facilities. The university has eight housing halls located within the campus and furnished with all utilities and facilities such as computer labs, laundry facilities, internet, refrigerator, etc. There are more than 150 students run organizations that encourage student participation on campus. The average cost of living is around USD 13,500 The college provides various scholarships to the students who excel in academic records. Career service at the university offers a range of services to students to help them write resumes, CV & cover letter, job search resources, interview preparations to help them apply for jobs. Graduates have access to career portals in various on-campus positions, internships, and employment.
Eligibility Overview: INTERNATIONAL FIRST YEARS ADMISSION REQUIREMENTSYou must have finished secondary school or high school to enroll as a first-year student. Your education must be comparable to that of a secondary school or high school student in the United States.When converted to the US 4.0 grading scale, you must have a cumulative (overall) grade point average (GPA) of at least 2.5.Completion of the English Language Proficiency Requirement is required. If you do not meet the English Language Proficiency Requirement at Portland State University, you may be admitted to the Intensive English Language Program (IELP). Find out more about the English language programmes at PSU.Check here: https://www.pdx.edu/admissions/international/first-year#:~:text=International%20First%20Years%20Admission%20Requirements&text=Your%20education%20must%20be%20equivalent,the%20English%20Language%20Proficiency%20Requirement.
Placement: None
Accommodation: Check this site to know everything about Housing at PSU: https://www.pdx.edu/housing/

Name: Brooklyn College
Overview: A public college in Brooklyn, New York, the Brooklyn College was established in 1930 as a part of the City University of New York. As four other colleges, namely Hunter College, Women's College, City College of New York, and Men's College, merged to form the Brooklyn College, it became the first public Coeducational Liberal arts college in New York. The College promotes the importance of effort and determination for the path to success while ensuring the future of its students as hard-working and focused leaders for the modern world. The College is organised into five schools Murray Koppelman School of Business, School of Education, School of Humanities and Social Sciences, School of Natural and Behavioural Sciences, and the School of Visual, Media and Performing Arts. The College offers over 100 undergraduate, 70 postgraduate and around ten doctorate degrees for its students in various fields of study. Some of the popular and highly ranked courses offered at the College hail from the Women Studies, Visual Arts, Film, Latino and Puerto Rican Studies, and Modern Literature programmes. With an acceptance rate of 45%, the College has become an anticipated choice for students striving for success. The average annual tuition can come to around $ 20K, but through many of the scholarships and grants provided by the College, the cost can be brought to as low as $ 3K. Spread across 35 acres of land, the College serves as a home to thousands of students from different parts of the world.
Eligibility Overview: Admission RequirementsBefore being considered for admission, international applicants who speak English as a second language must pass the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a score of 650 on the paper-based test, 280 on the computer-based test, or 110 on the Internet-based test. Check: http://www.brooklyn.cuny.edu/web/academics/schools/socialsciences/departments/english/graduate/ma/international-students.php#:~:text=International%20applicants%20for%20whom%20English,before%20being%20considered%20for%20admission.

Name: Life University
Overview: Life University in Marietta, Georgia, U.S.A., is a private college founded by the chiropractor Sid.E.Williams in 1974. It is the largest Chiropractic College in the world. Life University is dedicated to holistic development and promotes a healthy lifestyle. It offers bachelor's, master and Associate degrees. This unique college of Chiropractic is divided into the following academic areas; Division of Basic Sciences includes Anatomy, Biochemistry, Pathology, Physiology etc.; Division of Chiropractic Sciences includes Analysis, Chiropractic Principles and Philosophy, Research, Technique etc.; Division of Clinical Sciences includes Clinical Education (didactic), Diagnosis, Psychology, Public Health, Radiology etc.; Division of Health Sciences includes Athletic Training, Exercise Science, Nutrition and Sports Health Science. The Clinics division includes Health and Optimum Performance, Clinical Radiology, Functional Kinesiology, and the Division of Liberal Studies, Business, Interdisciplinary and Transitional Studies, and Computer Information Management. It also offers P.E.A.K. Clinic - a Doctors Office based Clinical Experience for a practical learning experience. The University offers on-campus accommodation. For student residents, the estimated cost would be USD 12,450. In addition, more than 100 organisations provide scholarships to study at Life University and help with financial expenses. The average salary within 10 years of graduating from the University is 32,000 USD. The University is famously known for its Rugby team and other sports programs. The University has 3000 student enrolments and international students representing 45 different countries.
Eligibility Overview: 1. Have a GPA of 2.75–2.99 for the requisite 90 semester credit hours/135 quarter credit hours OR have a GPA of 2.75–2.99 for the required 90 semester credit hours/135 quarter credit hours2. Hold a bachelor's degree with a GPA of 2.75–4.0 for the required 90 semester credit hours/135 quarter credit hours but do not meet the CCE criteria for regular admissions.The following are the prerequisites for the Doctor of Chiropractic Program: You must have completed a minimum of 90 semester credit hours or 135 quarter credit hours of non-duplicate coursework with a cumulative grade point average of 3.0 or higher before beginning your chiropractic studies.All science courses utilised for admissions must be completed with a C or above, and at least half of them must include a significant laboratory component. All students who are qualified for admission through the AAT will be evaluated individually based on their educational transcripts. The Dean of the College of Chiropractic makes the final admission decision.
Placement: Life University believes that career planning is a lifetime process and that all graduates should seek to follow its guiding concept of Lasting Purpose: To Give, To Do, To Love, To Serve – Out of a Sense of Abundance and share their unique abilities with the world after graduation.Our mission at Life University is to provide an atmosphere in which our students can thrive, grow, and achieve their greatest potential.They work hard to assist our students develop and pursue their professional goals to the best of their abilities. Their Professional Services department assists students in deciding on a career path and developing a strategy for getting there.
Accommodation: All first-year freshmen students coming to Life University who enrol in the College of Undergraduate Studies must live in University Housing for one academic year (3 quarters). The academic year at Life University is divided into three quarters: Fall, Winter, and Spring.THE FOLLOWING EXEMPTIONS COULD BE APPLICABLE:Must be 22 years old or older - Must be married and/or have dependents (Requires copy of marriage certificate) Live full-time with their parent(s) (or parental guardian) within a 15-mile driving distance to Life University, according to Google Maps. Freshman Student Athletes who get an athletic scholarship are not eligible for this exemption. Students who enrol for less than 12 quarter credit hours in each of the first four quarters of attendance.

Name: Kaplan International English - New York (Central Park)
Overview: Kaplan International English: New York (Central Park) is a private, English institute equipped with state-of-art educational technology, offering more than 30+programs to students wishing to comprehend and learn the English language. The institute provides multiple options according to the student’s convenience. One can opt for flexible courses, long-time English courses, Business English courses, and exam preparation courses. New York Central Park English school has 12 spacious classrooms offering cutting-edge learning technology. Students get to learn the language in a more professional and focused environment from highly-skilled and experienced facilitators. Furthermore, the institute offers dynamic tuition, copious study materials for the applicants, and detailed feedback on their performance. Learners will get interactive sessions, grammar module discussion, along with video and audio-based learning. General English courses are designed as per the student’s need so that applicants have an abundance of professional and academic options. Kaplan International English - New York (Central Park), doing wonders, providing students with exam preparation courses like IELTS, Cambridge and TOEFL. All the modules discussed extensively solving multiple question papers. Besides benefiting students with a top-notch language learning experience, the institute also provides accommodations to the students. On-campus and off-campus accommodations along with home-stay are available. Other student facilities like health services, extracurricular activities are easily accessible by the students. Even Kaplan came up with junior language learning training. They also arrange summer camps which allow the children and teenagers to learn the language with exciting adventures and projects. The institute aims at enhancing and improving the English language proficiency of both international students and residents.

Name: Brigham Young University
Overview: Brigham Young University is a private, coeducational university situated in Utah, United State, and was founded in 1875. It is owned by the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (LDS Church). There are two main campuses, one in Salt Lake City and the other one in Jerusalem. It is one of the oldest colleges in the US and is ranked 55th for Undergraduate Teaching ( US News). International students can opt for either UG/PG courses at BYU, under 12 departments, spread over different colleges. Brigham Young University offers 188 undergraduate, 87 graduate, and 32 doctorate programs. The college's most popular courses include MBA, EMBA, BSc in Psychology, Biological Sciences, MS in Mechanical Engineering, and MS in Chemical Engineering. The college's educational programs incorporate required courses within the Bible (KJV), LDS scripture, history, and doctrine. There are also university-sponsored weekly devotional gatherings where most speakers address religious subjects. The fees for the first year are between 10,890- 14,974 USD, although they may differ depending upon the course one opts for.

Name: State University of New York, Fredonia
Overview: Formed in 1826, the State University of New York, Fredonia is the westernmost member of the SUNY. It was opened initially as the Fredonia Academy under Austin Smith, and later it re-emerged as a New York State Normal School in 1867. The university is fully accredited by the State University of New York Board of Regents.With more than 4,600 students, the State University of New York, Fredonia, provides educational services at undergraduate and postgraduate levels. Currently, the students can receive options of more than 80 majors and 50 minors at these levels. Some of the popular areas of studies and courses here include Applied science, Computer science, Animation, Business Administration, Criminal Justice, Fine Arts, Journalism, Music, and several others.The campus is spread across 249 acres of land. The available facilities include large residential halls, gyms and swimming pools, emergency helplines, street lights and fire hydrants, electric assistance, etc. With an acceptance rate of 72%, the State University of New York, Fredonia, has invited enrolments from international students. The management believes in smaller class sizes and has maintained a student-faculty ratio of 14:1. Moreover, the 75% of student retention rate of the university shows that the students are satisfied with their services.The tuition fee structure set for the out-state students is affordable for most, between $15,000 and $19,000. State University of New York, Fredonia ranking shows its 60th position in Best Value Schools of 2020 by Regional Universities North. Employers hire about 96% of the university's students within six months of graduation. The university provides industry-specific first-hand training to help the students be prepared for employment while studying.

Name: Kean University

The university is the third-largest institution for higher education in the state while gaining popularity for its humanities, education, and social sciences programs. The average tuition fee is around USD 31,000 per annum.The university comprises five undergraduate schools and a graduate college offering numerous undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral programs. The best programs at Kean University include an MA in Educational Administration, a Master of Social Work (MSW), and a Master in Business Administration (MBA). A minimum of 6.0 is required for undergraduate courses and 6.5 for post-graduate courses.The university offers scholarships like Merit Scholarships for New Incoming Students, Kean Foundation Scholarships, and a few External Scholarships to aid students financially.Students earn an average of 50,888 USD after graduating.

Name: Auburn University at Montogomery
Overview: The Auburn University at Montogomery is a university located in Montgomery, USA. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Business. The main campus of Auburn University at Montogomery is located in Montgomery. The university offers over 8 undergraduate programs and 6 postgraduate programs. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. Auburn University at Montogomery offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Read more details about Auburn University at Montogomery on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.The average cost of tuition and fees for undergraduate students is 11,796 USD, domestic tuition is 31,956 USD. The credits are enrolled in 12 credits per semester and graduate students enrolled in 9 credits per semester.Auburn University chooses students based on their high school GPA (3.85 minimum), ACT/SAT scores (29/1330 minimum), essays submitted, and leadership and service histories. Admission may also be given consideration for Auburn students who are currently enrolled and have an unadjusted GPA of 3.4.

Name: Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology
Overview: Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology is a privately owned, coeducational university focusing on teaching science, engineering, and math. It is situated in Terre Haute, Indiana. The Institute was founded in 1874, and President Robert A. Coons is presently in charge.The undergraduate curriculum is the main priority at Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology, which also provides graduate study in eight different disciplines. The curriculum of the institute has a strong emphasis on engineering and the natural sciences. The Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology has approved the institute's software engineering, biomedical engineering, optical engineering, chemical engineering, and computer science (ABET) programs.The campus, which spans a huge area of 1300 acres, is home to eight social fraternities and three social sororities, some of which have houses on site. Students in Indiana's middle and high schools can get free homework assistance and tutoring via student-centered services like the Homework Hotline. Rose-Hulman Enterprises For Rose students and alumni, an annex of the institute offers internship and employment opportunities with new and established businesses of various sizes.Numerous notable alumni of the university include, among others: Abe Silverstein (American engineer), Tim Cindric (president of Team Penske), Marshall Goldsmith (American coach), Ernest R. Davidson (author), Art Nehf (baseball player), Don Lincoln (American physicist), Bernard V. Vonderschmitt (electrical engineer), Jim Umpleby (CEO of Caterpillar), Lawrence J. Giacoletto (American electrical engineer), and Matt Branam, the President of the Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology.

Placement: According to US News, the median beginning salary for graduates and alumni of Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology is USD 73,000According to THE, Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology graduates make USD 79,000 after ten years of graduating97% of graduates find work within two years after graduation
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation The Rose-Hulman offers on-campus housing for its students, with nine residence halls. A little over 55% of Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology students choose to live on campus. All first-year students are required to live on campusStudents who live on campus have greater opportunities to interact with peers from various countries and traditions and often perform better academicallyStudents who want to live on campus enjoy easy access to the university's amenities, such as its dining halls, sports facilities, and library On-campus housing link Off-Campus Accommodation Off-campus facilities include fully furnished apartments, with the average monthly rent between 550 and 650 USD. Studio flats, 3 bedroom, 4 bedroom, and shared apartments are also availableAll basic services such as power, water, and unrestricted internet access are included in the fee for the student homesThe majority of the flats also include bike storage Off-campus housing link
Course Description: Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology was founded in 1874. Located in Terre Haute,USA the university is home to about 333 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology is ranked 2949th in Top Universities by Webometrics - World. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 1 undergraduate and 2 postgraduate programs. Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology has 3 intakes in Sep,May,Jan. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 4 years and master’s degree courses is 2 years.The average yearly tuition fee of Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology is around 50,961 USD  Approx.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology include USC Associates Scholarships UG Business Programs,Horace W Goldsmith Fellowship,You Are Welcome Here Scholarship Bs In Kinesiology Michigan State University,Graduate Incentive Award MS Applied Economics.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology is the post-study work opportunities in USA. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.
